review: Very comfartable place and nice location, friendly staff.. This is our second stay in this hotel, we love it..İt is the heart of the town..close to shoping area, near the metro station, and all the restaurants are here.. How can İ say? Come and see❤️❤️

We loved staying in this hotel. The location is super central but still quiet inside. Great room, with a separate lounge area that made all the difference, delicious breakfast and excellent service. We’ll be back!

Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights earlier this month, had a very good experience, staff is very friendly & helpful & speak/understand English well. Check in & check out was a breeze. The room was Perfect, clean with good heating, and nightly turn down service.   Breakfast was Included & was very good. But keep in mind the restaurant is ONLY open for breakfast & there is no restaurant in the hotel for Lunch/Dinner but there are plenty of optinns for every budget right across the street.  It is 15-30 minute drive from Lisbon airport depending on traffic and cost is roughly 35Euros .  Location is excellent right in the city center with Christmas tree & lights right across the street & plenty of shopping & eating places as well as train/metro.   Highly recommend this hidden jem in

This was one of the finest hotel experiences I have ever had in decades of travel.  It’s a super luxurious hotel with a plush lounge, intimate wooden bar, and a sumptuous daily breakfast in a  high ceiling, chandelier dining room.  The concierge could not have been more helpful - even took a package to the post office to mail for us.  Without any prompting from my wife or me, the hotel sent my wife a personal birthday greeting along with a bottle of champagne and a specially made dessert at breakfast.   The hotel is ideally located near the major sites and fine shopping.  We look for to returning to the Avenida Palace on our next trip.

Couldn't fault anything.  Friendly and welcoming staff, comfortable room and great breakfast buffet.  Beautiful bar and lounge area.  Excellent location next to the station and many good restaurants.  Highly recommended.

Very comfartable place and nice location, friendly staff.. This is our second stay in this hotel, we love it..İt is the heart of the town..close to shoping area, near the metro station, and all the restaurants are here.. How can İ say? Come and see❤️❤️

We loved staying in this hotel. The location is super central but still quiet inside. Great room, with a separate lounge area that made all the difference, delicious breakfast and excellent service. We’ll be back!

Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights earlier this month, had a very good experience, staff is very friendly & helpful & speak/understand English well. Check in & check out was a breeze. The room was Perfect, clean with good heating, and nightly turn down service.   Breakfast was Included & was very good. But keep in mind the restaurant is ONLY open for breakfast & there is no restaurant in the hotel for Lunch/Dinner but there are plenty of optinns for every budget right across the street.  It is 15-30 minute drive from Lisbon airport depending on traffic and cost is roughly 35Euros .  Location is excellent right in the city center with Christmas tree & lights right across the street & plenty of shopping & eating places as well as train/metro.   Highly recommend this hidden jem in

This was one of the finest hotel experiences I have ever had in decades of travel.  It’s a super luxurious hotel with a plush lounge, intimate wooden bar, and a sumptuous daily breakfast in a  high ceiling, chandelier dining room.  The concierge could not have been more helpful - even took a package to the post office to mail for us.  Without any prompting from my wife or me, the hotel sent my wife a personal birthday greeting along with a bottle of champagne and a specially made dessert at breakfast.   The hotel is ideally located near the major sites and fine shopping.  We look for to returning to the Avenida Palace on our next trip.

Couldn't fault anything.  Friendly and welcoming staff, comfortable room and great breakfast buffet.  Beautiful bar and lounge area.  Excellent location next to the station and many good restaurants.  Highly recommended.

This was a real gem of hotel and well worth  trying. Probably one of the real standout features was the quality of the staff;  quite simply nothing was too much.  The rooms are all beautifully and very traditionally decorated,  making it feel very special.  Breakfast was awesome although we didn't have dinner at the hotel.  Our next visit will definitely see us staying at the Avenida Palace again.

Great location in the heart of Lisbon. Relaxing bar with Grand Piano music coming from the main parlor. The morning breakfasts are top notch and are open until 11:30am.  The front desk staff was incredibly flexible and generous when we asked to stay for 2 additional days.

I stayed at Avenida Palace November 10, 2021 to November 14, 2021.  While I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to Lisbon, I am disappointed to write a less-than-stellar review for Avenida Palace despite all of the positive reviews that led me to book my stay in the first place. Unfortunately, a single incident soured my stay enough that I feel compelled to share the awful customer experience that I received.  On the early morning of November 12, 2021, I was returning back to Avenida Palace via cab to find that the front doors had been locked. I knocked on the glass and a security guard welcomed myself and two friends who were also staying at the hotel. We walked through the lobby towards the elevator when we heard the security guard say, “the cab driver would like to speak to you.”

This Hotel is 5* Plus.  As the name implies it is a palace and once inside you feel like royalty and treated like  royalty.  It is beautifully decorated in a classic style that exudes taste and opulence.  Once inside you are transported into a different era.  It simply lacks for nothing.  Comfort, service and excellent location in downtown Lisbon. Room service at its best at all times.  Staff so polite and helpful.  The room and bathroom had all the necessary amenities which were replaced daily as needed.  Towels were replaced every day.  We were supplied with an electric kettle and teacups to replace the coffee machine as requested. The room was very quiet as it had double windows.  Excellent buffet breakfast.  Each day a pleasant gift awaited us in our room.   Chocolates, a

Hotel was clean and beautiful. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great. Bed was comfortable. Minimal noise in the room. Bathroom was nice and functional. Thanks for a great stay. Will come again.

Very attentive staff and perfect location. Great atmosphere. Excellent breakfast and beautiful rooms. Everything we wanted to see within walking distance and free parking right in the city center. We will come again!

The staff friendly and very efficient, very good hygiene for Covid precautions, felt very safe, buffet breakfast was superb, given an upgrade which was lovely, stayed 5 days, very central to all main attractions, will be back!

The hotel was beautiful. It is in a great location. Easy to walk anywhere and the train station is right next door, making an early morning trip to Sintra a breeze.  My room was beautiful, very clean, well equipped. There were special touches in the room during my stay which I was not expecting. I would recommend staying here!

My wife and I, both in our 60's, travel to Lisbon just to stay here. No restaurant but excellent bar menu. Top class breakfast. The physical beauty of the building and the warm welcome of the hotel team are exceptional. The 'extras' are superb. In our 3 night stay, this trip, we had two beautiful piano recitals provided without charge; when it looked like raining two rain hats were delivered to our room without us asking; a 'to keep' shopping bag, i could go on and on. Courtesy, cleanliness, friendliness and exceptional surrounding all brought together by a great team.

I cannot say enough about how wonderful our stay was. The room was immaculate, elegant, but not to the point of feeling like you were in a museum. The staff were accommodating, helpful, respectful and anxious to make you comfortable. We were exhausted on arrival and didn't want to go restaurant hunting. (There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there are wonderful ones within a short walk.) We were served a light supper in the bar complete with a cloth laid. Most of the staff we encountered had very adequate English. The included breakfast was buffet, with wait staff on hand for assistance and coffee. Served in a wonderful elegant room. There was always a concierge on duty for advice. The recommended restaurant for one dinner was beautiful, memorable, and easy to find. The hotel

This is a fabulous hotel in so many ways.  The room was available on arrival at 10.30 AM although the official check in time is 3 PM.  The hotel public areas and rooms are very elegant. A highlight was the daily breakfast.   As for location, it is absolutely perfect for discovering the city.  The metro, railway station and bus stops are literally a minute walk form the front door.

If we could give this hotel a 20/10 we would.  Beautifully appointed,  spacious rooms with all the modern conveniences.  Attentive staff, anxious to meet our every need.  From the amenities in the room to the delicious breakfast, not detail was overlooked.We loved the afternoons with musical entertainment, relaxing in the elegant sitting room with an evening cocktail.   We have been all over the world  and this hotel is unsurpassed.  A convenient location near bars, restaurants, transportation and shops.  Looking forward to another stay at this fabulous hotel.

I had never considered Avenida Palace in my previous trips to Lisbon. This time around I decided to give it a shot, I am so glad I did. Aside from its very central location the hotel has old world charm with a very efficient and polite staff. The corner superior room I was assigned was modern with a wall of windows. The breakfast room resembled a ballroom of a five star hotel. The breakfast itself was very good with multiple choices and a very attentive staff.  I am very happy with my decision and Avenida Palace will be my hotel of choice on future trips to Lisbon.

Our recent stay at the Avenida Palace in Lisbon was perfect after a long journey from the United States.  We enjoyed the gracious service, wonderful breakfasts, 24 hour room service, and the central location.  We are glad we chose the Avenida Palace over the Four Seasons and Valverde because of the old world charm and perfect location.  The staff is charming and unobtrusive.  When we asked for an iron for our wrinkled clothes, we were brought a perfect "steam machine" within five minutes.  Room service was also very quick and the food was delicious.  We are so happy we chose the Palace. It was a perfect way to enjoy Lisbon.

We stayed in Hotel Avenida Palace for 7 nights in September. We had notified the hotel of our arrival time in advance and were able to check in a little early with no issue. I had booked a Double Room and since I booked directly on the hotel site, we were upgraded to a Superior Room with a view of Restauradores square. The room was large and comfortable with a king size bed, a seating area and a large bathroom. While noise from the square outside could be heard in the bathroom, there was good soundproofing in the bedroom and noise was never an issue overnight. We were treated to a Welcome fruit plate, complementary bottle of water each day as well as turndown service. The breakfast buffet had a huge selection and was the best buffet we had while staying in Portugal with a

Hotel Avenida Palace is a lovely place to stay while exploring Lisbon. The location is excellent, close to the Castelo de Sao Jorge, Praca do Comercio, and Se cathedral. It’s beautifully redone, our room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast delicious with wide variety of selections. Staff friendly and helpful. A wonderful place to celebrate a birthday!

I stayed here for one night post cruise and the hotel is beautiful. Great location too. Bed very comfortable, really nice breakfast buffet. Service was very good as well. Needed a taxi to the airport and they had one set up right away.  I travel solo and felt very safe as well.  I will stay here again the next time I visit Lisbon.

This hotel is absolutely gorgeous and the staff were welcoming and attentive. Everything was clean and easy, room service was great, and the breakfast was amazing. Hotel staff also helped us navigate the COVID-19 policies in Portugal and were more than happy to keep us updated on any changes. We will definitely be coming back to stay here whenever we visit Lisbon!!

I am glad to say that the hotel lived up to the great reviews and exceeded expectations. Helpful, attentive staff, super large room on the 4th floor overlooking the square. The hotel's old world charm meant it felt like staying in a glorious stately home rather than a hotel. We were treated to piano recitals most evenings, cocktails made to our order by the friendly barman. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. The location is outstanding - right in the heart of the action and yet the hotel is sound proofed so you are not disturbed once inside. A fabulous choice that really made our visit quite special.

We took a chance and booked this hotel while we were in Paris.  We had never been to Lisbon before so we were not sure if this would be a good choice regarding location.  What a pleasant surprise.  You can't pick a better location.  We stayed there for three days before taking the train down to Faro for three days.  We were so happy with the Avenida that we booked again for three days on our return to Lisbon. The staff were so attentive and helpful.  Front desk, concierge, bar staff, breakfast staff, all went above and beyond to make our stay special. On our return they upgraded us to a suite. The expansive lounge off the front desk is a joy to sit in with groupings of antique furniture from one end to the other. We were extremely happy with our rooms, bed, bathrooms,

I’m 64 years old and I’ve been around the world many times and this is the best hotel my favorite hotel that I’ve ever stayed in the first thing that caught my eye was the free mini bar after checking in we decided to do the Christmas tour and the walking tour which were led by Beatrix Victoria and Diana the tours were extremely informative and give you a great layout of the land also we were treated with a super few surprises along the way which I would’ve gladly paid for but they took care of the staff is very professional and friendly and I really enjoyed everything about this wonderful boutique hotel when I am in Lisbon I will surely stay at this hotel every time thanks again for a wonderful time

I cannot fully express my gratitude for the warm and welcoming reception to Corpo Santo Hotel and everything the entire staff has done to make my stay in Lisboa absolutely perfect. PS - the personal touches, the special surprises placed in the room, the nightly turn-down service, and the bath time experience (which is totally unique and amazing!) are all things that put this hotel ahead of the others.   A few notable mentions, in addition to every staff member being so kind and professional: It all started with Pedro (guest ambassador) for taking my original inquiry phone call 7 weeks ago and working his magic to get me a room. Edgar (doorman) who so happily greeted me with a smile every day, helped me with my bags, and took care of parking my car. Eduardo (doorman) for being my

It was such a pleasure to meet the city with the best guide ever - Victoria. We really enjoyed her enthusiasm and good sense of humor! It's was an interesting tour throughout the city! We recommend it to everyone!

The location is amazing, Lisbon is beautiful, but I have no words for the hotel and its staff. Seriously the best I’ve ever experienced. Nothing is too big of a thing to ask and they are genuinely nice, which is so rare these days. They always had some nice words for me as I was passing by the reception. Breakfast is great and tasty, maybe a little too much :). All the complimentary things are just an amazing idea to make your stay even better, such as the massage, the water, snacks, daily small gifts, etc. You really feel pampered here on the best way possible. I also have to mention Pedro Falcao, the hotel ambassador, who gave me a late checkout without any extra charge and definitely saved the day with it as my flight was very late and this way I could get some sleep before.

Very warm hospitality, fantastic service, excellent location close to the main sites and fine dining restaurants. We had very interesting free walking city tours with Diana (Christas evening tour) and Victoria (morning historical tour), both full of information and humour.

I’m 64 years old and I’ve been around the world many times and this is the best hotel my favorite hotel that I’ve ever stayed in the first thing that caught my eye was the free mini bar after checking in we decided to do the Christmas tour and the walking tour which were led by Beatrix Victoria and Diana the tours were extremely informative and give you a great layout of the land also we were treated with a super few surprises along the way which I would’ve gladly paid for but they took care of the staff is very professional and friendly and I really enjoyed everything about this wonderful boutique hotel when I am in Lisbon I will surely stay at this hotel every time thanks again for a wonderful time

It was such a pleasure to meet the city with the best guide ever - Victoria. We really enjoyed her enthusiasm and good sense of humor! It's was an interesting tour throughout the city! We recommend it to everyone!

The location is amazing, Lisbon is beautiful, but I have no words for the hotel and its staff. Seriously the best I’ve ever experienced. Nothing is too big of a thing to ask and they are genuinely nice, which is so rare these days. They always had some nice words for me as I was passing by the reception. Breakfast is great and tasty, maybe a little too much :). All the complimentary things are just an amazing idea to make your stay even better, such as the massage, the water, snacks, daily small gifts, etc. You really feel pampered here on the best way possible. I also have to mention Pedro Falcao, the hotel ambassador, who gave me a late checkout without any extra charge and definitely saved the day with it as my flight was very late and this way I could get some sleep before.

Very warm hospitality, fantastic service, excellent location close to the main sites and fine dining restaurants. We had very interesting free walking city tours with Diana (Christas evening tour) and Victoria (morning historical tour), both full of information and humour.

The place is an example of excellent taste and of friendly and helpful staff. The location is as best as it can be: walking distance to everywhere or very well communicated by bus or tram. It is a must if you visit Lisbon. Do not forget to try the restaurant. Warmest regards to the personnel at the lobby, with very special thanks to Letizia Teixeira.

First day of our first trip to Lisbon and we’ve landed on our feet at the Corpo Santo Historical Hotel. Great location, excellent facilities and some nice touches you don’t find everywhere. Highlight today was the (free) walking tour of the Lisbon Xmas lights by Diana from guest relations. Beautiful city at night, knowledgeable but amusing commentary from Diana, who also bought us all a delicious custard tart. Great start to our visit.

Wonderful guest service in every aspect, from check in to turn down. The hotel has perfect amenities - they don’t nickel and dime you for water and snacks. And the twice daily free walking tour is outstanding. Mine was with Victoria, and it was perfect.

I had a wonderful experience at the Corpo Santo Hotel. Every staff member I encountered, from the concierge to the check- in to the cleaning staff were delightful and eager to help! Thank you! Will recommend to you!  The room was wonderful, clean and quiete.   amazing view from our window.   The SPA is amazing and Annabelle Beatrice and Filipa are very professional and their massages are unique and unforgettable  - you can’t miss it !

This is my second time staying at this hotel. It’s my favorite hotel in Lisbon. The staffs are super friendly and the service is the best you can get. Will recommend this hotel to all my family and friends.

The hotel in a great location offering great breakfast a la carte style, great atmosphere great laundry service and overall great staying in lisbon special thanks for a spa review about philpia that’s makes me amazing massage 10/10 thank you Phillipia

We had a wonderful stay at the Corpo Santo hotel.  Great hotel in a great location in the center of Lisbon.  Staff, room, food, they totally live up to the hotel's 5 stars.  A special star of the hotel is Beatriz.  She took us on a Christmas Walking Tour through Lisbon city center.  Enjoyed it very much and learned a lot about the history of Lisbon.  An absolute must!

This hotel meets all our expectations. Icing on the cake: the 2 tours provided by the most wonderful guest services staff ( Beatriz and her colleague).  Do not miss them.  Another kudo: the mini bar was offered complimentary. These items don’t cost much, but by making them free of charge to guests show that the hotel Management really knows how to bring the client experience to a different level altogether, instead of counting changes like most other hoteliers do.

Fantastic hotel. Brilliant location close to the river and centre. Modern bright rooms with complimentary mini bar containing soft drinks. Great breakfast and food in the bar.   Lovely reading /tv room on ground floor., which contains part of the old wall of the city!   Very helpful staff. Excellent complimentary  and informative walking tour with Victoria. A great start to our trip. Enjoyed this.  Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return.

The room was very nice. Was first assigned to a corner room with four windows. That was the reason for me to extend my stay over and over in this particular hotel. Very good breakfast and very decent food at Porter restaurant. Had a relaxing sightseeing tour with nice tour guide Beatriz. Everything about this hotel is very good.

Everything about this hotel is really special, the location is ideal for walking through Lisbon old town, the hotel itself has some fantastic history too, but the warm welcome and the staff make it perfect.  We took the (complimentary) walking tour with Victoria and even though it was raining she still took us out, and kept us entertained she gave a perfect introduction to Lisbon’s key spots and some really good stories as well as historical facts. We also took 2 massages with the team and they were so good we booked more! Best we’ve ever had!  We also ate in the restaurant for lunch and dinner and the food was always great and well priced. This hotel really can’t do enough for it guests, always a lovely surprise to be had, the mini bar, the evening tasting sessions, ice cream

I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We are sad that the ownership of Corpo Santo does not have more hotel properties around the world, because we cannot wait to repeat this experience. This was easily one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The food, historical setting, and friendly staff made it amazing. They even offer a free walking tour twice a day - Victoria, our tour guide, was informative and really allowed us to make an afternoon of it!

We had a lovely stay at Corpo Santo. The staff was very friendly, location was ideal and breakfast was tasty with lots of options. The rooms were quite spacious and we really enjoyed the complementary evening Portuguese snack and wine tasting! Overall I would 100% recommend staying here.

Wonderful walking tour with Victoria! Great way to get an overview of the city and history - at no cost, included in the hotel stay. Hotel is clean and nice. Felt very safe during COVID. Breakfast is included and is very good quality and selection.

Victoria was awesome- easy going and fun. She gave us small fun facts about Lisbon and 2 hours flew by. Highly recommended! She also gave us info on other places to visit as well as food to eat/ restaurants to book.

One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in Booked this hotel based on other reviews, and they are all very accurate. So many good things about this hotel that are ideal for a weekend break/short trip.  - Rooms are great, not too small. Bed was super comfortable and I am usually very fussy on bed quality - Free massage (which needs to be booked in advance ideally), was AMAZING. One of the best massages I have ever had, and it was free (20 mins). You can pay to extend it if you want, but we did not. It is not a gimmicky massage, but a proper full body massage - Two free walking tours every day around the city. We did ours with Beatriz who was great. The tours are not too long, and a great way to get to know the city.  - Lovely welcome gift of wine/strawberries for us. - Hotel

The hotel was really good, with increcible details. The tours made by Victoria and Beatriz around the city are very recommendable, as they introduce you to the history and the most special places of Lisbon, Always with kindness and ready to help.

This hotel is amazing in every way.  We arrived very early on our first day, and their morning walking tour was an excellent way to spend the time until check-in. We left our luggage at the hotel and Victoria took us for a 2-hour stroll around Lisbon. On the second day we took the afternoon tour, with Beatriz. Both walking tours are excellent - informative, in terms of history and culture, and fun. Both tours are free and exclusive to hotel guests.  The service throughout the hotel is outstanding. Everybody is very friendly, cooperative and do their best to exceed your expectations. In addition to the walking tours, as hotel guest, you also get free tastings in the lobby every evening (wine or cocktails with some snacks, between 18:00 and 19:30), 20-minute massage and one hot

Though we have yet to arrive at the Corpo Santo, I wanted to write about the amazing service we’ve already received.  The Covid pandemic has necessitated multiple changes of dates for us, and each request has been met with courtesy and kindness. One traveler dropped out - can you please cancel that room? Sure. We cannot come in January, can you cancel please? Not a problem, we understand. Are the rooms we’d love available in March?  Not now, but if they become available, we’ll make a notation and do our best to upgrade you.  We cannot wait to make this trip, and thank Liliana, Diana, and anyone else whose name I cannot recall, in person, for their gracious assistance. THIS is the sign of a wonderful hotel! :)

I spent 5 nights at Corpo Santo and I could’ve easily stayed longer. I stayed in room 118. The room had a small balcony and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. I loved all the perks like the free ice cream in the lobby, happy hour, surprises left in room, free walking tours, and a free 20 minute massage. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious. I also had lunch once and dinner twice at their restaurant (Porter Bistro) and everything I had was outstanding. I went on a walking tour with Victoria and she was a great guide. All the staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful. I can’t wait to go back to Lisbon just so I can stay here again.

I first came here in 2016 and gave it a 5-star review. Nothing has changed: great locality, super friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, good restaurant. One thing new, however, you arrive in your room to an ample bottle of Port and some sweets.  Can't think of a better place to anchor your visit to this magical city of Lisboa.

We had originally booked this hotel for December 2020 on a no refund, no exchange. With all  the covid restrictions we were not able to travel from the uk at that time.  The Santa Justa went above & beyond in my opinion as not only did they honour our reservation until December 2021 ( to be taken at our choice) they upgraded us to a junior suite on arrival.  For this we thank you very much!!   The hotel  is in an ideal location just a minutes walk away from the metro station at Rossio. Surrounded by restaurants, shops, bars & many of the beautiful sights of Lisbon.  The rooms are extremely comfortable, with high quality bed linen & the most amazing beds & pillows ( might have been all the sightseeing wearing us out..but we had the best sleep in these beds). The rooms have

I hope that this is not too premature, but I must say, it is nice to be back travelling. At the very least, we did manage to get in this trip to Portugal just before the closing of 2021. Unfortunately, things are heating up again with the new Omicron variant, but we remain optimistic that things will eventually settle down. They most certainly will! At any rate, we arrived in Portugal on November 28, rented a vehicle, and spent the first ten days or so visiting the Algarve area, and then returned our car and spent the last three nights in Lisbon.  Our research in where to stay while in Lisbon, resulted in us booking three nights at the Hotel Santa Justa Lisboa. A very good choice. This hotel truly lives up to all its claims. We found out afterwards, that rather than using the

A very good 4-star hotel in the middle of a bustling area.  The rooms were comfortable and the restaurant was fine.  What stood out for me was the helpfulness of the front desk staff with booking tours and transport, and making sure we each had a boxed breakfast for our very early flight out.  The restaurant staff were friendly and efficient, and made our husbands happy by switching the dining room’s cable channel to the live Champion’s League game, after hearing that we failed to get tickets.  Little personal touches make a big difference.

This hotel epitomizes excellence in every way .  We arrived here early after leaving our cruise and they were able to check us into a room…As unexpected as it was, it was a wonderful gift for two very tired travelers.   First of all the location is perfect, a delightful street close to everything and a beautiful hotel and superb staff. I can’t say enough kind words for this place.  It’s all in the details ….their attention to making you feel special will amaze you. It is because of this hotel and staff that we can’t wait to return to Lisbon. And then there’s the restaurant…for which I will write a separate review.  Don’t look any further…it’s the best. Trust me.  Thank you to all of you who made our short stay in Lisbon a memorable one. We can’t thank you enough.

I first came here in 2016 and gave it a 5-star review. Nothing has changed: great locality, super friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms, good restaurant. One thing new, however, you arrive in your room to an ample bottle of Port and some sweets.  Can't think of a better place to anchor your visit to this magical city of Lisboa.

The Santa Justa went above & beyond in my opinion as not only did they honour our reservation until December 2021 ( to be taken at our choice) they upgraded us to a junior suite on arrival.  For this we thank you very much!!   The hotel  is in an ideal location just a minutes walk away from the metro station at Rossio. Surrounded by restaurants, shops, bars & many of the beautiful sights of Lisbon.  The rooms are extremely comfortable, with high quality bed linen & the most amazing beds & pillows ( might have been all the sightseeing wearing us out..but we had the best sleep in these beds). The rooms have

I hope that this is not too premature, but I must say, it is nice to be back travelling. At the very least, we did manage to get in this trip to Portugal just before the closing of 2021. Unfortunately, things are heating up again with the new Omicron variant, but we remain optimistic that things will eventually settle down. They most certainly will! At any rate, we arrived in Portugal on November 28, rented a vehicle, and spent the first ten days or so visiting the Algarve area, and then returned our car and spent the last three nights in Lisbon.  Our research in where to stay while in Lisbon, resulted in us booking three nights at the Hotel Santa Justa Lisboa. A very good choice. This hotel truly lives up to all its claims. We found out afterwards, that rather than using the

A very good 4-star hotel in the middle of a bustling area.  The rooms were comfortable and the restaurant was fine.  What stood out for me was the helpfulness of the front desk staff with booking tours and transport, and making sure we each had a boxed breakfast for our very early flight out.  The restaurant staff were friendly and efficient, and made our husbands happy by switching the dining room’s cable channel to the live Champion’s League game, after hearing that we failed to get tickets.  Little personal touches make a big difference.

This hotel epitomizes excellence in every way .  We arrived here early after leaving our cruise and they were able to check us into a room…As unexpected as it was, it was a wonderful gift for two very tired travelers.   First of all the location is perfect, a delightful street close to everything and a beautiful hotel and superb staff. I can’t say enough kind words for this place.  It’s all in the details ….their attention to making you feel special will amaze you. It is because of this hotel and staff that we can’t wait to return to Lisbon. And then there’s the restaurant…for which I will write a separate review.  Don’t look any further…it’s the best. Trust me.  Thank you to all of you who made our short stay in Lisbon a memorable one. We can’t thank you enough.

We needed a place that help us maximize a short layover in Lisbon.  Hotel Santa Justa was perfect.  It is right where you want to be in Lisbon with shopping, dining, historic and architectural wonders all within a short walk.  The hotel staff welcomed us with a bottle of port wine and some very tasty Portuguese egg tarts.  When we discovered a problem with our air conditioner the friendly and accommodating staff moved us to another room with minimal disruption.  Finally, the complementary breakfast was the best we had on our whole European vacation.

We stayed in room 302 between October 22 and October 26.  Our stay was absolutely superb, one of the best hotels I have stayed in.  All the staff were friendly and we spoke a mixture of Portuguese, Spanish and English with them.  Thank you to the young gentleman with glasses who took our bags up to our room.  Unfortunately I didn’t catch his name.  On arrival in the room we were greeted with a bottle of Port wine and pastéis de nata.  There was also a chocolate left on our beds and the mini-bar was free.  We loved the walk-in shower and comfortable beds as well as the breakfast which was wide ranging.  Masks and gloves were used at breakfast which showed the hotel’s commitment to cleanliness.  The staff were also kind enough to call a taxi for us which left early in the morning

Excellent hotel right in the centre of Lisbon! Stayed for 5 nights. Room was very spacious and spotless 2 streets away from the Santa justa lift and the Main Street of Lisbon, lots of restaurants shops nearby and close to rossio station for trains and trams would definitely stay again!

Excellent placement, in the heart of the touristic attractions and 40 minutes from the airport by metro. Plenty of restaurants, bars, shops and places to visit very close to you. The hotel staff was kind and attentive. Rooms are perfectly soundproofed, so sleep quality is guaranteed. I would surely chose to stay there again.

Location was great, within easy walking distance to all the top tourist destinations. The concierge was very helpful in setting up tours and recommending restaurants. We enjoyed the Tuesday night Fado dinner very much. Good value for the $.

My husband and I made our 3rd trip to Portugal and our first stop was Hotel Santa Justa. It was everything you could ask for in a hotel. Yes the location is perfect for strolling the water front,visting the elevator and enjoying fine food. What really stood out to me was the staff. There was no question they did not gladly answer with patience and kindness. As others have said the breakfast was a very nice start to our day with a good variety of food from which to choose.Bottom line...go to Lisbon and stay here!

Great hotel. Friendly staff, nice breakfast well served by Olga (a very friendly and nice person).  The location of the hotel is exceptional, in the heart of Lisbon. The rooms are very convenient, larger than normal rooms in the city. I highly recommend it

Thank you to the team at Santa Justa for an amazing stay.  All of the staff that we met were really friendly and helpful, speaking great English as well as so many other languages.  We chose a "Comfort" room and it was a great size for the two of us, everything was clean and the furnishings were to a high standard.  The bathroom had great water pressure for a decent shower.  Breakfast was plentiful and the team kept everything topped up.  Breakfast is back to a buffet style but all guests are required to wear gloves when selecting their food as well as wearing masks when you are moving around the restaurant. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning a trip to Lisbon.

We loved this hotel! We stayed for 3 nights as a part of our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a suite, the room was fabulous and so spacious. The staff were so helpful and friendly. The location was perfect so central to everything. We would definitely recommend.

I really love the location and rooms are very comfortable. Staff couldnt be nicer. Specially shout out to Olga at the Dining Room and Marian at the front desk… they go above and beyond in their job… from remembering our preference for Ice Water … to helping us book our PCR testing and restaurant recommendation to helping us book an amazing tour guide. Definitely, recommend this place and will stay here again if we ever come back… thanks again!!!!

I was at the hotel for 4 nights and had an amazing experience. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, the location is ideal, super central and surrounded by nice restaurant options. Very grateful for Hugo, Nadiya and Ricardo who supported me through some personal hard times too, with excellent service and much empathy. I will certainly be back in the hotel next time!

My stay at Hotel Santa Justa was perfect. Everything was cleaned and organised, excellent breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff.  Keep in mind that the hotel is located on a very touristic street, if you are bothered with this it can be a problem. For us it was not a problem as we wanted a very central accommodation where we could do everything on foot. I recommend the hotel and I would stay there again.

This couldn’t have been any more perfect! After the long flight to Portugal, we stayed here a couple of nights to recuperate and get acquainted with Lisbon for the first time.  I wish we could have stayed longer.  The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Loved the walk-in shower, the robes, the toiletries, the decor, the comfy bed, the French balcony! We even purchased the breakfast with the room rate, and we’re pleasantly surprised how wonderful it was! We will definitely be back and stay here again.

A great stay in this city centre hotel. Having enjoyed the hospitality of a number of small family places on our Portugal trip it was a pleasant surprise for a big city hotel to give such a nice efficient and friendly welcome at reception. The following morning the breakfast lady was similarly informative and very friendly. Nice to see such positive staff. Our room, a small suite, was a good size, immaculately clean with large tv, good wifi, fridge, safe and even a small bottle of port as a welcome gift. The bathroom was very good quality and similarly sparkling clean. Breakfast was efficiently delivered from buffet behind a screen from the displayed choice simply by asking or pointing at what was required from fruits, breads, meats, cheeses, cereals etc. Additionally there was

Me and my family stayed in Lisbon for about 5-6 days and the hotel was nice. You get a complementary breakfast everyday and the rooms and showers were nice as well. I would definitely book this hotel.

We could not have asked for a better hotel, nicer staff or a better location for our first post covid trip!  Truly a  wonderful stay with a staff that wants you to be happy and relaxed and goes out of its way for its clients.  The restaurant is very good, the location can't be beat and we loved every minute!  Can't wait to visit again.

We loved it here. Our view was beautiful, and the location is perfect. So close to the Elevator and many restaurants around it. Rooms were clean and breakfast was delicious with fresh fruit and Pastel de nata every day. We recommend it from ❤️.

The employees are so nice, and it's in a beautiful part of a lovely city. They were able to get me in my room early for no early check-in fee and they rang once I'd gone up to check that everything was in order. Highly highly recommend.

This was the second time I stayed at Santa Justa Hotel. The hotel’s location is perfect. Chiado, Alfama, as well as the major turistic atractions are all close by such as Castelo de São Jorge, Praça do Mercado, Mosteiro do Carmo, Av. da Liberdade, Rua Augusta and the list goes on. The metro’s Green line is only 3 min. away making it easy to reach the Parque das Nações and the Oceanário de Lisboa, plus the airport. The metro ticket costs only €1.50 per trip. A real bargain! The classic room is great. It looks modern. The bathroom is of a good size and has an amazing shower with a strong water pressure. Very relaxing. The towels are big and heavy and toiletries are of a good quality. Staff is well trained and very helpful and welcoming. Breakfast is very good with fruits, a

Perfect location right in the heart of the center. Shops, restaurants,  McDonald's,  Burger King, Starbucks 3 minute walk. No parking here. Called hotel and set up my rides to the airport 35€ one way. Rm 408. Decent sized with a good TV with many cable channels in English. Breakfast very  simple buy its the covid times. Super clean. Awesome staff. I would stay again, stayed there 3 days over Christmas   around 110$ cdn a night.

Avoid this place. Picture look nice on the net but that is where it stops.  Horrid food and poor communication by the staff will become the highlight of your trip. Any engagement you have with the staff seems cordial and nice however they continually get things wrong from your food order to your departure date …

I chose H10 Duque de Loule only because of the rooftop terrace judged by my internet research as I have never been to Lisboa before.  H10 Duque de Loule is a great hotel, however, a bit far away from the tourist attractions – if one wants to walk. Be advised that Lisboa is like San Francisco, and takes a great deal of physical strength – if one wants to explore on foot.  The hotel is only 6 years old and is described as a “Boutique Hotel” which means less than 100 rooms and more personal and intimate focus on the customer. Yes, to that.    Breakfast was more than adequate – but the guest couldn´t choose their free table on their own… they were assigned by the waiter…! Please, change this…  I was in Lisboa during Covid-19 restriction which meant that all bars closed at 22:30 –

A charming hotel, with cozy rooms and perfect customer service! Quick check in and check out and free welcome drinks that can be taken anytime during the stay.  The views from the rooftop bar are amazing! The hotel itself isn't right in the middle of town but we did not mind the walk.

We were given a twin room despite having booked a double. We asked to be moved but there were no available doubles and staff were not very accommodating.   There’s no manager on duty in the hotel except on Mondays. Quite surprising for a 4 star….

Absolutely loved this charming, beautiful hotel situated within a walk distance from the city center. Friendly and always so helpful staff, lovely breakfast and good and comfortable beds. If You look for something unique, this might be for You.  Truly recommend!

Avoid this place. Picture look nice on the net but that is where it stops.  Horrid food and poor communication by the staff will become the highlight of your trip. Any engagement you have with the staff seems cordial and nice however they continually get things wrong from your food order to your departure date …

H10 Duque de Loule is a great hotel, however, a bit far away from the tourist attractions – if one wants to walk. The hotel is only 6 years old and is described as a “Boutique Hotel” which means less than 100 rooms and more personal and intimate focus on the customer. Yes, to that.    Breakfast was more than adequate – but the guest couldn´t choose their free table on their own… they were assigned by the waiter…! Please, change this…  I was in Lisboa during Covid-19 restriction which meant that all bars closed at 22:30 –

A charming hotel, with cozy rooms and perfect customer service! Quick check in and check out and free welcome drinks that can be taken anytime during the stay.  The views from the rooftop bar are amazing! The hotel itself isn't right in the middle of town but we did not mind the walk.

We were given a twin room despite having booked a double. We asked to be moved but there were no available doubles and staff were not very accommodating.   There’s no manager on duty in the hotel except on Mondays. Quite surprising for a 4 star….

Absolutely loved this charming, beautiful hotel situated within a walk distance from the city center. Friendly and always so helpful staff, lovely breakfast and good and comfortable beds. If You look for something unique, this might be for You.  Truly recommend!

Very good location near the metro station and you can go to the city centre by walking. The hotel staff is very polite and friendly. They are very nice with the kids, also.  Breakfast buffet is amazing you can choose buffet and menu. The rooms are very clean and beautiful decorated with all type of amenities. An enjoyable view of the city from the rooftop. We absolutely recommend this hotel and all H10 hotels!

Beatiful and stylish room, amazing rooftop. The breakfast - wow. We had the Deluxe room for 3. It was very spatious (38m) and comfortable. The location of the room is at the 10th floor where the rooftop is (so in fact the roooftop was our private balcony :) ). The staff was very kind and helpful. They offer complimentary cava at the reciption but only if you ask. The hotel is 20 min from the center by foot. Very nice not tourist trap restaurants in the surroundings (5 mins from the hotel towards the center).

We stayed in H10 for 2 nights in November 2021. As soon as we entered the lobby, we were greeted with a Portuguese cake and a glass of sparkling wine. What a start.  Room was very nice, spacious and perfectly clean. The rooftop bar was not working but food can be ordered at the other bar  and then taken to the rooftop that has such a beautiful view of the city and the river. Hotel food was very good offering both buffet and a la carte menu for breakfast. There is a bit of a walk down to the city and main attractions via Avenida da Liberdade but if you don't fancy walking - metro station is 2 minutes walk from the hotel. If we visit Lisbon again - this is the place we will stay!

Location was good and near the metro station, staff were very polite. Breakfast was amazing, very clean and beautiful rooms. Bed was so comfortable and we had a nice view of the city. The view from the rooftop was extremely beautiful. Overall I would absolutely recommend H10 hotels!

We stayed one night and from walking in to the reception we had a wonderful stay. Staff were very friendly and helpful, rooftop terrace was a great spot for a pre dinner drink, room was spacious, spotlessly clean and very well appointed. Location was so handy, a nice walk to the old town and a cheap taxi trip back.

We stayed at this hotel during the month of October 2021, and had a phenomenal time.  The management team is stellar and extremely helpful; they pay close attention to detail and bend over backwards to help make your experience a memorable one.  I love this hotel!   It's unique and it feels very quaint yet it offers all the amenities you need.  The roof top bar is fantastic, and the breakfast is well decorated with a beautiful display of food.   The price is reasonable, and the service is stellar.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone in Lisbon.  It's located in the city area and everything is within walking distance so it's strategically placed.  I LOVE the H10 TEAM.  They rock

My mom and I stayed here for 6 days. The interior is beautiful and the entire hotel is very clean. Our room was very nicely furnished and had a nice bathroom. The bed is large and soft. We could hear a peep whenever somebody in one of the rooms close to us was using the shower I think, which was a little annoying, but it wasn't very loud so it didn't bother me too much.  Almost every day when we returned from exploring the city our key card didn't work and we had to go back to the lobby to get it fixed. It's weird that this kept happening.  The wifi is horrible, which is a shame since I had to work on a project. Even checking social media was difficult. They do have computers you can use in the lobby.  The breakfast is amazing. A lot of choice, and they even prepare things like

The staff has been incredible with helping plan out our days and making dinner reservations for us. The rooftop bar was closed for the season but the views are still incredible and you can bring a drink from the lobby bar up to enjoy. I would highly recommend staying here!

Was there in Oct 21.Excellant location and service. Great food and breakfast. Roof top bar is beautiful even though the service there could be better. The room was very nice with open balcony. Location was great. Service gets tested when guests have problems. My jewelry box got left at H10 property in Saville and was shipped to Lisbon. The staff was amazing in following the delivery of it, keeping me connected as it could not come before we left.I can not thank them enough!! Will highly recommend the hotel in all categories of stay!

I loved everything about this property - incredible, clean, cozy rooms (with massive beds), and incredible staff who will make sure your stay will them is flawless. It has that home away from home kind of atmosphere which turns you into a repeat customer

Very good boutique hotel close to the Marques de Pombal. The rooftop bar is a must with a magnificent view. Good breakfast, amenities, very quiet and pleasant reception. There is a supermarket in front and very good restaurants as well.  Will come back!

Stayed  for five nights at the H10 Duque de Loule in Lisbon this week.  A beautiful hotel in a great location.  Rooms were bright and very clean and comfortable with a great shower.  Coffee machine and safe provided and kettle supplied on request.  Staff were very efficient and friendly.  Food was great in both the restaurant and bar, and the breakfast selection and service was excellent.  Staff were really helpful and accommodating in reorganising our stay after we had to cancel due to Covid lockdown in Uk.  I would be happy to recommend this hotel for a stay in Lisbon and hope to go back again in the future.

This is a four star review because the place lets itself down by providing inferior toiletries in the rooms.  This is such a shame because the standard is high in every other respect.  Our corner room couldn't have been more comfortable with a huge and good quality bed, quiet air conditioning and plenty of cupboard space.  We really enjoyed the breakfast each day (we stayed for 6 nights).  There's a very extensive and freshly topped up buffet, and you can also order freshly cooked items.  One bottleneck at breakfast was the coffee machine, which frequently had queues and was running out of water/milk.  One final improvement might be to provide fresh bottled water in the room for every night of the stay - however there is a supermarket right opposite which sells bottled water.

H10 is 10/10 the best choice to stay in Lisbon, friendly staff, cosy, well decorated environment, cleaning services and level excellent,  modern, helpful, covid regulations are followed, close to all interesting places to visit. Fluency in english.  No doubt value for money. Very satisfying experience.

Room was good size, well furnished, comfortable. Check in staff went out of their way to be helpful. Even offered a packed breakfast' because I had to leave before 6.00am. on my last day. Amazing buffet breakfast. Good view from roof bar.

The hotel was very comfortable.  The room was small but adequate.  The bathroom was functional.  The lobby area was comfortable and attractive.  The breakfast area was very pleasant, and the food choices were broad and excellent.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  Take advantage of the rooftop bar.  Great views with good drinks and food.

Amazing all round - great location, AMAZING service and beautiful rooms! Rooftop bar is amazing! Everyone speaks multiple languages and cater to every need. Rooms are gorgeous and very clean  10/10 will come back again. Wonderful choice for hotel in Lisbon with your lover

Duque de Loulé is a very nice hotel with good and super friendly staff. The made us feel welcome and at home from checking in until checking out.  Our room was fantastic. The rooftop bar offered delicious cocktails and the view over Lisbon was beautiful. Breakfast was the best we ever had with a lot of fresh food to choose and order. Thank you very much to the complete staff! We definitely want to come back!

It was all super l Nearby the metro station  Clean and nice rooms  Super friendly staff Good breakfast with many thinks to choose and order from the breakfast menu. And last but not least having a drink in the sun on rooftop bar with a view on Lisboa is a super nice !

We stayed here for 3 nights while sightseeing in Lisbon. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel is well located only a few minutes walk from Marques de Pombal Metro station and other bus connections. It took us 15 - 20 minutes to walk into the centre from the hotel.  The roof top has amazing views and we felt that the food there was reasonably priced.  The staff at the hotel are just amazing!!! Honestly we felt that they were actually happy to be taking their time and serving people. Keep up the good work. We had an issue with noise from above our room, and were relocated to a quieter room without any fuss.

This hotel is modern and well-equipped with a knowledgable and accommodating hotel staff. Well located, near shopping and good restaurants, with a beautiful rooftop bar and swimming pool, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

First time in Lisbon with my family & we had an amazing welcome by Diogo & Andre who looked after us so well .  Very professional & friendly, I used the fitness room which is 24h , I had the chance to used the Spa & had a massage from a women ( can t remember her name, she has glasses  ) she was very professional too. We had room service few times which was fast delivered. We also ate in the restaurant & thank you very much to Romario who was fantastic with us & my little son . He is such a great person in his job. The only little things it’s that we couldn’t use the swimming pool with our little one anytime during the day that we would . Good location with many little cafe around.  Highly recommended this hotel.

I booked a room for two nights as a present for my friend. Weeks before, I have asked to the hotel if they could prepare something for my friend's birthday and to upgrade us if possible, they answered it was okay for the birthday attentions and upgrade will be subject to availability. D-day The upgrade was not possible, I totally understood but they did nothing for my friend birthday no commercial gesture, champagne was possible only if I paid for (45 euros)... Well it bothered me since I have ask before to confirm my reservation.  Plus, after that check-in displeasure, there was an issue with the order of room service for the breakfast : cannot order the day before, cannot order by email, a call for telling me there was not credit for my room (easy to charge the room number arf

This hotel was defiantly a 4 star hotel experience. I loved everything about it! We had a VIP romantic room and it was massive, even the bathroom was massive. They decorated our bed with flowers and towels were made into swans and provided us with a champagne and strawberries. It was so beautiful. The service from the staff was really good whenever we needed anything they helped us straight away however they could. Our room was cleaned everyday we stayed there and our beds were made. It was my birthday when I stayed there and they gave me a cute note to wish me and gave us with champagne and a sweet pastry  to celebrate. It really made my day special. We used the Spa and everyone was so kind there and the spa experience was really good would for sure do it again. We were able to

What can you ask for more? 2 pools, 2 bars, parking, Spa and fitness center well equipped, maintained perfectly with excellent staff. All in a best competitive price. My second time there already and will keep coming back.

This hotel is modern and well-equipped with a knowledgable and accommodating hotel staff. Well located, near shopping and good restaurants, with a beautiful rooftop bar and swimming pool, I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

First time in Lisbon with my family & we had an amazing welcome by Diogo & Andre who looked after us so well .  Very professional & friendly, I used the fitness room which is 24h , I had the chance to used the Spa & had a massage from a women ( can t remember her name, she has glasses  ) she was very professional too. We had room service few times which was fast delivered. We also ate in the restaurant & thank you very much to Romario who was fantastic with us & my little son . He is such a great person in his job. The only little things it’s that we couldn’t use the swimming pool with our little one anytime during the day that we would . Good location with many little cafe around.  Highly recommended this hotel.
