Well it bothered me since I have ask before to confirm my reservation.  Plus, after that check-in displeasure, there was an issue with the order of room service for the breakfast : cannot order the day before, cannot order by email, a call for telling me there was not credit for my room (easy to charge the room number arf

This hotel was defiantly a 4 star hotel experience. I loved everything about it! We had a VIP romantic room and it was massive, even the bathroom was massive. They decorated our bed with flowers and towels were made into swans and provided us with a champagne and strawberries. It was so beautiful. The service from the staff was really good whenever we needed anything they helped us straight away however they could. Our room was cleaned everyday we stayed there and our beds were made. It was my birthday when I stayed there and they gave me a cute note to wish me and gave us with champagne and a sweet pastry  to celebrate. It really made my day special. We used the Spa and everyone was so kind there and the spa experience was really good would for sure do it again. We were able to

What can you ask for more? 2 pools, 2 bars, parking, Spa and fitness center well equipped, maintained perfectly with excellent staff. All in a best competitive price. My second time there already and will keep coming back.

Visited Lisbon and decided to stay in this hotel (08.10.21-12.10.21)  Everything was good. friendly staff, clean and comfortable room. Except for 1 thing- staff in the restaurant is rude and absolutely unpleasant..  So the hotel is good, but I don't recommend visiting the restaurant there

Staff is nice.   Noise insulation is poor especially in rooms with windows to the main Street. We had noisy neighbors and also could hear them. We did not get good night sleep.  The room was booked for two, but prepared for one. Reception number was not provided, so I called hotel number and was charged for it!!! In the end reception waived the fee, but was unpleasant situation.  Breakfast is good. However, when we had very early start of the day and asked to pack us breakfast - it was very poor.

A lovely hotel for a short break. Everyone was friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. Excellent breakfast variety and all the food I had was really nice, although some vegetarian main course options would be nice

We stayed one night before flying home with 2 kids under 3. Without even requesting anything we arrived to baby cribs, baby bath and baby soap/cream! Which was amazing! The room was very spacious, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was huge with a big bathtub and large detached shower. Everything was clean. The buffet breakfast was absolutely incredible with so much variety! I can’t speak too much about location because we were just staying one night on our way home but we would definitely recommend regarding everything else!

Really impressed and happy with my stay here, the room was spacious, clean & nicely designed, the staff went out of their way to be affable and helpful . The breakfast was fabulous & the social distancing measures left me feeling safe and looked after. Very happy customer! A******, would recommend wholeheartedly

My boyfriend and I visited this hotel for our first trip abroad since the pandemic and we were not disappointed at all.   Rooms were clean and spacious and had all the sorts of amenities you could want, including a big comfy bed, a nice hot shower, tea and coffee facilities etc.   Breakfast was the absolute highlight of this stay. The fried breakfast was delicious and although you had to be served rather than take yourself, the staff were generous with their portions. The best thing about the breakfast was the delicious pastries, especially the pasteis de nata which were seriously yummy!   The one downfall of the hotel was the pool area. It was a fight every morning to claim your sunbed as there were very few available, so if you didn’t get there at the right time, you stood no

A little bit far from the super center of the city (20-30minutes by car) but it enables you have a nice sleep and bigger room. The reception staff is very nice and speak good English. The rooftop bar is nice!

I stayed in Jupiter Lisboa hotel for 3 days celebrating my birthday and it was amazing!! The staff are so caring, friendly and professional they really care about their customers. On my birthday I was surprised with a gift from the staff that I really wasn’t expecting I couldn’t thank them enough. We were really glad I made the right decision selecting this hotel I would definitely stay again and recommend to my friends and family back home.

This is an amazing hotel to stay in. The staff are so friendly, happy and helpful; the room was really nice, the rooftop pools were great, as was the spa and indoor pool. The hotel is less than a minute away from the Campo Pequeño metro station, making it so easy to travel across the city quickly and cheaply

Stayed for 5 days and nobody came to clean my room, even-though I had a sign “please make up my room” on my doors. Every evening I came back to the no fresh towels on the floor since I left them to be washed. Swimming pool is not included in the price and you have to pay + wear a cap - so you have to also buy a cap there.  Breakfast is really poor, had to go eat outside.

I would definitely recommend staying here! The metro is only 20 meters from the hotel itself and the bed quality is really good! A thing that could be better are the prices at the bar. It’s really expensive in comparison with the prices in Lisbon itself.

I was there for one night and loved the whole experience. Especially the welcome massage I had booked. Amazing! I also ordered a small plate of Tapas(cheese and bread) as room service, which was good but would have been great with some olives or salted nuts. Would revisit if I’m ever in Lisbon again.

It was nice, the people also very nice and helpful, the distance to City center was quit good 2.5 km, it's a pity we didn't have a beautiful view, only many buildings. At the Spa was also very nice and the massage couple was very relaxing.

The hotel is well located in terms of accessibility to the airport and local transport connections with a subway stop right outside the front door and situated roughly equidistant from the historic old part of town, the sporting Lisbon soccer stadium & the modern district  which hosts the aquarium, cable car, science museum & Vasco de Gamma shopping mall. The immediate area around the hotel itself is fairly boring, business like, although a few nice restaurants to be found. The rooftop pool and bar really makes the hotel although the pool temperature was pretty bracing in October and could have done with a couple of degrees heating - it’s probably perfect in the peak heat of summer. The buffet breakfast was very good; the buffet dinner not so much - a fairly limited selection,

This was a nice and clean hotel, well managed. We liked the breakfasts - a selection of cold and warm dishes, nice pastries, juices... The highlight was definitely the rooftop bar and pool. It is not a big pool, but great to cool off. There is another pool downstairs in the spa, but we did not try that (mostly meanth for adults enjoying the treatments there) The hotel is not so near the city center, but it is very close to the yellow metro, but also blue and red are in a short walking distance. Metro was the best option for travelling as any ground traffic suffered from traffic jams, while metro was on time... There are many great restaurants nearby and also a bull fighting arena (now partly a shopping center ;) !

The hotel is located very well, close to restaurants and just a few steps away from the metro and buses. The room was very spacious and clean. The shower was exceptional. The breakfast buffet had a great assortment and the quality was very good. The staff was very helpful.

Jupiter Hotel was an excellent choice for us; good location with easy access to public transportation, friendly and service-minded staff, comfortable rooms and good facilities. Very good value for money!

One of the best hotels we ever stayed with. The only thing was that it was a bit off, but we knew that when we booked. And it really wasn’t a problem since the subway was just outside to the right. Quiet. Clean rooms. Great shower! And good pillows. The corona-breakfast worked fine as well. Really recommend Jupiter Lisboa hotel.

Staff were super friendly, welcoming, the room was beautiful decor wise, space wise and cleanliness. It’s a really great hotel for solo travellers and feels super safe! The spa was great staff were excellent! The whole hotel was incredibly clean. Recommend!

Nice hotel, next too the Metro was perfect for sightseeing Lissabon. Good food at the breakfast, lot of choice and very nice people who are working in the hotel.  The room was also very clean, but the mattress was a bit too hard for me.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Our stay at this hotel was one of the highlights of our holiday. We received an exceptionally warm welcome on arrival, and we were absolutely delighted with our corner suite. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean, and included a sitting room, elegant bathroom, luxuriously comfortable bed, tea and coffee making facilities, and a sun deck complete with loungers and outdoor table and chairs. We also very much appreciated the complimentary decanter of port. However, the highlight of the stay was the staff, who couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating. The reception staff made us feel at home and assisted with every query, while the breakfast staff were efficient and looked after our special dietary needs. The delicious breakfast was served in a lovely, characterful room.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We had such a nice stay here. It's a great location on a quiet street. The boulevard behind the hotel has high-end shopping (if you are in to that - we weren't) and the other parallel street has some nice restaurants and coffee places. That street leads down to a big commercial area.  The breakfast was great with lots of options. I loved the art deco look throughout the hotel. Really stylish! The hotel was also immaculate! Every common area and rooms were very clean.  Now the best part - the staff. They couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. All spoke English. I will stay here again when we come back.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. The overall feel of the hotel was elegant yet not stuffy. Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean and the furniture was lovely and comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and outstanding. The location of the hotel was ideal. In sum, it is among the finest hotel experiences we’ve ever had, anywhere in the world.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: In a city spoilt with tourists it is hard to find a hotel which staff is passionate to walk the extra mile for their guests. At Britania they do! Always with a smile at their face they will make your stay at Lisboa unforgettable. The accomodation itself is Art Deco as its best. Be prepared to be pampered and enjoy this fantastic place at a perfect location!

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Incredibly kind and attentive service. Comfortable bedroom (including the beautifully restored original cork flooring).  Lots of information when asked for and breakfast (including mini Pastel da Nata) till midday!!  My kind of place!!😀

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Our stay at this hotel was one of the highlights of our holiday. We received an exceptionally warm welcome on arrival, and we were absolutely delighted with our corner suite. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean, and included a sitting room, elegant bathroom, luxuriously comfortable bed, tea and coffee making facilities, and a sun deck complete with loungers and outdoor table and chairs. We also very much appreciated the complimentary decanter of port. However, the highlight of the stay was the staff, who couldn't have been more helpful and accommodating. The reception staff made us feel at home and assisted with every query, while the breakfast staff were efficient and looked after our special dietary needs. The delicious breakfast was served in a lovely, characterful room.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We had such a nice stay here. It's a great location on a quiet street. The boulevard behind the hotel has high-end shopping (if you are in to that - we weren't) and the other parallel street has some nice restaurants and coffee places. That street leads down to a big commercial area.  The breakfast was great with lots of options. I loved the art deco look throughout the hotel. Really stylish! The hotel was also immaculate! Every common area and rooms were very clean.  Now the best part - the staff. They couldn't have been nicer and more helpful. All spoke English. I will stay here again when we come back.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We had a wonderful experience staying at this hotel. The staff was warm, friendly and helpful. The overall feel of the hotel was elegant yet not stuffy. Our room was spacious, spotlessly clean and the furniture was lovely and comfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and outstanding. The location of the hotel was ideal. In sum, it is among the finest hotel experiences we’ve ever had, anywhere in the world.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: In a city spoilt with tourists it is hard to find a hotel which staff is passionate to walk the extra mile for their guests. At Britania they do! Always with a smile at their face they will make your stay at Lisboa unforgettable. The accomodation itself is Art Deco as its best. Be prepared to be pampered and enjoy this fantastic place at a perfect location!

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Incredibly kind and attentive service. Comfortable bedroom (including the beautifully restored original cork flooring).  Lots of information when asked for and breakfast (including mini Pastel da Nata) till midday!!  My kind of place!!😀

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Best location, exceptionally clean rooms and very friendly staff. The hotel is close to major attractions and good restaurants. We had a great time at the hotel.  Carolina and Miguel at the front desk were amazing.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Well, what an excellent experience!  Delightful hotel located one road behind Avenida Liberdade, with Avenida Metro 300 metres away. Shops, cafes, everything all close by yet very peaceful.   This is a beautifully appointment hotel in every respect.  Our room was exceptional, very spacious, huge comfortable bed with so many comfy pillows. A complimentary carafe of Port awaited which was a nice touch.  There was an additional small room just before entering the bedroom, which was handy for storing cases, it also contained the tea/coffee making facilities and a fridge, from here lead into a large bright bathroom.  Again, lots of thoughtful little touches and an excellent shower.  Breakfast was served between 7.30 to 12 noon which enabled you to relax and not rush to meet the usual

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We stayed for four nights and had a wonderful time in Hotel Britania. Terrific staff who looked after us. Gave us some splendid recommendations for restaurants. We enjoyed the afternoon tea and port too.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: From the moment you enter the lobby at the Britania you know you've arrived somewhere special. The hotel lobby, lounge and bar are incredibly beautiful and decorated with all kinds of historical art and photos. Our room was huge and fully restored to its original glory. It was clean, spotless and really comfortable. Our bed felt like it was the size of two king beds.  But beyond the design and the room, the service is what really makes this place amazing. The hotel staff are so genuinely friendly, helpful and attentive and you really feel like an honored guest. We especially enjoyed the afternoon/evening tea service with tea, coffee, pastries, and port. We spent a few hours out of the bad weather just hanging out and soaking up the history. Carolina even gave us a tour of the

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Merveilleux art deco hotel ! A magic place with history...The only one of this kind in Lisboa Most friendly staf ! Personel attentif et chaleureux !! Onvergetelijke belevenis ! Om zeker terug te komen ! Obrigado !!!

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Tucked in a quite street parallel to the main avenue, 10 minutes walk to the old town , Hotel Britannia is a beautifully appointed Art Deco hotel. The room was spacious with Art Deco furniture, very clean. Great value for money. The staff was also very helpful.Two minutes walk to all the great shops and many restaurants and cafes jyst around the corner

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We stayed for 4 nights and it really is an Art Deco gem; accurately described in the write ups of the hotel.  I'd like to say that ALL of the staff were so friendly and helpful and really could not fault anything.  I'd like to make a special mention to Daniel who greeted us at the door when we pulled up in our rental car (rather tired after a 3 hour+ drive). His smiling face (albeit behind a mask) and helpfulness was there for us the whole time during our stay. He really went over and above.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This is a lovely quiet and serene hotel , just off the main Avenida Liberdade - a very central spot in Lisbon. This is a very Portuguese area of Lisbon, not solely set up for the foreign tourists, but an area where locals come to in the evenings or for the expensive shops. The road one back from the hotel has lots of small local restaurants, some aspiring to michelin status, and some family places , where Mum/Dad is in the kitchen and the adult children are running front of house. On Avenida Liberdade are some expensive restaurants, which are very good, if thats your thing. The main thing about the Britania is the is the lovely staff, they were all so pleasant and welcoming, its a stylish hotel and very well maintained. The breakfast was particularly good, with the breakfast

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Loved the relaxed breakfast offered from 7-noon.  This helped us bridge an afternoon pickup on our last day.  Great restaurant recommendations and suggestions for things to do and see.  The Port in the room was a nice touch.  We loved our stay!

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My wife and I had just finished walking the Portuguese Camino and treated ourselves to a five night stay in Lisbon. I found Hotel Britania purely by luck. The hotel location a short block off the Avenida was perfect for us. The room was spacious and the entire facility was immaculately clean. The staff was incredible. Their dining recommendations were spot on. They were extremely helpful in obtaining and printing our COVID results for our flights back home. We both left Lisbon agreeing Hotel Britania provided us with the best hotel experience of our life.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Customer service and hotel were top class, we were greeted early morning and brought to our room. Front desk were excellent and Thiago who ran bar and concierge always smiling and couldn't do enough, very friendly also. The hotel offers a small indoor pool which was a grest wsy to start the stay. Location is perfect.  A must visit hotel and the city will not disappoint.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This is an Art Deco hotel built in the 1940’s.  It has elegant marble and cork wood floors.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  The location is near much of central Lisbon.  The rooms are large and the beds quite comfortable. Breakfast was excellent, with an assortment of fresh fruit, eggs, breads and fresh pastry. As an added bonus, pastries are offered in the evening as well as unlimited port and local cherry liquor. The bathroom is somewhat dated.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Large comfortable room. Friendly and very helpful staff. Nice morning breakfast.   So why only 4 stars? Because I am comparing this hotel to the Avenida Palace -- where I stayed recently.  The comparison:  Room: Equally large. Equally excellent comfortable beds. Equally excellent and quiet HVAC. Bathroom: The Britania has a perfectly functional bathroom, but comes in significantly lacking in modern finishes and fixtures when compared to the Avenida Palace. Location: Both are in very desirable areas and, in fact, are within easy walking distance of one another. But the Avenida Palace has a superior location on the Ave Libertad (although the Britania is on a parallel street).  Morning buffet: Both have complementary morning buffets. The Avenida Palace serves theirs in a

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This is a historic hotel with a staff that was the most professional and helpful I have ever experienced, and we have stayed in hotels around the world. From the front desk where we were welcomed by Victor to the lounge, where Jefferson mixed like a professional, any drink you could envision, we were never disappointed.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We stayed for 2 nights and enjoyed our stay. Probably a 10/15 min walk to main attractions. The staff were very friendly and made a great recommendation for dinner (Sr. Lisboa). We didn't have breakfast. Rooms are large and have everything you would expect. Iron was available on request. Only reason it lost a star was because the walls are a little thin and we had a noisy couple next to us.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Our third visit to beautiful Lisbon and our third stay in the wonderful Hotel Britania.  With the most friendly and welcoming staff, wonderful art deco surroundings and in a great location, we cannot recommend this Hotel highly enough.  The staff remembered us and greeted us like old friends.  Celebrating a special (25th) wedding anniversary, we were presented with a bottle of sparking wine on ice which was such a thoughtful and much appreciated gesture.  We opted for a room with a balcony on this trip and were thrilled with its charm and comfort.  Very large comfy bed, well stocked bathroom (Molten Brown product, fluffy white robes and slippers) and plenty of storage space.  All rooms have safes, mini bars and some complimentary port wine.  The hotel offers breakfast which is

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Excellent and big room, with amenities and super classic and clean. Germinate room ideal for family. Excellent localization and great brekfast. Great hotel. Classic Hotel. Ideal for famillies. Great city Lisbon, spetacular. I traveled in setember 6th.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My husband and I had the privilege of staying at Hotel Britania for 3 nights - we wish it was longer. This historical Art Deco boutique hotel is one of the finest hotels that I have experienced in a long. From the moment you walk through the door, the friendly assistance makes you feel like a VIP guest. Our room was a delight, spotlessly clean and freshen up like a daisy by the lovely Lucia every morning. A special thank you and much gratitude to  Miguel, Jefferson as well as the breakfast staff. We can't wait to visit you again. Obrigada.

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Charming Art Deco hotel, great location ( on a side street near a main street, just close enough to action without being in the middle of it).  Great breakfast and bar, take a coffee in the afternoon - you won't be disappointed.  Big comfortable rooms, and comfortable bed!  Good toiletries in the bathroom, too.  And the front desk staff is one of the best I've seen, go for the hospitality if nothing else, true professionals and very sincerely took great care of us.  I can't wait to return!

Hotel: Hotel Britania, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Wonderful stay at Hotel Britania. Very friendly staff, excellent accommodations, and we could not have asked for a better location from which to explore Lisboa. Would absolutely book a room at Hotel Britania for our next trip to Lisboa.

Beautiful hotel, amazing staff. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October to celebrate my husband's birthday, we booked a deluxe room which was huge and comfortable. The hotel delivered cava, chocolates & custard pies, a lovely surprise. Every member of staff were curtious and helpful, especially the gentleman and Ines who checked us in and gave us a map of the area and explained where everything is in the city. I also must mention Hugo who walked us across the courtyard to show us where the rooftop bar is situated, very helpful and friendly , he made us feel very welcome. The location is cental to everything, I would most definitely recommend and return in the future.

Just returned from this lovely hotel, both the hotel & staff were excellent !! We were there for the weekend for my wife's birthday. The hotel gave us an upgrade plus sent up a bottle fizz and cake on the night of her birthday. I emailed ahead to ask for restaurant recommendations, the hotel responded promptly with four choices, therefore, we selected a couple and the hotel then booked them on our behalf ! The location is also great !  We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone !

My first visit to this hotel and it will always be my hotel of choice in Lisbon. Centrally located just off the Rossio and overlooking a pedestrianised street. My deluxe room was spacious and well decorated and overlooked a courtyard which backed on to its sister hotel, Hotel Mundial. I had asked for a kettle and this was in the room waiting for me.  Bed extremely comfortable and interior shutters blocked out light at night. The staff on reception were exceptionally helpful and friendly. For comfort, location and quietness this hotel is unbeatable.

Great location, super friendly and helpful staff, and a design that sometimes makes you feel like you are in a classic bond film - absolutely loved it. Especially for the price, it was brilliant. Would stay again and again.

Amazing Experience!!!  Hotel staff is very accommodating and genuinely nice.  The breakfast room is efficiently run and catered to every need.  The Hotel is in a great location, walking distance to everything and convenient to the trains.  The front desk staff eagerly made reservation and helped us with making arrangements for our stay.

Beautiful hotel, amazing staff. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October to celebrate my husband's birthday, we booked a deluxe room which was huge and comfortable. The hotel delivered cava, chocolates & custard pies, a lovely surprise. Every member of staff were curtious and helpful, especially the gentleman and Ines who checked us in and gave us a map of the area and explained where everything is in the city. I also must mention Hugo who walked us across the courtyard to show us where the rooftop bar is situated, very helpful and friendly , he made us feel very welcome. The location is cental to everything, I would most definitely recommend and return in the future.

Just returned from this lovely hotel, both the hotel & staff were excellent !! We were there for the weekend for my wife's birthday. The hotel gave us an upgrade plus sent up a bottle fizz and cake on the night of her birthday. I emailed ahead to ask for restaurant recommendations, the hotel responded promptly with four choices, therefore, we selected a couple and the hotel then booked them on our behalf ! The location is also great !  We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone !

My first visit to this hotel and it will always be my hotel of choice in Lisbon. Centrally located just off the Rossio and overlooking a pedestrianised street. My deluxe room was spacious and well decorated and overlooked a courtyard which backed on to its sister hotel, Hotel Mundial. I had asked for a kettle and this was in the room waiting for me.  Bed extremely comfortable and interior shutters blocked out light at night. The staff on reception were exceptionally helpful and friendly. For comfort, location and quietness this hotel is unbeatable.

Great location, super friendly and helpful staff, and a design that sometimes makes you feel like you are in a classic bond film - absolutely loved it. Especially for the price, it was brilliant. Would stay again and again.

Amazing Experience!!!  Hotel staff is very accommodating and genuinely nice.  The breakfast room is efficiently run and catered to every need.  The Hotel is in a great location, walking distance to everything and convenient to the trains.  The front desk staff eagerly made reservation and helped us with making arrangements for our stay.

A bright, spacious, modern hotel conveniently located in the city centre. The accommodation was extremely comfortable and spotlessly clean. We found the staff, particularly the front of house staff very helpful, knowledgeable and professional. After our return to UK we had cause to contact the hotel again for assistance which we received promptly. Would certainly recommend.

Cracking location a short walk from many tourist attractions. Clean, modern hotel with a very good breakfast offering! Our stay was made even better by (I think her name was) Magdalena who was ever so helpful and a credit to the hotel. We would happily return!

We stayed at Hotel Portugal for a long weekend. When arriving from the airport we used the metro. It’s the red line from airport to alameda where we changed and then caught another tram to Rossio. When arriving at Rossio it’s literally 5 mins away. The hotel staff were extremely helpful. Gave us plenty of advice on where to eat and made bookings where necessary. They kindly assisted in printing of some paperwork for our return journey home. The rooms were clean and we were in room 409 which had a tub and quite spacious. It was my birthday when arriving and they sent some Prosecco and chocolate truffles to the room. A great hotel to stay and centrally located. Would definitely recommend this hotel if visiting Lisbon!

You CANNOT get a better location in Lisbon. Central to everything. The staff is great. Helpful, knowledgeable and willing to arrange any reservations, day trips or accommodations you need. Rooms are modern and comfortable. Everything we were looking for and more.

Travelled with 5 friend from 20th May.. What a fantastic hotel. Excellent and very helpful reception staff and other staff around the hotel, really amazing. Cannot fault the service and always done professionally and with a smile.  Breakfast was excellent as was room service. Rooms exactly as the photos and kept immaculate. Housekeeping deserve credit also. Hotel is near sister hotel Dunning which has a fabulous room top bar overlooking the city playing soft House music with a DJ and saxophonist. Excellent location too. Right in the centre. 100% stay here. I would if I visited again.

Fabulous modern and stylish hotel with excellent service the 2 girls in reception were outstanding in their welcome. The room bed was enormous , linen was superb we chose a shower room which was spacious with walk in shower with a rainshower and handheld with toiletries from Rituals, the breakfast was again outstanding , I guess it usually a buffet but in Covid times you have an allocated table all cold offerings are brought to your table and then you are offerred the hot with a large list of options (you can have them all if you can manage it!). Parking was free in their underground car park which was great . The Portugal shares a block with its sister hotel Mundial and you can walk across the innercourtyard to it. Mundial is more classic old elegance and has a well rated

We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in September 2020, very COVID aware  with temperature check on arrival,  regular cleaning on show, sanitisers at every entrance lifts etc, suitcase and passport all sanitised on our arrival. all staff were fabulous so helpful, especially Deborah and all the other girls on reception/concierge , nothing too much trouble they booked us train tickets/ restaurants and even walked us to a taxi to give taxi driver instructions, there is a wine cellar room which unfortunately was  closed due to Covid, but we went to the Muriad ? restaurant in their adjacent sister hotel which was absolutely superb. This hotel is centrally located and is great value, the breakfasts also very good , would definitely recommend this hotel.

My wife and I just returned from Lisbon. The Portugal Boutique Hotel was a great place to stay. The room was large and had all the comforts that you would expect. The breakfast was delicious. The best part of our stay were the people working at the hotel. During these trying 'COVID-19' times it was great to have such helpful and friendly people help us make responsible, safe and enjoyable decisions as to what we should do to get the most out of our stay. Great place to stay.

It's rare that I write reviews, but others need to know about Portugal Boutique Hotel. It was my first time in Lisbon, a destination we chose to celebrate our 1st anniversary/babymoon.  I choose this hotel due to the wonderful reviews about the customer service, and option of vegan breakfasts. Whilst I expected it to be good, I didn't expect to want to take all the staff home with me, or for me to want to never leave. They seriously couldn't do enough to help us; genuinely so friendly, kind, fun, all round wonderful staff!!! The manager is clearly an amazing person, who has not only instilled incredible customer service, but has recruited some of the loveliest, and professional staff I have ever met.   What I loved: The staff!!! (in case you didn't know that already). From the

This hotel was one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in, all staff were brilliant, hotel was spotless clean, felt save, sanatisers every where, breakfast, with social distancing, rooftop bar great, room big with excellent bathroom, one more big shout out for excellent staff

The visit to this hotel was wonderful from start to finish. It was to celebrate my 70th birthday which was way back in February but because of Covid had been cancelled in April. On arrival we were greeted by pleasant reception staff who gave us a glass of water and a small cake while we checked in our room was deluxe one and so large and decorated in blue with a large bed a large wall mirror which contained a tv which held our name and room no of 103 on the screen. The bathroom had a bath with shower over it, two sinks and a further huge shower. The windows overlooked a small terrace with tables and chairs and umbrellas where breakfast could be taken . The breakfast was good fresh fruit salad,bread croissants, cheese, ham preserves and butter plus additional items you could

We spent three nights here. The property is very well located in central Lisbon  on a quiet pedestrianised street  . Check-in and baggage handling are efficiently dealt with  . The room (302) was spacious and well presented in a modern style the bathroom was similarly well designed  with double rain  showers and a tub . toiletries are medium quality . There is a complimentary breakfast which is Ala Carte due to the pandemic nevertheless the portion sizes  are very generous and quality and variety are superb . The staff generally are very friendly especially in the restaurant , but the standout was definitely  Ricardo who helped with luggage and provided room services he was  a pleasure to deal with and couldn’t do enough for us. In short this is a good value well run four star

Great hotel in the heart of Lisabon! Location couldn’t be better, the hotel staff is ultra friendly and helpful, we received a lot of useful inside tips for our stay! Large, super clean rooms, everything looks perfect in this boutique hotel. Offers free parking.

Amazing hotel whenever you visit Portugal must take a stay in the hotel food is excellent over there  I will give a pic Thumbs up to this hotel hospitality why you are is amazing the staff are very good

Great location and beautiful hotel- but best of all was the staff who were fully prepared for post Covid-19 travellers with gel stations everywhere and staff wiping every surface after anyone has touched it. Free drink at the bar - barman friendly and experienced in making cocktails.  Breakfast was excellent, and well-planned with table settings brought after guests are seated and great options of extras (eg smoked salmon and scrambled eggs)though I may be a tad biased after the glass of bubbly offered with our orange juice. :) Definitely will revisit in the future

Perfect position for the hotel being in the centre. The hotel was exceptionally clean, the staff were magnificent. This is the best hotel we have everstayed in.   The room was very large and fully equiped. Just a shame the coffee making machine wasnt free.  The staff were fabulous, they went out of their way to answer our questions and were very helpfull as we were there at a very difficult time. The breakfast (included in the price) was amazing and plenty of choice.

1. Great city centre location Enjoyable walking distance to most of the sites. 2. Very spacious and modern (21st century shower) bathroom.  As we were travelling about a month, we had two large luggage.  We still had a good space left with two luggage racks. 3. Very hard working friendly staff including doorman. 4. Good selection of buffet breakfast.  Egg tart was one of the best we had in Portugal. 5. Their affiliated hotel, next door, has a rooftop bar, where you enjoy a beautiful waterfront view of Lisbon.

Unassuming hotel as it's quite hidden away. But once your in the lobby the quality is immediately obvious.  All the staff were exceptional which most hotels struggle with. They were attentive a thoughtful, prepared plates and cutlery when we ordered food in, any time my taxi arrived they contacted me even though I didn't tell them I ordered one :D.   Breakfast was very good, plenty of variety and fresh. Macarons and Nata were especially good.  We were also upgraded as the hotel seemed rather empty and room was very nice and had welcome drink, water and chocolates.  Definitely will book here when I'm back in Lisbon. A special thank you to the reception staff from 1st - 3rd March.

Our room was 305, one of the quietest hotel rooms we have have ever stayed in. The room was large and spacious, with a fantastic bathroom and shower. The location of the hotel is brilliant, very convenient for all the major places to visit. All the staff are fantastic, from the guy who opens the door, to the reception staff, cleaning personnel and people who help with breakfast. All the staff are helpful, polite and cheerful. Special mention to Dulce, Joao and Vera who helped at breakfast. The breakfast is great, with a wide variety of good quality food.. The only very minor criticism is that the breakfast area is a bit small and there isn’t free coffee/tea in the room. As a couple, we stayed for 6 nights, but only got one free bottle of water for both of us and one free cup of

We visited Lisbon for my wife's birthday and stayed in this lovely hotel, which is no more than 2 minutes from Rossio Metro station. Upon arrival we were welcomed and shown to our upgraded room, which was beautiful. The staff were very friendly and so helpful giving great advice on where to eat and visit. The reception recommended and booked the birthday dinner for my wife ... which was exceptional, they also sent her a bottle of  champagne and chocolates as a surprise present, this made my wife feel so special. The Hotel is close to many of Lisbon's attractions and transport links, there is a sister hotel next door with a restaurant and rooftop bar which gave stunning views over the city... great for a late night drink.  The breakfast was excellent with a great choice of hot

Beautiful hotel and great convenient location ! They are the positives.  However the negatives.. On check in we were told our deluxe room was first floor street view, I enquired as to whether it would be noisy and was assured it wasn't. I was woken early each morning by noise on the street so I suggest if you want a quiet break ask for garden view. However the biggest disappoint was the breakfast. The first morning I requested the hot breakfast and everything on the plate was cold except for the eggs. I pointed this out and it was returned with half of the original items and what tasted like it was warmed up in the microwave. The second morning I requested a crepe and again it was cold.  I noticed many other disgruntled customers complaining about the delays and similar issues.

Above all our expectations, is a good summary of what the four of us in the family have felt here from the first moment until departure. There is nothing to object to or demand, which can be said to be exceptional. Admittedly, the meaning of details is different for different people, but none of us have done anything but enjoy right through the entire stay. What is so good then? We start with the location, unbeatable on a street inside the large boulevard that goes down to the water. So central, but no disturbing sounds at all. An oasis in the middle of the city! In addition, the narrow Ruas das Portas de Santo Antao is very nice with lot's of  restaurants. You are close to a number of sights worth seeing, such as the castle and the tram ride with the 28th. The hotel itself is

This is a gorgeous property in a beautiful, central location in Lisbon. For the price, I would say the overall experience was sub-par. My room being street-facing, there was quite a bit of noise at all hours of the night, from garbage trucks, to construction, to revelers at the nearby restaurant. A wall panel in my room had come undone and was not fixed. The service was also below average. Though they were helpful in ordering taxis, three times I requested an appointment/recommendation at a local nail salon (their spa did not offer that service) and received no follow up.

my husband and i just spent a nice long weekend in this hotel. The location is very good -walking distance to major sights and close to lots of good restaurants, but at the same time also quiet. I like the small details the hotel offers such as welcome drinks, chocolates, masks and hand sanitisers (small size to bring with you). The spa is small and due to covid ristriction need to be booked - each booking for 40 minutes. Good thing is you then have the place all for yourself. The breakfast was very good - one of the best i had from a hotel. not buffet but a la carte - unlimited though. Also - breakfast is until 12!! I highly recommende to book a room with breakfast included. Only downside is that the outdoor swimming pool is not heated - so no one was using it...   Tip: we got

I've never really thought about going to Lisbon, but when my daughter was holidaying there a few weeks ago and started sending through photos and details of her experience, I became intrigued and booked a long weekend.  The One Palacio de Anunciada was an absolute joy!  Around 25 mins drive from the airport (only 14 euros in an Uber - Uber is ridiculously cheap in Lisbon!) and located in a really quaint and characterful side street, yet no more than five minutes walk from the bustling hub of Lisbon with its fascinating architecture, mosaics, trams and fantastic food in one direction and the grandness of it in the other. I immediately noticed a beautiful aroma in the hotel as we arrived. The hotel feels grand, yet intimate, modern, yet at the same time has an old-fashioned

Beautiful hotel and great convenient location ! They are the positives.  However the negatives.. On check in we were told our deluxe room was first floor street view, I enquired as to whether it would be noisy and was assured it wasn't. I was woken early each morning by noise on the street so I suggest if you want a quiet break ask for garden view. However the biggest disappoint was the breakfast. The first morning I requested the hot breakfast and everything on the plate was cold except for the eggs. I pointed this out and it was returned with half of the original items and what tasted like it was warmed up in the microwave. The second morning I requested a crepe and again it was cold.  I noticed many other disgruntled customers complaining about the delays and similar issues.

The hotel itself is

Though they were helpful in ordering taxis, three times I requested an appointment/recommendation at a local nail salon (their spa did not offer that service) and received no follow up.

my husband and i just spent a nice long weekend in this hotel. The location is very good -walking distance to major sights and close to lots of good restaurants, but at the same time also quiet. I like the small details the hotel offers such as welcome drinks, chocolates, masks and hand sanitisers (small size to bring with you). The spa is small and due to covid ristriction need to be booked - each booking for 40 minutes. Good thing is you then have the place all for yourself. The breakfast was very good - one of the best i had from a hotel. not buffet but a la carte - unlimited though. Also - breakfast is until 12!! I highly recommende to book a room with breakfast included. Only downside is that the outdoor swimming pool is not heated - so no one was using it...   Tip: we got

I've never really thought about going to Lisbon, but when my daughter was holidaying there a few weeks ago and started sending through photos and details of her experience, I became intrigued and booked a long weekend.  The One Palacio de Anunciada was an absolute joy!  Around 25 mins drive from the airport (only 14 euros in an Uber - Uber is ridiculously cheap in Lisbon!) and located in a really quaint and characterful side street, yet no more than five minutes walk from the bustling hub of Lisbon with its fascinating architecture, mosaics, trams and fantastic food in one direction and the grandness of it in the other. I immediately noticed a beautiful aroma in the hotel as we arrived. The hotel feels grand, yet intimate, modern, yet at the same time has an old-fashioned

I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and had very nice stay. The hotel has beautiful interiors and cosy rooms. Entire space smelled beautifully ! My room however had some leaks on the wall and needs refreshing up .  The food at the breakfast was delicious and plenty ! However salad of asparagus was a bit of a joke. I got one asparagus cut in half and half of cherry tomato. Important to point out is that one could order two of these salads. These were included in the breakfast price.  The most disappointing was that yet another hotel does not recognise single customers and charge them price for double room and double breakfast. A discount for single breakfast would be at least expected.

A Beautiful hotel and super location. The interiors are stunning feel very palatial but with a modern twist. The rooftop pool area was a great place to hangout after a long day sightseeing. Loved the breakfast! Super service on the whole (a bit slow at times).

We booked 5 nights at “The One” in Lisbon for our second only break since Covid. It seemed to tick all our boxes. New or newly refurbished boutique hotel, pool, gym and outdoor area. We arrived to be greeted by a very friendly reception guy who told us our room was ready. He then said without prompting that if we wrote a good review and they could check it first then they would give us a free bottle of wine. He laughed and called this Portuguese blackmail! Well as a lawyer, I don’t do blackmail, and nor do I write unfair reviews.   In any event, we were shown to our room, which was very small with a tiny window on the top floor. When I booked the room, we booked a “deluxe”, which was one up from the “Cosy” Room. Both of which are shown and described on the hotel website. We went

What a beautiful hotel with very welcoming staff. Spotless room, great location and an incredible setting. The terrace and pool are incredible which makes the fact we couldn’t use them even more disappointing.  Day two of our two day break the hotel has a wedding on which means all amenities are closed to guest. No indication of this when booking. At no point we’re we informed that the hotel would be closed to us. The whole reason we booked the hotel was for the pool and facilities but we can’t use them.  The alternative from the hotel was to use the pool of their sister hotel which is where I write this review from. Horrendous and in no way of the same standard. Don’t go to the sister hotel. Waste of you time and just adds to the frustrations. The reception staff have been very

Fabulous five star hotel, with a central location. Rooms are large with every comfort. Food is delicious served by friendly staff. Facilities are excellent with an outdoor pool and bar. Will be back !

Location is great , hotel deluxe rooms are ok , no view , not worth the price and their reservation process over the phone is not good. I called them directly booked 3 rooms  for  3 nights and I did'nt get any reward despite the fact that they didn't have to pay a commision to booking or any  other plateform. First and last time there.

Its amazing new renovated 5 Stars Hotel in the Middle of Lissabon, we use the pool outside after Coming (2 Flights from 6.00 to 12.00) from Germany - to relax and went 4 hours later to explore the Capital in the early evening.  You can organize the transfer - from/to the the airport - over the concierge of the hotel. For us it was very nice to get our guide - over the same service.  The breakfast is very delightful - don´t miss it !!!

Wonderful experience overall mainly because of the great attentions received from staff members like Karla, Martha, Lucas, Mario, Ricardo, Raphael, Beatriz - so so caring, Miguel - so precise, Paolo - incredible human being, Samuelson, Antonio, Raphaela, Vera, Nina and other members of the Team. We can confirm we'll come back to Lisbon and therefore to The One Palacio de Anunciada. We do believe Solange (at reception) could increase her level of kindness to keep up with the standard of the rest of the Team. Last, but not least we want to say that Helio "the Manager" is excellent.

The hotel is beautiful, but service is lackluster. Apparently the staff doesn't like management and it shows. Was extremely disappointed,  will not go back, We went with another couple, and their room was 100 euro less than ours and they refuse correct. Also not all rooms have a mirror. Never heard of!

Perfect location and beautiful room. The staff is exceptional and the amenities are everything you’d need or want.  As shown in the photo the room is spotless, tastefully decorated in a calming way, and there is zero city noise coming into the room.

Great hotel with lovely rooftop pool. Service is fantastic and location perfect to explore Lisbon. Room with a garden view was clean and has everything you need. The beds are very comfy. Would recommend having breakfast in the garden which has a lovely setting and the service is great.

First impression of the hotel was excellent. We arrived an hour early to check in and they accommodated us in a beautiful clean room. The service at check in and particularly the concierge Lucas was wonderful, everyone very chatty, happy and couldn’t help you enough. The location is perfect, we were able to walk to all of the tourist attractions in less than half an hour. The outdoor pool is beautiful and gets the sun until 6/7 o’clock, great to chill after a day of sightseeing. And the wine bar/terrace is a lovely setting for a drink. 10/10 hotel highly recommend, best city centre hotel I have stayed in.

Amazing location, exceptional service and beautiful facilities - couldn’t recommend this hotel more! Only 2 people are allowed in the spa at one time during covid but it’s easy to book and there was plenty of availability. The outdoor pool is a real highlight.

Our stay at the One Palacio was wonderful! The hotel is beautiful, very clean, and centrally located. The service was exceptional and the entire staff was friendly and helpful, especially Rafael. We were celebrating our honeymoon and they welcomed us with a beautiful cake and champagne in our room as well as welcome cocktails. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again ourselves. Thank you!

It's a pure pleasure to visit this hotel, high-end experience, starting from the entrance! Beautiful room, huge bed and the best possible linen. The service staff were really experienced and took all possible measures needed during the times of pandemic! The pool at the top is something to die for 🥰

We received an outstanding welcome by the front of house staff. This is a beautifully appointed hotel with all the amenities and services you can expect from a true 5 star hotel. Located on a quiet street just behind the main shopping avenue.

I was very pleased with my stay in this hotel , the service was very personal and brilliant . The location is perfect for walking the center . Bed rooms were very comfy and so clean witch was amazing . The only down fall is that there wasn’t a lot of sun beds at the pool .  But would definitely stay in this hotel again ! 😁

We stayed in one of the suite and had such a lovely time. This hotel is beautifully designed, extremely well located and clean. The staff is amazing, they truly look after you!  Mario was very helpful and took great care of us.  This hotel is perfect for a romantic gateway! We loved every minute of it and can’t wait to come back! Thank you to the whole team for making this very special stay better than we could have imagined!

Beautiful hotel and lovely staff! Can’t wait to come visit again! The pool was really nice to spend the day and great to relax away from the city. The bed was also really comfortable. Service is amazing from start to end

Excellent front of house service and a very spacious room. The bed, bedding and pillows were very comfortable and conducive to high quality sleep. Blackout blinds around the room too.  Pool is in an interesting part of the building and very relaxed feel.  Lots of different areas inside the hotel to explore and the garden for drinks is beautiful.  Concierge was also very helpful with ideas of where to eat (Zapata, Ramiro) and to travel.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My husband and I stayed here for our first two nights in Lisboa. What a great spot to get our bearings! The staff was SO friendly and super helpful with directions and helping us to navigate the latest COVID restrictions!. The room was so clean and spacious. The breakfast and complimentary port wine were both yummy and appreciated!   We will definitely stay here again!!

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We have just spent the most amazing 4 nights at this delightful boutique hotel. Ideally situated and an easy walk from all the main attractions in Lisbon but quiet and relaxing. Lovely big room, very good breakfast and very helpful staff. Special mention to Ruben who’s restaurant recommendations were excellent. Highly recommended

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My husband and I stayed at this charming hotel for 4 nights in room 54.  The room was spacious with beautiful views of the city. The well insulated walls  and the shuttered windows were perfect for sleeping.  Housekeeping did an excellent job. The 2 people who worked at reception went above and beyond in providing excellent service in recommending restaurants, wine shops (Garrafeira Nacional) and information where to go for Covid testing for our return to the US.  There was a pharmacy a few blocks away that take appointments. Otherwise, people wait in long lines without appointments. Breakfast in the lobby was fantastic.  Items included: bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, beans, imberico ham, cheeses, variety of bread, fresh fruit, olives, tomatoes, juices, coffee, tea and the best

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My daughter and  I stayed here for four nights, we just loved the hotel, our room, our view, our breakfast. The staff made our break perfect, my daughter had her birthday during the visit and she was completely spoilt - bottle of champagne waiting for her in her room after our meal out. Oh they do the best G&T night caps! Can’t wait to revisit …

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This was a very nice boutique hotel located toward the center of Lisbon, not far from the historic train station.  The hotel is beautiful inside and the rooms were lovely.  Service was first class.  Breakfast each morning was relatively extensive.  The location was easy to get to historic Lisbon and there are plenty of good restaurants around.  Definitely a good place to base your visit of Lisbon.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My husband and I stayed here for our first two nights in Lisboa. What a great spot to get our bearings! The staff was SO friendly and super helpful with directions and helping us to navigate the latest COVID restrictions!. The room was so clean and spacious. The breakfast and complimentary port wine were both yummy and appreciated!   We will definitely stay here again!!

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We have just spent the most amazing 4 nights at this delightful boutique hotel. Ideally situated and an easy walk from all the main attractions in Lisbon but quiet and relaxing. Lovely big room, very good breakfast and very helpful staff. Special mention to Ruben who’s restaurant recommendations were excellent. Highly recommended

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My husband and I stayed at this charming hotel for 4 nights in room 54.  The room was spacious with beautiful views of the city. The well insulated walls  and the shuttered windows were perfect for sleeping.  Housekeeping did an excellent job. The 2 people who worked at reception went above and beyond in providing excellent service in recommending restaurants, wine shops (Garrafeira Nacional) and information where to go for Covid testing for our return to the US.  There was a pharmacy a few blocks away that take appointments. Otherwise, people wait in long lines without appointments. Breakfast in the lobby was fantastic.  Items included: bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, beans, imberico ham, cheeses, variety of bread, fresh fruit, olives, tomatoes, juices, coffee, tea and the best

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My daughter and  I stayed here for four nights, we just loved the hotel, our room, our view, our breakfast. The staff made our break perfect, my daughter had her birthday during the visit and she was completely spoilt - bottle of champagne waiting for her in her room after our meal out. Oh they do the best G&T night caps! Can’t wait to revisit …

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This was a very nice boutique hotel located toward the center of Lisbon, not far from the historic train station.  The hotel is beautiful inside and the rooms were lovely.  Service was first class.  Breakfast each morning was relatively extensive.  The location was easy to get to historic Lisbon and there are plenty of good restaurants around.  Definitely a good place to base your visit of Lisbon.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Excellent location near Restauradores and Rossio Metro Stations. Easy walk to Baixa and Chiado for shopping, plus loads of interesting places nearby. Comfortable and spacious rooms, good breakfast choice and most of all excellent concierge service. We had a lot of COVID-related forms to fill on-line and print. Miguel was simply amazing as were all of the staff.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We stayed here when we arrived in Lisbon as well as when we returned to that great city after visiting Tomar, Coimbra, Porto and Guimaraes. Our first room overlooked the Avenida and was great but we really enjoyed our 6th floor room with a huge bathroom and views over the rooftops to the river and St.George’s. Lovely, friendly staff, prime location. Our new go to when in Lisboa.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Rooms are spacious, beds comfortable, extraordinary views, impeccable housekeeping, friendly and professional staff. Excellent breakfast with multiple choices. Ideal location on the fashionable avenue with all of fashionable  and historic Lisbon nearby

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Beautiful hotel situated in prime location of Central Lisbon. Friendly, helpful staff. Hotel room spotless,bed comfortable and all essentials provided. Breakfast great, such a variety!  Cosy atmosphere. Will certainly be recommending this hotel and hopefully can return there in time.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Planning for our stay in Portugal we booked this hotel the night of our arrival and for the night before departure. British Air changed schedules forcing us to arrive a day later forcing us to cancel the arrival night. We did stay our last night in Lisbon and were pleased with every aspect of the hotel be it the staff, our room, the location or the included breakfast. Arriving from the train station by taxi, we entered the door facing Avenida da Liberdade and carried our luggage down a short flight of stairs. We realized after checking in there’s a ramp into the hotel from the doors facing the side street which makes bringing luggage in much easier. Oh, well. Check in was quick with a brief introduction to the facilities, amenities and breakfast details. Our deluxe Lisboa room

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: The location on Avenida da Liberdade is perfect. The staff are friendly enough. There's free port or muscatel in the lounge. If you book and are over the age of 50 you get a free museum pass. But overall it's not very scintillating. There is no proper dining room - you have to sit eating your breakfast on low soft seating with the table kind of above you. The breakfast is good enough, but no more. We would choose somewhere a bit more enticing next time.  One little whinge. We came in one afternoon and requested a capuccino. 'No problem'. It came - made with those sachets of sweet instant powder that they serve on Turkish buses. But this is a hotel! And we had to pay for it!

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We stayed at this hotel for a week during September . The hotel was very comfortable and relaxing. Our rooms were large and provided everything we needed. The very best thing was the quality of every single member member of staff. The staff on the front desk were extremely helpful and very welcoming. The hotel lobby has a very casual but well organised bar and breakfast area which was always well staffed with pastries and Port available 24/7. Would definitely return to this lovely hotel

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: As a sensitive and with special care for detail restoration project, the hotel is a heritage building with an understated presence in the heart of the city, distinguished by elegant interiors and impeccable service. We loved the easy access to many of the most attractive amenities of the city and the special treats in the lobby available at all times. I will not let to much time pass before my next visit to this stylish hotel.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Highly recommend the Heritage Avenida Liberdade to anyone wanting a relaxing, luxurious holiday, in beautiful surroundings with exceptionally helpful staff and all within walking distance of everything you need in Lisbon - great restaurants, bars, castle and other tourist attractions. Our room was beautiful with great views and a glorious comfortable bed. We were treated with a bottle of champagne (to celebrate our 30th anniversary) and generally made to feel very welcome. Delicious breakfasts were enjoyed every morning and the complimentary tea, coffee, port and iced water were really appreciated too. Can’t recommend this fab hotel enough. Thank you for making our anniversary celebration so memorable!

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: I arrived and the hotel was overbooked and room not ready and the hotel were ‘very keen’ to move me to another hotel in the group and kept trying to ‘promote’ the idea of the other hotel which had rooms but did not look as nice and was also more expensive.  I insisted that I had booked one night in this hotel and resolutely refused to be moved!  Hopefully things will improve, but feel unlikely…

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Hotel was beautiful with old world charm. The staff of the hotel is excellent, always helpful, and friendly. The hotel sits right on the Liberdade close to all of the charming neighborhoods of Lisbon.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for two nights on our recent trip to Lisbon. We were assigned room 10, which is one floor up and on the main street. The room was quiet and comfortable. The girl that works doing the breakfast time is so lovely and so sweet, always with a pleasant greeting when we first saw her. My one and only nickle with the room was the size of the shower.....almost too small for the size of the bathroom.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: A really exceptional boutique hotel. They should train other hotels on how to provide a great guest experience. Comfortable, quiet sleep, good breakfast, helpful staff and a great location. Plus a nicely done room. I love when rooms have been given aesthetic upgrades like moulding, trim and local pictures. This hotel rocks, great job!

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We definitely enjoyed our stay here as everything was excellent. Located at a walking distance from all they key spots of Lisbon, the hotel offers a pretty nice overall atmosphere.  Our room was huge, furnished in a retro style with a bottle of Portuguese bubbles waiting for us. The bathroom was huge as well, vintage and super cute. The service was kind and helpful and generally we enjoyed the moments when we were at it.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We stayed 5 nights here. Perfect location for walking or using transit. we did not have a car.  Although on a busy (but beautiful) street, all is calm, wuiet, friendly and relaxed inside.   The front desk staff is great, always welcoming and helpful in every way. Ruben, who we saw the most, was a special standout for hospitality and service— he is a real star. The young woman who does the breakfast is also terrific.   We enjoyed the always available coffee and tea when coming in from a Lisbon adventure. And the complimentary port topped off the day.   Our room (25) eas very comfortable. Spotless. Big comfortable bed. Two comfortable chairs. it is a corner room with 2 well insulated windows and another large window in the beautiful bath.   We wre impressed with the care taken for

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Very happy to recommend this small, competitively priced boutique hotel. The rooms were delightful and the ground floor longe area wonderful. The gym/pool area were just lovely and a great place to chill for an hour after a busy day sightseeing. The hotel provided complimentary coffee and Sherry/Port all day, a very nice touch we thought!  The location is ideal, all the main shops/cultural places are on your doorstep. There is a train station 200mts away connecting you with other districts (such as Sinatra) You will not be disappointed-with this hotel it’s ideal for your stay in Lisbon.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Despite COVID restrictions the hotel made every effort to provide a safe but enjoyable stay. We stayed at the hotel last year so are aware how high the standards are and were very impressed with how they managed to adapt to recent events and still maintain the level of service and standards. We felt very safe and reassured during our stay.   The hotel is in a perfect location for transport hubs, restaurants and popular sightseeing attractions as well as shopping.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My daughter and I had a lovely three-day stay here in a beautiful room with high ceilings, comfort beds and a well-equipped bathroom. Breakfast is served in the stylish lobby, with tasty bacon and eggs cooked to order while we enjoyed muesli or fresh fruit salad.  Great central location,  friendly staff and good value. Definitely deserves a return visit.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: i had not high hopes with this place while checking in .. but step by step this hotel left my eyes open with fine interior beautiful room friendly staff and so on. really recmnd this heritage lisbon  hotel.

Hotel: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Having stayed a wonderful week at this hotel, we would highly recommend it for couples intent on exploring and enjoying Lisbon. The hotel’s strategic location, the very helpful front desk, superb buffet brunches (open until noon!), clean and comfortable rooms, and always courteous and efficient staff made our stay memorable. The short walking distance to our favourite restaurant, the excellent As Velhas, was an added bonus! We intend coming back for a longer stay as soon as this insane pandemic is finally vanquished!

We travelled to Lisbon for our wedding anniversary for 3 nights and chose Mundial for its fab location.  We couldnt fault the staff or hotel, it was warm and friendly. the room although a little old fashioned was in keeping with the hotel and very large and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and gallons of hot water from a high pressure shower was welcome.  The staff brought us sparkling wine the first evening and wished us a happy anniversary which was a lovely touch and made us feel so special.  The breakfast is very nice, buffet style and plenty of choice. we ate in the panoramic resturant the last night. Although v nice it was a bit chilly in there in november and the view hampered by the internal lights. I think it would work better for lunch.  WE would highly reccomend

The Hotel Mundial is situated just a few minutes walk from the Rossio Metro making it convenient for both airport access and the main Lisbon attractions. The rooms are spacious and well maintained. However, the windows provide little noise insulation and we had a sleepless first night in room 216 being kept awake by street noise of traffic, trams and people. We reported our concerns to the reception the next morning and they efficiently arranged for a room change to 604; a room facing towards an inner court yard which proved to be a haven of tranquility giving us an excellent nights sleep.  The breakfasts are substantial and well organised; hot drinks are served at the table whilst the diverse buffet of both hot and cold food is self-service.  The rooftop bar provides great

Brilliant hotel in a perfect location for exploring the city. The rooftop bar is a MUST when staying at this hotel. The staff were all extremely helpful, especially the guys on the door. Excellent selection for breakfast every day with nice, big, spacious rooms.

Awesome staff and accommodations. Excellent breakfast. Clean, modern hotel. Hugh sitting areas with beautiful decorations. Hotel located in central area, access to bus, ferry, train, taxi. Walking distance to multiple museums, restaurants, stores.

I agree with many of the other reviews, such as very well located, the breakfast is delicious, the rooms are very clean, the rooftop bar has a spectacular view.  What stood out for us was the service! It was very personable and tailored to us. It was remarkable from the moment we walked in. We were able to check in early and the concierge said it was their pleasure to spoil us. We were able to forget about how tired we were after our overnight flight. The doorman then directed us to a local coffee shop to start our day.  All the staff were amazing. Two staff members really stood out. Odette at the front desk always greeted us with a smile and friendly word every time she saw us. She answered our many questions and made us feel at home. The supervisor/manager at the breakfast

We travelled to Lisbon for our wedding anniversary for 3 nights and chose Mundial for its fab location.  We couldnt fault the staff or hotel, it was warm and friendly. the room although a little old fashioned was in keeping with the hotel and very large and comfortable. The bathroom was spotless and gallons of hot water from a high pressure shower was welcome.  The staff brought us sparkling wine the first evening and wished us a happy anniversary which was a lovely touch and made us feel so special.  The breakfast is very nice, buffet style and plenty of choice. we ate in the panoramic resturant the last night. Although v nice it was a bit chilly in there in november and the view hampered by the internal lights. I think it would work better for lunch.  WE would highly reccomend
