Brilliant hotel in a perfect location for exploring the city. The rooftop bar is a MUST when staying at this hotel. The staff were all extremely helpful, especially the guys on the door. Excellent selection for breakfast every day with nice, big, spacious rooms.

Awesome staff and accommodations. Excellent breakfast. Clean, modern hotel. Hugh sitting areas with beautiful decorations. Hotel located in central area, access to bus, ferry, train, taxi. Walking distance to multiple museums, restaurants, stores.

I agree with many of the other reviews, such as very well located, the breakfast is delicious, the rooms are very clean, the rooftop bar has a spectacular view.  What stood out for us was the service! It was very personable and tailored to us. It was remarkable from the moment we walked in. We were able to check in early and the concierge said it was their pleasure to spoil us. We were able to forget about how tired we were after our overnight flight. The doorman then directed us to a local coffee shop to start our day.  All the staff were amazing. Two staff members really stood out. Odette at the front desk always greeted us with a smile and friendly word every time she saw us. She answered our many questions and made us feel at home. The supervisor/manager at the breakfast

Good stay. Well located, good service and clean. Rooms require some updating but not urgent. Walking distance from the main attractions, restaurants and bars. Roome very quiet considering it is in the heart of the city.

The hotel is lovely, great location, staff are pleasant and happy to help. The breakfast is delicious, rooms are clean and tidied every day. I have nothing bad to say about the hotel and the basics which you require are here and work well. There is nothing above the average hotel here though, no actual facilities, no bar (except the roof top which is very busy and quite expensive), the restaurant  is so expensive to dine that we did not bother but does look quite good, there are no tea making facilities within the room which was disappointing for a Brit and it cost 8 Euro for tea by room service. So all in all, lovely basic hotel and does the job!

Missed flight due to issues, so would have been nice to have some food offered to compensate the missed breakfast when we arrived.  No iron or kettle in the room. 2 adults but given two single beds. Nothing special or personal touch, celebrated 2 birthdays and 2 anniversaries in lockdown and notified hotel in advance. (10 years anniversary). Ordred room service and tray and cups left for 2days, not taken away when room cleaned. Breakfast very very basic.  Room clean and modern but bathroom very outdated.  Great location but missing basics that should be there.

What a fantastic hotel. We spent a weekend there for my wife’s birthday. The hotel delivered fizz and chocolate’s on the day for my wife and me to enjoy! We also booked dinner in the hotel's varanda restaurant. The food, ambience (live music) and champagne & wine were truly excellent.  The roof top bar also has stunning views over Lisbon. I can highly recommend this hotel and restaurant, the staff are very attentive and helpful. We will certainly be coming back to Lisbon and staying in this hotel.  Thank you for some great memories.

I stayed at the Hotel Mundial in Lisbon for 5 nights in Nov 2021.  Very well located being about a 10 mins walk from the nearest metro stop (40 mins in total from the airport) and right outside a tram stop.    The hotel has a roof top bar with heaters given the cooler evenings in Nov.   I had breakfast included in my deal and the choice of breakfast was excellent as well - great selection.  I would like to highlight Andrea on the customer service desk who assisted me with inputting my data for my UK locator form as I was having technical problems on my phone.  She was incredibly patient and helped me through what was a slightly stressful time getting the document submitted!!  Couldn't recommend the hotel enough.    Lisbon is a beautiful city with great restaurants and sights.

We stayed here for 7 nights and absolutely loved it. We stayed in the suite on the 9th floor which was beautiful and had the best view of Lisbon from the balcony. The staff were so friendly and accommodating - especially Pedro. The location is perfect too as there are tram and bus stops directly outside the hotel and the airport is only 20 mins away.  We will definitely be staying here whenever we come to Lisbon again.

Excellent location. Lovely staff. They looked after our bags until we could check in as our flight was early in the morning.  The room was nice. Comfy huge bed. The bathroom was a bit dated though The free breakfast was great with plenty of choice and lovely coffee. The highlight was the roof top bar. It was so nice to sit there every evening and the staff always made sure that they could find you a table. Would recommend this hotel.

Great hotel, clean comfortable rooms. Very good location friendly helpful staff. The rooftop bar and Veranda restaurant are a must nicest meal we had in Lisbon and the bar great views and service. Cannot fault, will definetely stay again.

We came early because of a flight and wasn't sure we could check-in early. It was no problem at all, that we came a bit early. Super service.  We couldn't make the breakfast because of an early flight out, so they arrange and breakfast box for us when we checked-out.

I stayed here after our flight was diverted to Lisbon, turned up at 1am and they couldnt have been more helpful. Very good with helping me,  asked how my husband was every time I went through reception, great breakfast but excellent staff.

What can I say. Situated on a perfect location, possibility to park for free at the hotel, the best Rooftop bar in town and a perfect restaurant where you can enjoy excellent food and tasty wines.  And if you think this could not get any better, they knock on your door and  bring  you a bottle of bubbles for you birthday! I love it.   Cristina Bessa and her team did an amazing job and made our stay one to remember!

It was great  Hotel is good, clean, peole are nice Rooftop bar is EXCELLENT the DJ was really cool just recommend it guys  :-)  Parking garage no problem Hotel looks very good We enjoyed being there The location is perfect its quite near the city center, 10min walking

Located between two metro stations and 40 meters far from the Tram 28 first stop, great area to stay because you are just in the center of city and you can explore by foot most of the top sights in Lisbon. Very clean rooms, the hotel is huge but we did not have noise problem at all. Breakfast is good, not excellent but good. The stuff was helpful, i would stay again there.

Excellent location, very very close to the city center. It is 150 meters from a subway station and 200 meters from another. Pretty old room furniture, but very clean. Very nice rooftop. Free parking spaces.  Very poor breakfast, very few options.

Perfect location for exploring the city. We travelled with 3 teenagers and had 2 rooms both very well equipped comfy beds and pillows very dark blackout curtains we were on 5th floor and there was no noise from the street. Good air con, good breakfast and the rooftop bar is fab! It was my birthday and I got a surprise bottle if fizz and chocolates left in the room excellent stay again!

Hotel Mundial is a good hotel, don’t get me wrong, it has a warm and welcoming staff, and a nice rooftop bar.  The hotel is located in Baixa district which is the heart for shopping and close to many touristic sights.  Breakfast is very basic, and includes the default selection of bacon, sausages and beans as well as eggs, omelets and a small variety of vegetables, you have some fruit salad and yogurts as well as morning cereals.  The HUGE downside of this hotel however is the BAD acoustics and isolation that my room had. My room was at the sixth floor and I could hear every door slam in my corridor as well as people chatting outside my room as they were passing by as if my room has no door. I could also hear my next door neighbors showering as well as the show that they were

On a walk back uptown from the Praca do Commercio, we stopped at our old favorite, the Mundial Rooftop Bar. It was spacious and pleasant and the views as glorious as we remembered.  Nice maracuja caipirinha and a good snack. We were well treated from the doorman to the hostess to the wait staff. Bravo, Mundial!

Stayed with three persons in this hotel. It's perfectly located in the centre of Lissabon, from the hotel you can pretty much walk to everywhere in the centre. They offer free parking as well, which was very convenient. The room was spacious and clean, with comfortable beds. The bathroom was a bit old and outdated though, with an old shower. The head of the shower couldn't be fixed, so you had to hold it in your hand while showering. Breakfast buffet was nice and covid-19 proof. The hotel also has a rooftopbar with a stunning view on the city, and is definitely worth a visit!  All in all we had a pleasant stay here!

It was an interesting experience being in Lisbon and staying at the Hotel Mundial during the COVID-19 pandemic.  Having stayed in Lisbon on previous occasions a little way outside of the historic centre, I found it much more convenient to be in a hotel so central.  Considering the restrictions on travelling during the pandemic, it was interesting to find that the hotel appeared to be very full. Mask wearing was mandatory throughout public areas and temperature checks of guests and other visitors were routinely made on entering.   My room itself was of an average size with efficient air conditioning and although it overlooked a busy road, it was quiet with the windows closed. Mini-bar, room safe and plenty of wardrobe space was provided. Very wide range of English language TV

Room without air conditioning Parking spots available for people that go to the bar even not staying in hotel and no spot available for me staying there.so + 13€ per night on parking nearby Breakfast not available for take away Check in friendly and positive and after really bad service

We stayed here in early December to celebrate my wife's birthday. It was our 1st time in Lisbon. The hotel is beautiful and nicely located. The staff were ever so helpful. we had a wonderful visit and intend to return another time. We also think Lisbon is a great choice for a city break, lots of culture, nice outdoor lifestyle (even in December) and very friendly.

We happened upon Audrey's (the hotel's restaurant) randomly and by chance had a wonderful conversation with Manuel while dining. He's an incredibly interesting individual and a great conversationalist. He (and our lunch) indirectly convinced us we had to stay at Santiago for our short return trip to Lisbon. From check-in to check-out the service was fantastic. The space and room were lovely and more importantly, still adjusting to the time difference, the bed was very comfortable! The location is really great. The Hotel is on a very quiet street in Alfama but the #28 trolley is 1/2 a block away and will sweep you into the center of city quickly. Of course, staying in the heart of the amazing Alfama neighborhood has its own charm. Stop your search....stay here. You won't be

Visited the hotel with friends and got a room in the first floor, room was very big with a very comfortable bed. I had breakfast included and each day I selected something else, everything was very good and the portions were large, all staff were very friendly and helpful . The hotel is located in Alfama and has a small terrace with perfect morning view. It is also very close to many places. I will Definitely  return.

Thank you SO much, Santiago de Alfama for the wonderful 4 night stay! I was in the city on a girls' trip and this hotel was PERFECT for what we needed. Great for walking, nearby sites, restaurants, etc. The accommodations were AMAZING and we had a wonderful dinner in the hotel restaurant. I only wish we could have stayed longer!

Fantastic trip to Santiago de Alfama. A 15 minute taxi ride to the hotel from the airport. Less than €10 in a taxi. Breakfast was superb. Very close to all sights and amenities in city. All staff members were incredibly helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

We stayed here in early December to celebrate my wife's birthday. It was our 1st time in Lisbon. The hotel is beautiful and nicely located. The staff were ever so helpful. we had a wonderful visit and intend to return another time. We also think Lisbon is a great choice for a city break, lots of culture, nice outdoor lifestyle (even in December) and very friendly.

We happened upon Audrey's (the hotel's restaurant) randomly and by chance had a wonderful conversation with Manuel while dining. He's an incredibly interesting individual and a great conversationalist. He (and our lunch) indirectly convinced us we had to stay at Santiago for our short return trip to Lisbon. From check-in to check-out the service was fantastic. The space and room were lovely and more importantly, still adjusting to the time difference, the bed was very comfortable! The location is really great. The Hotel is on a very quiet street in Alfama but the #28 trolley is 1/2 a block away and will sweep you into the center of city quickly. Of course, staying in the heart of the amazing Alfama neighborhood has its own charm. Stop your search....stay here. You won't be

Visited the hotel with friends and got a room in the first floor, room was very big with a very comfortable bed. I had breakfast included and each day I selected something else, everything was very good and the portions were large, all staff were very friendly and helpful . The hotel is located in Alfama and has a small terrace with perfect morning view. It is also very close to many places. I will Definitely  return.

Thank you SO much, Santiago de Alfama for the wonderful 4 night stay! I was in the city on a girls' trip and this hotel was PERFECT for what we needed. Great for walking, nearby sites, restaurants, etc. The accommodations were AMAZING and we had a wonderful dinner in the hotel restaurant. I only wish we could have stayed longer!

Fantastic trip to Santiago de Alfama. A 15 minute taxi ride to the hotel from the airport. Less than €10 in a taxi. Breakfast was superb. Very close to all sights and amenities in city. All staff members were incredibly helpful. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

My ideal soft landing for a long journey through Portugal. This elegant hotel is the perfect blend of ancient architecture and modern design.  I felt deliciously at ease,  whilst behind the scenes every detail had been carefully caressed.

Juste only a word Excellent. Beautiful place, excellent service, excellent food. Beautiful room and hôtel environnent.Great place to be in connexion with thé nature. Thank you for this moment of refueling yourself

A fabulous hotel in a great location. With very friendly knowledgeable staff and great and superb service. We really enjoyed the rooftop terrace and we had drinks there watching the sun set,We would stay there again when we visit Lisbon.

As good luck would have it, on the second of February, 2020 - in the nascent hours of the year of our pandemic - almost two years ago, I checked into the boutique hotel I had pre-booked months in advance: The Santiago de Alfama.   I was welcomed into its charms that day by a lovely young receptionist named Lana. Later, at my second floor room, I opened a white-draped window facing out over the  light of the afternoon and gazed at the wide expanse of the view.   The next morning I lay in that sumptuously comfortable bed, watching the morning blue of the sky through the sheers. When I did get up, I could see the Rio Tejus revealed.   A little later, over my comforting bowl of hot latte espresso, and milk, and a tenderly buttered croissant, I had the extraordinary pleasure of

Fantastic hotel! We had such a lovely stay, wish just we could have stayed longer! Excellent service, gorgeous room, fabulous location. The hotel food is really delicious, and there are tons of places to eat in the lovely neighborhood for other options.

Well placed in the heart of Alfama and overall, a pleasant stay, but does not match its category. For comparison, we stayed in another hotel for 3 nights before in Lisbon (4*) and roamed in its sister hotel in Alfama which deepened even further our disappointment. Details ?  - Entrance  Located in a room on your right when you enter. Definitely oddly placed. No one is in front to welcome you. Weird. You can wait in the Lobby on your own without anyone noticing.  - Lobby / Main room  The patio is nice but really, nothing fancy. Style is minimal, a bit kitsch. Not a place where you'd feel like : wow, what is that ? Beautiful arrangement, that would feel nice in your home. The main dining area is worse. A huge curtain separates it from a another part of the room. Don't know why it

Loved our stay at the Santiago de Alfama.   Staff made us feel like we were part of their extended family.  Outstanding accommodations, excellent breakfast (loved the fresh bakery items offered in abundance), high quality and tasty cuisine for dinner!    All in a lovely setting in one of the most beautiful areas of historic Lisbon.  We look forward to a return visit to this hotel!

This is a gem of a hotel. Important to know: if you love a Four Seasons or Ritz Carleton experience (not that they are bad!) this is not your place. By that I mean the luxury is subtle. There is no grand lobby or shiny marble. Rather the luxury, which is real, is in the details—beautiful linens, bath products, a fantastically comfortable bed, tomb-like silence in the rooms, total darkness from beautifully crafted shutters, and more. Audrey’s Restaurant served magnificent breakfasts daily, and we had great dinner there one night too. Manuel, the proprietor, is an accomplished business executive who is well travelled and he and his wife created this special oasis in the grittiness of Lisbon that is a perfect balance, the whole team was spectacular; personable, caring and warm. We

My wife and I had our third stay at the Santiago de Alfama and it was every bit as good as we remembered it from our first two visits.  The property itself is outstanding.  It is architecturally interesting, well designed and perfectly decorated to reflect the vibe of Alfama with slightly eclectic twist.  But it is the incredible staff that really make this place our favorite place to stay (not just in Lisbon, but anywhere).  They are friendly and welcoming upon arrival and go to great lengths be helpful with whatever we need...from booking Fado tickets, recommending restaurants to extreme things like putting together a list of good places to take Portuguese lessons (including dong some internet research on each place to make sure their recommendations got good reviews).  We

Every member of the staff here is exceptional!  Beatriz is a particular standout--so very, very helpful.  The food at Audrey's is delicious and service was very friendly and accommodating.  The personal touch of the owners is a huge bonus.  They are very hands on from morning through night. Location could not be better for experiencing the oldest part of the city.  The room was spotless and very comfortable and we had a wonderful view of the river.  We would definitely stay here again, thanks!

Elegant Room, very well decorated and great spacious. Very confortable bed and unforgettable pillows.  Good size wardrobe. Great locations and staff. Plenty of dishes at the restaurant and open until late at night.

Authentic, warm, wholehearted people at the reception,  delicious food,  feel totally at ease in the center of the old town,  Forget your sorrows, everything is taken care of Rustic, luxury,  complimentary drinks and more in the room,

Our stay at the Santiago de Alfama Boutique Hotel was fabulous. A 5-star experience, in all aspects. Modern renovations elevate this cozy space. Our room was gracefully appointed and was comfortable. We enjoyed views of the Tejo River from the balcony.  In addition to the space being phenomenal the staff also matched this high standard by being friendly and resourceful. The owner took time to speak with  us about the hotel’s rich history adding a distinctive touch. Dinner at their sidewalk café Audrey’s included menu items from their own garden,  creating a farm to table experience in the heart of Lisbon! Our time there was well spent.

Perfect location in Lisbon with beautiful rooms, impeccable and friendly service - we loved our stay and will definitely be going back hopefully in the not too distant future. Nothing was too much trouble for them.

This is what a five-star boutique hotel should be: understated tasteful decor, large room and bathroom, big comfortable bed, plush towels, good toiletries, pleasant smell in the lobby, and last but not least warm and helpful staff. When in Lisbon, I wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else. Lana at the front desk was super helpful planning our local trips and activities and recommending restaurants. Manual was a fun conversationalist, the staff at the cafe remembered my allergy and prepared the morning mixed juice without the culprit ingredient.  There were always cold water flavored with fruit, sucking candy, and apples in the lobby. It's the small things that count and add up to a larger picture. This was a total package. A word of warning: breakfast is served outside

We stayed in this wonderful gem of a cozy personal hotel for 3 nights, and enjoyed every minute.  They really looked after us so well, going above and beyond expectations.  From making dinner reservations on a busy Friday evening for us in a super waterfront restaurant, Ibo, to lending us a plug to charge our phone, Fabulous breakfast, friendly service, and great chats with the charming owners who love to mingle and chat with their guests. We had such a lovely time and will definitely return.  Thank you

The staff was incredible and made our stay a total pleasure. We hope to visit again soon! The location is excellent directly below the Castle. The outside patio Restarant is a perfect place for a delicious meal

Our stay here celebrating our honeymoon was wonderful! Lana in reception is exceptional and helped us with all of our needs. Kusum at the restaurant was very sweet and attentive. Manuel spoke with us at breakfast for a time. Rooms are very nice with spacious bathrooms. We stayed in a river view room which I would recommend. Also there is a shared terrace on the floor with beautiful views. The service is 10/10 and they are able to help with food/entertainment recommendations as well as scheduling COVID testing for travel or car service. The hotel is located next to the old trolley 28 stop at Miradouro Sta. Luzia and I highly recommend taking a ride on the historic trolley. Beautiful views of the skyline across the river just a few steps away from the hotel and a few minutes walk

Overall, this hotel was great.The staff were all outstanding in their attitudes, service abilities, and willingness to help.Excellent breakfast in their restaurant, Audrey's.There were a couple of items that need addressing--  the sofa in our room was stained and worn and although there were 2 tvs, neither could be made to work.  In all fairness, I did not request that the tv problem be addressed, but one does not expect a stained and worn sofa in this level of hotel.

Santiago de Alfama is OUR home from home in Lisbon. Manuel and Heleen, Andrea and the entire team made us feel as if we were staying with them in their own house - everyone is so invested in the property, its history and ambiance. The rooms are exquisitely and tastefully decorated, yet understated in a way that makes one feel at home - no gadgets, but everything one needs - and more. The food at Audrey's Restaurant is wonderful, as is the service - from the moment one walks in to the moment one leaves - with sadness that the stay with the staff has ended so quickly. All the guests were happy and chatty - a testament to the owners and staff. Breakfasts can be quick or one can languish there all day, chatting and imbibing the history and culture of the building and area. It is a

We liked TRYP Lisboa Aeroporto Hotel very much and enjoyed our four-day stay. We particularly enjoyed using the Spa facilities, with a sauna and steam room (they call it the Turkish Spa). The couple massage was an extra treat! Lunch was a buffet and reasonably priced with a good variety of food and wine. English and continental breakfast were included in our rate. Our room was big enough and comfortable. The staff were friendly and spoke very good English. The hotel is a three-minute walk from the airport. It was the shortest ride for us by taxi! We did not realise that it was a walking distance from the airport. Don't waste your money and walk it instead. You can take the shuttle bus provided by the hotel on your departure day. You can take a bus or taxi (again reasonably

We spend 4 nights in Lisbon, where we search a hotel near the airport.  This is hotel was a good choice. Clean rooms, great choice for breakfast.  The staff is very friendly.   There is also a metro from the airport to the city center, providing easy access to many attractions.

We had a 5 a.m. departure to the United States so we wanted to stay as close as we could to the airport.  Yes, the hotel was about a ten minute walk from Terminal 1 but it is difficult if a person has quite a bit of luggage which was our case.  The hotel shuttle started at 4 a.m. which was too late for us.  Breakfast was not available for very early departures either.  In order to walk to the airport, there were several crosswalks and no stop lights.  Fortunately, there was no traffic at 3:30 a.m. but it would be rather dangerous to be in those crosswalks during busy times during the day.   We stayed in room 801 which was quiet.

The TRYP is in walking distance of the Lisbon Airport.  If you have too much luggage you can take a once every 20 minutes shuttle.  The rooms are clean and the room service was efficient.  Good breakfast spread.  The 2 times we stayed there our keys would not work beginning the morning of the day of check out which seems odd.  Otherwise this is an efficient hotel if you are flying out the next morning.

This is a great hotel for staying near the airport. It is right across the street; probably about a 10 minute walk. We had a really early flight so we stayed here for our last night. If the weather hadn't been horrific we probably would have walked - we wound up taking a cab which was really easy from the lobby.  Our check-in was really great - we told the agent when our flight was and she made sure to book us a breakfast to go and recommended when we leave for the airport.   The rooms were large, modern and nicely appointed. There was a really nice pool but we were too late to take advantage of it.  I give it three stars because our room had a weird smell and the bed was lumpy and very uncomfortable. I couldn't sleep much at all.   Also, while the staff was friendly, the place

The couple massage was an extra treat! Lunch was a buffet and reasonably priced with a good variety of food and wine. English and continental breakfast were included in our rate. Our room was big enough and comfortable. The staff were friendly and spoke very good English. The hotel is a three-minute walk from the airport. It was the shortest ride for us by taxi! We did not realise that it was a walking distance from the airport. Don't waste your money and walk it instead. You can take the shuttle bus provided by the hotel on your departure day. Good breakfast spread.  The 2 times we stayed there our keys would not work beginning the morning of the day of check out which seems odd.  Otherwise this is an efficient hotel if you are flying out the next morning.

If the weather hadn't been horrific we probably would have walked - we wound up taking a cab which was really easy from the lobby.  Our check-in was really great - we told the agent when our flight was and she made sure to book us a breakfast to go and recommended when we leave for the airport.   The rooms were large, modern and nicely appointed. There was a really nice pool but we were too late to take advantage of it.  I give it three stars because our room had a weird smell and the bed was lumpy and very uncomfortable. I couldn't sleep much at all.   Also, while the staff was friendly, the place

Stayed in room 112 & 114 , your right above kitchens constant squeaking of kitchen door below no sleep .  Breakfast the waiter was ignorant as we entered,  unhelpful ..... but made a fuss of females with a smile.  Complained Manager just looked like a deer in headlights zero customer service !!! Would never stay here again !!!!

I have been using TRYP hotels for many years and this stay was the worst I have ever experienced! Renovations in the lobby area meant the whole area was closed. A small area at the back of the hotel with a separate entrance was being used with two staff on reception. Checking in was a nightmare with their system down. We are both disabled guests so standing around made the experience even worse. Half a hour later we were given our room.  We then went to the bar area for a a meal!  The seating area has been changed which was a positive. However the noise from the lobby area was horrendous. The order was taken very promptly but it took 50minutes for the main course to arrive- a club sandwich and a burger. The soup too 15 mins and arrive COLD.  For the first time ever the staff

Having missed my flight it was late in the evening when I arrived at the TRYP Hotel. I didn’t have a booking and the reception area was busy with people checking in. I was met by and extremely kind and welcoming gentleman and he assured me he had a room.  The room was beautiful with a wonderful bathroom complete with Body Lotion, lots of Soap and a Shower Hat. The restaurant was very busy but the staff were extremely pleasant and efficient. The meal was lovely and the menu includes a lot to please different palates.  There is no problem getting to the Airport as the Shuttle Bus is very efficient. This Hotel is the one of the best airport hotels I have stayed in. I would totally recommend it.

I made a mistake in booking, and tried to cancel within one hour of making the booking. They were completely unhelpful in getting this done. They hide behind their booking partner, Agoda, and instruct me to call Agoda. Agoda only lists their contact information, so essentially they are telling me to go away

When I arrived at the hotel at 1320 my room was not ready and the receptionist (young girl with glasses) pushed me away once I handled out my ID, without checking out that my status permits early check-in after 10 am. My room on the 8th floor was ok but my preferences were not met, so I had to ask for a change. The other room was nice, however it wasn't properly maintained nor cleaned thoroughly.  Breakfast was ok but the staff there (all teenagers) did not meet my expectations. A lack of customer care and approach was a big minus.  The coffee from the machine was a mix of dark milk and water, definitely not acceptable for a country with such coffee tradition!  When I complained to the management, they were open to solutions and offered an upgrade with some extra details which

There's one main reason to stay at the Tryp - but it's an important one: if you need to be at the airport before the subways in Lisbon start running at 6:30 am. If so, you have two main choices, the Tryp or the Star across the courtyard from it, but the Tryp starts breakfast at 4 am, and the Star at 6:30. I had a 7 am flight, so it was the Tryp.  I arrived after a transatlantic flight at 11:30 am - the hotel charged me €40 to check in before 2 pm.  I know they are entitled to do this, but more often than not, hotels will let you check in early (and unfortunately I don't have Wyndham status).  Still, that's a stiff charge - you may want to consider another hotel if your flight arrives before the afternoon.  Rooms were not large, but not cramped. The beds were very firm, but I

A friendly welcome after a flight. The bar and restaurant were still open and we had a surprisingly tasty meal late at night. Everyone was so friendly, not like many corporate hotels. The room was spacious and well appointed. And most importantly a comfortable bed.

Tryp Lisboa Aeroporto is a convenient choice when you have an early morning departure or late arrival into Lisbon. As many others have said, it's a quick 3-4 minute walk to the terminal. I walked it both ways (it's slightly uphill on the walk back to the terminal). You'll be fine if like me, all you have is carry-on luggage. If you're a Melia Rewards member, you get the perks of the program, which isn't something the other on airport property can offer as I don't believe it's a chain. Bottom line, as with any other Melia property, you know what you're getting.   Now, I gave it 3/5 when I really wanted to give it 5//5. Why? Well for starters, all of the staff, from the front desk to the bar or restaurant, were polite. All were actually quite friendly, but some of the bar staff,

Great location if arriving late. Easy to get to it just a 3 minute walk out the front door. Surprisingly quiet.  Rooms are small but to be expected.  Food in the 2 restaurants was ok and room was comfortable. Checkin process was Effiecient and the people were very helpful

I got stranded in Lisbon because of the Groundforce strike in July 2021 and the next available flight was on Tuesday. I had, however, to send an important work and attend an online meeting on Monday! Fortunately, TRYP Hotel was there to save the day (and possibly my job, this meeting was extremely important). I was able to book two additional nights, use the wonderful work room and desktop PC free of charge and didn't miss the meeting. TRYP Lisboa Aeroporto Hotel is now my favorite hotel in the world. I can't thank you enough for your help, keep up your excellent work!

You could not ask for a better located hotel for the airport. It is an easy walk, which probably takes less time than the shuttle, but with baggage and the uphill walk to the airport, the shuttle service is a great amenity.  It was up and running, no problem.  We walked to and from the airport to get our covid tests and took the shuttle in the morning for our flight. Breakfast choices were copious and it was running as of 4 am.  We had a helpful and courteous early check in.  Above all, my experience booking was excellent. I had trouble booking online, so I ended up calling and the person who attended me could not have been more helpful.  I gave only a 4 rating because while the beds were comfortable and the room had everything we needed, some of the fittings were cheaply made

After being booked in the hotel due to airline issues, we had a wonderful stay here. First night was paid for by the airline and we enjoyed our first night so much, that we booked a second night here.   The room design was modern and very clean as well as the rest of the hotel with sanitizers by the elevators on every floor. We had a dinner voucher from the airline. We were pleasantly by the high quality of the food and the very friendly and professional staff. Excellent service!!!   I had mentioned at check-in that due to the flight delay, we were missing being home for a major birthday milestone. That second night, we were surprised by a bottle of Cava and a big piece of cake! Thank you to Mr. Sassetti and the staff at the front desk for spoiling us.

This has to be the most pleasant, happy and helpful staff that I have ever come across. They were all so incredibly kind and helpful. The breakfast was included and simply amazing for the cost is what we paid for the room. The rooms were nice and modern

This hotel is right across the street from the airport. So very easy access if you need to stay at the airport! Great large rooms and nice buffet breakfast. Recommend for anyone who needs to stay at Lisbon airport!

Good value for money.  Located 3 min from the airport and metro station.  About 25 min on a train to the city centre.  Covid-19 safe. Checking out contactless.   Staff friendly.   Clean but not perfect, well located, large rooms, air con.   2 people in a lift at a time: Covid-19 rules.

3 min walk from the airport and metro station.  Good staff. Good value for money. Clean.  Easy check-in and contactess check out. Covid-19 safe: 2 people at a time in the lift.  Wearing masks is mandatory.  Staff is checking temperature before start of a shift.

I'm normally hard on this evaluations but there isn't much to say. Worst thing I can say it's that the bed was waaay too soft for me but that's just preference. Best thing? I had the best breakfast of my life and believe me when I say it because I always find hotel's breakfast to be more about quantity and the quality is simply not there, but this one was really amazing. Everything (I tried almost a bit of everything) was pretty awesome.

I had actually booked a room at the neighboring hotel but for some reason they were closed and I got transfered to Tryp.  As it turns out, I think this was an upgrade! I got a great room, with balcony.  The staff was extremely polite and helpful, the complimentary breakfast that came with the room was excellent.  Great value.

Smiles all around. After the way I was treated in the Sheraton at Brussels Airport, this hotel was a marvellous surprise. A welcoming staff, a nice room, a very modern bathroom and very good room service too.

Room was quite ok with very small tv. It could have been cleaned little bit better but it was not horrible. At the covid times you had to order breakfast/dinner to room both were quite nice and plenty of food. I had two dinners there both times I did order coffee with food and both times it was missing. Check in did take quite much time but that was probably because extra work with covid measuring temperatures and filling extra papers.

Airport hotels can be a mixed bag, they have a captive audience - even with Covid, but normally the experience is pretty average. I think no one told the team at the Star Inn they were in an airport, they treat you more like a top flight hotel in Tokyo or Sydney. Great and friendly reception staff, spacious rooms, all the details are correct. Finally they advertise the breakfast as being very good, it’s actually outstanding, the cooked tomatoes were some of the best I’ve tasted, fresh croissants, and coffee. Sounds crazy I know to write about tomatoes but the team go the extra yard. If only there were more hotels like this the world would be a better place. One more detail, very eco-friendly, paper water bottle in the room, not plastic, another detail that matters in the big

Extremely good services everyone was helpful and efficient Fabulous breakfast very useful location for airport and has bus which is a great help. Had a good experience and great value for money. Will be staying again good Gin / tonics. Very clean

Located within 5 minutes walk of Terminal 1. Clean and modern. Free cookie & mini bottle of port on arrival! Room clean & spacious. Wifi fast. Breakfast good.  Disliked · Feels a bit functional, but fab for an airport hotel.

Of course, the hotel is close to the airport , but with a 5 minutes drive, they are plenty of very nices and clean hotels. This one is dirty , and people are very rude, may be it s difficult to work in a dirty place and with a bad management but not the fault of the clients. To avoid at any costs , the rooms are dirty , smell, and if you complain, they just don’t care , they don’t even come to see. Even for free , you should not come here .

I have tried numerous emails about an upcoming booking and haven't hard anything.  Awful customer service. I realise this pandemic has had negative affects on businesses but that is no reason to completely ignore customers and take their money.   Customers will support businesses that support them.   This hotel clearly doesn’t.  AVOID

Airport hotels can be a mixed bag, they have a captive audience - even with Covid, but normally the experience is pretty average. I think no one told the team at the Star Inn they were in an airport, they treat you more like a top flight hotel in Tokyo or Sydney. Great and friendly reception staff, spacious rooms, all the details are correct. Finally they advertise the breakfast as being very good, it’s actually outstanding, the cooked tomatoes were some of the best I’ve tasted, fresh croissants, and coffee. Sounds crazy I know to write about tomatoes but the team go the extra yard. If only there were more hotels like this the world would be a better place. One more detail, very eco-friendly, paper water bottle in the room, not plastic, another detail that matters in the big

Extremely good services everyone was helpful and efficient Fabulous breakfast very useful location for airport and has bus which is a great help. Had a good experience and great value for money. Will be staying again good Gin / tonics. Very clean

Located within 5 minutes walk of Terminal 1. Clean and modern. Free cookie & mini bottle of port on arrival! Room clean & spacious. Wifi fast. Breakfast good.  Disliked · Feels a bit functional, but fab for an airport hotel.

Of course, the hotel is close to the airport , but with a 5 minutes drive, they are plenty of very nices and clean hotels. This one is dirty , and people are very rude, may be it s difficult to work in a dirty place and with a bad management but not the fault of the clients. To avoid at any costs , the rooms are dirty , smell, and if you complain, they just don’t care , they don’t even come to see. Even for free , you should not come here .

I have tried numerous emails about an upcoming booking and haven't hard anything.  Awful customer service. I realise this pandemic has had negative affects on businesses but that is no reason to completely ignore customers and take their money.   Customers will support businesses that support them.   This hotel clearly doesn’t.  AVOID

First of all the the hotel has not much to offer other than been close to the airport.  But the way they attract is clearly fraudulent.   They claim on their web site that they have low rates (€ 74 as far as I was concerned) and then get you to a so called "secured" booking website where you find your-self with more than the room rate added supposedly because of "taxes" (which taxes, no one knows but certainly not the usual local tax which you have to add on arrival).  It is not easy at all to find out about this tax before paying and of course the payment is non reimbursable even in these difficult pandemic times.   Basically this is fraud.  First they advertise low rates that they top up with so called taxes then they make you pay additional for the real tax.  Of course

Flights cancelled due to Covid told we could have a refund which did not appear in our account. Rang back and basically told i was a liar! We can have a voucher so we can spend a night at an airport hotel yippee NOT and waste flight money for the pleasure which will not happen anyway. Terrible customer service useless emailing the hotel they are as bad as hotel.com This hotel doesn’t care about the reasons you are unable to get there they will not refund you they just keep your money.

Stayed a night due to an early flight the next morning. Hotel is relatively sober, but the rooms are adequate. Shower and bed where good, didn't have breakfast as my flight left very early. Rooms are quite noisy

Star Inn was booked about one week before an early flight from Lisbon Airport. Day before confirmed a late arrival.  All should have been OK. The payment had been taken from the credit card as well. When arriving about 22.30 to the hotel all was closed. After a while found a piece of paper on a glass door with info:  go to another hotel, TRYP nearby.  Very good. About 30-40 people had already done that and were there waiting for a room for the night, very short night!! Only one person checking people in. Had been much more polite to send an email or SMS about changes, even a phone call had been nice. Also some information on that piece of paper too about the reason.  Have been staying in this hotel before, but not going to book it anymore!.

Arrived on 24th April Star Inn was closed with a sign to use TRYP hotel across road which is the same company. Next morning received an Email saying no show at Star Inn. I asked at reception about no show and he said he would make sure I wouldn't be charged as it was the same company. However on 28th April I have been charged for a no show and now have the hassle of a chargeback. I think this is probably deliberate.

We found ourselves stranded for two days in Lisbon when a state of emergency was declared and our flight home was cancelled. We walked to the Star Inn from Lisbon Airport and we were met with warm hospitality. Our room was very comfortable, nicely decorated, and the bed, bedding, bathroom and other amenities were very good (even a rain water shower!)-- a huge improvement from many other airport hotels we have encountered around the world. We never heard a single plane! Most of all we appreciated the kindness and professionalism of the staff, working the front line in the face of a pandemic. We really felt the Star was an oasis of calm and comfort. THANK YOU!

Had to stay 3 days await for available flight home due to flights restrictions and decided to sray close to airport,therefore hotel has been choosen. Perfect location either to reach airport or visit town.Airport 5 min walk-town 20 min by metro. Perefect personnel in respection-we arrived rnd 11.00 and they found room for us. Good breakfast -various food and nice service.Espectially we noted very kind lady Olga,servicing in restaurant. Very comfortable room.

This hotel is really only a few minutes walk from the Lisbon international airport. But, it is very difficult to find their underground parking lot if you have never been: there is only a small sign with"hotel" on it to indicate it. And, if you are traveling with someone you consider just a friend, you might want to book 2 rooms: the toilet and the shower are NOT in a room of their own. They are directly IN the bedroom. So, if you are a bit prude and prefer not having your bowel movement experience in public, better have separate rooms! Otherwisr, beds comfy, food ok.

With a Hollywood theme, this hotel serves up a quiet place - no airplane noise - only one block from the airport which is a 10 minute walk. Free shuttle available every 20 minutes. Reasonable breakfast included so very good place to grab some shut-eye before a morning flight.

Absolutely excellent in every way for an airport hotel. Reception were concise and welcoming, the room more the adequate, the location very close to T1 with an early start shuttle to T2. It is a newish hotel with efficient facilities including a restaurant. Just very good for what we needed.

Great location with clean rooms less than a 5 minute walk from the Lisbon airport (terminal 1). We had a 5am flight out of Lisbon and the Starr Inn worked well to overnight before our flight. Reception was great and had rooms available for us before check-in. Since we left before the free breakfast (5am), they provided us boxed breakfasts when we checked out at 3am. Quite a distance away from the tourist areas, but after arriving around noon from Porto, we were able to sight-see and eat supper in Belem.

If you want to be near the airport, try this place, as it’s a 5 minute walk or €4 shuttle.  The room was surprisingly quiet, given how close the airport is.  Internet worked well and the bed was comfortable.  Breakfast is included.

This hotel is in walking distance to airport, its very clean and modern. Staff was friendly and helpful. Has flights listed in lobby that is helpful for travelers with layovers. Breakfast was included and very good.

Spent one night prior to flying back to EDinburgh. Very happy with the hotel. The rooms were a good size and very clean. White bedding which I prefer. The beds were very comfortable and I had a great nights sleep.  Room has TV, fridge with water and soft drinks which you can purchase. There was a bottle of water in the room and we were given free cookies on arrival. The room as an unusual set up. It included an individual toilet and separate shower each had glass doors and were separated from the rest of the room by a curtain which extended the full width of the room. As the room was large there was plenty of space for the bathroom. This set up was not a problem for me. We ate in the hotel rather than going out. As we were not too hungry we had soup and toasties which were good.

We stayed overnight for an early flight the next morning. It's really close to the airport, about 5 mins walk.   The room was modern & quiet. Breakfast was ok.   We caught the shuttle to the airport which only took a few minutes.   A nice stay overall.

Good location if you are flying, short walk and good shuttle to airport.  Clean, small rooms with average bedding.  Breakfast is good.  Difficult and expensive parking,  Took Cab to Fado club and it is a long way.  If your traveling it is a reasonable airport hotel.

5 mins walk from Airport. Rooms small and dark but ok. Breakfast tasty with a variety of food. Would highly recommend this place if you need to stay overnight to catch a morning flight. Staff ok. Down side for me was previous guest had smoked and smell in the room was awful. Staff accepted my complaint

We stayed here prior to a 6:30 am flight to the US.  The room was comfortable and quiet.  We used the free shuttle at 4 am to the airport, and it was easy and punctual.  Because we would miss the included breakfast, the hotel prepared a box lunch of sandwich, crackers, cookie, apple, and water.  The bathroom wasn't quite private with a barn door style sliding door, but it was OK.  We had a decent inexpensive dinner in the hotel also.  We would stay here again under the same circumstances.

Upon my arrival in Lisbon I was astonished that this hotel is about a 5 minute walk downhill from the airport.   It is a modern hotel complete with Spa and a restaurant. Breakfast is included with the room. Breakfast has great selection. The restaurant is open during the day for other meals. The menu is limited to sandwiches and hamburgers but I did see somebody eating spaghetti.  There are also soup, salads and deserts.

There's nothing to complain about here. The checkin was quick. the room was spacious and very clean. the breakfast was abundant.. the checkout was super fast.  the greatest lusury was that it was all a 5-min walk from the airport.

Carolina in reception made our stay. She was so lovely and helpful. We found the wait for the lifts somewhat annoying at night and breakfast time but the Skybar and location to the Altice Arena, shopping centre and trains was outstanding. Room size great and bed super comfortable. Breakfast was great but the space small so difficult to distance.

On the  pandemic time , the courtesy and cleaned/safe environment has been impressive  (Gymn, swimming pool , and others amenities ). Moreover the location is enjoyable, easily reachable from Airport   by Subway..

This is a nice business hotel steps from the Oriente station, a major transportation hub in LIsbon. The room I got was 1017, a room with a view of the river and the Vasco da Gama bridge. The room was large, clean and well appointed. I arrived very early and they offered an early check in for a fee of 45 euros. All very convenient.  Didn’t use any of the facilities but the reception staff was wonderful. I will definitely be back!

Very nice hotel. The gym is small but it has all the equimpment. Spa area and indoor pools are great. Location is very good. Bar at the rooftop is great with very nice view. Breakfast is perfect. All the reccomendations for the hotel and stuff.

Very nice peple. Very welcoming. Very helpful. Good brekfast. I will com again. Close to the airport. Easy to get every  were Love to be here. If yoyu like shoping it is near vasco de gama moll. Loved it

Carolina in reception made our stay. She was so lovely and helpful. We found the wait for the lifts somewhat annoying at night and breakfast time but the Skybar and location to the Altice Arena, shopping centre and trains was outstanding. Room size great and bed super comfortable. Breakfast was great but the space small so difficult to distance.

On the  pandemic time , the courtesy and cleaned/safe environment has been impressive  (Gymn, swimming pool , and others amenities ). Moreover the location is enjoyable, easily reachable from Airport   by Subway..

This is a nice business hotel steps from the Oriente station, a major transportation hub in LIsbon. The room I got was 1017, a room with a view of the river and the Vasco da Gama bridge. The room was large, clean and well appointed. I arrived very early and they offered an early check in for a fee of 45 euros. All very convenient.  Didn’t use any of the facilities but the reception staff was wonderful. I will definitely be back!

Very nice hotel. The gym is small but it has all the equimpment. Spa area and indoor pools are great. Location is very good. Bar at the rooftop is great with very nice view. Breakfast is perfect. All the reccomendations for the hotel and stuff.

Very nice peple. Very welcoming. Very helpful. Good brekfast. I will com again. Close to the airport. Easy to get every  were Love to be here. If yoyu like shoping it is near vasco de gama moll. Loved it

I love Lisbon and this was my first trip abroad since lockdown in March 2020.  I travelled with my 11 year old grandson and after arriving on the flight from Scotland , it was a short metro ride to the Tivoli, hotel a minute walk from the entrance to the station!  Perfect.  Our room was On The 13Th floor, overlooking the river, fabulous views, although the outer windows could be cleaner to get a clearer view.  The room was nice with a wardrobe and safe inside it.  Good amount of storage.  Beds were comfortable and pillows too.  Had good quality sleep as no noise to disturb us.  The bathroom was a shower o er the bath and felt the bathroom could do with an upgrade to a walk in shower.  Apart from that thought the room suited our needs  adequately.  The breakfast was good

We decided to stay here as the hotel is close to the airport for our early flight home. Booked the room with river view which was a good choice. On the 13th floor, so fantastic view. Room was spotlessly clean and had everything we required. Went up to the roof bar for a drink which was fabulous. The receptionist called us a taxi in the morning which arrived promptly to take us to the airport. It is a shame we could not stay longer, but I as sure we will be back sometime as we have stayed in a few Tivoli hotels and find them very good.

I stayed here on the suggestion of the company I was visiting and it suited fine as regards distance from airport. Check in was efficient. Room was on 5th floor. Carpet in the room could do with upgrading but overall the room, linen, bathroom were spotless. I didn’t feel like going out for food as I had checked in late but room service was available and was fine.  Breakfast was served from 7 and was buffet style with hot and cold options. I was early and it was quiet enough when I was there. The sky bar was lovely to relax with a drink at the end of the day but I left before it got busy around 7pm.  I would stay again.

We chose this hotel for a first-night in Portugal stay, because it's just across a narrow and road from the Oriente train station and we were catching a train to Porto the following morning. There's nothing much else to say really. It served its purpose. Bed comfortable enough. Breakfast underwhelming. The high point is the rooftop bar - great cocktails and views.

The hotel is right outside the Orient train station and a short taxis ride  to the airport. The staff were friendly and professional. The room was spacious and clean. We enjoyed walking the short distance to the mall. The 16th floor Sky Bar had amazing views .  Excellent hotel!

Great hotel for access to transportation options. Great waterfront, restaurant access. Beautiful view from rooftop lounge. Hotel facilities were very good and staff was extremely helpful. Would stay here again when in Lisbon.

Great potential - horrible guests. They don't have enough elevators, due to which guests have to wait literally half an hour. I'm about to miss my plane. Another guest became so angry that she started verbally abusing and aggressively touching people. I had to call the police. The sky bar brings in horrible people it seems.

Live in a room overlooking the longest bridge in Europe - the Vasco de Gama bridge, almost 17 km, and then the blue horizon and the ocean. Very comfortable room, there is everything you need. Comfortable bed. Place next to Calatrava's masterpiece. Already deserves attention. Getting to the center is a trifle, parking is under the hotel. Varied breakfasts, fruits and dairy products, omelets, hot dishes, coffee and fresh pastries. Excellent service.

Good place and and area , it is near to airport (like 10min) also you can go shopping and use many restaurants near to hotel. Hotel is also suitable but breakfast not very good that maybe main reason was COVID-19 but others were good. I hope come next time!

Every night this hotel allows the Guests in its restaurant to stay on the Esplanada (Outside tables right on the street) until 2 am, screaming, yelling and disturbing the neighbors and probably Hotel guests. We called several times and they don't even care...The reception is not able to take control of their restaurant!!!  BE AWARE IF YOU STAY THERE IT WILL BE A BAD NIGHT SLEEP! Be aware if you stay there, it will be a bad night SLEEP!

+ very confortable bed + the location. Right next to the station and shopping centre + sky bar with a nice view and good cocktails  - it takes around 5 minutes for the water to get warm. Maybe because  our room was on the 14th floor? - the rooms are a little bit dated.

Well we stay here 2 nights more but would cancel right away if the room were not already paid ! What’s worse for a family with a 7 years old child than not have any availability at the hotel Restaurant to eat !!! Not a single table is left for the hotel guests and reservations must been done quickly at your arrival otherwise no tables left !!! And being honest it’s not even a nice restaurant…  So before to come here ensure you have book all Your restaurants evenings because otherwise you will Be like us eating at the sky bar some room service food (even then the ceasar salad was bad)… We came for our second time but we will definitely not come a 3rd one ! Much better to stay in the center at least it will be easier to find a restaurant other than a shopping mall corner food….

Excellent service! Very happy with the stay. From the reception to breakfast and room service, each and everyone was super friendly and hospitable. Gostei muito e agradeço a todos pelo excelente serviço e atenção prestada. Senti me em casa 😊🙏🏻

On arrival Manuel who welcomed us was nice and friendly and very helpful.   If you want to use the pool make sure you ask at reception as  you need to book the swimming pool. It was slightly annoying that you need to go down to reception to collect the key and towels then back up again and the elevators are very slow, one was out of action and quite a few people staying at the hotel. Prepare for long waits.   We choose the hotel for the location as we were going to the aquarium. I would normally stay in the centre which is much nicer. The hotel is Close to the train station and to the shopping centre, cable car etc good location to access all amenities and also you could get the train into the centre easily. Very convenient to have a car park under the hotel.  The sky bar looked

This is the best hotel of the world to be with children! Staff is extremely careful and welcoming to the little ones! Highly recommended! Great views, excellent location, very good breakfast and close to public transports! Top!!!

I booked this hotel immediately after the quarantine restrictions changed between England and Portugal and I was not disappointed. This hotel was superb and offered first-class service in every department and showed the utmost care needed for the present day Covid restrictions. The personal service it showed cannot be faulted. breakfast was excellent and showed great choice with great fried eggs! Thank you.

This is an exceptional hotel. The rooms are spacious, clean and very comfortable. Everything we wanted was available, as per the previous review. The staff are well presented, polite, knowledgeable and bend over backwards to be of assistance. The bars and restaurants offer fine food, drinks and cocktails. The bonus for us on this visit was that Sky View has now opened, although this was not the fault of the hotel but due to the government and the situation. Treat yourself and give it a try. I'm sure you will not be disappointed.

We have stayed at this hotel for a few days including my birthday, I did not mention when I have booked the stay or when we arrived there about my birthday, but surprisingly on the day of my birthday I have received a complementary bottle of champagne and delicious tiramisu cake with the candle, it has certainly made my special day. This hotel isn't right at the city centre although it is within 5 minutes from the tube which has made it easily accessible for us, the location wasn't a problem at all. Room was very clean and bed was very comfortable, breakfast choice was amazing, fresh food, gluten free options, choice for plant-based milk which has made the difference. On the roof-top there is a luxurious bar that provides indoor or outdoor sitting with stunning views, cocktails

My wife and I have just returned from a few days in the Hotel Tivoli. Lisbon. We found the staff were some of the best we have ever had. They all spoke excellent English, were knowledgable, friendly and helpful. We cannot speak too highly of them. Plus of course the very excellent hotel. Everything was top quality as one would expect from a “proper” 5 star hotel. We cannot wait to return in summer.

Located in one of the most important parts in Lisbon, i believe if you are there for 2 nights you will never need to drive or think where to go, the hotel decoration has a nice warm taste, and all hotel areas very well functionally distributed, to make you feel bigger luxury space more than a normal building, hotel entrance need some touches to give strong impression about what's behind it. very comfortable rooms and beds, big LCD screens, modern stylish toilets, breakfast area is relaxing with nice view, food is great but miss more varieties, swimming pool area, Turkish bath, gym and sauna are wonderful, and being opened till 10PM is a big plus for the hotel but need someone to control the kids movement especially in wet areas, and the best part on my stay was the amazing sky

This hotel was absolutely gorgeous from the exterior to the interior. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The room was beautifully decorated with nice views from the third floor and a very comfortable bed. Breakfast each morning was also lovely. It was my boyfriends birthday during our stay and the staff surprised us with champagne and cake in our room which was a lovely touch. There were no faults to note during our stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

We couldn’t fault the room we stayed in. The service, linen, room layout, and power shower were all excellent. The location of the hotel was superb. I would perhaps next time ask for a room at the back of the hotel as partygoers were a bit loud in the square below. A few years ago, I’d have been joining them!

We stayed for some days at the 1908 Lisboa. The hotel is beautiful designed. Beds are really comfortable. Rooms fairly small, which would be ok, but there is hardly no place to store your clothes and suitcase. Bathrooms are nice, but I’m missing again something where you can put your staff. There is also no hanger for towels! You can only place towels on open door to dry.  Biggest downside of hotel is noice! Friday evening a lot of people are celebrating in front of hotel. Sunday night 4am loud music is played in neighboring bar. In morning traffic starts.  Staff is really nice.  I wouldn’t stay here again because of constant noise.

My boyfriend and I planned our trip to Lisbon to celebrate our anniversary and 1908 knew exactly how to make it special.   First of all, before even arriving in the country, Catarina and Jorge were providing me with a bunch of recommendations such as bars and restaurants in the area which helped us to quickly navigate around the city once we arrived.   Upon arrival, we got an incredible upgrade from a double to king room with a beautiful bath. This was a shock to the both of us and was truly appreciated.   The breakfast was very calm and clean. There were options for bread, croissant, fruit, ham, and freshly made orange juice. Then, someone would take your order for hot food (try the pancakes with syrup and bacon!).   On the day of our anniversary we were surprised to see the

Excellent hotel, courteous, friendly staff, great food and cocktails. The hotel is tasteful & modern & not far from the town centre. Andre the manager is amazing & extremely helpful nothing is to much trouble for him and he knows all the best places to go. I will definitely return.

This hotel was absolutely gorgeous from the exterior to the interior. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. The room was beautifully decorated with nice views from the third floor and a very comfortable bed. Breakfast each morning was also lovely. It was my boyfriends birthday during our stay and the staff surprised us with champagne and cake in our room which was a lovely touch. There were no faults to note during our stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

We couldn’t fault the room we stayed in. The service, linen, room layout, and power shower were all excellent. The location of the hotel was superb. I would perhaps next time ask for a room at the back of the hotel as partygoers were a bit loud in the square below. A few years ago, I’d have been joining them!

We stayed for some days at the 1908 Lisboa. The hotel is beautiful designed. Beds are really comfortable. Rooms fairly small, which would be ok, but there is hardly no place to store your clothes and suitcase. Bathrooms are nice, but I’m missing again something where you can put your staff. There is also no hanger for towels! You can only place towels on open door to dry.  Biggest downside of hotel is noice! Friday evening a lot of people are celebrating in front of hotel. Sunday night 4am loud music is played in neighboring bar. In morning traffic starts.  Staff is really nice.  I wouldn’t stay here again because of constant noise.

My boyfriend and I planned our trip to Lisbon to celebrate our anniversary and 1908 knew exactly how to make it special.   First of all, before even arriving in the country, Catarina and Jorge were providing me with a bunch of recommendations such as bars and restaurants in the area which helped us to quickly navigate around the city once we arrived.   Upon arrival, we got an incredible upgrade from a double to king room with a beautiful bath. This was a shock to the both of us and was truly appreciated.   The breakfast was very calm and clean. There were options for bread, croissant, fruit, ham, and freshly made orange juice. Then, someone would take your order for hot food (try the pancakes with syrup and bacon!).   On the day of our anniversary we were surprised to see the

Excellent hotel, courteous, friendly staff, great food and cocktails. The hotel is tasteful & modern & not far from the town centre. Andre the manager is amazing & extremely helpful nothing is to much trouble for him and he knows all the best places to go. I will definitely return.

This hotel is superb , amazing architecture of the building and decor.  The staff are what really makes the place from the manager Andre to the waiting staff in the morning throughout the day . Super attentive and nothing is a problem. The location is not far from the main tourist attractions and the vibe around the hotel is relaxed but vibrant.  Transport is at the doorstep of the hotel .  Download the Bolt app better than Uber and cheaper.  The reception staff will give you an itinerary and send it on what’s app for your convenience.  Thank you to the staff  And well done on making my staff thoroughly enjoyable.

Just back from sunny Lisbon. Had 4 nights at the 1908  with my son - fantastic welcome, upgrade on arrival- just sooo helpful, nothing too much trouble.  Drink offered on arrival. Rooms and amenities v clean, bed incredibly comfy, beautifully renovated building with stylish architectural features, mixed with modern furnishings. Good relaxed vibe. Breakfast great, lots of choice and a la carte hot options available. Cool bar area and outside seating. Staff all polite and friendly. Highly recommend - close to metro to get around plus only a 30 min journey from airport. About a  10 min walk to centre of town - and a steep 15 minute climb to castle.

I cannot recommend the 1908 Lisboa Hotel enough! We received incredible service upon our arrival, including help with getting around to the different sites we wanted to see in Lisbon. The hotel itself is beautiful and artistic with great attention to detail in the design - right down to the slippers and bathrobes. When I let Catarina know that my fiancé and I had gotten engaged just a couple of days beforehand, she arranged for a fruit plate and champagne on ice delivered to our room while we were out sightseeing for the day, which was so thoughtful! The hotel also uses WhatsApp as a quick way for guests to ask questions, which was very convenient for us when we were offsite. The complimentary breakfast was delicious with lots of options for cold and hot food. We also received

We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting Lisbon. Location is good; a few minutes walk to the Intendente metro station and trams etc passing by regularly. It’s maybe a 20 minute walk down to Praça do Comércio.   The hotel is a very interesting building, with an interesting history. Our room was the entry level ‘Avenue view’ double. It was clean, modern and with lots of interesting quirks. The bedroom area wasn’t particularly big but the bathroom was massive.  The service at the hotel was top notch - everyone was extremely helpful, friendly and welcoming. We had breakfast both mornings, and there were lots of fruits, meats, cheeses and pastries available, as well as several hot options.  I’d thoroughly recommend a stay here for anyone visiting Lisbon.

We recently visited the 1908 as part of our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were greeted by Andre who helped us with everything we needed to kick start our trip in Lisbon, from helping with our luggage to a free welcome drink and providing recommendations as to where to go and explore. Sara was also very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. Rooms are very clean and spacious, location is perfect (approximately 10 min walk to main shops etc). Breakfast was included and also amazing, one of the best hotel breakfasts that I have had! We cannot recommend this hotel enough, if you are planning a trip to Lisbon staying here is a must!

This hotel is amazing in all possible senses. Starting from the well accomodated and nicely designed rooms with welcome sweets as well as very friendly and helpfull staff, welcome drinks, very tastefull breakfast and the very picturesque view  from the room. I will come for sure again.

We haven’t been treated so good in many many holidays   We would definitely come back to 1809 Hotel when visiting Lisbon again.   They have such a wonderful service. The staff is very warmth, kind and willing to help at any time. They would do any reservation we need or give us any advice throughout the 24/7 wapp chat they have for guests. They gave us very good recommendations of places and restaurants to visit.  Fantastic bedroom with very good complementary treats.   My wife is vegan and they did amazing at the kitchen to provide excellent food to her. It was also her birthday and the staff prepared a beautiful surprise for her including  a vegan cake. This was very much appreciated.   We could use their free car park outside the hotel just in front of the the main door.

Incredible historic hotel and amazing staff! They were able to keep the hotel running for only 4 guests including myself and my mother during the Covid-19 outbreak. They were so understanding and unbelievably supportive when the news of many hotels in the area shutting down and dispersing the guests broke through. Thank you once again for all your hospitality and the stay at this beautiful property!

I would like to thank the management at the hotel for their help during this troubling time of the COVID outbreak My wife and I were due to arrive on Thursday 26th March for a 3 night stay Unfortunately, this has now been postponed. When we booked last year, it was a no “recourse if cancelled booking” However , the hotel have supplied us with a voucher, at no additional cost, which can be used at a later date I know that this terrible virus is affecting many people, in far more serious ways than missing a weekend break, but if all hotels follow the 1908’s example, it makes cancelling any trips a little less stressful  Thanks again

My wife and I enjoyed every aspect of our five nights at 1908 Lisboa.  Our accommodations were clean, quiet and comfortable, the breakfast buffet was outstanding, and all of the service was friendly and professional.  We particularly appreciated the enthusiastic assistance and recommendations provided by Andre, who effectively functioned as our concierge during our stay.  He welcomed us with a glass of wine, gave us helpful advice about places to go and booked our train tickets for an excursion to Porto.  By way of a couple of ancillary notes, this hotel is located in a transition zone between Lisbon's historic area and a bustling modern zone.  The immediate surrounding area is a bit shopworn in appearance, but we found it perfectly safe and had no concerns about walking to the

We visited the 1908 Hotel for the weekend of the 6th March, we arrived to a warm welcome from hotel staff which included a welcome drink and when arriving at our room cakes and a little glass of port each. We stayed in room 205 which overlooked the road at first I thought this may cause a problem with traffic but in fact it didn't we did not hear a thing from the road during the night. We were shown to our room which was spacious, with  a large bathroom. The hotel was situated central to everything we wanted to do and was along the famous 28E tram route which is a must for people visiting Lisbon. The bar downstairs provides excellent cocktails and would highly recommend a visit to give them a try. Breakfast is a buffet style but also fresh cooked items to order from. Staff were

I’m so happy I stumbled a upon this hotel while looking for a place to stay in Lisbon. The rooms are small, but comfortable. A complimentary bottle of water, tarts and port awaited for us when we arrived to our room - nice treat!  We were also told we could go to the bar for a welcome drink!   Location was good. About a 10 minute walk from Rossio Square. Less than that to Martim Moniz Square where you can catch the famous Tram 28.   Breakfast was amazing. They had an assortment of breads, meats, cheese, tarts, cake etc. They also provided you with a menu for other items where you could order toast, eggs, pancakes, yogurt etc.  The staff were always welcoming, helpful and pleasant. If ever back in Lisbon I would not hesitate to stay here.

We loved this hotel. The staff was very nice and friendly. The decor of the whole hotel was excellent, very modern. We found there was coffee and tea in the room, along with two small bottles of port with pasteries in the room. Staff also gave us a voucher for complimentary drinks at the bar, however, we did not take advantage of this, but definitely do because the bar area looks really cool! Our room was very nice; the room was a good size with a place for our coats and luggage. A small desk near the window. The bathroom was really big which was great, however for the size of the bathroom the shower was small. But that's ok. We loved our stay! Please note that this hotel is not very close to the main tourist areas. It took us 15-20 minutes to walk to the coast.

excellent room, clean and comfortable. Nice view of the avenue Staff are so helpful, polite & prefessional. the area is perfect - the metro just 2 minutes away.  Easy to walk to train station, restaurants, castle, metro, bars, shopping.

We has the most magical experience at 1908 Lisboa. From the second we walked in until the day we had to force ourselves to check out, the entire staff made us feel so welcome and went above and beyond to make our stay there so incredibly special. Please do yourself a favor and stay in this hotel if you’re visiting Lisbon! We can’t wait to come back.

This hotel was wonderful on so many levels, accommodating staff, artsy location, fun local bars and restaurants (though the restaurant in the hotel was SO good) The room and its accommodations were brand new and impeccably done. Close to public transportation. Highly recommend!

My mother and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights.  From when we booked this hotel until we left, the reception staff who has excellent English were so helpful and friendly, from arranging airport transfers to restaurant recommendations/ bookings.   The room and bathroom were lovely. We overlooked the small square and found it quiet at night. The bed was extremely comfortable. Toiletries and a good hairdryer are provided. On the first night we returned back to sweet treats and port in our room... a lovely touch. One little recommendation... to add a mirror to the room. There are 3 mirrors in the bathroom including a full length one but none in the bedroom itself.   We had breakfast included and we were delighted we had. Selection of breads, sweet treats, fruit, juices, cereal,

Stayed for 3 nights at this fab hotel. The rooms are amazing, we were upgraded to a panoramic room overlooking the bustling square and with views of the castle. The staff were second to none, from the minute we arrived until we left we were made to feel incredibly special, they could not do enough for us!! I would absolutely recommend this hotel, over and over again!

We had more service and better accommodations at 1908 Lisboa Hotel than we have had at 5 star hotels. The management deserves praise for their efforts to make this the best hotel experience possible. The rooms are beautiful, the beds heavenly and we felt cared for and happy here. We will always stay here on our visits to the great city of Lisbon!

Just had 3 nights at this great hotel. It’s a bit out of town but near the metro and Tram 28 ( and only a 15 min walk into the main  hustle and bustle). Staff couldn’t have been nicer and more helpful. The room was spacious, contemporary and clean. Lots of toiletries, water, tea and coffee. Breakfast is varied, fresh and plentiful. We have really enjoyed it here.
