Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Great facility, great location and wonderful staff.  the view from the little balcony in our room was amazing. Breakfast is served in a spectacular internal covered court, the bar is real little gem with also external tables diretcly on the square.  highly recommended!

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: The hotel is excellent, the staff are very kind and thoughtful. The facilities are great, the restaurant is great and the location is wonderful! Service was excellent. My room was very  comfortable. The location is excellent, close to restaurants and main attractions. Main quality is the kindness and attention of all employees.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Good hotel right at the centre. Helpful staff; the room was a bit small, but adequate. Breakfast was fine - good service.  Difficulty getting an uber to the hotel - they thought they couldn't stop in front of it.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Wonderful hotel. Great room. Staff very professional and courteous and go out of their way to help. Location excellent. Breakfast delightful. We stayed for 4 nights. The rooms were cleaned at least once a day to a very high standard.   We came to Lisbon to celebrate a special birthday, we did not tell the hotel. On the date, the hotel sent fizz and a birthday cake to our room.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Not bad but for a SLH it is just not good enough. The Ivens is 100m away and 5 times better. For a SLH everything is a little old and also outdated. People are friendly but not extreme service driven. Room is OK but old. The place is clean and on a perfect spot in town.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Great facility, great location and wonderful staff.  the view from the little balcony in our room was amazing. Breakfast is served in a spectacular internal covered court, the bar is real little gem with also external tables diretcly on the square.  highly recommended!

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: The hotel is excellent, the staff are very kind and thoughtful. The facilities are great, the restaurant is great and the location is wonderful! Service was excellent. My room was very  comfortable. The location is excellent, close to restaurants and main attractions. Main quality is the kindness and attention of all employees.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Good hotel right at the centre. Helpful staff; the room was a bit small, but adequate. Breakfast was fine - good service.  Difficulty getting an uber to the hotel - they thought they couldn't stop in front of it.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Wonderful hotel. Great room. Staff very professional and courteous and go out of their way to help. Location excellent. Breakfast delightful. We stayed for 4 nights. The rooms were cleaned at least once a day to a very high standard.   We came to Lisbon to celebrate a special birthday, we did not tell the hotel. On the date, the hotel sent fizz and a birthday cake to our room.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Not bad but for a SLH it is just not good enough. The Ivens is 100m away and 5 times better. For a SLH everything is a little old and also outdated. People are friendly but not extreme service driven. Room is OK but old. The place is clean and on a perfect spot in town.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: This hotel was amazing.  The location is the best.  You can walk to all the cool places in the city.  The staff is super nice and attentive.  They even help you book day trips that are reasonably priced.  Breakfast was good!  I do wish Europeans would learn about american bacon, the European bacon is gross. The square 50 feet away is beautiful.  The rooms were awesome too, so was the cleaning staff.   The pool was nice but cold.  Everything else was amazing!

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Great location. Exactly in the center of the city. The main tourist locations are in walking distance. Very nice hotel and staff. Very fast check in and out. The breakfast is tasty with good selection and quality. The room is well equiped, clean and quiet. Highly recommanded.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: We were treated wonderfully on our stay from beginning to end. Location was great and the room was spacious and clean. We were presented with a bottle of bubbly and sweets to celebrate our anniversary. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh and the service was excellent in the dining room.  The hotel arranged a tour which was excellent to Sintra.  Note that the refreshments in the refrigerator are a charged minibar although is wasn’t made clear.  All in all a great experience.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Greatly located, the hotel provides a nice feeling of historical authenticity but at the same time offers all the modern comforts. Staff was very attentive and thoughtful. The concierge helped us for all touristic plans and transportations whilst the lady at room service could even remember which type of coffee I prefer! Worth a visit also the RIB restaurant. Nice meat and a good wine and drink list!  We will be back!

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Marvelous experience, best bed and pillows I have ever slept in, it felt like clouds. Amazing service, employees exceeded the expectation in kindest and caring, I was really happy there and it was amazing to celebrate 1 year anniversary at the hotel. Restaurant also amazing! Recommend 100%

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: The staff here were really amazing! They helped us with all of our requests prior to our stay—Tours, drivers, restaurants, and then contacted our airline for items left behind. The hotel itself is beautifully located at the commerce Plaza and it’s a real gem architecturally.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Very well located, great staff, great service. The restaurant is fantastic. Breakfast is very diverse. There are always people available who can readily help you. Definitely, a place to come back to when visiting Lisbon in the future.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: This is a lovely hotel in a prime location.  The quality of the furnishings and the cleanliness are both first rate.  The public areas are beautiful and peaceful.  There is a parking garage closeby with a hotel discounted rate of 35 euros a night.  Quite expensive but it is a European capital with limited parking in an historic area.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: The hotel is very well located and the ratio price/quality of the services is amazing. I was also greatly suprised by the breakfast (it's not the typical buffet... the hotel propose a very nice breakfast with really good homemade dishes). I really recommend this hotel. Lastly, the staff is amazing. Everyone is very polite, welcoming and makes its best to ensure clients best satisfaction.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: TLDR version: Any hotel where a guest is not able to sleep, does not accomplish its purpose.  I stayed for one night. Have been to 3 Pousadas Pestanas previously so I was confident and knew what to expect. The staff was welcoming, professional, polite and accommodating.  Difficult to ask for more. The room was neat. No flaws to point at regarding furniture and hygiene. Amazing mattress and pillows. The site is beautiful and the art and decoration are an attraction on their own right. (a booklet explaining the art available for the guests would be a great addition). The breakfast is cooked to order. The space, the agile staff and amazing food make it work wonderfully.  Now, the bitter part. - I was negatively surprised by the check-in and check-out hours. From 16:00 to 11:00, we

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Incredible hotel. Perfectly located in Lisbon. Nice and big room. Creazy bed. And on top of this the staff at the hotel and RIB Beef & Wine restaurant are so nice. I recommend this hotel a million times.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Fantastic location, very clean and comfortable,  staff very supportive and extremely polite, breakfast was very good and served at table. They also have a very good bar and meat restaurant. I would really suggest this place to visit Lisbon

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: The frontdesk very helpful they arrange birthday for my husband  They were smiling abd ready to help anytime   Clean good location , you can go anywhere by foot The room view was amazing 301  Breakfast was fair not that tasty   I enjoyed the stay in the hotel and i may repeat it

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: I stayed at Pousada for only a couple nights but it was an amazing stay. All staff was great, very friendly and helpful in every way. The location of the hotel was incredible! Right in the center of everything. Clean hotel, quiet, and breakfast was good as well as service. If I ever go back to Lisbon I would definitely stay here again!!

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: We’ve just enjoyed 2 days at the Pousada - a really lovely, historical building with fantastic features. Everyone we met there was friendly and helpful. We ate at their restaurant Rib one evening and had delicious steaks. Would definitely recommend

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: The Pousada de Lisboa is first choice if you are looking for LOCATION - 5* amenities - highly professional, helpful and friendly personnel - very good Bar-Service - modern rooms - free and perfect WiFi.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: I had high expectations based on the other reviews, and I was not disappointed! Booked through World of Hyatt and the process was smooth. I ended up changing my reservation dates and no problems there either.  The hotel location is steps away from attractions and trams, and it is very convenient for getting around Lisbon. Check in was quick and staff were very helpful and friendly. I was escorted to the elevator and provided with information regarding breakfast, dining options and suggested area attractions to see during the afternoon.  I was booked into Room 109 with a King bed, desk area and small reading nook with armchair. This room was beautifully appointed with hardwood floors and vaulted ceilings. The small balcony with doors opening out to views of the plaza and sea were

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: We spent 3 nights at the Pousada, which has been renovated to a very high standard with many wonderful historic pieces on display.  Our room was perfect and was cleaned to a high standard.  All the staff were friendly and the service was excellent.  The food in the RIB restaurant was fab and the coffee the best we had whilst in Lisbon.  The location on the Praca do Commercio meant we were close to the river and to the many tourist trams.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: Wonderfully renovated Pousada in a great location. Walkable to many of the city areas and the Tram 28.  Rooms are clean and modern. All the staff was knowledgeable and friendly and helpful with directions and reservations. Definitely would stay again on another trip.

Hotel: Pousada de Lisboa, Praca do Comercio
review: This a beautifully sited hotel overlooking one of Lisbon’s prettiest squares. We went for a three night break. Concierge service in advance of our arrival from Rita and Emanuel was really good. And that continued after we arrived. They somehow found out - must have been from our passports- that it was my wife’s birthday and so sent flowers and champagne to the room.   We had a beautiful room, upgraded it has to be said. . All aspects of service during the stay were excellent. The square is noisy and the windows don’t quite eliminate the problem  -  but don’t let that put you off.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Our room was lovely, Beautiful Hotel and staff! we felt like being with friends! The best experience ever!  We loved the Breakfast, always ate too much, ha   My husband and I enjoy a drink at night it was so nice to have the nice Bar/Dining area! I ate the soup almost every night! The Chef knows how to make soup so flavor full. We also loved Paul and his staff!  Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Beautiful 1954 hotel. This hotel is a true gem in his original splendor. Location is perfect near Avenida da Liberdade for walking and sight seeing. Breakfast is good and bar has a simple and efficient food menu. All staff very attentive and a special thank you to Paulo Lopes, Carla in bar and Anastasia.  Don’t expect technology here, the hotel stays true to his roots and makes you time travel to the glorious and charming 1950’s. Love it a must return

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: The perfect hotel to celebrate my wife's birthday. Centrally located, great breakfast to start the day, extremely helpful and friendly staff. They provided umbrellas for guests leaving during a rainy day. We will stay here next time we come to Lisbon.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Hotel Lisboa Plaza is located just a stone‘s throw away from Avenida da Liberdade with its upmarket shops and metro stops. The popular Bairro Alto with many eating options is at walking distance (uphill). Some mini markets are also closeby.  Service was excellent, as was the price-quality ratio (at least during the low season). Breakfast was fine as well.  The decor of the hotel is old style which is lovely (unless you prefer modern style hotels).  The wifi worked well in the room and  in the lobby.  For a short city break I would recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Recently returned from a short break in Lisbon. Lisbon Plaza Hotel is well situated.  Helpful, friendly staff.  Rooms clean and breakfast had good selection.  24 hour Tea/ Coffee available in Lounge. Would definitely stay here again!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Our room was lovely, Beautiful Hotel and staff! we felt like being with friends! The best experience ever!  We loved the Breakfast, always ate too much, ha   My husband and I enjoy a drink at night it was so nice to have the nice Bar/Dining area! I ate the soup almost every night! The Chef knows how to make soup so flavor full. We also loved Paul and his staff!  Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Beautiful 1954 hotel. This hotel is a true gem in his original splendor. Location is perfect near Avenida da Liberdade for walking and sight seeing. Breakfast is good and bar has a simple and efficient food menu. All staff very attentive and a special thank you to Paulo Lopes, Carla in bar and Anastasia.  Don’t expect technology here, the hotel stays true to his roots and makes you time travel to the glorious and charming 1950’s. Love it a must return

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: The perfect hotel to celebrate my wife's birthday. Centrally located, great breakfast to start the day, extremely helpful and friendly staff. They provided umbrellas for guests leaving during a rainy day. We will stay here next time we come to Lisbon.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Hotel Lisboa Plaza is located just a stone‘s throw away from Avenida da Liberdade with its upmarket shops and metro stops. The popular Bairro Alto with many eating options is at walking distance (uphill). Some mini markets are also closeby.  Service was excellent, as was the price-quality ratio (at least during the low season). Breakfast was fine as well.  The decor of the hotel is old style which is lovely (unless you prefer modern style hotels).  The wifi worked well in the room and  in the lobby.  For a short city break I would recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Recently returned from a short break in Lisbon. Lisbon Plaza Hotel is well situated.  Helpful, friendly staff.  Rooms clean and breakfast had good selection.  24 hour Tea/ Coffee available in Lounge. Would definitely stay here again!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: A wonderful hotel with great staff. Stayed for two nights as that was all that was available for our dates. The hotel is very well located for seeing all the sights of Lisbon.  We will return. Thank you all for a great stay.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: The breakfast in the hotel was superb. We stayed here three nights and found the accommodations fine. The location was close to the shopping district; the staff was friendly and knowledgeable and the price was fine for the value that we received. I would gladly recommend this hotel to others.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This beautiful old world hotel is ideally placed for all the sites in Lisbon. The staff are fantastic and the hotel is clean and well presented if not modern. Room walls are thin and footsteps noise can be an issue. Biulders at the rear of the property also are causing a constant noise. Breakfast is very well presented with something to suit everyone.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Located near upscale shops, green spaces and a metro station Hotel Lisboa Plaza is an incredible find for under 80 Euros a night.  Family-operated with comfortable rooms and a lounge with Coffee or Tea 24/7 there is also an on-site bar, 24-hour fitness center and included breakfast Buffet.  Strong wifi, good water pressure and a quiet cobblestone street add to the experience.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: This is an excellent Hotel in a good position to the City Centre. Staff are polite and helpful if you need anything. Reception rooms are beautifully decorated, some in traditional decor. Breakfast is plentyful and fresh. There is a small roof top terrace with seating.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Hotel Plaza has a luxurious and personal feel. We have stayed here twice and have booked again for another stay.The staff are fabulous, so helpful and caring. Nothing is a problem, their only concern is your comfort. Breakfast is a lovely self-serve affair with plenty of choice. There are plenty of places to relax and enjoy the bar service. We always take our little dog and she is made very welcome. It’s our favourite place to relax and stay in Lisbon.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: I stayed here for 5 nights. Great hotel - perfect location and very helpful staff. The bedrooms are spacious with everything you need. Breakfast was good despite COVID restrictions. Reception staff were very helpful in arranging COVID test and printing all the paperwork. Thank you. I will be back. Nothing more to say!!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: I ended up here "by accident." The hotel I was booked into via booking.com was closed! Pandemic mania. I was kindly helped to book into this one. Lovely place, nice staff, the room was sparkling clean and plenty big enough. Room service could have a bit more variety, but I understand they don't have many guests right now!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: In one hand was sad in a magnificent city as Lisboa that all was closed down about COVID situation. In the other hand service, attention of personel of hotel has made really comfortable to stay even in this strange time. Guess all goes better in Portugal and I totally recommend this hotel for emplacement and services!!!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: It is a very good Hotel, value for money, everything under control, like hygienic service, top Location in Lisbon. Also location, direct in Centre of Lisbon, with good parking facilities. The employees are taking care, at the door, at the Reception, the Breakfast etc, 24 hours service. And is is very clean!!!! Regards John Voogd CAVO Trade  The Netherlands

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: My daughter and I stayed in the hotel for a week and we enjoyed every minute of it. A truly great service, polite and helpful staff. lovely rooms, cleaned to high standards. A fab hotel on one of the trendiest and most accessible streets of Lisbon. We highly recommend this hotel

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Extremely well located. Outstanding service overall. Refined decoration and classic style. Cleanliness of the rooms, personnel and breakfast are all excellent. Very high safety standards during unsecure times. Felt most welcome during our stay. Thanks

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Stayed here a few nights with my love and it was amazing. Hotel was very clean, food was really good and the staff was so accommodating. Location was perfect. If you are looking for a good place to stay, definitely stay here. We loved that the hotel was so close to everything buy still so quiet. Great places to eat nearby.  We were so impressed overall that  we will absolutely be back.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: I stayed one night inthe hotel with my husband and daughter. It was great for three people, as there were really two rooms, so there was space enogh. It was very clean. The decoration was good, the bed was confortable.  The situation is great, as it is almost in Avenida da Libertade and it was walking distance to Plaza del Comercio and also to the Goulbekian Foundation. The employees in Reception were very nice and helpful, the gave us good advice about restaurants near the hotel. They have a parking very near the hotel. We did not have breakfast, so I cannot give an opinion about it. I recommend this hotel, and I plan to go back to it next time I travel to Lisbon.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: I repeat every year because I found all the things I look for in a hotel. Well located in the heart of Lisbon, but a quite street. Personal is nice and helpful, and the breakfast is good and with a wide variety ok products. It is not a super-modern hotel, but it has an exquisite decoration which makes it adorable from the moment you cross de door. Rooms are comfortable and I adore their towels. And lots of plugs, which is important!

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Great hotel, Fantastic breakfast, the location is very nice close to everything. The staff were really helpful.. Staff very knowledgeable and recommended some great places to eat.   Rooms are nice size and spotlessly clean.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Stayed here during the covid 19 crisis.  Our plans changed so we came back early and stayed at the hotel awaiting a flight to Canada.  The staff was so accommodating to us, particularly at the front desk.  Ate our meals there as most restaurants nearby were closed.  Meals were good and well served.  Would highly recommend this hotel.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Fabulous hotel.  Excellent location, comfortable rooms always thoroughly cleaned and stocked, friendly staff, good breakfast.  Open lounge with 24 hour tea, coffee and water.  Bar that stayed open until late.   One negative - no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. Would definitely recommend and revisit.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: Fantastic hotel, great breakfast, excellent location close to everything. The staff were really helpful.  Nice bar with great choice of drink.  Rooms are nice size and spotlessly clean room service available should you require no need to check out till 12 which we found helpful.  Staff very knowledgeable and recommended some lovely places to eat.

Hotel: Hotel Lisboa Plaza, a Lisbon Heritage Collection
review: We booked three nights directly with the hotel for May.  We were immediately charged for the rooms and they were 100% refundable if cancelled 7 days prior to the stay.  We cancelled the reservations on March 12th and 10 days later we are still waiting for the amount to be refunded.  It would seem if they have the ability to instantaneously charge my credit card they could refund my money a lot sooner than this is taking.

The hotel is in a very strategic position! The rooms are cute, but I advice to book a superior room with an open view. The staff is kind and ready to satisfy your request helping you! We can do something more for breakfast.

Excellent location, beautiful and comfortable hotel with a Super Friendly Staff.  Room was beautiful and spacious.  Bed was very comfortable.. Bathrooms was very sexy, water got really hot....Really good buffet breakfast.. had a really good selection of food items, even gluten free.  Nice upscale Mexican restaurant connected ..good food

good place well located in downtown and the staff are welcomed accordingly. I enjoyed my stay and  I am pleased to recommend the hotel to any visitors for tourism or business. Very Wonderfull place. many thanks to all.

Very well situated hotel in the center of Lisbon, plenty of restaurants and bars in the vicility. Very friendly staff at the reception, though one day the room was not made when returning in the evening. Excellent breakfast buffet. One downside in the room: There was no desk to work on my notebook.

The location of this hotel is simply excellent - there are great restaurants just across the street, it's close to trams and buses and 5 mins away from the metro station. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop bar was closed. The rooms could use some refreshing, especially bathrooms could use a proper check if everything works properly.

The hotel is in a very strategic position! The rooms are cute, but I advice to book a superior room with an open view. The staff is kind and ready to satisfy your request helping you! We can do something more for breakfast.

Excellent location, beautiful and comfortable hotel with a Super Friendly Staff.  Room was beautiful and spacious.  Bed was very comfortable.. Bathrooms was very sexy, water got really hot....Really good buffet breakfast.. had a really good selection of food items, even gluten free.  Nice upscale Mexican restaurant connected ..good food

good place well located in downtown and the staff are welcomed accordingly. I enjoyed my stay and  I am pleased to recommend the hotel to any visitors for tourism or business. Very Wonderfull place. many thanks to all.

Very well situated hotel in the center of Lisbon, plenty of restaurants and bars in the vicility. Very friendly staff at the reception, though one day the room was not made when returning in the evening. Excellent breakfast buffet. One downside in the room: There was no desk to work on my notebook.

The location of this hotel is simply excellent - there are great restaurants just across the street, it's close to trams and buses and 5 mins away from the metro station. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop bar was closed. The rooms could use some refreshing, especially bathrooms could use a proper check if everything works properly.

Stayed here for 4 nights, really enjoyed the hotel, room was clean, comfortable and modern. Great location, parking available very close by. Found the staff ALL really polite, friendly and helpful, for me personally just genuine staff makes a huge difference. These guys face off to people daily, some nice some not so nice :/ we really appreciated their help and the stay, would definitely stay again

Tiny narrow hotel. Loud rooms in the night, terrible breakfast in a basement room without windows. Rooftop bar was closed and never open. I could not even go out there Go there if you get a good deal. Location is great but that's about it. Don't expect a four star hotel. Dont even think about it if you bring kids. Service was there but not really forthcoming.

Beyond great! Makes your stay better than expected, and when coming back to Lissabon there should be only this in ones mind ... 9 Hotel Mercy takes the breath out of you, and floor 5 room 503 will be my next focus when returning to Lissabon/Portugal.

Great location, was central to everything.  Helpful/friendly staff who made local recommendations. Fun little rooftop bar with great views of the castle. Only downside: beds could be a little more comfy, but definitely fine for a few nights.

Perfect hotel in a very central location.  Rooms quite, very hight quality and well decorate. Breakfast with a lot of choice (even gluten free bread was proposed). We can see Lisbon by nigth from the bar in the rooftop : amazing !  Staff very helpfull and welcoming all was perfect ! we recommanded and come back for sure

For nightlife and experiencing the contemporary culture of the city, this really couldn't be better situated. Also, from the bar on the roof, the lookout over to other historic parts of the city and the river are enchanting.

Have additional choices of meat for breakfast.  Have some soft subtle music playing that keeps you upbeat and alert. Offer water or tea to guess as they are entering the hotel at a certain period.  The Hotel Staff was excellent and helpful and will stay again.

Close to lots of great bars and restaurants, Barrio Alto, easy access to main train stations and a tram runs right outside! The team on the front desk were all very helpful and lovely and I'll stay again.

We booked a hotel that was not nearly as nice as the pictures mad it out to be. We looked in the area and I found this hotel. They got our room ready hours before the normal check in time. It was a sign of relief staying here. Very spacious room, good amenities. So many shops and restaurants within walking distance. I feel like i found the best hotel for my money in Lisbon. Well done.

We are on the last night of our 6 night stay and it’s been a very pleasurable experience. The hotel is in a fantastic location, more or less between Barrio  Alto and Chiado. Everything is within walking distance but it’s a very hilly city so we opted use the electric scooters a couple of times to get about.   The rooms are really modern and sleek, we stayed in an executive double which really well presented.   Breakfast is self service, continental style but there are scrambled eggs, bacon, etc etc for those that want something close to an English breakfast.   All the staff speak perfect English and are extremely helpful, they were more than happy to print out our fit to fly certificates from the nearby pharmacy for our flight back to the UK.   There are so many restaurants and

This hotel was in a great location for a fun night out. It is also very central to tourist spots in town.  The rooms are not fancy but they have robes and slippers.  Great staff too!  We are planning another trip back to Lisbon and will stay here again.

Great little hotel in the heart or at least “my heart” of Lisbon!  Plenty to see and do in any direction that you travel.  My son and I had a great time in your beautiful city!  Side trip to Nazare is a great side trip.  No waves during our visit but still beautiful and the museum allowed you to see the worlds largest waves even though they were not there the day we went.  I am told that November and winter months is when they return.

No disappointments, above and beyond service, directions, recommendations. Came back already for a second stay before leaving Lesbon.  Very clean and modern rooms.  Roof top bar very fun. Everyone so helpful, cheerful, and friendly

Wife, daughter and I loved every minute of our five night stay. Amazingly modern facilities with all amenities, best location in Lisbon, and best of all was the kind and genuine staff. It's noisy at night in this party district and equally fun and fascinating. Not the place you want if quiet is all you seek. After decades of travel in many countries, only one hotel in Milan had a breakfast so fine.  The rooftop bar is a great place to watch evening light on the castle and city. Only downside is bedding is a comforter that's a bit warm for summer sleeping, but the room's AC helps keep it comfortable. We'll be going back in a few weeks, looking forward to it.

beautifully quirky hotel.  The best breakfast in the city!  Such a very helpful staff.  And the rooftop bar has amazing drinks and superlative view of Sao Jorge castle.  Strategically located to enjoy the Tejo river, Bairro Alto, Baixa - Chiado and Alfama sections of the city. Trams and busses drive right down the street and the subway is less than a half a mile away.  Beautiful! Thank you, Obrigado!

Had a fantastic stay with work - very comfortable, well run, perfect location, great rooftop to end the day. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, and welcoming. The rooms were small, but that's to be expected in a hotel in the city centre.   Would highly recommend, and look forward to staying again.

We choose this hotel to stay close to our family living in Bairo Alto and it was a very good discovery. The rooms are really quiet, spacious and very confortable. We also appreciate the great view from the Rooftop bar. Very welle located in the center of the city, close to the Metro. They only negative point is the bath; too small and all the water flows outside when showering even if the curtain is closed. Despite of that we recommend the hotel and will for sure come back.

Stayed for 1 week to work from Lisbon. Amazing stay in the executive room. Love the rooftop bar as well. Great location. Super friendly staff. I’m definitely coming back to stay in this hotel. Thank you!

We had a great stay. The room was oddly shaped but clean. Wish we could have enjoyed the bars but sadly it wasn’t possible due to the situation. Best of luck going forward and looking forward to coming back to Lisbon. Front desk/Housekeeping were outstanding. Sweet and kind with personality.

Staff was accommodating and helpful especially helping us sort out our COVID test prior to our flight. Very fancy room with all the amenities we need. We enjoyed our stay! Highly would recommend staying here.

What a gem of a hotel!  Rooms were perfect, location was perfect, hotel front desk staff were prefect, housekeeping was perfect, free breakfast was perfect.... And the for price was perfect too!  This Is definitely my new 'go to hotel' in Lisboa.  Thanks for a truly perfect stay!

The 7 hotel locates in heart of historical Lisbon. Minutes walk to subway station and lift as well as to the major shopping street. Clean and not noisy room along with tasty complementary breakfast was like a cherry on top of our European cake. Thank you very much The 7 hotel.

All was fine during our stay. room was very clear and is pretty much new and well equipped kitchen. very good location. very decent breakfast. friendly staff. no parking but theres a paid one close by.

Warning. Very unfriendly staff.  They charge you double the amount and then ignore you so that they can keep the extra money.... Please save the money and time and go somewhere else. I'm usually happy with all my travels but this hotel just ruined it

I had a reservation to this hotel. Due to  conlicts and rockets  in Israel, all flights has been canceled in the last moment. I asked this hotel to understand the situation and cancel my reservation without fee, and they were kindly enough to understand the circumstances and they  canceled my reservation free of chrage. Thank you guys,  I'll defently stay at your hotel very soon.

What a gem of a hotel!  Rooms were perfect, location was perfect, hotel front desk staff were prefect, housekeeping was perfect, free breakfast was perfect.... And the for price was perfect too!  This Is definitely my new 'go to hotel' in Lisboa.  Thanks for a truly perfect stay!

The 7 hotel locates in heart of historical Lisbon. Minutes walk to subway station and lift as well as to the major shopping street. Clean and not noisy room along with tasty complementary breakfast was like a cherry on top of our European cake. Thank you very much The 7 hotel.

All was fine during our stay. room was very clear and is pretty much new and well equipped kitchen. very good location. very decent breakfast. friendly staff. no parking but theres a paid one close by.

Warning. Very unfriendly staff.  They charge you double the amount and then ignore you so that they can keep the extra money.... Please save the money and time and go somewhere else. I'm usually happy with all my travels but this hotel just ruined it

I had a reservation to this hotel. Due to  conlicts and rockets  in Israel, all flights has been canceled in the last moment. I asked this hotel to understand the situation and cancel my reservation without fee, and they were kindly enough to understand the circumstances and they  canceled my reservation free of chrage. Thank you guys,  I'll defently stay at your hotel very soon.

very nice hotel in terms of price and location Hotel location is in the center of downtown everything is just a walking distance from the hotel , you have access to main transportation lines beside train line is 10 min walking  it is not that fancy but for its price location and cleanness it is a very good deal  staff is very welcoming and helpful

Great location close to the Praça do Comércio and Santa Justa, walking distance to most sites and on good public transport. Lots of restaurants and cosy bars locally. Easily walkable to the castle, Barrio Alto and to Miraduros which are a lovely spot for sunsets.   Our room was comfortable, we went for an interior room and it was so quiet we slept so well every night. The bathroom was very modern, shower has great water pressure (with jets) and the bed is really comfortable. Staff were friendly and very helpful. They provide Nespresso and fruit in the lobby and it was super clean. We had our anniversary while there and the staff left bubbles and strawberry’s such a nice touch, thank you!!! We will return as soon as we can!

Excellent hotel in a perfect position in the Baixa, close to a Metro, and easy access to most parts of the city.  Internally very pleasant with comfortable rooms. Be aware that you can only get into the hotel after 3pm, but have to leave by 11am on departure (although bags can be left ). We were not happy to have paid for bed and breakfast to be told that the breakfast room was closed and we would have to use vouchers at a nearby cafe (which was good), thus disrupting our morning routine. TV didn't work in the room so changed rooms. Could have been handled much better by staff - one in particular - who forgot that "The customer is always right" and was more tan happy to engage in arguements. Plus side, I did get half a bottle of sparkling wine for my birthday!!

We stayed for 4 nights at The 7 Hotel. The location is perfect. Easy walking distance to all the main points of interest and public transport links. The hotel itself is small and friendly however the rooms are of adequate size and very well appointed. The whole hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff are extremely helpful. At present the breakfast room is closed for refurbishment so vouchers are offered so that guests can take breakfast at a nearby cafe.  Initially there was a mix up with our breakfast arrangements caused by our tour operator but the hotel staff bent over backwards to resolve the matter. It was my birthday during our stay and they even sent a bottle of Cava to the room as a surprise.  Thank you Hotel 7 for a wonderful stay.  Highly recommended

After walking around sightseeing Lisbon we came  back at 7pm and  our  room was not  cleaned. Apparently by mistake instead of the sign " ready to be  cleaned" we left the sign " come back later" that for  the staff of the hotel just means "don't clean  my room". There are keycard so they could easely understand if  someone  was in. there should be  a manager double checking if  everything is done but they left the housekeeper go without cleaning our room. The conclusion  is that the room was not cleaned. Just choose  another place.

The hotel is really close to everything, just around the corner from Baixa-Chiado metro station and a few minutes' walk from the main sights. The staff were polite and helpful and the breakfast was decent.

I stayed at the 7 Hotel in October 2019.  This boutique hotel is in an excellent location and great for walking to restaurants and shops. It is also very close to many of the sights and meeting points for tours.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and gave us many delicious restaurant recommendations. Please note, not all of the rooms are exterior facing, I had a TINY interior room.  I could barely move around the bed, but it was enough for me. It was extremely loud because the walls are super thin and you can hear people in the hallway or going in and out of their rooms.  Overall, it is a perfectly situated boutique hotel, you just won't get too much restful sleep.

Excellent location, clean and modern.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast was great with a good selection.  Great value as only 3 star but would highly recommend staying here if in Lisbon.  Close to everthing

On arrival staff argued with us that they had no responsibility for change to room type made by their partner agency and could not move us to city view which we had chosen and paid for.  The 'inner' room given smelled stale and view to downpipes in dark and dreary area was quite a disappointment.   We eventually got the room we booked despite been told the hotel was full only minutes before.  There is no restaurant other than a breakfast room.  I was surprised scrambled eggs were complimentary however poached costs €2.00 arriving out in solitary splendour. Positives: good central location close to restaurants, trams, shops and city sights.

The hotel was clean, the service super, frendly staff, breakfast for a 3 star hotel good. Room for 2 Piersons good, bathroom clean. Central in the city, walking distanz to the boulervard, overall a good weekend with a hotel to komm back

Can not recommend this hotel enough we had an absolutely brilliant stay from the minute we arrived the reception staff where lovely and friendly. Room was lovely breakfast was delicious and then a surprise bottle of bubbles sent to our room we definitely will be back.

WHEN: Our stay at The 7 was October 7-10 2019.  SERVICE: The front desk was great - I couldn't get in touch with a restaurant that I wanted reservations for, and the Front Desk did it for me before our arrival.  ROOMS: Smallish, but tidy. The outer rooms with the city views are better than the interior. Bathrooms have been updated. Serviceable.  OTHER: Breakfast was good - staff changed out the variety a little bit each day, and they always had mini pasteis de nata available, which was quite nice.  SUMMARY: One of the best features is location - a quick walk to Praca Commercio, trams, subway - very convenient.

There are so many boutique hotels in Lisbon.  7 hotel is located on Rua Aurea which is parallel to the main Rua Augusta. Rua Augusta is a pedestrian only street which connects to Praca de Comercio.  Room rates are reasonable.  Rooms are moderate.    The hotel is also very near the metro station Baxia- Chiado.  The airport bus also passes in front.  It is also near Praca dom Pedro IV.  Consider 7 hotel for a Lisbon stay. You can walk, take the bus or the metro system to get around.  Look for the red façade building.  The signage is small. It can be a challenge to find the hotel for a first time Lisbon visitor where all streets look the same and some parts are hilly.

Great location. Great bakerys for breakfast to visit close by. What ever you do request a street view room. Back rooms are small and dark. Eooms were clean and staff very helpful with a good understanding if english.

I stay here every time I visit. It's super easy to get to from the airport via bus or taxi. I've never tried via metro. Located near the comercio de praça, it's close to shops, dining and any of the tourist buses. The staff is always super friendly and helpful whenever I have questions. The breakfast is good, lots of different meats, cheeses and pastries and most importantly, a coffee maker.  My rooms have always been super nice and clean, no complaints.  See you guys at Christmas!

We picked the 7 Hotel for its convenience to many of the venues we wanted to visit in Portugal and we were right on target. The Hotel is small by modern standards, but felt very boutiquey. It was very clean and inviting, the staff was hospitable and pleasant, and the rooms were spotless and cozy for two.  We had a kitchenette, a plus, but unused. We were on the front of the hotel on the main street, but the walls and glass were well insulated and we didn’t hear any noise or traffic with the windows closed.    7 Hotel is on Rua Aurea literally around the corner from the Baixa Chiado Metro (the intersection of the Green and Blue lines) – a 2 min walk. Hidden up the street (Ruo do Cricifixo) to the right is an entrance to the multistory Armazens Do Chiado Mall (modern urban indoor

Short walk to many other sights, cafes, squares you name it. Blew into town at 6am, had to walk around until my room was ready, felt like I saw all of Lisbon on day one. If I could give a 4.5 or higher I would, as rooms and bath were small compared to many other hotels I have visited in center of major European cities, also price a little higher. Room and bath were inmaculate as the rest of Portugal seems to be. Was on first floor and still very quiet at night. Didn't so breakfast as there were so many other options within walking distance. Did I mention the location? Oh, and they gave me a small backpack which I used the rest of my trip, thank you.

Short stay in Lisbon brought me to the 7 Hotel. It is conveniently located very close to the metro station. Staff is indifferent and not very pleasing. I booked direct with the hotel due to several offers they make on their website, none of which were fulfilled. I recommend using your preferred booking company instead. I was not able to check in early, I did not receive 5 euros credit ( staff had no idea about that one even though it is on their website). Room had some cleaning issues and coffee pods were not refilled, leaving me high and dry when I had to leave at 5 am. Next time in Lisbon I’ll choose a different hotel in this area.

The 7 Hotel is a great hotel. Clean, modern, very nice accommodations in a good neighborhood. Walking distance to many things and nicely priced. Very friendly, English speaking staff. The room was well equipped.

This hotel is in the heart of Baixa close to everything. The rooms are spacious. Catarina at Reception is exceptional. I was fasting and she made she I was provided with a breakfast box each night as I had paid for breakfast. One big negative is a staff member called Bruno who was rude and nasty, lied to me and refused to help. He said its not his job to help guests and he laughed in my face when I said I would complain to the manager. Sadly this kind of attitude from staff is going to deter guests from staying at this hotel.

Hotel is located in a very touristy party of town. While location is convenient and rooms are a decent size, it is EXTREMELY loud all night long. The main areas of the hotel also smelled like raw sewage the entire 4 days we were there.  I would not stay here again. There are other places within a couple blocks if you are looking in this area that would still be convenient but without the 24 hour foot traffic outside your window.

There is no sense how the rooms are made. I took twim room. Its was not same as hotels.com pictures. The sink was at the room not at the toilet. Toilet was really small. Also the tv is somewhere you can not watch it. Also in hotel.com its it sayin sounds proof. Yep no. Everything you will hear at the hallway. Step, voices. I woke up many times at the night. Also there is safe deposit at the room but no code or no key. You have to get that from the reception. Shower draine is were slow and you have to put shower of all the time. Also no empty working power plugs.  Also tv remote doesn't work.   Also not safe place to stay with small children. Our room wardrobe door came off when child moved that. Luckily I was near and got a grip of the heavy door  and no injury happened. Also on

- room close to elevator, you could hear everything - wireless, does not working properly - roomphone does not work as told - fast check-in - city taxes not included if not booked directly - location is pretty - too tired - cant sleep cause of noise

Chiado is a great area of Lisbon but this hotel is a complete dump! They charged us top dollar for a deluxe superior room and we can’t open the windows because all of the machines and generators for this hotel are the view from our hotel room. When we went to switch rooms they told us we couldn’t and said our room was the front desk employee's favorite room. There are bugs flying in the room around the ceiling area all day and night. We’ve been to some amazing hotels in Lisbon but this one is just horrible! There is mildew, water damage in the waiting areas on the first floor, sitting areas and gym as well. The ceiling in the gym area has water damage with plaster hanging off the ceiling and bits and pieces all over the gym floor while I worked out. When the cleaning crew runs

The hotel is well located right next to a subway station in a great shopping district with lots to see. The staff was very friendly and professional. The rooms were cozy and clean, a bit rustic but comfortable. Was a bit disappointed with the central hall to where the room windows led to, it compromised the guests privacy a great deal as it was very easy to see everything into the rooms. The breakfast room was very fancy and beautiful. Recommend, great value.

Hotel is located in a very touristy party of town. While location is convenient and rooms are a decent size, it is EXTREMELY loud all night long. The main areas of the hotel also smelled like raw sewage the entire 4 days we were there.  I would not stay here again. There are other places within a couple blocks if you are looking in this area that would still be convenient but without the 24 hour foot traffic outside your window.

Luckily I was near and got a grip of the heavy door  and no injury happened. Also on

- room close to elevator, you could hear everything - wireless, does not working properly - roomphone does not work as told - fast check-in - city taxes not included if not booked directly - location is pretty - too tired - cant sleep cause of noise

The ceiling in the gym area has water damage with plaster hanging off the ceiling and bits and pieces all over the gym floor while I worked out. When the cleaning crew runs

The hotel is well located right next to a subway station in a great shopping district with lots to see. The staff was very friendly and professional. The rooms were cozy and clean, a bit rustic but comfortable. Was a bit disappointed with the central hall to where the room windows led to, it compromised the guests privacy a great deal as it was very easy to see everything into the rooms. The breakfast room was very fancy and beautiful. Recommend, great value.

The state and cleanliness of the rooms were not up to standard with a 3 star hotel. Although I understand that we got a ‘deal’ from a 3 star hotel, we expected more from the ratings on Booking.com.   First, we were given a room that was completely different to what the pictures had. On arrival, it smelled of sewage as well as had previous guests’ hair plastered on the walls, sink and shower. I assume that the smell of sewage was due to the fact that the bathroom wasn’t really separate to the room, it was only frosted glass that was between the bed and the “bathroom”. I called the reception immediately and asked for a different room. The reception agreed, although when we arrived at the lobby, the manager who was on duty was very annoyed with us and explained that it was because

Hotel Borges Chiado is excellently located, near a metro station, and in walking distance of the train station Rossio and several restaurants and places of interests. For example the San Justa elevators are a 5-10 minutes walk away. Our room was small and cozy, but inconvenient, because it was on the top and half of it was the diagonal of the roof top. My brother being 1.80 had to stay on one part of the room. Also the TV was badly placed, causing us to hit our head more than once. The staff is friendly, and they try to accommodate you as much as possible. I would recommend this place if you are planning to spend more of your day outside.

Just returned from Lisbon today. Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights with 12 friends. Can't fault the hotel. Big rooms. Perfect location and friendly staff. First time in Lisbon and would definitely book here again when I return. Liam. Dublin, Ireland.

The hotel is on a part of Rua Garret closed to cars. Cafes and restaurants very close and a small mall 150 m. from it, with plenty of fast- food . The Baixa-Chiado station of the metro (underground) just in front of the entrance. There are different kinds of rooms, and different views, so ask for what you need. The staff very kind and helpful. Breakfast buffet very satisfactory. .

This was our next stay at this hotel. Great location - city center, next to the metro station. It is worth asking for a quiet room, because, as in Lisbon, the party lasts until late at night. We would especially like to thank the lady at the reception (Friday evening, July 31), who took care of the breakfast boxes for us, despite the fact that she was alone on the shift. Thank you for your help, kind word and smile. We hope the hotel management will notice this. We will be back soon.

I had a very bad experience at this hotel. Once we arrived at the hotel the air conditioning was not working. The room was extremely stuffy and we only had 2 hours to shower, change and make our dinner reservation. We asked the receptionist could she fix it, to which she said she would be coming shortly. 20min later no sign of her. I had to go down to reception again and ask when she would be coming to look at this issue as the room was way too hot, and we needed to get ready and leave shortly. She then arrived at the room moments later, got the air con to turn on and said it was fixed. Soon after she left I realised it was only the fan which was working and not cold air, it also shut off automatically after 5 minutes. I turned it back on and it began blowing out hot air meaning

The location of this hotel is great for exploring Lisbon. The staff were very welcoming and allowed us to check in early with no extra charge. We were also able to leave our bags after we checked out which was useful. I booked two superior rooms which were vastly different. One was large and spacious with large beds, tv hidden in the mirror, sound proofing and a really large bathroom. The other was very small, noisy with tiny beds. I queried the disparity in the rooms with the hotel but was assured they were of the same standard. To crown it off there was no hot water in the smaller room. Unfortunately I cannot recommend this hotel and will not be returning although one of the rooms was nice.

We had an amazing room thanks very much we couldn't have got better Excellent location with the tram and metro a minute from the hotel. Cafes, bars, restaurants and shops only few steps away. Hotel itself was clean with beautiful lounge areas to relax in. There was a good selection for breakfast  served in a beautiful ornate room. All the staff were lovely polite and very helpful. I can recommend this hotel to and would love to return.

The Borges offers dusty no-frills accommodation in an old building that’s in desperate need of renovation. Think of it as a two-star rather than the advertised three stars to avoid disappointments. I paid 65€ a night, without breakfast, which was probably more or less what the place was worth.  The first room they tried to give me (434) was awful. It was basically a long, narrow corridor with a bed and a sofa bed. The receptionist also claimed there would be a bathtub in the room, but there wasn’t.  I was then given room 101, which was a lot better. It was large, but very worn-out. There were frosted glass windows to an inner courtyard of sorts, although it looked more like a dumpster. The fitted carpet was dusty and the room had a stuffy smell to it. The bed was a bit too soft,

Greeted by lovely friendly staff. Hotel very clean and some areas are very nicely decorated. Our room was ok not in the best condition and dated. Could hear the next door room as walls very thin. The breakfast room was lovely, food was adequate but breakfast staff very slow at clearing away the tables. Good central location.

Excellent location. Tram, metro few steps away. Cafes, bars, restaurants and shops only few steps away. Hotel itself was clean, good selection for breakfast although staff a little slow in filling up empty choices and drinks machines. Our room was a good size. Very clean and could not fault cleaning of rooms, fresh towels and sheets every day. Only negative was sewage smell in reception and lounge/gym areas. Money well spent would definitely use again and recommend.

I arrived early at the hotel and wanted to leave my bag, but the charming receptionist checked to see if there was a room available and checked me in straight away. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The location was perfect for metro and tram E28. Breakfast was nice with a wide range of produce. One small negative was the smell of salty damp in the coffee lounge and gym. The customer service was exceptional!

Very very small room.Our room size was for one person,not for two. Door from bathroom were broken, we couldn’t close them. And That smell , disgusting from toilet. Brekfast ok and location great , very close to subway and town centre.

The location is great  you step out of the hotel and whitin walking distance of several hotspots such as the elevator San Justa and the praca de commercio. Tram 28 stops 20 meters from the hotel. The hotel is also next to the famous cafe Brasielera but we went to Benard wich is also nextdoor but on the other side,because the staff of Benard was hundred times nicer than the staff from Brasielera.The breakfastroom is beautiful and the room was good only in the bathroom was not much space to put your beautycase.

Two fun loving Canadian sisters travelling together. We spent four nights here before our Celebrity Cruise in October.   We loved the room and location. Room was equipped with two twin beds and an in room safe.  Some reviews indicate no safe but the safe is in the closet and while it is not an electronic safe it is operated by a small key which is obtained from the front desk-no charge and kept our valuables safe.  Our room overlooked the plaza;  it was lively with sound with the window open complete silence once the window was closed.  Comfortable beds, bathroom was equipped with soap, shampoo and body wash, hair dryer and even provided a shower cap.  There is not too much space to keep bathroom products but it worked for us.  Shower pressure great with lots of hot water. Never

Yet another stay in that hotel mainly for the location. It was a budget stay in 1 person room with adopted tiny bathroom (shower gel, towels, shaving kit, toothbrush and toothpaste provided). Not good if you are claustrophobic,though. Good for one night but wouldn't stay for longer (unless you take a bigger room - havent checked that yet. Pictures are a bit misleading.  Basic breakfast but tasty, no complaints. Lisbon is full or nice restaurants, pastelarias where you can find nice food.  Staff very friendly and helpful.  If the price is right will stay again mainly for the location, right in front of the metro station.

This hotel really has a top top top location. Lisbon is a really great city and the location of this hotel has certainly contributed to a great holiday for us.  It is within walking distance to almost everything! When you walk out of the hotel you don't know where to go. Everywhere restaurants, cafes and socializing.  We had two rooms, one of which was renovated and the other not. The non-renovated room was okay. The beds slept well and were wide! The bathroom had a bathtub which was difficult for me as a rheumatoid patient. But that is a personal thing.  The breakfast was standard but not special. The breakfast room was stately and beautiful.  Due to the location, we will definitely book this hotel again.

Loved the hotel.Its location is amazing you get out of the metro and its right there, also the square has nightly entertainment. Nice and helpfull staff. Food is ok and rooms are clean and a good size.

Great location near bars and restaurants. The hotel rooms can be small and badly sound proofed. The reception staff are very badly trained with no attention to the guests experiences. No happy welcomes or offers of help. Breakfast was good, with nice choice of food. Coffee machines spew out factory waste - but there is filter coffee on tap too - which is better. I would advice you to see room before accepting. Top floors are better for quiet.  Very close to metro.

Not a first time for us in this hotel, so far so good overall, no complaints about the small rooms, that's the European standard,  This time the breakfast was very chaotic and extremely busy, dining room completely filled and basically not enough service people to handle it properly...not helping complaints. But we had a bright star at the front desk, Sonia is very patient, pleasant and professional...thank you!

The hotel is easily accessible from the highway and has a free parking in front of the hotel (limited places, but enough in this period).  Reception staff (the smile team) was very friendly and helped us with covid certificates.   Breakfast is good, could be improved with some warm food (eggs, sausages).  To summarize - worth for the money.

Specifically looked for Hotel near the airport also close enough to the bus station to Fatima. Ibis Hotel Malhoa is clean but very small for 2 people. We arrived at the airport almost at midnight and do not want to get a cab too far to the City.  This hotel is walking distance to the Sete-Rios Rede Express but if you have a lot of luggage, I suggest to take Uber.   If you plan to stay for more than a night, it's possible if you're by yourself because the space around the bed are too tight you have to walk sideways to get access.  The best asset in this hotel is their breakfast, lots of choices with fresh fruits too.  Staff are friendly, you can leave your suitcases if you want to check-out in the morning to spend time in the City but you must get it before the night ends because

Good location, near metro so central to see Lisbon. Rooms aren’t huge but clean with comfortable beds. Very helpful hotel staff. They were informative about open top bus tours and things to see. Bar in the hotel and food. I would stay here again.

We have booked this hotel mainly to have the easy access to metro (  approx 10 min walk )  Room :: clean & neat . Staffs:: Very friendly & helpful :)  Internet connection :; Good. suggestion:: break fast variety should   change on  alternate days considering no much restaurant/eat out  available/ opened  near by on early morning .

Warm smile, decent service and professional service... I would say the hotel is excellent. We'd love to go back to the hotel in the future. Our only concern is about the hotel restaurant. The Hotel restaurant is a little overpriced compared with other hotel restaurants.

The hotel is easily accessible from the highway and has a free parking in front of the hotel (limited places, but enough in this period).  Reception staff (the smile team) was very friendly and helped us with covid certificates.   Breakfast is good, could be improved with some warm food (eggs, sausages).  To summarize - worth for the money.

We arrived at the airport almost at midnight and do not want to get a cab too far to the City. Staff are friendly, you can leave your suitcases if you want to check-out in the morning to spend time in the City but you must get it before the night ends because

Good location, near metro so central to see Lisbon. Rooms aren’t huge but clean with comfortable beds. Very helpful hotel staff. They were informative about open top bus tours and things to see. Bar in the hotel and food. I would stay here again.

We have booked this hotel mainly to have the easy access to metro (  approx 10 min walk )  Room :: clean & neat . Staffs:: Very friendly & helpful :)  Internet connection :; Good. suggestion:: break fast variety should   change on  alternate days considering no much restaurant/eat out  available/ opened  near by on early morning .

Warm smile, decent service and professional service... I would say the hotel is excellent. We'd love to go back to the hotel in the future. Our only concern is about the hotel restaurant. The Hotel restaurant is a little overpriced compared with other hotel restaurants.

while i turned up way too early to check in staff were more than good enough to store my luggage,on my return it was a simple check in,the ibis has a colourful bar which is very fairly priced in my opinion,clients also have the use of a lap top and printer which is helpful to some.you have lifts to all floors and while the bedrooms are basic they are spotless,very quiet and have all you need for a comfortable stay. the hotel isn't central but a ten minute walk and ten minute metro ride your in the heart of the city and for those who want to visit sintra during your stay the train station is only a ten minute walk away.all in all a comfortable stay.

The hotel is comfortable for short visits in Lisbon as it is close to São Sebastião underground station and has restaurants nearby. The rooms are functional and are equipped with a TV and windows that isolate from street noise.

I had hoped that this hotel was closer to everything but it is well-run and has taxis outside. The rooms are nive and clean. The staff friendly. The food is not very good so avoid this. It is good value if you like walking.

One night in transit. Very friendly staff, everyone we meet had a smile and a hello for us. Excellent breakfast buffet. Small clean rooms. Area a little boring with high rise building in the business district. Value for money all the way

The service was good - Everyone was very helpful. Clean room, good shower, very comfortable bed. Had a nice weekend!!! I stay at this property whenever possible!! It is beautiful hotel. Would recommend to everyone!!

Service was friendly and helpful and the rooms were standard Ibis style. A nice place to stay, specially for quick trips. Parking was not as expected and the location is not the best. But you get what you pay for.

Located in a business area, but you can easily get to city center, so this wasn't too much trouble. Our room was standardly furnished and not so spacious, but for couple of nights it's absolutely fine. Staff very kind and professional, feel free to ask them if you have any issues. We might stay again.

I liked the location, very close to the best attractions of Lisbon. The room is standard, unsurprisingly. Breakfast is very good, all Ibis staff was friendly and attentive. Parking is suitable for small cars, there is no way to maneuver large vehicles. The region has good restaurants.

Small and cosy rooms, Ibis-style, not american size (of course). Friendly staff. Good breakfast. Good options in the menu at the 24/7 restaurant/pub/bar in the lobby. Only one towel per person, no hand towel.

Modern hotel conveniently located near a Metro station on the blue line. Breakfast was included and this was first class especially the pastel de nata (custard tarts). Staff were very friendly and helpful.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. For some reason, I like the mattress at Ibis hotels a lot, so I sleep very well. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is not exactly centrally located but is quickly reached by subway. Our room was basic but clean and comfortable. We didn't have breakfast at this Ibis hotel so I couldnt rate. I would stay again at this hotel if I came to Lisbon.

This hotel is just what you need for a 2/3 night city break. Its decor is plain and simple but beds are comfortable with a super walk in shower.  It did lack shelves but they are gradually introducing shelving units; our friend had one next to her wardrobe.  The room is serviced each day.  Whilst you only get 1 large towel each, you do get fresh ones each day. Pillows are soft foam based  If you're coming from the UK, don't expect tea/coffee making facilities in the room. However the bar downstairs can provide these drinks and Tetley tea too! Breakfast is served in a large dining area. It's a lavish Continental style fare with cereals, breads, cakes,  fruits, cheese, eggs and ham. No cooked food but there is a decent toaster. If you have a particular cereal you like, best bring

Stayed here for 4 nights. Convenient for Praça de Espanha metro. Small room, clean, nice towels and bedding, comfy bed. Came in late one evening, had paninis at bar which were good. Drinks very reasonable... small beer and glass of wine only €3! Staff helpful. Would be happy to stay here again!

Very good hotel Clean rooms Friendly personnel Excellent breakfast 15 minutes in car from city center Close to Corte Ingles store Close to plaza de España subway may be 10 minutes walk Has small restaurant inside Free wifi

A cute lobby, quite far from the center of Lisbon, not walking distance. Small, very basic, but clean rooms. Surprisingly, nice breakfast. If you go for pleasure don’t stay at this hotel. The staff was indifferent, most of them sometimes gave the sense that were pretty bored being there, but not all of them.

The hotel is not in the city center, but it’s only five minutes away from the Praça De Espahna metro station. Everyone is very polite and ready to help you whenever you need. They can provide help with rental cars, with tours, with touristic information etc. The bar is open 24/7 and it also provides to the costumers food along with the drinks. The room that I stayed was very clean and the bed was very comfortable! I would surely recommend it to anyone visiting Lisbon.

Every member of staff we came across was friendly and helpful, the hotel is located in the business area of town rather than the tourist area so restaurant choice is limited in the evening but your are only a couple of minutes walk from a metro and 5 mins from el Corte Ingles which has many food outlet in its basement and some good restaurants in store. The rooms are basic but clean and fully functional - lacking in room safes and no tea/or coffee making in the room. Hotel restaurant is good but choice is limited if you are here for more than a couple of days - menu mentions dish of the day but we never found any signage to indicate what it was..Overall good value for money and a very good stay, would stay again, transport is very reasonable 1.50 a trip on metro.

Good breakfast buffet spread, lots of fresh fruit along with other good stuff. Clean rooms, strange TV channels, nice bathroom. Free un-secure wi-fi. A bit of a walk from either metro stop (Praça de Espanha or S. Sabastião). Aoubt 8 euro taxi ride into the center or the riverfront and to many museums.

We stayed there in October 2019; it's not quite a central location (there are a lot of companies around), but the Metro station is nearby (Praça de Espanha) and that will take in 10-15 minutes to city centre. Very nice breakfast and nice room, although not very big. Will probably stay at Ibis again.

Clean, but bare minimum room. One thin towel per person. Reminded me of a dorm room. When 6 couples arrived they only had 4 rooms for us. Blamed it on booking.com. Bar area nice for group gathering after touring all day. Rooms were surprisingly quiet (or maybe I was just very tired!) Would not stay again.

Staff nice, helpful, not their fault, proprietor needs to step up. Bathroom, black mold No refill tp, shower gel Minibar empty and lukewarm Spirits a no-no No bar No bacon  Owner Muslin so not permitted

This hotel stay was the worst part of our visit to Lisbon. Apparently the hotel doesn't allow customers to adjust the AC level in their rooms - it's all managed at the front desk. They didn't inform us of this until our last night there and the manager happended to be work that night. After the first sweltering hot night, we took a picture of the AC settings and showed it to the front desk to confirm it wasn't user error. We were told our settings were correct but the front desk associates didn't inform us that the issue was that they were controlling our settings. When we informed the front desk during our last night - hoping to get one night of comfortable sleep - the manager then informed us that they control the AC settings for all rooms and that perhaps our settings were on

Well I don’t know what to say… everything was perfect. From the amazingly warm welcome of the staff to the amazingly beautiful room…  This was our home for 3 days and the only thing I must say is that it was so short that I miss this place so badly that I almost cried coming to my real home!  The staff is amazing, kind and really available for any advice or help. They speak many languages.  The pool is open even really late at night it’s pretty rare for hotels. The pool is really cold I heard it was the Portuguese way to enjoy a pool so we dealt with it ! The solarium is heaven on earth.  The breakfast is so good, and they have so many options (gluten free, lactose free and halal).  Ideally located on the direct line to the airport it’s so convenient to leave your luggage there

We spent 4 nights at this hotel while visiting Lisbon, and it was delightful! Very nice and personable staff, fast check-in/check-out. We stayed in a superior double room on the 6th floor. The room was quiet, spotlessly clean, modernly furnished, with a flat-screen TV. No city view, unfortunately. The room had a cozy, small seating area near the large windows. Very comfortable bed/pillows. The bathroom was modern & spotlessly clean. Toiletries provided. Daily room housekeeping. Excellent, free wi-fi. Coffee maker, free bottled water, little chocolates, and apples in the room. Good continental breakfast in a nice ambiance. Spending time by the poolside on the 9th floor during the day and after dark, while admiring the city view was definitely the highlight of our stay here. The

I stayed 3 nights at this posh and beautiful hotel in June 2021.  The hotel staff were very welcoming and nice I'd like to point out especially Pablo who assisted me and recommended me about places to visit and how to get there. My room was beautiful, spotless and well designed with a big window overlooking the Republic Ave. The bed was very comfortable with soft pillows. I also loved that the TV was part of the mirror and the lighting of the room, all very minimalistic.  The bathtub and shower were big and the shower head was good with strong water pressure which was very nice.  You get a bottle of water and some chocolate complimentary upon arrival and a new bottle of water every day. The location is great right next to the metro stop in the center of Saldanha with many shops

Staff nice, helpful, not their fault, proprietor needs to step up. Bathroom, black mold No refill tp, shower gel Minibar empty and lukewarm Spirits a no-no No bar No bacon  Owner Muslin so not permitted
