The pool is really cold I heard it was the Portuguese way to enjoy a pool so we dealt with it ! The solarium is heaven on earth.  The breakfast is so good, and they have so many options (gluten free, lactose free and halal).  Ideally located on the direct line to the airport it’s so convenient to leave your luggage there

We spent 4 nights at this hotel while visiting Lisbon, and it was delightful! Very nice and personable staff, fast check-in/check-out. We stayed in a superior double room on the 6th floor. The room was quiet, spotlessly clean, modernly furnished, with a flat-screen TV. No city view, unfortunately. The room had a cozy, small seating area near the large windows. Very comfortable bed/pillows. The bathroom was modern & spotlessly clean. Toiletries provided. Daily room housekeeping. Excellent, free wi-fi. Coffee maker, free bottled water, little chocolates, and apples in the room. Good continental breakfast in a nice ambiance. Spending time by the poolside on the 9th floor during the day and after dark, while admiring the city view was definitely the highlight of our stay here. The

I stayed 3 nights at this posh and beautiful hotel in June 2021.  The hotel staff were very welcoming and nice I'd like to point out especially Pablo who assisted me and recommended me about places to visit and how to get there. My room was beautiful, spotless and well designed with a big window overlooking the Republic Ave. The bed was very comfortable with soft pillows. I also loved that the TV was part of the mirror and the lighting of the room, all very minimalistic.  The bathtub and shower were big and the shower head was good with strong water pressure which was very nice.  You get a bottle of water and some chocolate complimentary upon arrival and a new bottle of water every day. The location is great right next to the metro stop in the center of Saldanha with many shops

An ideal hotel to stay in during a pandemic - the hotel was super-clean and their Covid precautions very thoughtful. We loved the decor which was very stylish and attractive. The staff were very helpful. Very convenient for Lisbon’s excellent metro system. A lovely place to stay.

We enjoyed the location most of all. Next to the hotel is one of the best bakeries in Lisbon. Subway stop is at the hotel door. One of the best vegan restaurants is in the mall nearby and Panorama restaurant is 5 minutes away, which made it extremely easy to explore the city.  We asked for the tea kettle  and enjoyed a cup of tea every evening.

Great hotel - small, quiet, friendly staff and extremely helpful as we had arrived from Cape Verde without our luggage they kindly provided us with some essentials. Well located for transport and local bars and restaurants all within walking. Walkable to centre too if you don’t mind walking. Very clean. Would definitely stay here again.

Stayed for four nights on a room only basis. Hotel literally next to Metro stop for touring around the city. Also a really nice bakery next door for breakfast if you dont take the B&B option at the Hotel.  Rooms are very comfortable and immaculately clean. We had a problem whern our flight back home was cancelled without notice from the airline. The Hotel staff could not have been more helpful - and we got things sorted out.  Thanks to everyone at the Hotel.

Easy access from Lisbon airport as there is a metro station directly outside the hotel  Very funky modern establishment.  Our room was very well equipped and exceptionally quiet for a city centre hotel.  Decent sized rooftop pool which we would love to have swum in had our stay had been during one of the warmer months.  All staff were very helpful and professional.  Vlad in particular was very proactive during the breakfast service.

The small and convenient hotel is located next to Saldanha metro station. Very interesting design, public areas and rooms are designed in the same style, dominated by white (which is natural) and different shades of gray. The room was not very large, but quite comfortable. Beds are very good quality. Spacious wardrobe, safe, small refrigerator, TV,  The lighting is sufficient. The bathroom comes with a Hairdryer and a full set of toiletries. Towels were changed every day. There is a special mirror for shaving, which is convenient.

I spent 4 nights at this wonderful hotel for my birthday and would definitely recommend this accommodation for anyone visiting Lisbon ! The hotel is so clean and decorated beautifully , the rooms are well equipped and have very comfy beds and excellent showers. The breakfast is great too and has a wide selection to choose from.  The best thing about the hotel are the welcoming staff . They are so kind and friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. A very big special thank you to the staff for the generous fruit basket and pastries and birthday card, really appreciated the effort made!  A Special mention to Pedro, Diego and the breakfast staff Vlad, Wilson and Vinicius for their hospitality!  Tips (Room comes with fridge and safe and you can ask

There are so many brilliant things about this hotel. Firstly it is literally steps from the closest metro which makes the whole of Lisbon easy and quick to get to.   The hotel is beautiful and spotless. The rooms were cleaned everyday and chocolates, fruit and water left for us each day. We also had traditional Belem pastries waiting for us on arrival too. The rooms were modern and looked great.   The rooftop bar was really nice and the pool looked inviting. Unfortunately the water was freezing and the weather a little too cold for us to appreciate it. It would have been nice if they were able to heat the pool a little so it could be used throughout Autumn too.   The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was nice and there was a good choice. However there is no cooked

Very clean room, friendly and young staff, pool and solarium on the roof, we paid an honest price, perfect position for transport and Colina’s restaurant in 3 minutes walk!! We will surely be back next time in Lisbon

Great hotel,nice helpful staff, brilliant showers, nice area, feels safe and is super easy to get to places  being right  next to the metro.  Water fruit and chocolate in the room every day.  Staff really knowledgeable and also really helpful.  Would definitely stay here again.  Nice places to eat nearby.

Rating this 4.5! Hotel White checked off all of the boxes for us.  The only thing some people would not like is that it is a little far from the city center(25-30 min walk), however, the metro line is literally steps away from the hotel door.    Bed was super comfy and air conditioning worked very well.  We opted for the breakfast option and it served us well but was nothing special.    Staff was great, always willing to answer any of our questions and made our stay extra enjoyable.    We went up to the roof top pool once (in the rain) to look at it.  Very small, but would of been real nice to utilize.  We spent too much time exploring so never took advantage.  Our visit was end of September so wasn’t exactly pool weather either.    Happy we chose this hotel and would recommend

I would rate this good rather than very good. We had a very nice room, but 2 twin beds pushed together when we had booked a deluxe double. Sliding door to the bathroom - personal preference would be for one you can close properly! We were on the 9th floor so had a balcony which was a plus. Breakfast was OK - continental and not a particularly inspiring selection. There's a metro stop right outside, which was very handy, and it only a minute's walk to the Versailles cafe which is where we had a delicious breakfast both days.

Stayed here for 3 nights, staff very attentive and friendly, hotel was spotless, nothing was too much trouble, not a big hotel, but big on service!  Hotel was minutes away from the metro and the city and only 5 mins from the airport Would stay here again

We have just spent 2 nights at this excellent hotel and can't talk too highly about it.  It is bang next to Saldanha Metro with easy connections into the rest of Lisbon.  The metro fares at 1 Euro 50 cents for any ride is so cheap (especially compared to London) and when we left we got the metro straight to the airport - again for 1.50!!! We arrived from our cruise at 10 o'clock and although check in is supposed to be 15.00 they let us in straight away which made a huge difference to our day.  The Reception Staff are excellent - helpful and friendly.  We only had to ask for an adapter or a glass of orange and they were there!!  When we said we were going on the Metro to the airport and were going to get the elevator on the other side of the road, immediately our guy lifted up

This is a fairly new hotel in a very nice area. Very clean modern design. Extremely comfortable beds. Nice rooms well fitted out. Lovely rooftop pool area with great views. Young keen helpful staff. Secure underground parking just across the street.   There are lots of good places to eat and drink close by.  Pastelaria Versailles is brilliant for pastries and wonderful for breakfast. Galeto is another Lisbon institution just across the road. If you don’t fancy eating there it’s great for a nightcap. Taxis are inexpensive and plentiful so getting around the city is easy. A very good place to stay.

Our criteria for a hotel for a city break in the summer is simple, it needs to be clean, comfortable, have good access to public transport if it is not in the centre of all tourist attractions, as a bonus serve a decent breakfast and have a pool.   Hotel White Lisboa offers all of this. It is situated right by the entrance to the Saldana Metro station. It is spotlessly clean, the standard rooms were comfortable. The rooms and bathrooms were small, but more than adequate for a city break and the shower was one of the best I have encountered in any hotel. The rooftop pool is small and cold but we appreciated being able to spend an hour or two up there in the late afternoon after walking  around the sites of Lisbon all day.  Breakfast, served daily and included in the price of our

We were blown away with the quality of this hotel for the price paid for 3 nights with breakfast. This is a small boutique hotel with 5 rooms on each floor. We arrived a little bit earlier than the 3pm check in time, but this was no problem for the staff, they checked us in to our rooms within 10 minutes. Our rooms were beautiful, clean and had air con which was greatly appreciated. The hotel is on a busy main road but we heard absolute no noise on the second floor, facing the road. The breakfast was of usual continental standard, there was plenty of choice to eat.  We absolutely loved the roof top pool. Bare in mind though, it is only small with around 8 sun beds. This provided great views over the city of Lisbon. The hotel is also situated in the heart of Lisbon, so you’re

This place is the best. Nearby to all what you need on a holiday. Specially the staffs are super friendly and helpful if you need any information around the city or anything.Rooms were pretty clean and beyond expectation.

This hotel is very clean, modern and despite being on a main road -  surprisingly quiet. We had two rooms on the first floor both were clean with good air con. Small ish bathrooms. Breakfast was good but nothing hot. No tea or coffee in the rooms. Rooftop pool was great but only about 8 sun beds up there. The freezing cold water and high winds made it near impossible to go in. Still - it was a nice place to hang out for an hour or two in the late afternoon. If it’s not too hot you can walk everywhere but with the heat of the summer we decided to take the metro which was quick easy and cool. It’s about a forty minute walk to Rossio area and about 20 mins to Eduardo park - nice to do in the evening. But to get to anywhere else you’ll need the metro or bus. There aren’t many signs

We had a very good stay at this hotel.  Their greatest asset being the impeccable cleanliness and the location of the hotel close to the metro and in the heart of Lisbon.  The hotel is open 24 hours a day with a nice pool. The staff is very warm and kind.  Regarding the lack of the hotel I would say the lack of insulation that we can easily hear the neighbors and the fact that we are watched by the staff when we have lunch.  But it didn’t affect our stay at this hotel for 10 days.  Thank you!

Expensive, noisy, terrible view to an abandoned and broken building, worst breakfast we ever had. I really don’t recommend this hotel.. we could hear people from others room all night, we heard the cards and people fighting on the street. The abandoned building in front of our room is creepy. Lisbon hotel are all very expensive compare to many countries we have been traveled to. The only positive point is that the room was clean.

Booked this B&B on a emergency for my mum and aunty who missed there flight and were stuck at Lisbon Airport. My family have told me to make sure you leave a 5⭐ review for this place. The rooms were clean checking was smooth eventhough they checked in at 00.00am. The most importantly thank you so much to the night staff called "Arthur and weksley" who were so kind and very helpful to them. After encountering such rude unhelpful staff at the Airport. Thank you again so much.

Great comfort and quality, in my opinion extraordinary value for money!  I was rather hesitant to book a room at this hotel due to the fact that it's so close to the airport, but my oh my it only added to the comfort of my stay! I was caught by surprise by the Coffee Corner with free coffee and tea which apparently is functioning 24/7, as it's self serviceable!  Decent Wi-Fi too, as I was able to work (and play some video games before bedtime).  Lovely young staff, always with a smile and ready to help you.  Definitely recommend!

I didn’t have the possibility to stay in the hotel but the staff were excellent on understanding the current situation and accepting my cancellation without charging the fees associated. I’ll take good note of this hotel for my next travel to Lisbon. Thank you !

Expensive, noisy, terrible view to an abandoned and broken building, worst breakfast we ever had. I really don’t recommend this hotel.. we could hear people from others room all night, we heard the cards and people fighting on the street. The abandoned building in front of our room is creepy. Lisbon hotel are all very expensive compare to many countries we have been traveled to. The only positive point is that the room was clean.

Booked this B&B on a emergency for my mum and aunty who missed there flight and were stuck at Lisbon Airport. My family have told me to make sure you leave a 5⭐ review for this place. The rooms were clean checking was smooth eventhough they checked in at 00.00am. The most importantly thank you so much to the night staff called "Arthur and weksley" who were so kind and very helpful to them. After encountering such rude unhelpful staff at the Airport. Thank you again so much.

Great comfort and quality, in my opinion extraordinary value for money!  I was rather hesitant to book a room at this hotel due to the fact that it's so close to the airport, but my oh my it only added to the comfort of my stay! I was caught by surprise by the Coffee Corner with free coffee and tea which apparently is functioning 24/7, as it's self serviceable!  Decent Wi-Fi too, as I was able to work (and play some video games before bedtime).  Lovely young staff, always with a smile and ready to help you.  Definitely recommend!

I didn’t have the possibility to stay in the hotel but the staff were excellent on understanding the current situation and accepting my cancellation without charging the fees associated. I’ll take good note of this hotel for my next travel to Lisbon. Thank you !

The hotel is right near 2 important Pracas / squares of Lisbon: 2 min from Rossio square and 5 min from Figueira, most touristical squares. 1 min from train station. Is renovated, very clean. Small rooms but very comfortable, elegant bathroom. We really enjoyed. Ask for upper floor rooms, and facing back of hotel, are less noisy. Did not take breakfast.

A very nice hotel, central in Lisbon, with spacious rooms where cleaning is done every day.  I do not recommend the front view room because it is noisy because of the cars, there is no mini bar.  The boy at the reception when we arrived recommended us to drink water from the sink because everything was closed, including the airport, it was midnight.  He could give us something to drink from breakfast, but no, he said to drink from the tap, instead, from the very nice reception.  Breakfast is not wow, I prefer to pay more for a good breakfast, I ate one day here!

We stayed here 3 nights and enjoyed the stay with the hotel.  It's centrally located and a 5 minute walk away from Rossio metro station and a few minutes away from Rossio train station.  Masks have to be worn within the hotel during covid, but this was not an issue at all as all the team were were also wearing them at all times.   The staff at reception were great and always helpful if you needed anything.   We were in a twin room and it was on the small side is my only negative comment.   The rooms do come with air con, a tv and the bed was really comfortable.  There's also a lovely supermarket downstairs, so not far to walk to stock up on anything you need.   The location made it a great base to explore Lisbon from!

Had no complaints at all with this hotel. Found staff friendly, breakfast was fine. For a budget hotel i don't think you can go wrong. Seeing it is right in hart of Lisbon, thought it would be more expensive..

The entrance to the hotel is between the entrance and exit of a grocery store. The room was small and clean. We stayed for a week. Our only problem with the place was the bathroom. The plumbing must not have a "bend" so the smell from the pipes was terrible at times. The shower was narrow with a door that didn't seal so water was always on the floor.

The hotel is right near 2 important Pracas / squares of Lisbon: 2 min from Rossio square and 5 min from Figueira, most touristical squares. 1 min from train station. Is renovated, very clean. Small rooms but very comfortable, elegant bathroom. We really enjoyed. Ask for upper floor rooms, and facing back of hotel, are less noisy. Did not take breakfast.

A very nice hotel, central in Lisbon, with spacious rooms where cleaning is done every day.  I do not recommend the front view room because it is noisy because of the cars, there is no mini bar.  The boy at the reception when we arrived recommended us to drink water from the sink because everything was closed, including the airport, it was midnight.  He could give us something to drink from breakfast, but no, he said to drink from the tap, instead, from the very nice reception.  Breakfast is not wow, I prefer to pay more for a good breakfast, I ate one day here!

We stayed here 3 nights and enjoyed the stay with the hotel.  It's centrally located and a 5 minute walk away from Rossio metro station and a few minutes away from Rossio train station.  Masks have to be worn within the hotel during covid, but this was not an issue at all as all the team were were also wearing them at all times.   The staff at reception were great and always helpful if you needed anything.   We were in a twin room and it was on the small side is my only negative comment.   The rooms do come with air con, a tv and the bed was really comfortable.  There's also a lovely supermarket downstairs, so not far to walk to stock up on anything you need.   The location made it a great base to explore Lisbon from!

Had no complaints at all with this hotel. Found staff friendly, breakfast was fine. For a budget hotel i don't think you can go wrong. Seeing it is right in hart of Lisbon, thought it would be more expensive..

The entrance to the hotel is between the entrance and exit of a grocery store. The room was small and clean. We stayed for a week. Our only problem with the place was the bathroom. The plumbing must not have a "bend" so the smell from the pipes was terrible at times. The shower was narrow with a door that didn't seal so water was always on the floor.

Like many hotels in the center of cities the rooms are small but cozy. The Inn Rossio has the same boutique feel you can expect at a place like this. The location for tourist couldn’t be better, it’s even at the bottom of the hill. A short minute walk to anywhere you want to go.   The service is minimal so if you are high maintenance might not be for you. Little things like you have to check your own bags after check out for the whole day there is no bell hop and you are responsible for the 2 flights up to carry your bags. I recommend getting that key before you check out to save a step in going back up and down the stairs.   The views from the windows are great and there is a very fun music video Chanel that makes getting ready a blast.

Proximity to metro,buses and local trains.Also grocery stores and restaurants .It had rossio metro exactly beside the hotel and local buses were behind the hotel.Acces to trams also nearby.Famous rossio square 20mts

A year ago we looked for a hotel near the airport. This hotel popped up. We were a bit to fast with booking it. Right after booking, we found out it wasn’t near the airport. So we tried to cancel it, but it wasn’t refundable.  Today we stayed here, room 307, but never again. The room is very small for 3 people because it is under the roof, so there a not many places where you can stand straight. I bumped my head several times. The bathroom is very tiny. The remote from the aircon very dirty. I cleaned it before using. The room has 2 windows and both have a view of aircons. It is also very noisy.  The bathroom was clean. Good WiFi en the hotel is in the center of the city, close to the metro.

A hotel located at the central location with walking distance to Rossio and Chiado areas, easy access to train station for day trip to Sintra and metro, bus, tram, elevator rides. But it needs to improve its poor ventilation in the washroom.

The hotel is in a great location but we were disappointed with room and breakfast, considering the price.(over 110 euros) The room was very small and this was supposed to be a superior room - no tea or coffee facility, no fridge, slightly shabby. The girl at reception was very helpful and pleasant, no problems there. Breakfast was very disappointing, when we arrived about three quarters of the tables were free but all had  dirty tablecloths covered in debris from previous guests so had to sit at a dirty table. The food was very budget, poor quality, cheap processed bread and hot option was a small amount of congealed cold hard scrambled egg and a couple of tiny tinned frankfurters.

The hotel location is in the main center of Lisbon and just five minutes walk from the metro station Rossio. An ideal place if you have a night arrival in Lisbon.  We arrive at the hotel after midnight and helped by a man Rui Martinho; he speaks good English. The reception is minimal as well as the hotel lobby. However, my eye caught the staircase; a beautifully painted wall with a design from the tram 28 and Santa Justa-lift, it looks like real, awesome! There is an elevator in the hotel in case if your room is on the top of the building  The room description:  The bedroom is well enough for us with two single beds. Our room is facing down to the shopping streets, but we have no noise from the outside. The room facilities: it has a cupboard with hangers, a big mirror,

Stayed for 2 nights in Feb 19. Three of us stayed in a very oddly shaped room with one of the beds almost being in the corridor of the space alongside the sink (bathroom was shower and loo). We weren't expecting anything fancy and that's what we got - a no-frills very central hotel. Location is excellent. Room clean but basic. Check-in reception staff not particularly friendly but we got checked-in.  All in all would definitely use again but don't expect anything fancy!

The hotel was a bit old fashioned and quirky. Not really much going in the way of facilities but there are plenty of shops and cafes within a 2 minute walk. Close to the main squares and waterfront. Taxi rank close and taxis are very reasonable

We booked this hotel via booking and it looked nice with the pictures. However we ended up in a room that was not refurbished (all the ones on the pictures were ref.), and dated back to the '70. as they were fully booked we could not change room either. Thankfully the room was quiet, bed comfy and shower good (although the bathroom was also very tired), so we let it be. The staff did not help making this place better either, no info on breakfast room, coffee room, baggage room badly explained etc etc. I have stayed in several hotels in Lisbon in the past and this was definitely the worst ever and not worth the price. Lisbon is one of the few places that still has very good decent hotels between 60-100 euros but location you obviously pay for.

Great hotel and a great location for that price! The rooms were big enourh for a family. The breakfast was ok. Near to the central station and Rossio square. I would definitely recommend it.. It was a bit noisy though

Terrible bad hotel! Incompetent staff! Agresibe! Not polite at all!!! No water in tehe room! Par fun in the aeration in order to avoid bad smells!!! Try another hotel! The personal is not helpful at all! You will have the “privilege “ to be admonestated! It was a disastrous experience! They are lying on booking and they show rooms that they do not have!!! Chesty pictures! Be aware!!!

This hotel is as it says on the packet- a cheap budget hotel. Our room was supposed to be a superior room- well it was bigger than most but that was where it ended. There was a peculiar smell that hung around the room all the time.  The floor sloped and the drawers on the bedside tables and desk had minds of their own and opened when they felt like it!!!! The walls were paper thin every move and shower from the next room were very clearly audible.  Being very near the station the noise at times was loud but bearable. The shower was good and the room was cleaned every day. The towels were small and rough but changed frequently. The safe had no key at the outset.  After getting it from reception it was very difficult to lock and open - very iffy. As a hotel it is ideally placed

very central hotel, rooms clean but can be odd shaped and space can be small, but clean and staff helpful, breakfast adequate although it can be a little slow to replenish the plates of food, but the  location as I say is good so it makes up for the downsides

Well placed for exploring the city, the staff were friendly and helpful when needed. We found the room to be clean, and the breakfast was adequate, no full English available but cereal, toast, yoghurt, ham, and cheese, enough to keep you going until lunch. My only qualm is that the bathroom was small, the shower was big enough for two inside which meant no elbow room when using the sink, and there was nowhere to put a towel or clothes when showering/washing, but overall I was happy and would definitely stay there again.

My husband and I had a lovely stay at the Hotel Rossio Inn, the hotel's location is absolutely perfect. Smack bam in the middle of central Lisbon. Close to a lot of tourist attractions, restaurants and close and east access to public transport. Rooms are stylish and has everything you need. Friendly staff and good service. Simple breakfast but good and sufficient. Hotel is good value for money.

We stayed here for four nights. it's a nice city hotel and the location is ideal. The staff were very nice and the room was clean. Although the hotel is in the busy city centre, the rooms are very quiet. Our room was very small and cramped. When we got home we found out that we had booked and paid for an Superior room but were given a Standard room. I don't think this was intentional but check your booking when you get your room. The safe in the room is a bit of a joke because it can be picked up and carried out. But all in all I would recommend this hotel if you are in Lissabon for a few days.

Very convenient location for all sights. Room, small but clean. No key available for safe in room. Hairdryer was very bashed and worked for 2 minutes then stopped until it cooled down, no use for 2 ladies! Girl On reception was very helpful and allowed us to use dryer in an empty room but man on reception next day was extremely unhelpful and directed us to the 'lady of the housekeeping' who was just rude! Breakfast was basic but not inedible.

I recently stayed at the Hotel Inn Rossio in Lisbon whilst travelling solo! I was abit anxious about the trip but the hotel was really easy to find! Literally out of Rossio station and it’s round the corner. Plenty of eateries around and a supermarket next door which was really helpful. I arrived before check in time and luckily was able to place my bag in the luggage room so I didn’t have to carry it around all day with me. This was excellent. The room was perfect for what I wanted. The bed was comfy and the room was clean. The bathroom was a little on the small side and the hot water temperature in the shower was abit hit and miss so you do have to watch you don’t get burnt. However the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The location is ideal for exploring Lisbon. You

Amazing location near everything, you have metro restauradores five minutes walk, supermarket pingo doce,  baixa-Chiado this hotel its amazing and super clean! Amazing experience I will back  Melhor escolha no centro da cidade

Clean , well presented rooms in a fantastic central  location. Don’t bother with the breakfast - it is awful. After the first morning we went out for our wake up coffee & pastry.... which given the location was easy ito do

The hotel is located in a central area of Lisbon, just a couple of stations away from the Downtown Lisbon, and about 15min from the airport (taxi), there is a whole range of local restaurants nearby, for a true taste of Portuguese food (away from The rip-off of touristic areas). The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable, and I found the room of a reasonable size, and containing all the essentials.  The dark tones of the room gives a cozy impression. The staff at the reception was amazing, and sought to help me as I arrived quite a bit earlier. I did not visit their restaurant and bar, as I found the prices in the restaurants nearby more competitive. An overall nice experience, looking forward to another booking on future trips to Lisbon.

We stayed here whilst visiting our daughter who works in Lisbon. This is a first class hotel. Our room was beautiful and adequately spacious. The breakfast was of good quality and offered plenty of choice. The staff were friendly and helpful. I felt the hotel offered excellent value for money. Good to note Covid precautions were observed. Located in a busy neighbourhood as you would expect in a large and vibrant city. We recommend the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Loved this place (and Lisbon in general).  Great recommendation by Sara at the counter for a "Very Portuguese Dinner" restaurant just up the street - but that would be another full review!  Very clean, easy to work with - everything we asked for was met with an "of course!".  Stored bags after we checked out - of course!  Some pods for the in-room coffee maker - of course.  Near the main road to downtown, near a Metro stop, near a bus stop.  Clean room, with nice amenities, like the coffee maker, some nice soap, shampoo, etc. Did not try the breakfast or any other food in the hotel.  Elevators are quick, but standard European small.  Not a great place for a view, at least from our room.  Bed was firm, but I like that.  It was 2 doubles pushed together, so a bit unconventional

Stayed here for three nights and was very pleased with the hotel. Room had good facilities and was clean and big enough. Restaurant was only open for breakfast and anyone on a dinner package. Even we tried to ask if we could pay extra to save going out after a long drive but was told that facility was not available even the bar was not open!. I felt this was strange as they were cooking anyway for the dinners on the package so we had to go out to another local restaurant which was very good. We had a car so the parking is via a car lift so our car was a medium size SUV and was extremely tight fit and the parking bays were very small. Luckily my wife directed me into the lift but would be difficult by myself. Staff were very helpful in every detail and nothing was too much

We came here for two days with my husband. The staff was kind and available. The room was clean with a view on the city. They respect Covid 19 rules so you will feel safe there. Parking in the hotel. The breakfast was good, sweet and salty choices. we will come back next time !

The hotel is located in a central area of Lisbon, just a couple of stations away from the Downtown Lisbon, and about 15min from the airport (taxi), there is a whole range of local restaurants nearby, for a true taste of Portuguese food (away from The rip-off of touristic areas). The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable, and I found the room of a reasonable size, and containing all the essentials.  The dark tones of the room gives a cozy impression. The staff at the reception was amazing, and sought to help me as I arrived quite a bit earlier. I did not visit their restaurant and bar, as I found the prices in the restaurants nearby more competitive. An overall nice experience, looking forward to another booking on future trips to Lisbon.

We stayed here whilst visiting our daughter who works in Lisbon. This is a first class hotel. Our room was beautiful and adequately spacious. The breakfast was of good quality and offered plenty of choice. The staff were friendly and helpful. I felt the hotel offered excellent value for money. Good to note Covid precautions were observed. Located in a busy neighbourhood as you would expect in a large and vibrant city. We recommend the hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Loved this place (and Lisbon in general).  Great recommendation by Sara at the counter for a "Very Portuguese Dinner" restaurant just up the street - but that would be another full review!  Very clean, easy to work with - everything we asked for was met with an "of course!".  Stored bags after we checked out - of course!  Some pods for the in-room coffee maker - of course.  Near the main road to downtown, near a Metro stop, near a bus stop.  Clean room, with nice amenities, like the coffee maker, some nice soap, shampoo, etc. Did not try the breakfast or any other food in the hotel.  Elevators are quick, but standard European small.  Not a great place for a view, at least from our room.  Bed was firm, but I like that.  It was 2 doubles pushed together, so a bit unconventional

Stayed here for three nights and was very pleased with the hotel. Room had good facilities and was clean and big enough. Restaurant was only open for breakfast and anyone on a dinner package. Even we tried to ask if we could pay extra to save going out after a long drive but was told that facility was not available even the bar was not open!. I felt this was strange as they were cooking anyway for the dinners on the package so we had to go out to another local restaurant which was very good. We had a car so the parking is via a car lift so our car was a medium size SUV and was extremely tight fit and the parking bays were very small. Luckily my wife directed me into the lift but would be difficult by myself. Staff were very helpful in every detail and nothing was too much

We came here for two days with my husband. The staff was kind and available. The room was clean with a view on the city. They respect Covid 19 rules so you will feel safe there. Parking in the hotel. The breakfast was good, sweet and salty choices. we will come back next time !

I stayed in hotel on 24th July to 26th July. Hotel facilities are great and quality of rooms and standard is very high. There was not many guests staying because of COVID 19 but rooms were very clean shower excellent and service as well. We have to say thank you to Reuben he gave us and extended check out because we needed to shower and had a later flight, so a big thank you to him. Overall breakfast selection was good staff very friendly and helpful. The location is a 20 min walk away from the main centre or if you take transport it’s 5 mins. I would stay again and recommend this hotel. Price and value of hotel is very very good for lisbon.

I went with my friend for a weekend away for her birthday and loved this hotel. A little bit up from the centre, but the taxis and Uber are cheap enough. The staff here are fantastic ~ nothing was too much trouble. They even noticed it was her birthday and after coming back from sightseeing, that supplied us with cake and champagne. Above and beyond, especially Marcello and Carlos, the two bar staff, who looked after us.

Good enjoyable stay very well presented and clean hotel.room was basic but did have fridge but had to pay for coffee pods,and no USB charging points in the room.but other than this very enjoyable stay.

Good personal, good food and very helpful people! Very clean and not far from the center of Lisbon. They have a taxi service very good and it takes just few minutes to go to the airport of Lisbon. Go there!

Friendly staff very helpful. Good breakfast. Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Short walk to city centre and good restaurants close by. We arrived early made accommodations for us to get our room a bit earlier.

Stayed 3 nights at hotel. Extremely clean, staff was very helpful. Pro's: local coffee shop across the street taht had wonderful pastries, cappucino, very close to subway entrance. Cons: Area of town appears to be getting run down, homeless people sleeping within 1 block and while we were outside seated, was approached by one who had some issues.

Comfortable beds, delicious breakfasts and excellent concierge assistance.  Everyone associated with the hotel was friendly and helpful.  The location of the hotel made it easy to walk to restaurants and tourist sights.

A good base for a short stay. Situated just outside the tourist areas of the city in a residential district, but only 150 metres walk from the Anjos metro station, which is the way to explore Lisbon. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Staff friendly and knowledgeable, and a good range of food for breakfast. Single metro ticket from the airport costs 2 euro, and a day rambler ticket costs 6euro50. Drinks in the hotel are expensive.

Nice hotel nearby centre, very good breakfast, clean everywhere. Staff is professional and there mood is all the time positive. We took away our breakfast in the last day, they called a cab and gave us a coffee in the lobby. Yes, very good host!

Stayed for a week in Lisbon on a tour package.  The staff was fantastic and always very accommodating.  The housekeeping staff made sure to check on cleaning the room if the do not disturb sign was out during their regular cleaning time.  The rooms and baths are well done with nice tile and rain shower heads. Our only criticism would be the lack of storage for longer stays.  Nice breakfast buffet which wasn't included in our package and a little pricey at 10 EU/PP.  Overall would definitely recommend!

The Czar Lisbon Hotel is an excellent hotel, nice bar and restaurant easy walking distance to the centre of Lisbon. The rooms are average size but large bathrooms. It is also very quiet for a city centre hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff, I would stay here again.

Excellent loved everything! You got everything in the room ! All kind toiletries and hair dryer ! Also the safe! Everyone was so friendly and professional! Food was delicious too! Thank you! Definitely will return and recommend this hotel!

Like the service from all the people in the hotel. The room was very clean, a little bit dark and because on the roof outside there was a filter we could hear it it the room a little bit during the night, but not that it would keep me awake.

It has been my second time at czar and I’m happy I picked them again.  I fear I arrived at the hotel hours before the check in. The concierge - I’m sorry for not remembering your name - has done ALL she could to allow me to access the room as she understood my situation.   The amenities are adequate but you’d expect a tad more from a 4* hotel. Other than that it was very handy but you’ll need to go to reception if you need anything (that’s what happened to me when I requested a toothbrush).  Bed is unfairly amazing! I did struggle a lot to wake up the following morning and I had to take a nap through the day!  Walk in shower and toilet are perfect, the view to the back of the hotel is appalling. You’ll think you’re in poverty and would easily downgrade this hotel if proper

Excellent hotel to stay at when visiting Lisbon.  The hotel location is conveniently located near the metro staton and a close walk to the city center.  The hotel staff was helpful with check in and check out and even helped making local restaurant reservations. The hotel has a daily dinner option and a bar with creative cocktails. The rooms were clean and had all the amenities necessary when traveling. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Room was clean with modern furnishings. Close to Metro. Minimal facilities for tea and coffee. Items needed to be purchased at a cost from the hotel. Should have been complimentary like other hotels of this standard/rating.

We stayed at this hotel for a week.  The room was comfortable and overall the hotel was very nice.  The front desk staff was very helpful whenever we requested assistance.  The bar staff was also very friendly and made some  very creative cocktails.  A Metro station is a block away which makes it very convenient to get to the central part of the city.

Excellent hotel, every minute worth to stay . Very clean and neat. Nice people. Very good breakfast buffet. Next to metro station. Close to center Lisboa Sit outside at terras Pleasant people to help you.

The hotel is very clean and very beautifully decorated.  Staff was very friendly, kind and  helpful. Allover a good location, it was a very plaisent  stay.  A negative thing was the large window with a kid could open very easily and passe trough it😱.   Kiran

The lobby area and room are clean. Convenient location - just a couple minutes from  Metro station and there is a grocery store nearby. One thing that stands out is the internet, it’s the fastest internet we have ever experienced staying in hotels in several countries in several parts of the world. The unfortunate downside is the air conditioning/heating did not work for 3 days while we were there. Staff are friendly and nice. Housekeeper was not quite consistent.

Good hotel close to the airport. Rooms and bathrooms need modernising, but comfortable.  Staff very friendly and welcoming. Restaurant bit expensive. Breakfast was good.  Carpark handy, but had to pay extra

I just came back from Lisbon and I had a great stay at Radisson Blu Lisbon Hotel. Rooms are exceptionally clean, mattrasses were amazing  and really comfy, and we really enjoyed our stay there. Staff member were  really helpful in answering all our questions and I liked the location as it is very close to the airport (7 minutes taxi ride) but also conveniently located near Capo Grande metro station so it is excellent for exploring the city and not to be worried especially if you have early flight in the morning. Overall, great stay, comfortable  and clean rooms, tentative staff, great location and I will be happy to return.

The hotel is about 6 minutes from the airport which helps out with early morning flights.  The hotel states airport transportation is available but only at 6 AM.  Taxis are available at a cost of about 8 Euros.

We stayed for a further night with our young family at this hotel and were not disappointed. The staff at this hotel are the most wonderful and welcoming staff that I have found in any hotel in the world. They recognised us by sight and made us feel so welcome. No request was too much trouble for them - especially with our young family. Each one of them made us feel like family returning home.  We will choose this hotel every time that we visit Lisbon simply because of the wonderful staff here and the caring way that they take care of us - above and beyond what we expect every time.  (Plus the location is really convenient for the airport and metro etc. and the hotel facilities are really good too).

Very good hotel with nice central location between airport and centre.Spacy room, nice staff and excellent service. Food in the restaurant was also good. Perfect price/quality ration, worth the money.

Good hotel close to the airport. Rooms and bathrooms need modernising, but comfortable.  Staff very friendly and welcoming. Restaurant bit expensive. Breakfast was good.  Carpark handy, but had to pay extra

I just came back from Lisbon and I had a great stay at Radisson Blu Lisbon Hotel. Rooms are exceptionally clean, mattrasses were amazing  and really comfy, and we really enjoyed our stay there. Staff member were  really helpful in answering all our questions and I liked the location as it is very close to the airport (7 minutes taxi ride) but also conveniently located near Capo Grande metro station so it is excellent for exploring the city and not to be worried especially if you have early flight in the morning. Overall, great stay, comfortable  and clean rooms, tentative staff, great location and I will be happy to return.

The hotel is about 6 minutes from the airport which helps out with early morning flights.  The hotel states airport transportation is available but only at 6 AM.  Taxis are available at a cost of about 8 Euros.

We stayed for a further night with our young family at this hotel and were not disappointed. The staff at this hotel are the most wonderful and welcoming staff that I have found in any hotel in the world. They recognised us by sight and made us feel so welcome. No request was too much trouble for them - especially with our young family. Each one of them made us feel like family returning home.  We will choose this hotel every time that we visit Lisbon simply because of the wonderful staff here and the caring way that they take care of us - above and beyond what we expect every time.  (Plus the location is really convenient for the airport and metro etc. and the hotel facilities are really good too).

Very good hotel with nice central location between airport and centre.Spacy room, nice staff and excellent service. Food in the restaurant was also good. Perfect price/quality ration, worth the money.

On my house I have my room near a road. Time to time is passing  a car, motorcycle or whatever. However the window and door of the room is so well insonorized that I merely or not even notice the transit passing by. I knowed this hotel is located near  one of the most busy roads of Lisbon (segunda circular). But I was expecting a well insonorization of the room windows. But this is not the case, at All!! They provided me a room turned to  the road with two windows, one I can see the west side of the road and by the other I can see the west side. The room, even located on the 9° floor, is so noisy from the traffic on the road that I needed to go the bathroom at 6.30 AM and was never sleep again with the great noise of cars, motorcycles and flights (located near the airport). I

It was a good location (a few minutes to the city center and the airport), very clean (everyday cleaning done perfectly, fresh towels, and friendly cleaning team). It was cold weather outside, and the heating in the air conditioning was not working, a good restaurant and a great team at the bar.  The hotel is not respecting the terms of the Radisson Rewards. So if you are a Gold member, don't expect anything from the hotel (they only respect the privileges of the Platinium members).

Most of the staff were nice and helpful except 1 or 2 . Breakfast was good and plenty. location was central and near to airport and metro.No way it meets standards of Radisson blu in other countries. rooms are not sound proof and can hear people talking from next room. water leaking from windows and roof at times. stayed for 4 nights, tea and coffee in the rooms were not refilled. phone was not working. found left over can of tuna in the fridge. felt hotel was understaffed and badly need renovation.

I chose this hotel because of its location (close to friends I was visiting). I was very pleased with the facilities and the comfort of my room. It was extremely quiet, despite being near a busy highway and not far from the airport.

The hotel needs to update the rooms. It’s really old fashion for the price payed. I was with my husband and my kids in a Junior Suite and the room was really big, which was great but the furniture was really old for a 4 star hotel in the centre of Lisbon

Good room for 4 persons (2 adults + 2 children). The beds were very comfortable. Clean. Good location for getting aroun Lisbon, near restaurants, parking always available near the hotel. Helpful staff

Stayed less than 24 hours and that was too long. The rooms are dingy and old. TV and lamp didn’t work in room. The restaurant was open, however they didn’t have enough people there apparently,as it took 30 mins to get a drink and another hourish my food. It was a tasty meal once it arrived though. It felt like a 2 star hotel. The floor I was on had bicycle gear laying outside door-gross!!! I paid $125 and expected a bit more. Utterly appalled by this hotel

Extremely well located for our last night in Lisbon with a 4 minute drive to the airport in the morning or we could have taken the free shuttle. Excellent check in with attentive and friendly staff. Henrique also later put us into a cab to a traditional restaurant he made reservations for on our behalf; it was SUPERB and we would never have found it on our own.

The hotel is nice, the staff friendly and helpful, only critic is the fridge didn’t work but was replaced but we lost time waiting for this to happen and I asked for a second duvet but got a blanket which I don’t like and the pillows were lumpy, I asked for cervical pillows but only got two normal ones. I stayed 3 nights in total with 2 days imbetween and the larger 32m2 room on the fourth floor was meant to be more luxurious but was the worst, we had terrible very  loud creaking noise every hour throughout the night but when we said at the reception no one was really interested, it’s a shame as I’ve used this hotel every time I’ve been in Lisbon and encouraged my friends to as well

The staff at the hotel are amazing but the hotel is tired and the rooms and decor are very old and worn…and we had lukewarm water in the evening and No hot water at all in the morning. For a family of 5 this was really not good and sadly not only did the hotel have no maintenance available but also no manager. We were offered NO compensation at all for this and I felt we should not have paid. The breakfast too was really mediocre. The hotel is convenient for the airport but that’s about it!

Everyone was very accommodating and we appreciated it since we had a lot of stress in our travel that day. Food in the restaurant was absolutely delicious and our bed was super comfortable. The rooms were feeding Lee spacious as well

Impressive hotel. Close to the airport with cheap parking in front. Nice rooms and cool ac. Very friendly staff and was impressed by how helpful they were. Overall much better than I expected.  We will be back. The shuttle runs after 6 am only.

Family rooms are pretty large.   Breakfast good but did not change for 5 days. Hotel Parking expensive and not included by default.  Public parking available just outside (keep a lot of change , 5 euros denominations when you park in Lisbonne)

Tired hotel with poor breakfast and crazy house keepers. Bathroom quality of cleaning wasn't good. There was a vakuum cleaning on our floor hall on Sunday morning 7.30. It was done quite loud, with hitting our room door. There wasn't oatmeal on breakfast.

Good welcoming, upgrade my room , good services , good foods, friendly staffs. , good location for access to city and others places. , good price and much better of others hotels like that , room was clean , everything was good

this is a comfortable hotel 2 minutes away from lisbon airport. i had an excellent stay and look forward to returning. it is also next a nice park for an afternoon stroll. room service had delicious pastel di natas

The hotel needs a facelift as an all.  The rooms have nice areas, tho a bit old fashion. Sleep quality very good.  The breakfirst has very low choices and expensive for what is offered, the service was very slow and unprofossional from the attendant.  The

After a month of work in the canteen of the Papal Swiss Guard in the Vatican, I returned to Portugal via Madrid. Knowing that I won't find a taxi on the last mile to my house, I decided to stay at the Radisson Blu Hotel. The reception staff recognized me. There is a more familiar atmosphere. I just feel good in this hotel chain. I am a loyal soul. See you again within the loyaliity program!

I would agree completely with the review from 1JU. The hotel is perfectly placed for access to the airport but the rooms are tired and in need of refurbishment. The staff were helpful and friendly and we didn’t have a problem with noise as Portugal was in lockdown so no bike racers on the highway !

The hotel itself wasn’t up to usual Radisson standards. The property felt old and tired and in dire need of a renovation, the room decor felt dated but the bed was really comfy. The breakfast currently on offer too was a pretty poor selection but that is likely a product of Covid-19.   Proximity to the airport was the best thing about this hotel though being probably only 5 minutes away from the terminal by taxi.

Had one night stay at the twin room,really great room with nice view . Rooms are of good size .very clean and nice service.just need some work done in kitchen as there was nothing in kitchen because of the covid situation

My Charm Lisbon Suites is a really charming hotel. Front staff is very friendly and helpful. My room was small but very charming, with great attention to details, modern bathroom and everything you need for a comfortable stay. Location is convenient, close to the Metro and a 30 min walk to a train station. It's located in a multi-cultured neighborhood with various shops and restaurants.   The room was facing a noisy street and a curtain was not long enough to block the street lights. If you a light sleeper, bring an eye mask and ear plugs. After dark you see homeless people sleeping next to closed shops, so one may feel uncomfortable walking streets at night, but I never felt threatened.  Overall, I recommend this affordable hotel with great staff, clean rooms and a convenient

Name is very appropriate!  With very friendly & accomodating staff esp. Cristiana, I don't mind staying there again given the opportunity.  As expected among European hotels, rooms are small depending on what you reserved but very clean.

It was a very nice hotel and very clean.  It was very near the metro station and about 30 minutes walking to the town center. The only dissavantage was that the room was a little bit small but if i visit lisbon again i would defenitely stay to the same hotel

This hotel has small but very clean rooms.  It is newly updated and has a wonderful staff.  It is on the "3rd and 4th Andars" (4th and 5th stories) of a building.  The entrance is odd and a bit hard to spot.  There are two SMALL elevators.  You may need to send luggage up in one and other people in the other.  The entrance is deceiving.  It gets WAY better once you arrive at reception on the 3rd Andar.  The price was good.  It was quiet, in spite of being on a busy street.  Yes, we would stay there again/

Had one night stay at the twin room,really great room with nice view . Rooms are of good size .very clean and nice service.just need some work done in kitchen as there was nothing in kitchen because of the covid situation

My Charm Lisbon Suites is a really charming hotel. Front staff is very friendly and helpful. My room was small but very charming, with great attention to details, modern bathroom and everything you need for a comfortable stay. Location is convenient, close to the Metro and a 30 min walk to a train station. It's located in a multi-cultured neighborhood with various shops and restaurants.   The room was facing a noisy street and a curtain was not long enough to block the street lights. If you a light sleeper, bring an eye mask and ear plugs. After dark you see homeless people sleeping next to closed shops, so one may feel uncomfortable walking streets at night, but I never felt threatened.  Overall, I recommend this affordable hotel with great staff, clean rooms and a convenient

Name is very appropriate!  With very friendly & accomodating staff esp. Cristiana, I don't mind staying there again given the opportunity.  As expected among European hotels, rooms are small depending on what you reserved but very clean.

It was a very nice hotel and very clean.  It was very near the metro station and about 30 minutes walking to the town center. The only dissavantage was that the room was a little bit small but if i visit lisbon again i would defenitely stay to the same hotel

This hotel has small but very clean rooms.  It is newly updated and has a wonderful staff.  It is on the "3rd and 4th Andars" (4th and 5th stories) of a building.  The entrance is odd and a bit hard to spot.  There are two SMALL elevators.  You may need to send luggage up in one and other people in the other.  The entrance is deceiving.  It gets WAY better once you arrive at reception on the 3rd Andar.  The price was good.  It was quiet, in spite of being on a busy street.  Yes, we would stay there again/

I would have liked to rate this property as Good but unfortunately it was not an option. It's located on a main road so easy to access but a little difficult to find as it is not advertised with a big sign.  It looks like an office building from the outside which you will walk by if you are not expecting it.  Nice ambience once inside.  The elevator is pretty small if you have a big party, stroller or lots of luggage.  The room was very modernly decorated but could only accommodate the bed which made it uncomfortable when we wanted to just have a quiet night in.  One chair to sit in would have been nice.  The bathroom (again very modern) didn't have one rail to hang a towel after a shower.   There were common areas to sit and eat (if you chose to do so) and amenities such as a

- clean hotel though the bathroom are shared.  - kitchen and laundry are available to use.  - close to metro stations, one is direct to the airport without change - walking to the city center  - the room faces the main road so the noise of cars are there

I was surprised with how it looked from the outside and then when we got Inside it was absolutely beautiful place the lady at the front desk was great Evan upgrade us for free will be  staying agian 😁

We stayed as a family for 7 nights at My Charm Lisbon Suite for a city break in Lisbon. We arrived very early, but the receptionists were kind and let us keep our luggage there while we did a bit of exploring. They spoke very good English.  The Hotel was located close to the 2 Metro stations, Anjos is about a 6 minute walk and is on the green line and Alameda is about a 10 minute walk and is on the Green/Red line. The area was residential and had homeless problem around the hotel, however mostly we were left alone when walking around in the area. There are many restaurants, cafes and bars in the area.  We booked a room (404) for 2 adults and 1 child and got 2 single beds and 1 foldable bed because we could not choose bed type, however, it was quite comfortable and we slept well.

I arrived late evening just for a night for sleep.  Next from the metro about 10mins walk. Located in the old Lisbon area. Lost of restaurants, coffee shop and supermarket just near by.  My room with additional sofa bed, very comfortable traveling with kids. There is balcony in my room with nice view to the old town.  Staffs are helpful even the receptionist actively assist housekeeping open and prepare my sofa bed for kids.

The hotel is on the 2nd floor and was a bit hard to find, but the warm staff at the counter and the cleanliness of the hotel was great.  The rooms are tiny, but it was a decent price and we only used the hotel for sleep.  The neighborhood is being renovated - not a place I'd walk at night, but that was the only drawback.

Charm Lisbon Suites was a great place to stay at in Lisbon. Our stay with my grandma was brief to see and enjoy the city much but the hotel was perfect. Location and finding it was easy. The taxi from the airport was cheap (around 5€) and all the staff were kind and helpful. I really liked the young lady (the Hospitality student pf about 22) who welcomed us (was it Daniela, it was a month ago and I forgot:(() The other ladies and gentlemen serving us were superb in their manners and levels of customer service. There’s nothing that was lacking or not done well. The room had a balcony which was good. Bathroom was fine. Beds comfortable. There were nice touches in the form of home baked cookies and juice which was a nice surprise. When I go back to Lisbon I’d stay at Charm Suites

I stayed here on a mini break with my partner and was impressed with the quality of the rooms for the price we paid. We did struggle to locate this place initially as it shares an entrance with some student accommodation amongst other things and isn’t particularly easy to spot.  The rooms are quite small but very modern and clean. The walls are quite thin though and we could hear EVERYTHING going on next door at 2am.. 😬 There isn’t much in terms of bars etc close by to the hotel but the metro link is just down the street so it is a handy spot to stay in.  The bed was extremely comfy and the AC was fantastic.

Three of us stayed there for one night in their triple room, which is really small for three people even by European standard. With the extra bed, we hardly had space to open our luggage and unpack. But the front desk staff was really kind and friendly, and they let us check-in early at 11am. Location is awesome: 5 minutes walk from metro station that takes you to old town.

Hotel staff friendly, rooms cleaned everyday and tidy. Has air conditioning and not that old so decorated very well. It is in a multi use building so be warned not just hotel. Which does not affect anything at all im just saying so you are aware. Has hairdryer all be it a slow one so i'd stick to your own. English tv and other english speaking channels along with other worldwide channels. No breakfast place when i went, set up for it just no licence but lovely cafe called pastelaria charrete down the road with friendly owner. Although not much speaking english they get what you want just about. They have kettle in room with teabags but no english tea. So we went to the shop 2 mins away and found some. There is no fridge so it will have to be black tea. Think fridge even if tiny

I visited with my friend for a couple of days to celebrate my birthday. On arrival we checked in quickly with a lovely receptionist and were taken to our rooms. We opted for twin beds and despite the room being originally made up as a double the staff quickly changed that for us the next day once the housekeeping staff were back in. The room was bigger than I expected with a balcony, tv and wardrobe (the shower was a little small) but as a clean base it was perfect. We used Uber to get into the main Barrio Alto area most days as it was so cheap - about €5! You could also walk in and it would take 30 mins or so.   Lovely hotel - would return and recommend.

I stayed here 2 nights, 3-4 minutes walk from the metro station Anjos (the nearest Arroio is closed), the area is quite and sure, i saw some homeless but any problem. The rooms are on the third floor of a condominium. They are super new! Super clean and perfumed. Very comfy bed, kind and helpfull staff. The have breakfast room but the don’t serve it yet, if you pay for it the give you a voucher to have breakfast in a bar. Keep going this way guys!!!! Congratulations

This was an awesome experience. The hotel is less than 15 min from the airport by car and can easily be accessed by the Metro. Very nice lobby and great customer service. Our rooms were ready on our arrival. Got wonderful and friendly customer care from Marianna. She gave us recommendations on things to eat, see and do. The rooms were beyond beautiful and impressive. The balcony view was amazing!

Eduardo C. I booked a room for 2 for April 19. Due to Covid the hotel closed. I have requested a refund to my credit card but to no avail. No voucher was also given. I have stayed at this hotel for the last 10 years. I went to the hotel personally, I was told they would not give me my money back or credit my account. I will never stay at this hotel anymore. What a rip-off.

I stayed at the lutecia for 4 nights, October thru 28 room 722. Bright white room with balcony and twin beds. Bathroom with tub and shower.  Mini fridge but no coffee maker. Sadly the reason given was not convincing and I wish I could have been able to enjoy a cup as advertised.  Welcome was super friendly and staff fluent in English French and Spanish. Ready to help, they deserve 5☆.  Breakfast  was good. Not varied but plenty of choice.  Best time is right at 7am when people are still in bed. The hotel should also consider offering self laundry.  I must say I had a good time. Really I highly recommend  that hotel to anyone wishing to have a great time.  Use of minibar is expensive.  €2.50 for  small bottle of water you can find for 29 cents a continente nearby.

We chose this Hotel because it was very near to the Airport and also due to the cheap price. The receptionist was very polite and disponible, they let us to leave the luggages before the chek in at 14. The structure was very clean,  the room was very big with a bed that i never seen one like that, a gigant bed. My experience was really good.  The restaurant it wasn't very good, i talk about the carbonara that i ordered. Please watch some videos on YT, but don't make a carbonara with cream, prosciutto and an egg uncoocked over the pasta, please.

Seems to be a high quality *** or **** hotel, e.g. rooms are comfortable, buffet breakfast is good, there are black out curtains, etc. However, there were 3 points on the negative side. 1: flat sinks in the bathroom do not make sense because if you spit on it, you have to manually direct the toothpaste and food (I have braces) to the edge of the flat part 2: signing up for the breakfast did not seem to be well managed and did not make sense 3: the staff who checked the registration at the breakfast was a redneck. My friend made a mistake when she spelled her room number out loud (she was very tired) and the staff made fun of her.

This was an awesome experience. The hotel is less than 15 min from the airport by car and can easily be accessed by the Metro. Very nice lobby and great customer service. Our rooms were ready on our arrival. Got wonderful and friendly customer care from Marianna. She gave us recommendations on things to eat, see and do. The rooms were beyond beautiful and impressive. The balcony view was amazing!

I have stayed at this hotel for the last 10 years. I went to the hotel personally, I was told they would not give me my money back or credit my account. I will never stay at this hotel anymore. What a rip-off.

I must say I had a good time. Really I highly recommend  that hotel to anyone wishing to have a great time.  Use of minibar is expensive.  €2.50 for  small bottle of water you can find for 29 cents a continente nearby.
