Seems to be a high quality *** or **** hotel, e.g. rooms are comfortable, buffet breakfast is good, there are black out curtains, etc. However, there were 3 points on the negative side. 1: flat sinks in the bathroom do not make sense because if you spit on it, you have to manually direct the toothpaste and food (I have braces) to the edge of the flat part 2: signing up for the breakfast did not seem to be well managed and did not make sense 3: the staff who checked the registration at the breakfast was a redneck. My friend made a mistake when she spelled her room number out loud (she was very tired) and the staff made fun of her.

A posh-looking hotel, a perfect walking-distance location from the Roma metro station, very friendly staff, great spacious rooms. But there had to be several mishaps from the start. Briefly: 1) We booked a room with  a double bed well in advance. After a check-in we are coming to our designated floor and...into a room with two separate beds. Went straight back to the reception to find out that they have run out of rooms with double beds (a pandemic honeymoon weekend in the hotel?). Not a good enough excuse for a booking made beforehand! However, they upgraded us to a double bed after a short conversation. 2) The room we were given was so spacious! Enough space to dance and do somersaults, in fact. But...the lighting was totally inadequate and (maybe because of the Covid) a total

On arrival Antonio the receptionist, immediatly makes you feel welcome, I am a travel agent and find this seldom on hotel reception. The hotel all over is nice cosy and very well decorated, good bar and very nice restaurant.The room was fantastic big, nicely decorated . Fantastic beds and lovely very luxery sheets a top place.

A clean and spacious room, 306. Facing the street and the train station but a decent sized balcony and not noisy at night at all, we slept fine. The pillows are massive, one wasn’t enough for me, two was too many. I did ask for a thinner pillow but they don’t have any options so I used one of the bedspreads folded and it worked fine. You get shower gel and shampoo, a shower cap and soap. The room had a coffee machine but the coffee pods are chargeable, I think they were €1.75. Very good coffee all over central Lisbon at €1, but if you’re desperate... Good breakfast, no complaints at all. Reception staff were pleasant. We didn’t use the hotel’s bar or room service as there are so many options locally. I recommend walking 8-10 mins to Pastelaria Mexicana for toasted sandwiches,

A good suprise, clean and spacious rooms, with confortable beds, everything was working. Nice breakfast and great location, even though its close to the train station you cant hear them much.  Only down is no private parking but there is a park nearby at 10€ a day.

We had interconnecting rooms so there was enough space for our large luggage. However, if we didn’t have this option it would have been a tight squeeze to get everything in! The service is standard, there doesn’t seem to be much to write home about. I thought a smart design hotel might have a wow factor to it, but it’s just another hotel for an overnight stay before you head to your next destination.

I stayed at this hotel during an overnight layover in Lisbon.  In light traffic it's 10 minutes from the airport, about a 10 Euro cab fare.  Checkin and checkout were quick and efficient.  WiFi is good.  Breakfast (included) included a fantastic spread and helpful service staff.

Just having come from an AirBNB in Porto, we were simply looking for a hotel with a triple room close to the airport. I had found this hotel online a few months earlier and booked it, not expecting much. This was such a pleasant surprise!  First of all, it's much nicer than we anticipated. Our triple room had a huge balcony overlooking the city and there was plenty of room to move about for three people. It was very clean and very modern. Secondly, the service was very good both at the front desk and bar. Finally, this is close enough to be able to walk to several shops and restaurants (might I recommend Hamburgeria 21 which is about 10 minutes away, it's cash only but wonderful hamburgers and well-priced drinks). The wifi worked very well once we knew how to use it (you have to

We were exhausted after Eurail brought us to Lisdon from Madrid--and rather than taking the bus to our friends' home in Setubal, we opted for a room in Lisbon and then commuting in the morning, Our friends found this room for us--and what true friends they are.  Spacious! Lots of white, a lounging area and a dining table, and it's a suite with separate enclosed bedroom. Lots of storage. Desk space. A bathroom to die for, complete with whirlpool tub.  Staying with friends is of course more fun and less costly, but I am quite glad we had a nifght here.

This place has all what I needed in a reasonably good price. The location was nice too and the room was very clean and - apparently - recently refurbished. Which made it look even better. I loved my stay in this hotel, and I really like the surrounding area. I would gladly stay again in it

Lovely modern hotel however breakfast was disappointing. My husband is coeliac. Staff offered no assistance as to which food he could access. He was given 2x gf buns however there was no tomato and no gf information regarding jam. When I asked for 2x boiled or poached eggs as we had been able to access in other hotels I was told no without paying extra. Since we were already providing his own milk this didn't seem fair. I attempted to discuss this with reception staff who said they would talk to management plus I emailed management but got no response. So if you are coeliac stay somewhere else as food allergies are not well catered for.

For what it offers, this place is overpriced. I must say that it is clean, comfortable and the staff is nice. But there are quite a few low points. The breakfast food choice is rather limited; you are given very few toiletries (in my case those were not replenished at all during my 5 day stay); and the minibar offer is dissapointing (you are not even given free tea/coffee). Keep also in mind that it is rather far from the centre, but very close to the airport. Good for business purposes, not the best for a cozy holiday!

I had an executive room on the top floor; maybe this is why I didn't experience any of the issues some reviewers mentioned, such as noise - it was quiet and there was a great sea view too.  Extremely comfy Queensize with many different pillows.  I had business in the area; location was therefore obviously great.  I didn't especially like the breakfast selection; the fact that the Nespresso machine wasn't free (never seen that before); the unhygienic wall-to-wall carpeting; that WiFi required to switch the TV on; and that there were hardly any plugs (ONE in the bed area; who doesn't need two?).  Excellent A/C. Not very smart, not very well designed, but altogether still very nice to come home to and relax.

Very good hotel 10 minutes' drive from Lisbon Airport. Ideal for overnight stays after a late landing in Lisbon. The hotel is clean, the rooms are cozy and the beds are comfortable, the reception staff are very kind and good breakfast.

Lutecia is right next to a train station. Maybe for some, it is an advantage, but it is noisy. The service in the dining room is good. The reception service is not professional - Poor English of many of the receptionist and lack of efficiency. Rooms are O.K and so are the bathrooms.

Not acceptable for business travellers. Full of tourists.   Cons Hotel is above a train stop, very loud, with loud sirens too. No WiFi in my room. Very noisy breakfast, and long lines for breakfast at peak times. Long lines at reception, which doubles as concierge, for check-in, check-out and asking questions. Not much space in lounge area to wait or to meet.  Pros Room was comfortable. You can sleep if you close the windows and put A/C on. Decent shower. Good location in terms of being central and close to some restaurants. Mini bar exists and works.  Overall Probably good value for tourists but bad value for business.

Spent three nights at the Lutecia hotel and was very impressed with the spacious room and bathroom. Both were very clean and serviced daily. The reception staff were efficient and polite. The breakfast selection was excellent. The hotel is situated near the Roma metro staying with a direct line to Rossio in the heart of the city centre. Can highly recommend this hotel.

It’s a convenient hotel. Fair location, clean room, reasonable staff, decent breakfast. It has public parking in front of the hotel (I think it is payed during weekdays but not shure). One of those nice hotels for a quick business meeting.

Located next to tube station which is good, for the price it was a decent hotel. Couple of things for me which stop it being a 4 star such as the comfort of the bed, you end up waking up everyday with ear pain because of the pillows. Likewise there is an expectation it seems from the cleaning staff there that you will leave the hotel room at 9am as they will relentlessly knock on your door for housekeeping early in the morning which is quite annoying especially if you are one (like myself) who likes to sleep a bit on holidays. The staff downstairs can be awesome, but the second they get busy with one customer they will leave you there waiting(for at least 20 minutes) which was also a bit disappointing.  Nevertheless they do try to help, and people like Beatriz and the guy were

We were there in March 2019 and I can tell you it is a pretty good hotel, mid size but comfortable and centric, excellent breakfast, clean rooms, a lot of places to eat close to there, and no far from the Metro station.

Situated in the business area  of lisbon! Comfy rooms with a beautiful decoration, very helpfull staff and rich breakfast.   Metros, bus and trains are only  five mintues walking from the hotel!  Few restaurants and bars too

Stayed here 1 night while i was in transit to other country this is a nice clean hostel staff and residents at the time were polite. It is local to most things in lisbon and a 15 min drive from the airport. Will recommend this hostel to travellers

Stayed here 1 night while i was in transit to other country this is a nice clean hostel staff and residents at the time were polite. It is local to most things in lisbon and a 15 min drive from the airport.

Due to covid I decided to book a private room. Room itself was ok, but was located on the 3rd floor (6 stairs up) and no easy way to get my suitcase up. Quite a lot of noise, especially from the students living there and the traffic.  Especially during the situation that we're in, I expected bathroom facilities to be up to standard. Unfortunately there was no toilet paper, no soap and no paper towels on my floor. Water tap was loose and the button to flush to toilet was not there. I also got told that there wasn't any breakfast (but only after enquiring myself).  Room was very bare; no trash can, no night light. Bed was ok. Location of the hostel was ok. Receptionist was kind.

We had a paid reservation 2 persons, 2 night. We could not come due to corona situation. For over a week we spoke with them and we could not solve or find any solution. Considering the world world situation and the situation from both our countries, I am sure we could have found a solution. But nothing. Very inflexible. We had a week of vacation in Portugal. 4 places. This is the only one we could not reason with Shame. I consider it a theft.

I absolutely loved staying at this hostel! The receptionists were lovely and super friendly, the breakfast and the event dinners were delicious, and everything was super clean. I met a lot of other travellers thanks to the event dinners and we all ended up going out and had a great time. My room was so cosy and the bathrooms always clean.  I will definitely come back here next time I visit Lisbon

Stayed here 1 night while i was in transit to other country this is a nice clean hostel staff and residents at the time were polite. It is local to most things in lisbon and a 15 min drive from the airport. Will recommend this hostel to travellers

Stayed here 1 night while i was in transit to other country this is a nice clean hostel staff and residents at the time were polite. It is local to most things in lisbon and a 15 min drive from the airport.

Receptionist was kind.

Considering the world world situation and the situation from both our countries, I am sure we could have found a solution. But nothing. Very inflexible. We had a week of vacation in Portugal. 4 places. This is the only one we could not reason with Shame. I consider it a theft.

I absolutely loved staying at this hostel! The receptionists were lovely and super friendly, the breakfast and the event dinners were delicious, and everything was super clean. I met a lot of other travellers thanks to the event dinners and we all ended up going out and had a great time. My room was so cosy and the bathrooms always clean.  I will definitely come back here next time I visit Lisbon

I reached the hostel at night at 12.30. The receptionist was waiting for me even though reception closes midnight. Staffs are kind enough to help. neat and clean place. I paid around Rs. 8000 for 5 nights. worth for it. The only issue is shared rooms are small with 6 cots.

I am probably one of their most frequent guests! I love Livin' Lisbon and refer it to all of my fellow digital nomads and travelers to Lisbon. The location is fantastic! Located right next to Avenida Liberdade, one of the most exclusive Avenues in Lisbon, it features quick access to the Metro, Russio Square, fantastic shopping, great restaurants and just about anything you would want. You can walk the tree-lined, beautifully tiled sidewalks of the Avenida by day and night or visit the lively Bairro Alto with its bohemian feel and vibrant nightlife.  i  The best thing about Livin' Lisbon is their staff! Always friendly, welcoming, helpful and accommodating, they are professional and warm. This is important for travelers like me who spend their life on the road. Management is most

We slept 3 nights in this place. Overall the place is nice and well located and people are very welcoming. But that’s all!  I slept in the worst mattress of my life! As hard as wood! And the pillows are the same! Not fluffy at all.  Our room was at the 4st level, but they keep the doors of the corridor open so you can hear the street and people coming in and out of the building. The building is old and there is no A/C, so very uncomfortable in the hot days.  To summarize, I was not able to sleep during those 3 days! I don’t not recommend

I had my best hostel experience at Liv'in! The rooms are so clean and neat, the breakfast is delicious and the staff (especially Jonathan!) is always friendly and helpful. Its perfect if you want to be on your own or if you want to meet people - both is possible. I'd go back anytime and recommend it to any kind of traveller. Thank you Liv'in Lisbon :)

We loved this place! Breakfast was included and it was the best Hostel breakfast we have had so far! You get fresh pan cackes, bread, cheese, ham, teas, coffee, juice, jam, nutella, greek jogurt with granola and more!!! The place is very clean and renovated. Bed linen was clean and the bed was huge!  It is a bit if walk to the historical center, but city is beautiful, enjoy it 😉

Spent 6 nights hear and found it very clean. Great decor. Staff very pleasant.  Could do with some hooks on the wall to hang coats. One thing wrong lots of stairs.  Not good for people with disabilities.

First od all, I was badly informed about my transfer to airport. I was told in the reception, that whole price for the car from the hostel to the airport is 15 euros. I paied that price on the spot, but when i got to the airport, the driver told me to pay another 15 euro. I wrote an email to the hostel, because i wanted to explain the situation. Nobody answered.  The hostel looks better on pictures than im reality. Anyway it's quite clean. Breakfasts are ok. What's was strange - you cant cook on the kithen where breakfasts are served. It's only for stuff.   It was very cold in that building, but the worse was the noise. You could hear every talks from every rooms and even floors under.

It was a horrible night. Besides the noise until dawn a person who was not in the room came to have sex. Despite the signs and requests, this has been extended for a long time. I feared for the safety of my belongings and mine. The hotel has no control of who enters and leaves the rooms! The next morning, I explained and left because there was no condition of staying. Even changing rooms as the hostel could guarantee security if they have no controls?

Location is really great, metro, busses around and actually you can reach a city centre on foot in 10-15 min. Staff members are friendly and helpful. However, a bit dissapointing was cleaning of the room. When you want new towels or a bed to be change, you need to ask at the reception for it, no prob. But, as we stayed for a one week and nobody even once took garbage from the room, I’m not sure about this policy. It was around 30 degrees everyday and garbage started to smell bas very soon. So everytime we wanted garbage to be taken, we needed to put it outside the room, otherwise, nobody checks.  Another thing - we had room for two persons. The view from a window was a wall. We saw other double room - the view was really nice. Not sure if the price is different, but the pic

Great location, near Liberdade Avenue and Principe Eduardo VII Park and underground, that zone has lot of restaurants and shops, the hostel has a good vibe, excellent staff and breakfast. I stayed 4days and loved everything ;)

Are you searching for a decent cozy place, near the transports&main places to visit? 🏛 A place with a warm&friendly host, nice new people to stay with? ☀️ Or even a quiet light room, where you can reboot your positive energy while visiting the beautiful Lisbon? 🇵🇹🌴 Then you should definitely come to Liv’in Lisbon! 😃✨

This hostel is a perfect fit for your travel. The personel is very welcoming and helping. I arrive at 9 am and my room was only available at 3 pm. They stored my lugguage and offered me the breakfast. I really appreciated it.   It is all renovated and very clean so don’t pay attention to pictures of other travellers showing a broken interior.   It is not noisy which is nice while travelling in hostels. All sanitary and the kitchen are shared, but remain very clean so no problem.  Be careful, there is no air conditionning so when it id hot like today (41 degres) it tends to be very hot! There are ventilators!   The breakfast is included and is pretty good and modern! Yoghurt bowls with muesli and fruits, toasts, pancakes, hot and cold beverages. Everything is nicely presented.

As title suggests elderly man with mental health issues living out of hostel with dozens of bags strewn across room. Staff aware of 'weird guy everyone complaining about', although ambivalent. He urinated Into the sink in the bathroom, with door open. Otherwise lovely hostel though. Modern and funky with friendly staff.

Generally a good experience, primarily due to the central location and access to metro system.  The hostel is situated off of a quiet retail street amid offices and some other hotels/hostels.  Night time noise can be an issue if windows are open and cigarette smoke from the street can enter into the rooms.  The breakfast was OK - european-style with cheese, meats, toast/jam.  The pancakes were also good.  The rooms are not air conditioned and if you are fortunate you can receive a fan (thus open windows).  The website advertises laundry though I discovered that laundry facilities are not offered on site.  The rooms do not have any TV.  On the whole, the building was clean, staff were welcoming and the experience was average.

Me and my girlfriend were visiting Lisbon and stayed at Liv’in which was a great experience. Super nice staff and organized well as the private room are separated from the dorms, making it a better environment for couples.  The rooms are a little noisy, but the facilities are great and rooms are clean and nice.  The breakfast is also to recommend!

Functional affordable base for Pombal & Avenida, on three levels. Dorms kinda cramped. Splashed out on the third floor king bed for an occasion, and that was very comfortable. Staff pleasant enough. Don't come in winter & expect to get your stuff washed & dried in a hurry.

I stayed for one nigth. It is a nice and friendly hostel. It is located in a busy area, so it is very lively. But somehow it didn't disturb and it turned out to be a lovely place to take some rest after travelling.Beds are comfy and hostel is very clean. Enjoy if you decide to stay there.

Positive: location. Nice kitchen where they serve breakfast. Personal very friendly and   helpful. Negative: only 2 toilets per floor. Of the 2 showers one was missing the shower hose! !! One of the showers needs painting, very humid, and had nothing to hang your clothes or leave your stuff. Our 4 beds room was next to the kitchen on the 2nd floor, which was the only place to meet others, therefore very loud, in addition our windows were facing the kitchen...were some smoked, and we could not close them properly. From the four sockets in the room only 2 working. The famous "pancakes" of breakfast were like rubber...

Horrible experience. My wife and I got a double room. When we got to the hostel it was full of construction materials at the entrance. Then at reception they said nothing and gave us a room at the 4th floor. Once we were there, we realized they were renovating the place and people working at the time (Saturday 8pm - noisy). The place wasn't closed due to works and therefore a cold air stream. We asked the receptionist for extra blankets or a heater and she never came back to us, but when we saw her she said they were full and no extra blankets nor heaters. Important to mention that the room was just painted and it had a strong smell. That same night at 4am we woke up after hearing doors hitting due to wind. I had to get up and fix it however I could, using toilet paper to avoid

This hostel/hotel hybrid is very pretty and clean. It's not in the centre but you can walk there within 15 minutes. The staff is friendly and the free breakfast is great. My room was really unique and an incredible value since it was a private. However it was very cold in the room, and I was next to the staircase so it was pretty noisy. Also it's not a very social place. There isn't a good place to hang out and meet people which takes away from the atmosphere a bit. But if you are looking for a comfortable and more relaxing pace to stay, this is your place.

Just wow.  The apartment was so beautifully designed-- solid hardwood floors, original tiling, a gorgeous color palate and comfortable, modern furnishings that soaked up the  natural light that filled the space. I loved it so much that I struggled to leave my apartment to explore Lisbon!  It's one block away from the main square, in the center of the city, surrounded by local culture. At night I opened up my balcony doors, sipped on tea they provided and listened to night life unfolding around me. The staff were warm and hospitable, they even called me Internationally the day before to make sure I received checkin information and was ready for my stay. They were thorough, gracious, and gave me space to enjoy my stay in this stunning, one of a kind space. I can't recommend

This is a modern, stylish and comfortable establishment in a perfect location for sightseeing, shopping and dining. The staff were extremely helpful and the room spacious, clean and very well equipped

Really cute hotel that has a nice boutique vibe, it's in a great location, central to Chiado & Bairro Alto. The staff was very friendly to me in assisting my check in process. I did get a little nervous with understanding the check-in process, but it all worked out - you end up having a code to enter the main lobby, and then a different code for your room. So it feels nice and secure when you're settled in.   The design of the rooms were spacious and even have a little kitchenette. Would definitely stay again.

The room was so hot! I wouldn’t call this hotel boutique I have been to 27 countries and stayed all over the world and have stayed in hostels in Denmark and Australia that I would say are comparable.  The AC does not work and they charged an extra 20$ for a towel because I wiped off my makeup on it.  The girls working we’re helpful but other than that I wouldn’t say much else was good.  The beds were not comfortable and the water pressure wasn’t great.

I stayed in Boutique Chiado as a solo tourist just as Lisbon was on the verge of reopening post-pandemic shutdowns. Portugal had just opened its borders to non-essential travel. The location is really great, just a few blocks from Baixa-Chiodo metro, which was helpful when I arrived too late for the airport bus to still be running. I was able to take the metro easily with my one rolling bag, though I was kind of disoriented due to a day of travel. Hotel reception went out of its way to call me and email me with instructions for late arrival.   In addition to being near the metro, the famous #28 tram is only about a block away. The Bica funicular is also a block away and a fun way to go down to the TimeOut Market or to Comoda for breakfast. Fabrica coffee shop is nearby, just a

I loved it so much that I struggled to leave my apartment to explore Lisbon!  It's one block away from the main square, in the center of the city, surrounded by local culture. They were thorough, gracious, and gave me space to enjoy my stay in this stunning, one of a kind space. I can't recommend

This is a modern, stylish and comfortable establishment in a perfect location for sightseeing, shopping and dining. The staff were extremely helpful and the room spacious, clean and very well equipped

Really cute hotel that has a nice boutique vibe, it's in a great location, central to Chiado & Bairro Alto. The staff was very friendly to me in assisting my check in process. I did get a little nervous with understanding the check-in process, but it all worked out - you end up having a code to enter the main lobby, and then a different code for your room. So it feels nice and secure when you're settled in.   The design of the rooms were spacious and even have a little kitchenette. Would definitely stay again.

The room was so hot! I wouldn’t call this hotel boutique I have been to 27 countries and stayed all over the world and have stayed in hostels in Denmark and Australia that I would say are comparable.  The AC does not work and they charged an extra 20$ for a towel because I wiped off my makeup on it.  The girls working we’re helpful but other than that I wouldn’t say much else was good.  The beds were not comfortable and the water pressure wasn’t great.

The location is really great, just a few blocks from Baixa-Chiodo metro, which was helpful when I arrived too late for the airport bus to still be running. I was able to take the metro easily with my one rolling bag, though I was kind of disoriented due to a day of travel. Hotel reception went out of its way to call me and email me with instructions for late arrival.   In addition to being near the metro, the famous #28 tram is only about a block away. The Bica funicular is also a block away and a fun way to go down to the TimeOut Market or to Comoda for breakfast. Fabrica coffee shop is nearby, just a

This hotel is fantastic! The service is unbeatable. They have cleaned our rooms daily without being asked and even did the dishes for me! This room is so cozy and we have an amazing view! The hotel is also walking distance from everything you need in Lisbon. Amazing

We spent a week at Boutique Chiado Suites and we only have good things to say about our experience. The rooms are large enough, are neat and are in tiptop shape. The design of the suites is well thought of and the kitchenette is well equipped with plates and utensils you may need during your stay. Housekeeping does a great job cleaning, and staying at this hotel during Covid was no issue at all (all measures are taken and everything was spick and span). Deborah (Debbie) at the reception is amazing; She is always making sure that all our needs are met (be it extra towels or advice on where to eat or where to go). Debbie goes above and beyond to make sure you have answers to all your questions, queries or concerns (and always with a smile, that can be sensed even with a mask on

Amazing quality for the price of this boutique hotel. Located in the heart of Chiado but in a quiet street, the hotel seems to be quite new. We stayed in the Deluxe room which was really spacious and bright. Staff was very helpful and answered to all our demands.

What can I say, everything was perfect! The room, maintenance and care. Water and coffee were replenished every day. Neat location, close to public transport and shops. Reception staff very friendly. We were perfectly advised by Rachel, thanks for that!

We really enjoyed our stay here and would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Lisbon.  The location is amazing - a short walk or Uber ride to everything, and on a quiet street.  The room was very clean and we loved that it included a Nespresso maker.  This isn't a traditional hotel, but a small boutique property.  There is typically one person at the front desk who may or not be there when you check in/check out, and the door is locked at night and you are provided a code to enter.  One other good thing of note - they have a million TV channels in English, when you are looking to relax and just watch something on TV.

I stayed in this boutique hotel for several days. The room was so nice and clean. I love the design. And the location is perfect,    near everything and lots of fun around. The people are so helpful and friendly. I would stay there again when I come back. Highly recommended!!!

In the top of one of the many hills in Lisbon this place is quiet and beautiful. But don’t make you wrong. Chiado with iconic places to visit shops restaurants and all the movement of barrio alto is only few blocks away. Good cafe some water or tea and two very good pastries for breakfast only one block far. Remember to use Uber or taxi to arrive. You don’t want to climb with a hug luggage.

The bedrooms are very well decorated with confortable beds and modern bathrooms.  An adjacent small room has a kitchen, desk and large TV screen . The rooms are very quiet and the location super central . Many top restaurants and boutiques are within walking distance.

Stayed here for 3 night stay in Lisbon, chose location with proximity to interesting restaurants and decent spring board for seeing the city - did not disappoint.  Most everything handled via email and using codes, minimal staff interaction which was fine.  room was smallish but worked out, clean, ok courtyard view, bright, comfy bed.  recommendation on breakfast spot from lady who checked our passports was spot on.

This little suite hotel is located in a quiet street just of the bustling Praca Luis de Camoes. Easy access to everywhere by foot or public transport. Take a day card for 6€ and you can take metro, trams, buses and the elevator trams.  The building only opened in August 2018 and everything is brand new. The building has been renovated with style in a good mix of the original architecture (wooden stairs and floors) and modern, amenities. Good size rooms, great bed and lovely rain shower.  The staff was also very helpful and friendly. Use the recommendations for bars and restaurants the hotel sends you with your reservation. We had some fantastic experiences.  Enjoy Lisbon!

We spent 3 great days in Boutique Chiado, a very elegant and cosy place in a perfect location. With many details that make you feel at  home... and a kitchenette. No better place in Lisbon! We will come back!

Beautifully renovated small hotel in the heart of Chiado-steps away from the main square, subway stop, Barrio Alta.  My husband and I stayed in room 203 which was very quiet, spacious, modernized queen room. The, large well equipped bathroom with rain shower and toiletries was very nice, included towel warming rack.  The room also included a minifridge, kettle, espresso machine with pods and dish set for two people as well as a bistro set-with a mini preco (small grocery)around the corner you could easily have breakfast in your room.  The staff was wonderful-very helpful and offered to arrange dinner reservations and general travel tips.  Staff was on site between 8am and 8pm with entry in off hours with door codes.  The guest rooms are also entered by code-I love not having to

Very pleased with our decision to stay here. The staff can’t do enough to help, the rooms are beautifully clean and decorated - each room has a small fridge and kettle and Nespresso machine. The location is perfect - walk to most main attractions and the area itself is very vibrant. There’s no bar or restaurant in the hotel but there are so many nearby it’s not an issue at all. For breakfast/brunch go to Dear Breakfast which is a 5 min walk. Highly recommend this accommodation to you

This is the cleanest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in. The room is flooded with natural light and includes a living room with a big tv and a small kitchen with refrigerator, microwave and sink as well as cabinets stocked with utensils and dishes.  The location is ideal. Love Chiado with its hills and pink streets and waterfront location with tons of bars, restaurants and cafes.  The hotel has a wonderful shower that didn’t soak the floor (even though it only has half a door) and wonderful organic shower gels.  The decor is a beautiful mix of sleek modern lines and antique touches — chandeliers and old-world wallpaper.   The best part — thé helpful staff who went out of their way to help me when I was so sick. I am so grateful.  Wonderful, wonderful place.

This was an oasis off calm in the busy city. The taxi can drive to the hotel and it’s only a short walk away from the city centre although the walk does also involve steps and steep gradients which if it does rain which thankfully isn’t very often the roads and steps become lethal being very slippery and uneven so you do have to be goat like..    The hotel is excellent in every way everything you need to enjoy your stay . A pool outside and we had a room with a jacuzzi number 1 which was a treat and had a fantastic view over the city. The room was very spacious with a large king bed ,spotlessly clean,large bathroom with walk in shower and even a mini kitchen area. The large windows opened onto the balcony which had again plenty off space for sunbathing and very private.    The

Ideal location to base a visit exploring Lisbon Fantastic rooms, some with incredible views. Rooms were quiet at night, warm (visiting during November), and had excellent bathrooms (with bidet). An excellent breakfast each morning (meat, cheese, croissant, juice, rolls, and sweets). Incredibly helpful staff

We spent 2 nights at the beautiful Casa Balthazar.  This beautiful complex of buildings is well located in Chiado, up the hill from the train station.  Our room was bright a beautifully appointed, there were many common spaces to lounge including poolside (had it not been raining). Our hostess was gracious, welcoming and accommodating. We will stay here again when we visit Lisbon.  Thank you so much!

Casa Balthazar is a must if you are visiting Lisbon. Hidden down a narrow street in the old town behind a large door are beautifully designed comfortable suites. We took the apartment which was elegant, comfortable and had the most heavenly  sofa for us to admire the city view. I could have spent the entire trip on the sofa looking out the window.  Service was excellent. Smiley Juren was very helpful when my teens wanted to move their beds around and the breakfast was lovely.  I would highly recommend

Everyone was so friendly and helpful when we stayed at Casa Balthazar for our honeymoon. It's a great location to walk around Lisbon or to hop on a train to Sintra or other outskirts of Lisbon. Wonderful breakfast and amenities. Would love to stay here again!

This was an oasis off calm in the busy city. The taxi can drive to the hotel and it’s only a short walk away from the city centre although the walk does also involve steps and steep gradients which if it does rain which thankfully isn’t very often the roads and steps become lethal being very slippery and uneven so you do have to be goat like..    The hotel is excellent in every way everything you need to enjoy your stay . A pool outside and we had a room with a jacuzzi number 1 which was a treat and had a fantastic view over the city. The room was very spacious with a large king bed ,spotlessly clean,large bathroom with walk in shower and even a mini kitchen area. The large windows opened onto the balcony which had again plenty off space for sunbathing and very private.    The

An excellent breakfast each morning (meat, cheese, croissant, juice, rolls, and sweets). Incredibly helpful staff

We spent 2 nights at the beautiful Casa Balthazar.  This beautiful complex of buildings is well located in Chiado, up the hill from the train station.  Our room was bright a beautifully appointed, there were many common spaces to lounge including poolside (had it not been raining). Our hostess was gracious, welcoming and accommodating. We will stay here again when we visit Lisbon.  Thank you so much!

We took the apartment which was elegant, comfortable and had the most heavenly  sofa for us to admire the city view. I could have spent the entire trip on the sofa looking out the window.  Service was excellent. Smiley Juren was very helpful when my teens wanted to move their beds around and the breakfast was lovely.  I would highly recommend

Everyone was so friendly and helpful when we stayed at Casa Balthazar for our honeymoon. It's a great location to walk around Lisbon or to hop on a train to Sintra or other outskirts of Lisbon. Wonderful breakfast and amenities. Would love to stay here again!

When I arrived at this charming hotel, I was greeted with such warmth as I had been communicating with Erica before and felt like old friends.  The owner has such exquisite taste and has renovated, yet kept the charm of this 1882 building. My room was spacious and  it was newly renovated with a gorgeous view and large bathroom,  The A/C wasnt working and it was a hot day , so they graciously moved me to a jacuzzi room, for the night.    The grounds are gorgeous, the location perfect and those breakfasts......the best I have ever had and they were delivered every morning. Thank you to Erica and Ana and the entire staff for making my stay so special  They couldnt do enough for me and I am definitely coming back and highly recommending to friends.   Love from Toronto....Shelley

Casa Balthazar is centrally located and within short walking distance to the main pedestrian areas in Lisbon.  Our room was on the second floor and had a view of the courtyard with a common pool.  Breakfast is brought to your room in the morning - or you can request to eat in one of the common areas.  The croissants were fresh and tasty.  In the evenings, the area was quiet and we used the a/c used in the late afternoon.  The room was well appointed with a kitchenette supplied with basic necessities for meals or snacks in the room.  A microwave was there, but we didn't have a need for it.  The refrigerator had ample room for our own snack items and a bottle or two.  The bathroom was large and accommodating.  Our bath towels were worn in a few spots and should have been retired.

My wife and I just stayed here in October, 2021.  Every single thing about this hotel is fantastic!  We had a Jacuzzi Terrace room, and it was awesome to have a patio with beautiful view to enjoy breakfast and other light meals.  We also stayed one night in the Antique room before we flew home, and it was very spacious and pretty with a view of the pool & courtyard.    The staff was super helpful with recommendations and a couple of dinner reservations for us.  Excellent common spaces as well.  Location was also perfect.  Seemingly right at the "corner" of the Chido, Barrio Alto and Baixa.  Adjacent to the Rossio train station, and a few blocks to the Baixa-Chiado Green/Blue line Metro.  The only caution would be if you had limited mobility, there's no "flat" way to get to the

Fabulous room, breakfast, location, service… we loved everything about it :) Our room looked over the castle and with a large bathroom and kitchenette/space for cupboards, and amazing breakfasts delivered we felt very treated. The tiled floors would have been cooling in the summer and despite its central location the double glazing meant it was beautifully quiet.

This was a peaceful boutique hotel in the middle of Lisbon. It was beautifully appointed with lovely artwork and design. It had a sophisticated country feel but was smack in the middle of the very cool Chiado district. We got a jacuzzi terrace room which was amazing because of the view. The jacuzzi did take over 10 hours to warm up to 40 degrees celsius though so we weren't able to really enjoy it until the morning of our departure unfortunately since we only stayed for 1 night.

Nice rooms- some with amazing views. The lobby and lounge areas are cozy. The pool was comfortable and quiet. Great location close to everything. The hotel staff was vey accommodating. Next trip to Lisbon we will stay here again.

We had an AMAZING stay at Casa Balthazar! We kicked off our honeymoon in Lisbon, and they had a bottle of sparkling wine waiting in the room, which was so nice. It is a must to stay in one of the jacuzzi rooms. Sitting in a jacuzzi overlooking the rooftops of Lisbon was phenomenal. We never wanted to leave the hotel! The location was great-walkable to everything and yet also tucked away. Would highly recommend!

We had booked 2 rooms for a total of 5 nights. We loved everything about this hotel. It is hidden behind a tall wall and gate ensuring the privacy of its guests. All the rooms and public areas are tastefully furnished and there is interesting and quirky artwork throughout the property. The hosts couldn’t have been nicer and made us feel welcome throughout the stay. Due to COVID breakfast was delivered to the room on a tray with a nice selection of fruits, ham and cheese, a selection of rolls and pastries. And because the hotel used to be a historical pastry factory, there are always some delicious pastries delivered with the breakfast. The level of cleanliness throughout the property was kept to the highest standard and we felt totally safe during our stay. Definitely a place we

The hotel is very charming and perfectly situated to walk most everywhere. I spent 4 nights here with my grown daughter and even though the room was small, it worked out fine since we had a lovely terrace with a hot tub and great views of Lisbon. The staff were all very nice and helpful. You feel like you're staying at a friend's home here. The decor is lovely and the beds are very comfortable, although the walls are a little thin and I could easily hear my neighbors—luckily they weren't loud.

The other guests who we spoke to at this hotel all agreed - this is a little oasis in the heart of Lisbon. Though literally steps from several busy restaurants (all with outdoor seating), inside the walls of Casa Balthazar there is a calm and peaceful atmosphere. Our room, the Duplex, was huge, with its own rooftop terrace that gave a wonderful view over the hills of Lisbon. But we spent a part of each day sitting next to the pool, enjoying the garden and a glass of beer from the honor bar. All the staff were so kind and helpful with information on where to eat and what to do. It was such a nice relaxing start to our Portugal trip!

Wow, what a hotel. The room we stayed in - the panoramic terrace - was absolutely incredible. Amazing views over the city and just a beautiful and relaxing spot. The whole hotel is beautifully appointed, room was comfortable and with excellent blackout curtains, and the breakfast was exceptional. The onsite secure parking lot was a huge plus as well.

I went with my partner and another couple also stayed in a different room. The staff were invisible but also on-hand as soon as you needed them, everything was immaculate and pristine and we loved the style of the hotel. Both us and our friends had big, well thought out rooms with superb facilities and the attention to detail was second to none. It was peaceful with stunning views and we enjoyed having breakfast delivered to our room.

Beautiful hotel and friendly staff. Decorated nicely, and the breakfast is good. We enjoyed our stay here - it is a very romantic oasis in the middle of the city. Location is good. Not great for a business traveler, though - no desk or table to work from - but good for a romantic trip or traveling with family.

This is a gorgeous small hotel in a quiet cul-de-sac in Lisbon's old quarter. The suite we stayed inn had a lovely balcony facing south with a panoramic view of the city, all the way to the castle. It's quiet, the service is excellent, the suite was tastefully decorated and in impeccable condition. The courtyard with its small pool is charming and so is the living room with doors opening to it. Highly recommend this hotel.

Service , stuff, location and facilities were just perfect! We had  a great time there and I hope I will be back soon! I love the interior of this place and room service! Breakfast was delicious! Thank you for everything! Wiktoria & Aramis

My partner and I stayed for four nights in October. The hotel's location is excellent. Close to useful public transport options as well as excellent bars and hotels. Despite the proximity to these, once inside all was an oasis of calm and peace.   We had the Duplex Terrace which is located just inside the main entrance and so feels like you're in a private home. There are lots of stairs to this accommodation, not much of an inconvenience but could be a challenge to people with lots of luggage, etc.   The first floor comprised the living / kitchen / dining area. This was simply furnished and very comfortable. The Nespresso coffee machine was well used! The fridge contained a few (chargabel) drinks options but left lots of space for any items we wanted to store. There were plenty

We were in the Panoramic Room with an incredible view of Lisbon and it’s castle. Staff were highly attentive, room was very clean, breakfast was delicious and the pool quiet and warm! Also in a great location. Will most definitely return.

In January, we booked a 4-night stay (end of May to beginning of June) and transferred the required 50% deposit. Their cancellation policy was full refund up to 72 hours before check-in time. On March 18 we cancelled our reservation because of the pandemic. We received acknowledgement of our cancellation and assurance that the full refund would be sent. Our follow-up requests were sent weekly. Each time we were told the refund was being processed and we would receive it in a few days. Our final request on April 17 was ignored. It is now April 24 and we have given up hope of any refund. This hotel is not trustworthy.

Casa Balthazar was incredible, a lovely retreat in the heart of busy and hilly Lisbon. It really would be great for a honeymoon, but I went with my best friend and we LOVED it still! We stayed in Terrace Castle 2 and it was lovely. Beautiful city/castle views, and the balcony seating and hot tub is just incredible. The hotel staff is so accommodating and happy to help all the time. The breakfast is DELICIOUS and we looked forward to it every day. I highly recommend staying here!

We were in the cottage suite, very well equipped but without the views of the more expensive suites. The suite was clean and very well equipped. The house keeping were great  the continental breakfast was lovely. The location was right in the middle of all the attractions.

This was our first visit to Portugal, during the pandemic. We were treated with incredible respect and surrounded by a staff that was wonderful. As a gay couple, we felt welcomed by an intelligent, enthusiastic and entertaining staff!!! The concierge Francisca helped get us excellent dinner reservations at popular restaurants. Maria Inez, in the restaurant, taught us about Portuguese wines and helped us enjoy a fantastic dinner in the beautiful restaurant, and the walking your arranged with Manuel was fun and very informative! The room was beautiful, the service outstanding and the location exceptional for both views and central location. We will return!

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Memmo Principle Real.  The staff was extremely accommodating and positive. The complimentary breakfast was fabulous, and healthy - fresh cheeses breads and juices, delicious coffee, and a selection from the full menu (not solely access to the buffet). The design was beautiful, the environment relaxing and the room extremely comfortable and quiet. We actually overslept on our last night because the room was so dark, comfortable and silent.  We’ll definitely stay here again, and will highly recommend it to others.

Top level staff, delicious food/drink, beautiful design throughout the property, and a very comfortable room. The hotel is located in the perfect spot for access to great shopping, restaurants, and attractions. Our stay at Memmo Principe Real was incredible and we will stay here again when we return to Lisbon.

We love Bairo Alto, we love Lisbon and the nice Boutique Hotel Memmo Principe Real. Nice, functional rooms, friendly staff, nice breakfast. WIFI working perfectly. Was our third stay and we are looking forward to come back soon.

The location was perfect...central to the primary sites in Lisbon...but also in a great neighborhood for dining, shopping, parks and views...easy to walk! Additionally, the hotel staff was outstanding...they were very attentive to our needs and helped us solve every "travel challenge" we encountered...most accommodating!

This was our first visit to Portugal, during the pandemic. We were treated with incredible respect and surrounded by a staff that was wonderful. As a gay couple, we felt welcomed by an intelligent, enthusiastic and entertaining staff!!! The concierge Francisca helped get us excellent dinner reservations at popular restaurants. Maria Inez, in the restaurant, taught us about Portuguese wines and helped us enjoy a fantastic dinner in the beautiful restaurant, and the walking your arranged with Manuel was fun and very informative! The room was beautiful, the service outstanding and the location exceptional for both views and central location. We will return!

The design was beautiful, the environment relaxing and the room extremely comfortable and quiet. We actually overslept on our last night because the room was so dark, comfortable and silent.  We’ll definitely stay here again, and will highly recommend it to others.

Top level staff, delicious food/drink, beautiful design throughout the property, and a very comfortable room. The hotel is located in the perfect spot for access to great shopping, restaurants, and attractions. Our stay at Memmo Principe Real was incredible and we will stay here again when we return to Lisbon.

We love Bairo Alto, we love Lisbon and the nice Boutique Hotel Memmo Principe Real. Nice, functional rooms, friendly staff, nice breakfast. WIFI working perfectly. Was our third stay and we are looking forward to come back soon.

The location was perfect...central to the primary sites in Lisbon...but also in a great neighborhood for dining, shopping, parks and views...easy to walk! Additionally, the hotel staff was outstanding...they were very attentive to our needs and helped us solve every "travel challenge" we encountered...most accommodating!

This gem of a hotel is nestled in the hillside of a beautiful part of Lisbon. Truly a unique property with beautiful views of Lisbon throughout. Every team member was very attentive and welcoming from the moment we arrived. Very clean, modern and well appointed rooms. Pleasantly surprised by the terrific restaurant on site and great indoor/outdoor spaces. Will definitely be back!

On arrival we came up a small hill and entered a narrow alley leading to the hotel, hidden behind the nightlife but perched on a scenic lookout.  I could tell right away that every detail was well thought out, with the best use of space and materials.  We came for my birthday celebration and couldn't have picked a more romantic stay.  From the Hermes amenities to the daily chocolate truffles, the 5pm walking tour (highly recommended!) and wonderful breakfast offerings, plus a location walkable to fashionable Chiado, we would certainly stay again.  Cons?  Like many European hotels, it is on the small side and the pool lacks a jacuzzi.  Next time it would be nice to try a suite.

Everything at this hotel exceeded my expectations! The rooms were beautiful and very clean! The food was great and the staff was very welcoming! I would definitely recommend this hotel my friend and I both enjoyed our stay very much!

This is a stunning hotel with such attention to detail on every level. Would 100% recommend. Such kind staff who look after your every need, but leave you to your independence too. The views are amazing and the location is super cool. Love the street it’s off and the cafes and bars surrounding the hotel are authentic and fun.

Great experience, everything what even the most demanding guest can dream of. Beautiful views from room and restaurant, great food but most importantly amazing service from start to finish. Will definitely stay here again.

From our arrival until our departure two days later, the staff was exceptional.  Nuno greeted us upon arrival and assisted with our luggage.  Throughout the stay, he was always exceptionally personable, ensuring that our stay was pleasant.  All of the front desk staff were extremely nice and again, ensured that we had all that we needed to make our stay enjoyable.  The room was very comfortable and exceptionally clean.  The balcony with the fireplace was a nice bonus and made for a cozy and relaxing evening with a glass of wine.  The nightly turn down service and refreshing of the room was greatly appreciated.  The hotel location is very convenient to visiting the sites of Lisbon, yet removed enough that it is very quiet and relaxing.   Overall, a most enjoyable stay that was

Fabulous location and beautiful building.  Loved taking the complimentary walking tour; Inês, our tour guide was beyond fabulous.  Monica, our server during breakfast, was very attentive and nice! The buffet breakfast overlooking the city was excellent. Will definitely visit again.

This hotel is a true 5-star experience from the minute you walk through the front door. My wife and I had a very memorable stay.  The attention to details in the guest room was impressive.  The staff are all courteous and professional.  I highly recommend this fine hotel.

We've tried to see as much as possible in five day's. The whole crew of the special place is fantastic. We enjoied our stay very much. The breakfast is brilliant and the view at the front rooms is breath taking. Thank you for a super stay.

The memmo hotel is in the very city centre but does not feel like that. Somehow hidden from the street (you need to enter a "narrow" passway), built on the hillside, overlooking the city, this hotel lets you relax during your city trip. Our rooms had a terrace, reinforcing this feeling even more. The lobby, restaurant, bar and open-air areas are wonderful to relax. They even have a small open-air swimming pool. The breakfast is fantastic. Last but not least, they have an excellent guest relations department (Francisca) who will help you will all your tourism and dining requests.

The hotel is beautiful with nice wood work. The location is perfect with a beautiful view of Lisbon.  There are many good restaurants close by and it is a short walk to the tourist areas.  All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Joao at the front desk greeted us by names and made us feel like home. We stayed for a week for work and the pool area is a great spot  to plug in our computers and work with a backdrop of the city . We will stay here again when we are back for fun.

Wonderful hotel with great service. Redeemed Marriott Bonvoy points for a three night stay. Not any Titanium elite benefits to speak of but none were expected since this is a Design property. The room was exceptionally quiet and we appreciated the blackout curtains, balcony, modern design and location. Room wasn’t spacious but was very functional. Complimentary in room port cocktail and fruit dish were nice touches. Ubers are much cheaper in Lisbon than they are in California so we took them everywhere. This location is not very conducive to mass transit from what I could tell.   The Memmo is a small property, so don’t expect early check in or late checkout. I was lucky to get a 1 PM departure.   We didn’t partake of the 30 Euro pp breakfast but did enjoy a pitcher of gin

Truly an incredible luxury boutique hotel in the perfect Lisbon location.  Located in Barrio Alto with the most amazing views over Lisbon.  Rooms and the hotel are beautifully designed!  Welcome Port tonic in your room, beautiful views, incredible breakfast/dinner, spectacular infinity pool over looking Lisbon, Hermès toiletries, and amazing staff.  Available Tesla transfers to/from the airport.  Filipa the hotel director provided amazing recommendations and set up a dinner reservation at the Memmo Alfama (also with amazing views!).  Francisca with Guest Experience was wonderful answering all our pre-arrival questions and assisting with all our transfers.  Nemo the bellman was always available to assist with a smile.  All the staff at the hotel were truly spectacular!!  We

What a location Stunning view right in the Heart of the Center When we arrived we thought we were wrong but once you passed the entry if was sensational  Modern Charming Great terrace  Breakfast as fresh as it gets Will come back asap

The hotel location was great, everything walking distance.  The roof terrace and pool was second to none and we enjoyed breakfast and sunset there every day.  Rooms were great and staff were so friendly.

Great Hotel, brilliant value for money with exceptional service. From  the time we arrive all staff were welcoming, informative and friendly. The breakfast was delightful, perhaps the sunbathing around the pool could be improved. Would defiantly stay again.

The staff were amazing and went out of the way to help. I would highly recommend it as a great place to stay while visiting Lisbon. It was  super clean and a nice areal stay. I would definitely make a return visit. Francesca is a great asset to the hotel.

The Memmo Principe Real is located in the best location in town. Restaurants, Bars and the Park Pricipe Real near. Baiiro Alto is not far, Chiado only 10 Minutes to walk. The architecture of the Memmo Principe is very special, modern but also stylish. Every detail is looked after. The place is visited by younger people and restaurant is a meeting point also for posh locals. This is the place to be!

This hotel has everything. I didn't want to leave. The staff was excellent, and so were the services. It's located in an excellent area, with access to everything. Everything. I was lucky to have a room so that when I sit in my bed and look out the window, my view was looking out and down at the awesome landscape of Lisbon. And, the price was well worth it because of the extras it came with, such as the walking tour every evening and breakfast. The staff was also very professional, quick, friendly and responsive. There are so many nice hotels and areas in Lisbon, no need for repeats, yet, Memmo Principe Real so stole my heart, I would return.

Great Hotel, very friendly staff. We visited Lisbon in September 2021, the location of the hotel is good, there are some good restaurants nearby - to Alfama you have to go by taxi otherwise it is too far. That was no problem for us. The breakfast was really good

Outstanding, when my wife had an accident on the first day of your visit the staff were so supportive, friendly and helpful.  They are without doubt the best staff in any hotel I have been in (and that is a lot).  They come across as one big family.  Thank you to them all :)

We loved everything about PortoBay Marques, accommodation, location, friendly staff- very experienced and helped us with a lot of information. The hotel is very cozy, the decor is chic and modern. It exceed our expectations. I strongly recommend this hotel👍

like the Porto Bay brand. Very nice boutique hotel. Rooms were on the small size. Service was excellent. It was within walking distance to the city center. Dinner at Il Basilico was excellent. Highly recommend .

Very good hotels and staff. Everything was perfect.  The rooms are very large and everything is provided by the hotel. Swimming pool heat and sauna and steam room very good.  The cocktails were very good with the local Capairiniha.

PortoBay Marques is a faultless and flawless hotel in a great central Lisbon location.  Staff are wonderful and clearly very happy in their jobs which is almost certainly to do with good management.  Place is spotlessly clean and food was good and reasonably priced.  Rooms are well appointed and bed and bed linen of good quality.  I look forward to my next trip.

Outstanding, when my wife had an accident on the first day of your visit the staff were so supportive, friendly and helpful.  They are without doubt the best staff in any hotel I have been in (and that is a lot).  They come across as one big family.  Thank you to them all :)

We loved everything about PortoBay Marques, accommodation, location, friendly staff- very experienced and helped us with a lot of information. The hotel is very cozy, the decor is chic and modern. It exceed our expectations. I strongly recommend this hotel👍

like the Porto Bay brand. Very nice boutique hotel. Rooms were on the small size. Service was excellent. It was within walking distance to the city center. Dinner at Il Basilico was excellent. Highly recommend .

Very good hotels and staff. Everything was perfect.  The rooms are very large and everything is provided by the hotel. Swimming pool heat and sauna and steam room very good.  The cocktails were very good with the local Capairiniha.

PortoBay Marques is a faultless and flawless hotel in a great central Lisbon location.  Staff are wonderful and clearly very happy in their jobs which is almost certainly to do with good management.  Place is spotlessly clean and food was good and reasonably priced.  Rooms are well appointed and bed and bed linen of good quality.  I look forward to my next trip.

Really great hotel in great location. 20 mins walk to centre of city. Very clean, modern decor, lovely comfy beds. Great rooftop bar and plunge pool. Nice restaurant. Next door to the metro. Would definitely recommend.

The hotel location is perfect for visiting Lisbon. There are metro, bus and even touristic bus stops The staff is 10+ The breakfast is very good.  The quality of the sleep is grest.  Quiet street.  Rooftop terrace and pool!

Stayed for three nights in November. Booked a Junior Suite which well appointed and pristine (including small fridge and microwave). Beautiful Rituals products in the bathroom were a lovely addition/ along with robes, slippers and extra towels. Very good breakfast with both hot and cold selection which was refreshed constantly.  Great location and extremely friendly & helpful staff.  Would highly recommend and are already planning our next visit to this gem of a hotel :-)

My brother stayed at the PortoBay Liberdade a few years ago so when I informed him that I was traveling to Lisbon he strongly recommend it. It happened to be fully booked when I was arriving so I booked the sister hotel . . . The PortoBay Marques and I absolutely loved it. The staff were amazing and the room was beyond perfect. I was so impressed that I made it a point to have lunch at the PortoBay Liberdade and that was also amazing. So when I moved on to Porto I naturally booked the ProtoBay Teatro in the center of everything. That was also an amazing experience which I will never forget.  My bucket list now has a new item . . . Visit each and every PortoBay hotel in Portugal and maybe even Brazil.

The rooms are plenty big and appointed with everything one would expect, including slippers which they didn't have at my first hotel stop. The bathroom was fine too. Breakfast was on par with just about every other hotel I've stayed at in Portugal. Most of all, the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.

Great location, very friendly staff, great location so central, The restaurant on-site was very good and very affordable. Rooms are cleaned daily and beds are very comfortable. They are well-appointed with free upgraded extras. There's a nice bar in the lobby with very nice bar staff. Easy to get anything you want to do in Lisbon. Would definitely stay here again. Looking forward to staying again. Excellent doorman. and Johana in reception is a lovely person to deal with.

Really liked this hotel.  Great location, friendly staff, and great restaurant on-site.  Rooms are clean and comfortable and there's a nice bar in the lobby.  Easy to get anything you want to do in Lisbon.  Would definitely stay here again.

I visited Lisbon in March 2020, in the beginning of COVID-19 pandemic. Although the country had just a few cases, the hotel was well-prepared, with measures already in place to protect its guests, so I felt pretty safe whilst there. Upon arrival, I was greeted by one of the front desk employees and received a room upgrade. The room was very spacious, with a small kitchen which even had a microwave. This is very convenient in case you want to have breakfast/dinner in your room. Bathrooms are also spacious and equipped with Rituals toiletries. No all rooms have a bathtub, though. There is a pool in the terrace, and a nice view to the street. The gym is also located on the same floor, but it's quite small... In terms of location, the hotel is only a few minutes from Eduardo Park

Welcoming lobby with cozy lobby bar, small rooms but with a super comfortable bed and very spacious bathroom!!! All personnel was highly professional and great location!!! The in-house restaurant was very good!!! breakfast was not included in the rate but there are some great bakeries nearby, the best for me was called Simpli and is delicious!!!

We enjoyed our 5-night stay at this attractive PortoBay hotel in Lisbon. The location is perfect. Not too far from the city centre and quite peaceful. You can walk along the fashionable Avenida de Liberdade and may sights are within walking distance. Alternatively you can use the inexpensive public transport facilities or take a taxi. The hotel itself is super. Professional staff, good breakfast, a nice Italian restaurant on site, nice and well-equipped relatively small rooms (we booked a standard room). The small rooftop pool is surrounded by deckchairs; a perfect place to relax after a busy day. All the PortoBay hotels that we’ve stayed at have met our expectations. Definitely recommended!

We recently stayed at this hotel, which had been arranged as a surprise for my 50th birthday. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel extremely welcome. The attention to detail with the service was second to none and nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. The receptionist, Lara, went out of her way to offer some great places to visit and even helped us with a dinner reservation at a restaurant near the bridge for my birthday. A special mention also to Ana who we received fantastic service from when we dined in the hotel's restaurant on the first night (so much so, we also booked in again for our final evening!) The hotel itself is really lovely with a modern decor and its ambience is very chilled. The self service rooftop bar was an added bonus, although we

Great service at breakfast by all the team but espciallyJoanna Dias Bernarjo, very helpful attentive without being invasive all with great effeciency, another true asset to this hotel, forgot to mention roof top (Very heated )pool and an Honesty Bar , REALLY ,in a city centre Fab. Managed to get sun burn in March ,could even see the Sea from the roof ,JJackson

Great location, pleasant staff, good breakfast, would recommend to anyone going to Lisbon. Found concierge particularity helpful. Staff in Restaurant pleasant also. Only negative was evening meal where food should have been hotter.

Stayed for 3 nights last weekend in February. Very clean, excellent location, all staff exceptional, nice honesty bar on roof top (ideal for plane spotting). Used the roof top pool which was nice. Good choice for breakfast and very tasty. Nice bar by reception with big TV which generally showed the football (great for a drink before heading out).Great base to explore the lovely city of Lisbon. Nice to see hand sanertiser available at reception with current virus scare!! Room a little small and quite dark which could be an issue for a longer stay. Would absolutely recommend for a short stay!!

This is a very good hotel which has a very attentive yet friendly staff. There is another "Portobay" near to it but the Marques appears less pretenious and better for it. The rooms and facilities are of a very, very good standard - and the service levels and general professionalism / friendliness of the staff is outstanding.  Breakfast provides an excellent choice of food in the nicely laid out resturant, and the dinner choices are mainly aligned to an Itailian theme.  The food we had was very acceptable with great service. When we visited, the two Portabay hotels in the location each gave an incentive (free pud/ or glass of wine) to use each others resturant and we tried both (offers are not surprising as there are so many good eating places in Lisbon). The other Portobay food

We stayed for a 4 night trip & the hotel is in a very central location convenient for several top tourist destinations either via uber, walking or hop on hop off bus. Our room was small but comfortable enough. The hotel benefits from a nice rooftop terrace bar although the 'pool' in reality is really the size of a plunge pool. There is a gym although the steam room/jacuzzi where out of action when we were there. Breakfast was very good, plenty of selection in the spacious restaurant area to the rear. The staff were lovely and very helpful in recommendations as to where to visit & as we celebrated a birthday, a bottle of sparkling wine was left in our room, which was a very kind gesture. All in all a very nice hotel, good value for money and very friendly staff. Recommended.

Stayed here for a couple of nights, the hotel was perfect, and the location was great. The hotel was easy to find and not too far away from the airport about 20-30 min drive. The reception was brilliant and healpfull. Got into the room, which was nice and comfortable, stayed in the standard room had no view, but everything else was excellent. Breakfast was good with the usual options. We were able to walk to many of the attractions and if your interested in doing the 'hop on hop off' bus tour then stop 1 was literally around the corner. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Lisbon.

We knew nothing about Lisbon or where to stay that would allow us to be centrally located for roaming the area. To be honest it was sheer luck we stayed here but we will recommend it to anyone looking for a great place in Lisbon. The front desk helped us map out a full day of taking in the sights from Belém to Sintra. The restaurant/bar manager arranged for me to try some port and I discovered I actually enjoy a good port. When we were tired and didn’t feel like finding a restaurant we decided to try the one at the hotel. The food was absolutely delicious and we are happy we did. If you’re visiting Lisbon do yourself a favor and stay at the PortoBay.

This hotel, service, rooms, location was excellent. We got a cab from the airport for 15 euro and arrived before our room was ready. We completed the paperwork and left our cases and after our day out they were waiting in our rooms when we got back early evening. The staff are so friendly and helpful. They helped us out with maps and showed us the locations of everywhere we planned to go, they taught us some basic portugeuse too. The hotel is about 2 minutes from the metro at Marques de Pombal and you can also walk down towards the main tourist area. The bar/lobby is combined and we had a few drinks in the evening before heading to our room, comfy seats and it all looks very nice. It was just being dresssed for Christmas. Our room had a comfy bed with 2 side tables, a built in

We visited this hotel to celebrate my sisters 60th Birthday. The reception we received on our arrival was most helpful & welcoming, they very kindly upgraded our room which we all absolutely enjoyed, it made our trip even more special. All of the staff were very friendly and eager to please, the atmosphere they created was very warm and friendly.  We loved the comfort of the beds, the delicious food and the location. We can’t wait to return to enjoy once more!

We loved everything about Barrio Alto, the accommodations, the staff, the excellent restaurant, the location. Cannot recommend it high enough. Our corner room had an extraordinary view of the Plaza in front of the hotel. Unforgettable

What a fabulous stay!  Room far exceeded our expectations - absolutely luxurious. Beautiful view, double sink and walk in shower. Pastries with thoughtful turndown every night.   Included breakfast was fabulous.  Eggs Florentine and chorizo were creative and subtle - so much so that we ordered them twice! Who in the world would race about porridge and granola? We would because they were so great!   The rooftop bar was fantastic - terrific cocktails and wine, beautiful view.   But what really makes this special is the staff. I’m unfortunately unable to remember names well but the young ladies at the rooftop bar were so attentive and professional; the desk, porter and concierge staff were patient and helpful. We were made to feel like family.   All in all a gem of a hotel 100

The hotel is in a fabulous location, the rooms are comfortable and a reasonable size. The staff and service is wonderful & the rooftop terrace was nice for sunset! The breakfast service and menu was excellent- but watch out for smokers allowed during dining on the patio.

I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed my stay tremendously. Service was seamless - from concierge, reception, doorman, and restaurant staff. The food at the restaurant is outstanding - I had one dinner and two breakfasts. Even housekeeping that does the daily turndown services was so friendly (and always leaves a pastry treat!). They even gladly pre-arranged for a nurse to come to the hotel to do a PCR test that is required for my flight back home.  My only quibble is the room, a renovated Classic Tejo, was a little tight between the bed, bench and tv wall. It was a very quiet room though. Secondly, the in-room esperesso maker is different from what most other hotels have (not a Nespresso brand), so it was a little challenging to figure out as there are no instructions provided

I came on here to add a review but it seems as if all recent travelers have had the same experience we have had….one truly fabulous hotel!  I have nothing but great things to say about the quality of the property and the staff. From booking to concierge help in advance to included Mercedes transfer from the airport to check in to delicious breakfast with a knock out view to a nice gym…it’s all great. We booked a junior suite and it’s HUGE. The bathroom is luxurious with double sinks and great amenities. The room is very quiet even though we are only on the first floor. New press o maker in the room is a big plus as are some free treats and lovely nightly turndown service.  And the location can’t be beat!  Easy access to touring, great restaurants in Bairro Alto and the 28 tram

We loved everything about Barrio Alto, the accommodations, the staff, the excellent restaurant, the location. Cannot recommend it high enough. Our corner room had an extraordinary view of the Plaza in front of the hotel. Unforgettable

What a fabulous stay!  Room far exceeded our expectations - absolutely luxurious. Beautiful view, double sink and walk in shower. Pastries with thoughtful turndown every night.   Included breakfast was fabulous.  Eggs Florentine and chorizo were creative and subtle - so much so that we ordered them twice! Who in the world would race about porridge and granola? We would because they were so great!   The rooftop bar was fantastic - terrific cocktails and wine, beautiful view.   But what really makes this special is the staff. I’m unfortunately unable to remember names well but the young ladies at the rooftop bar were so attentive and professional; the desk, porter and concierge staff were patient and helpful. We were made to feel like family.   All in all a gem of a hotel 100

The hotel is in a fabulous location, the rooms are comfortable and a reasonable size. The staff and service is wonderful & the rooftop terrace was nice for sunset! The breakfast service and menu was excellent- but watch out for smokers allowed during dining on the patio.

I stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed my stay tremendously. Service was seamless - from concierge, reception, doorman, and restaurant staff. The food at the restaurant is outstanding - I had one dinner and two breakfasts. Even housekeeping that does the daily turndown services was so friendly (and always leaves a pastry treat!). They even gladly pre-arranged for a nurse to come to the hotel to do a PCR test that is required for my flight back home.  My only quibble is the room, a renovated Classic Tejo, was a little tight between the bed, bench and tv wall. It was a very quiet room though. Secondly, the in-room esperesso maker is different from what most other hotels have (not a Nespresso brand), so it was a little challenging to figure out as there are no instructions provided

I came on here to add a review but it seems as if all recent travelers have had the same experience we have had….one truly fabulous hotel!  I have nothing but great things to say about the quality of the property and the staff. From booking to concierge help in advance to included Mercedes transfer from the airport to check in to delicious breakfast with a knock out view to a nice gym…it’s all great. We booked a junior suite and it’s HUGE. The bathroom is luxurious with double sinks and great amenities. The room is very quiet even though we are only on the first floor. New press o maker in the room is a big plus as are some free treats and lovely nightly turndown service.  And the location can’t be beat!  Easy access to touring, great restaurants in Bairro Alto and the 28 tram

We have been to Lisbon a few times and always stayed at the Ritz, which is lovely but a bit removed from the action. After reading about this hotel, we decided to stay here.
