We booked a Tejo Suite, which is very large and so nice. We loved everything about the room, so much care and thought went into the design. It's comfortable and gorgeous. There are two sets (an inner and outer) of windows which kept out street noise and our room was very quiet and great for sleeping. The restaurant is great and has a wonderful view.  We also enjoyed the rooftop lounge. Service at every level--from housekeeping to the concierege--was top notch. The location is great and fun, tons of restaurants, bars, shops, etc. I have no complaints about or criticisms of this hotel

From the moment that we stepped into the Barrio Alto hotel we were treated so well. The staff could not do enough to help us. Wonderful. It then has to be said that the restaurant and  terrace food is amongst the finest you will find in Europe. They have superb chefs, and even better waiting staff. The veal and tuna tartare are 5*, and if you don’t have the Bahr homemade crisps, then I feel sorry for you. I would have always left a 5* review, as this is one of the best hotels I have stayed in, but one of the staff overheard me talking about my 50th birthday and I arrived back to my room to find a cake and a bottle of sparkling wine. Now that is service!! Thank you to everyone in the hotel. It is wonderful. I could not give a higher recommendation other than I could spend every

After nearly two years of pandemic we had saved enough money to splurge on our much needed escape and we spent an entire week at Bairro Alto Hotel.  It was wonderful.  We easily figured out the subway from the airport - there is a stop less than a city block from the front door of the hotel and it's a fairly brief trip (less than half an hour).  The staff were incredible from the  moment of our arrival - ready with anything we needed but never pushy or overly engaging.  There are two elevators in the hotel, one goes to the rooms and the restaurant and the other to the rooftop.  We  occasionally used the stairs, but never found a long wait for the elevator if we used it.- despite COVID precautions limiting one party to the elevator at a time.  Our room was superb - we chose a

The hotel is extremely well located and walking distance from everything in Lisbon. The decor is chic and modern, but still retains a lot of traditional Portuguese character. I was constantly reminded of the Pulitzer Hotel (in Amsterdam). The rooms are all recently updated, and very well appointed with thoughtful design touches including wireless speakers, mini fridge, coffee makers, etc. The bathrooms are also all wonderfully updated. The rooftop is a a huge draw and provides absolutely fantastic views of Lisbon. The rooftop breakfast is also excellent - extremely high quality with wonderful views. What I really felt set the Bairro Alto apart was just the absolutely fantastic level of service we received from everyone from the doorman to the cleaning staff. Priscilla at

The location of the hotel was very central. The rooms are relatively big and very clean. The best part of the experience is the front desk and lobby staff. They are so friendly and accommodating and make you feel very special . The rooftop bar is amazing  and the breakfast was very good although staff seemed very uptight.

Location is excellent. You can reach everything in walking distance or by public transport. Rooms are wonderful decorated and very quiet. Bars and restarurants are perfect. All staff is extremly helpfull and extrordinary friendly. And although the management takes care of you. Moreover  the view from the terraces gives you a overwhelming view over the city, the river and the southbank landscape.  If you do not come to this hotel you will miss a lot.

The hotel is conveniently located and very accessible to shopping and several of the sights of Lisbon.  We had booked the Chiado suite but were kindly upgraded to the Tejo suite upon check in.  The suite has contemporary decor and is brilliantly laid out with lots of storage space and a walk in wardrobe in addition to the bedroom, living area, bathroom and WC. The service was excellent and the room service food extremely yummy.  Lovely terrace for drinks and a breakfast area / restaurant with a view of the river. Overall, a wonderful experience and highly recommended.

This is the best hotel you will find in Lisbon and most likely one of the best hotel stays I have ever had anywhere. I expected something much more simple. It located in a very nice area, the Old town, and the hotel building is beatiful (also seems to be newly renovated). The room interior is a perfect mix between modern and a more classic portugese style and every detail has a thought behind it.  The breakfast is unbelievable and offers newly baked croissants (baked at the hotels own pastry shop on the ground floor). The room service food is on of the best room service food I have ever had and the staff working here are highly professional (the service is flawless).  Personally I avoid hotels in "old town" areas because they usually are crowded and pretty basic (even when they

We spent one night in the Bairro Alto Hotel on our very quick visit to Lisbon and the whole experience was delightful. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming, the room was beautiful and the food was exquisite. The view from the terrace was also dazzling.

New hotel for us - perfect location within walking distance to most places in central Lisbon, valet parking, nice terrace on top floor, very nice rooms (many of which appeared to be recently built). Friendly and helpful staff!

We had an outstanding stay at Bairro Alto. The rooms are beautiful and the recent renovation appears to have been carried out with the highest quality. Meanwhile, the service provided by the hotel was without a doubt among the best I've ever experienced. Management has clearly invested in training their staff, who are courteous, personable, always present, and willing to help at every juncture. Food at the restaurant was also outstanding.  The hotel is situated in a fantastic location for visitors. We'd gladly stay at Bairro Alto again.   The only suggestion for potential guests is to carefully select one's room, as the description of one of the rooms we stayed in really wasn't entirely accurate.  But this was rectified in a more than satisfactory manner and didn't mar the stay

I travel and stay at hotels very frequently for work, and stayed at four different hotels on this journal that were all priced similarly in Portugal.  This hotel delivered incredibly bad service from start to finish. Of all the five star hotels at which i have stayed, this is literally the first hotel that compelled me to post a review  to trip advisor.  Every comment I make is 100% accurate.    First, I tried to book on the hotel website.  The prices listed for our two night stay were significantly different one night one and night two.  Yet, when I made the booking, the website increased the price to the higher level and charged it for both nights.   I called the hotel to ask why this was happening, and they said "we have no idea.  Can you take photo of the website and e-mail

The Barrio Alto Hotel and staff never missed an opportunity to impress during my recent 6 night stay. I was celebrating my birthday and traveling solo but never felt alone - the management and staff were very warm and welcoming and went the extra step to make this trip memorable for me. The roof top terrace is definitely one of the coolest spots in town to enjoy a few drinks before heading out on the town or retiring for the evening. The Barrio Alto is conveniently located and easy to find after walking for hours all over Lisbon. My room was spacious , well appointed and spotless. The turn down service was a plus!!  Best of all - everyone remembered my name - way to make a girl feel right at home. Thanks to everyone at Barrio Alto for a truly fabulous week. See you soon. Belinda

This hotel was absolutely wonderful. From the staff, to the location, and the amenities. This hotel has recently re-opened, and my mother and I had a great experience. The staff is extremely helpful and just a joy to be around. They have a beautiful gym that I used frequently, always clean. Our room was wonderful with a great view of the square. They had an amazing rooftop lounge with a stunning view. Would definitely go recommend. Ask for Iago if you find yourself there - he's awesome.

If I could give this hotel 6 stars, I would. The staff is amazing, knowledgeable, so helpful and very funny. They enjoyed helping me and my husband as we navigated the city and seemed to like hearing about our experiences as well. The hotel is located perfectly with access to the river, Baixa-Chiado metro, the shopping and dining areas you need as well as hundreds of restaurants. The food is amazing at the BAHR restaurant as well, and the view towards the river is sublime.The rooms are small, but well decorated, maybe a little too many small pieces of furniture as sometimes you have to move things to get to the window. You can open the window/doors and have a view as well. The bathroom is luxurious with all you could need and the shower is excellent, with lots of hot water. The

Absolutely loved the Bairro Alto Hotel! Recently renovated the rooms are fabulous, new and luxurious. The staff was amazingly helpful and friendly, could not have been nicer and the hotel is in an absolute perfect location for touring Lisbon on the border of the Chiado and Bairro Alto districts it is easy to walk pretty much anywhere in the city. The breakfast was absolutely delicious and the rooftop has gorgeous views of the city and a great place to either relax and unwind at the end of the day or go for an after dinner drink, dessert, tea, etc. Perfect perfect hotel would highly recommend!

What a find!  Pefectly located this hotel was totally renovated and is a little paradise in the best part of town.  The room was large and there was a lot of care put into decorating the room.  The bathroom was also quite large .  The staff were very pleasant to deal with.  The restaurant has a beautiful view and the breakfast that was included on our package was plentiful and of high quality.  We had a lunch at the restaurant before we left, thinking it wouldl be an average hotel lunch but it was one of the best meals we had in Lisbon.  We really had no complaints about the hotel...which is unusual for us :).

Recently refurbished to an excellent standard.  Fabulous central location close to bars, shops and restaurants. That said the rooftop bar and restaurant at the hotel have to be some of the best in the city. The head chef is well worthy of his Mitchelin star!  The staff team are amazing. So friendly and attentive without being overbearing. Perfect.

The hotel was newly redone.  Rooms were excellent and up to date.  Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Actually the entire staff was great.  You were addressed by your name.  The roof top restaurant was excellent. Food was extraordinarily good. Location was in old Portugal and great.  As a solo traveler I was made to feel very comfortable I look forward to returning again for a longer stay.

Reopened after 2 years of extensive renovation. Entrance is finally up To the hotel, rooms are modern fully equipped. We where in 317, sufficiently large and very comfortable. Bathroom is not huge but it has all is needed. WiFi ok. Breakfast a la carte. Location optimal for the Bairro and Chiado area.  The restaurant is very good too!

Wonderful hotel with very cozy spacious rooms and fantastic view right on the water! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is diverse a lot of healthy options. The restaurant book in advance - it’s too popular and only has 12 tables.  We had a great time, will come back for sure!

Had a birthday brunch with close friends and family at the Altis Belém, and honestly could not have chosen a better place. The large windows with view to the marina, the AMAZING food and the wonderful friendly staff made the celebration unforgettable. The brunch is served in a buffet style, rich with starters, salads, hot dishes (the braised pork was to die for), fruit and desserts! This brunch is by far one of the best in Lisbon. The staff is very thoughtful and attentive to detail. Nuno who was waiting our table seemed to always be one step ahead of my needs, my glass was never empty!  The hotel manager came to greet us and wish a happy birthday. A very thoughtful and delicate touch.  Overall great experience and will definitely go back.

Having recently had the Dine & Sleep Experience, I commend the Altis Belem on their wonderful property, service and dining, particularly the Feitoria Restaurant. We had a fantastic 9-course tasting menu and enjoyed the design and eye for detail the hotel provides. Its perfect location between the monument to Portugal's nautical discoveries and the historic Torre de Belem are just an added bonus.

The hotel sits in a wonderful location, by the Tejo river with loads of movement and cool atractions and museums to visit. Spectacular and amazing staff. Super friendly and welcoming during the whole stay, spa and lunch. I would definitely return.

Great modern design in black and white colors.  Excellent service. Nice spa.  Nice views. Perfect location close to Jeronimos and Belém. Perfect for business and turism. We will come back on our future trips to Lisbon!

Wonderful hotel with very cozy spacious rooms and fantastic view right on the water! The staff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is diverse a lot of healthy options. The restaurant book in advance - it’s too popular and only has 12 tables.  We had a great time, will come back for sure!

Had a birthday brunch with close friends and family at the Altis Belém, and honestly could not have chosen a better place. The large windows with view to the marina, the AMAZING food and the wonderful friendly staff made the celebration unforgettable. The brunch is served in a buffet style, rich with starters, salads, hot dishes (the braised pork was to die for), fruit and desserts! This brunch is by far one of the best in Lisbon. The staff is very thoughtful and attentive to detail. Nuno who was waiting our table seemed to always be one step ahead of my needs, my glass was never empty!  The hotel manager came to greet us and wish a happy birthday. A very thoughtful and delicate touch.  Overall great experience and will definitely go back.

Having recently had the Dine & Sleep Experience, I commend the Altis Belem on their wonderful property, service and dining, particularly the Feitoria Restaurant. We had a fantastic 9-course tasting menu and enjoyed the design and eye for detail the hotel provides. Its perfect location between the monument to Portugal's nautical discoveries and the historic Torre de Belem are just an added bonus.

The hotel sits in a wonderful location, by the Tejo river with loads of movement and cool atractions and museums to visit. Spectacular and amazing staff. Super friendly and welcoming during the whole stay, spa and lunch. I would definitely return.

Great modern design in black and white colors.  Excellent service. Nice spa.  Nice views. Perfect location close to Jeronimos and Belém. Perfect for business and turism. We will come back on our future trips to Lisbon!

Amazing! Brunch of great quality and variety. Very helpful and pleasant staff. Room with a fantastic view and a large capacity (we were 50 but it can accommodate at least 20 more). For sure we will repeat!

The staff were very helpful. Except for the Michelin stared restaurant, not many choices for food. The bar was mediocre, nothing great to talk about.For a 5 star hotel not much choices for food.Complimentary breakfast had very limited choices.

I stayed at the Atis Belém for my recent business trip to Lisbon. What a lovely hotel! The room was spacious and clean with a comfortable bed, useful desk, and terrific bathroom that included both a shower and separate tub. The service was attentive, friendly and quick. Plus, the location in Belém was wonderful - right on the water with easy access to recreation, restaurants, and activities. The only drawback was that there are very few outlets in the room and none by the bed - bring extras if your technology (laptop, phone, tablet) requires it.

Contemporary hotel in an excellent location. Our room looked out over the harbor and was by far our favorite hotel during our 21 day trip in Portugal, Spain and Italy.  The staff was very attentive and accommodating providing great restaurant and site seeing recommendations.  We greatly enjoyed our stay and recommend for those that enjoy modern amenities in an upscale hotel.

Our first date was in the Bar of Altis Belém. After 6 years dating, and 1 year married we decided to celebrate our anniversary in Altis Belém.  We have chosen to do a Massage "Fall in Love", a tasting menu with a wine paring for dinner, in their Michelin Star Restaurant "Feitoria" and one night stay. We couldn't ask for more.!! It was perfect!! Thank you Bruno, Ricardo, Manuel, Pedro Garcia, Bernardo, André, Chef João Rodrigues and all the staff that we don't remember the names, but also helped to make our experience unforgetable. We totally recommend!

I had an incredible stay at Altis Belem. The rooms, location and breakfast can’t be faulted. The only thing I would say is the cleanliness of the roof could have been better. I don’t know if that’s because it wasn’t being used as much to the time of year, but it wasn’t up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel - but I’m still giving the hotel a 5 star review as the service and everything else was absolutely fantastic.

Hotel is stunningly beautiful.  The location is in the Belem neighborhood of Lisbon, a bit away from the city center but still conveniently located.  Location turned out to be perfect for us as the views were stunning and the area was much more relaxed. Everything about staying at Altis Belem was relaxing and of the highest quality.  Breakfast was delicious, the entire staff was friendly and accommodating.  Rita at the front desk made excellent local recommendations. Overall we loved our stay and only wish we could have had a few more days to stay at this property.  Don't miss a drink at the gastro bar...the views are stunning!

This is my favourite hotel, mostly because the staff are so welcoming and kind.  The last few visits however have shown it a little run down by Covid - minor failures of room maintenance Etc.   Your staff are memorably good - especially in reception and in the bar.

I would stay at Altis Belem again anytime. The pool and sundeck was very nice, I was a bit worried about the space, but had no problem finding space. Staff hospitality very nice and the breakfast delicious. Unfortunately the Restaurant was closed during stay, which was a dissapointment. Overall - very good experience.

Altis Belem Hotel & Spa is pure indulgence. The rooms are perfect and have a beautiful view on the Tagus, the wonderful river that crosses Lisbon. The staff of the hotel are very friendly and kind and always willing to assist you if possible. Breakfast is perfect and if you want to have something for lunch or diner, the Bar is always open. Altis Belem Hotel & Spa is a place to come back anytime you feel a little bit stressed: it's over when you arrive....  Compliments to all the people of the hotel!

The hotel was easy to locate and situated by the marina and riverside so was in a great location. The check in was smooth and the staff polite. I was told that i had been upgraded which was a pleasant surprise but i found the room did not live up to my expectations. The decor was a bit dated and very clinical. The bathroom was so dark as it was all black and had very low level lighting that you could not really see very well. Due to this the mirror in the bathroom was not very flattering at all. The door to the toilet area would not close very well and kept opening when using the toilet. There was also a large stain in the ceiling just above the bed so was very unpleasant to. look at. The hallways were also black and very little lighting. Each door has  a small light above the

Excellent hotel, very friendly staff and great food! The location is also great for sightseeing, being located within walking distance of all Belém sights and easy access to Sintra and Cascais. The Michelin * restaurant Feitoria is very much worth a visit as well!

I would like to thank you Altis Belém for the amazing Stay we had, from the reception, Bar, Breakfast, Room, everything was amazing, everyone in Altis Belém Team were very Helpfull and amazing, giving us all the attention and guidance during our Staying… The Altis Belém Hotel is an excellent Hotel for everyone that Wants to come to Lisbon in business or pleasure

Great location.   Although the hotel is off centre it is easily accessible by tram, bus and train.  The hotel is stunning with lovely riverside views and lots around the area.  It sits within the cultural arts district also with plenty worth visiting.

Staff went above-and-beyond to ensure that my stay was as comfortable as possible. The hotel has fantastic views of the river and is only a 15 min ride from the city centre. Although there is some noise from the nearby train line, this was less noticeable on south side of the hotel. Would come back in a heartbeat.

I was not a guest of this hotel but the attention and consideration of Melanie and João who were working that day saved my mother’s life. She fell outside of the hotel and they saw it happening through a window. They rushed outside to help with ice. This stopped her brain injury from becoming lethal. I can not be more grateful for the attention of this staff! I would definitely stay there next time I visit and am forever grateful.

From the front desk staff to room service, restaurant, everything was just perfect! The views are also incredible, as well as the perfect distance from the main tourist attractions. Definitely recommend as the best hotel in Lisbon.

Unique hotel by the Tagus River! I've had the privilege to report on the inauguration about a decade ago and it keeps rocking! Best regards to the director and the friendly staff! Nysse Arruda, journalist and author, Lisbon, Portugal.

An excellent design hotel on the banks of the Tagus , really good sized well designed bedrooms overlooking the marina with big bathrooms , except value and with one of the best Michelin two stars in Lisbon .   Roof top pool is good to cool off in and the star are super friendly and efficient.   My favourite place to stay in Lisbon .

Excellent location, next to Tejo River. The decoration and the comfort stand out. Rooms with great areas and privacy. The swimming pool and rest area with adequate dimensions. Excellent quality snacks and bar. The hotel team os extremely available which makes the experience unforgettable. Definitely a place to return.

It was really a pleasure! The Stuff is amazing!!! Thank you so much for the experience 😍 All staff are very attentive, constantly monitoring the needs of guests. Breakfast, bar offer, service excellent!

Good location, convenient with different transport yet maintains certain tranquility to enjoy the vibes of the neigbourhood. The staff are very helpful and polite. Really like the new and nice decor of the room , with a window and without carpet.  It is really a gem in the city and cant wait to go back and stay there.

Loved Lisbon and this hotel was in the perfect location.   The staff was helpful, the rooms were modern and the breakfast was great.   The concierge recommended great restaurants and things to do in Lisbon.  We were about a 10 minute walk to the main square along the high end shopping district.

My wife and I are taking this Euro trip for her Birthday and we started with Lisbon and she loves it, the stay, the staff at the hotels, the service, everyone responsiveness when request were made was amazing. Definitely will stay with you when I come back to Lisbon

We like the location. It’s very convenient and safe. The front desk staffs are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a little pricey. We won’t recommend. Everything else is perfect. We love it and definitely will recommend it to everyone.

It was really a pleasure! The Stuff is amazing!!! Thank you so much for the experience 😍 All staff are very attentive, constantly monitoring the needs of guests. Breakfast, bar offer, service excellent!

Good location, convenient with different transport yet maintains certain tranquility to enjoy the vibes of the neigbourhood. The staff are very helpful and polite. Really like the new and nice decor of the room , with a window and without carpet.  It is really a gem in the city and cant wait to go back and stay there.

Loved Lisbon and this hotel was in the perfect location.   The staff was helpful, the rooms were modern and the breakfast was great.   The concierge recommended great restaurants and things to do in Lisbon.  We were about a 10 minute walk to the main square along the high end shopping district.

My wife and I are taking this Euro trip for her Birthday and we started with Lisbon and she loves it, the stay, the staff at the hotels, the service, everyone responsiveness when request were made was amazing. Definitely will stay with you when I come back to Lisbon

We like the location. It’s very convenient and safe. The front desk staffs are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is a little pricey. We won’t recommend. Everything else is perfect. We love it and definitely will recommend it to everyone.

Had a fabulous week at the Vincci Liberdade hotel ! Its very well located , great friendly staff who are very helpfull in every way. We did a lot of searching before choosing this hotel and it certainly paid off as our stay was for 6 nights and it felt like home away from home.

Last week we spend a week in this great hotel. The room was big with all the facilities. The people at the reception gave us a warm welcome and help us with every need. The breakfast was great and the service with got was excellent. When we had to take a Covid test the reception help us to have it in the hotel. We for sure will come again !!!.

One night stay was good although the room was very warm and the bed sinks down because it is very soft. Overall very nice room and bathroom and nice service. Quite location but you need to go by foot to the city centre

This beautiful place made us feel home visiting Lisbon first time just for 3 days. The atmosphere is a custom made like in a boutique hotel thanks to the highly professional staff. Super handy location is a bonus as well.

I stayed 4 nights and on arrival I was pleasantly surprised with an early checkin at 11.30. The very helpful staff on reception answered any questions I had and gave me some good tips for local attractions. I booked a standard double room which although small, was comfortable. The bathroom had a nice shower and double sink although it was quite small.  I got a good sleep as the room was quiet with good aircon and blackout blinds. The TV had loads of channels but most in Portuguese but you just need to scroll to find English channels.  Breakfast wasn’t included in my room rate but at €12 it was excellent value. Due to the COVID restrictions it was table service, but a lot of credit should go to the staff serving as they were incredibly friendly and efficient despite it being

Good service and clean, with nice bathroom. Parking opposite is free in evenings and during weekend so was easy enough to park car. Breakfast included some of the best made eggs I have had at a hotel. Staff at breakfast were great, especially Jose who was a delight, always greeted us with a smile to start each day. Hotel otherwise had standard amenities but reception fulfilled all of our requests.

Aa I said everybody was excellent. From the cleaning service to the service people and reception. No complaints and definitely recommending the hotel to everyone that goes to Lisbon. Definitely will come back to this hotel. Thank you for everything and hope you the best!

Lovely small hotel just off Liberdade, a short walk to the seafront with dozens of touristy shops and restaurants, close to two metro stations and a short (uphill) walk to Corte Ingles store (if you’re not familiar with it, it’s a Spanish chain, upscale, excellent clothes choices). Also close to the Calouste Gulbenkian Museum with one of the most remarkable private art collections ever assembled and the most beautiful park around it.

Very pleasant hotel, excellent service,and location, just a few more furnitures in rooms,would be convenient, excellent breakfast with good  products, quality remains as I have been staying at this hotel for many years

This is an excellent hotel in a quiet location just off Avenida Liberdade but only a few minutes walk from most attractions. The room was clean .and comfortable. Breakfast was excellent and the food in the restaurant was tasty. The front desk staff were all friendly and helpful. I really enjoy staying in this hotel when I am in Lisbon.

I enjoyed the frienlyness and helful ness of the staff.  The breakfast were all very good.  The rooms were quiet and clean. The location was also very good for us.  I woulsd stay again if nesessary and recomend it to others.

I spent 4 nights at Vincci Liberdade Hotel where I was warmly welcomed. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful. The housekeeping team cleaned and made my bed daily in check-in condition. The restaurant staff were welcoming and the lunch menu was of good value and superb quality which exceeded my expectation. The surroundings are quiet and peaceful despite being in a convenient location. I highly recommend this hotel.

I was on a business trip and will come back with pleasure to Lisbon staying at this hotel. It is really well located and the staff is really friendly, welcoming, and professional. I will come back with pleasure, hopefully spending more time and enjoying the restaurant facilities. Thank you

We went on a couples weekend and we can really recommend this hotel. It is near the city center, you are in walking distance of almost everything. There are good place to run in the morning nearby. The room are clean, nice and the comfort of the bed is excellent. The personal is very helpful and nice.

We stayed at the Vincci Liberdade Hotel in Lisbon from Jan 27th to 29th.   From the moment we arrived the hotel staff went above & beyond their call of duty to make our stay most enjoyable & memorable.   They are all amazing so courteous, friendly ,knowledgeable & very helpful.They are always available to tend to their guests queries & needs.   The hotel is lovely & clean & the ambiance is just so relaxing .  The bar & restaurant are very inviting with great food & drinks & a very friendly efficient service. Breakfast was out of this world.   I will definitely go back & I will be recommending this hotel to my family & friends.   It's location is outstanding ,so very convenient & close to city centre.

Huge and comfortable bed. The breakfast was delicious, buffet style with warm items a la carte. Lovely restaurant. Good base to explore Lisbon.  Staff were friendly but more important extremely competent.

Just back from a 4 night stay in Vincci Liberdade and had a wonderful time.   The hotel is located just of the Avenida de Liberdade, with a 5 minute walk to either Marques da Pombal or Avenida metro stations. Rossio square is around a 15/20 minute walk and Praça do Comércio is about a 30 minute walk from the hotel.   We stayed in a lovely double room on the 4th floor. The room was spacious and clean, had a large comfortable bed, a nespresso machine, minibar and safe. We also had two small balconies in the room. The bathroom was perfect too with two sinks and a large rainfall shower.  The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and really try their best to ensure you enjoy your stay. On the first evening we were sent up complimentary  sweets, ginger ale, a small

Excellent hotel.  Room of high standard with very good bed and very clean. Breakfast with everything one can wish, fresh products and everything available, even if you arrive a bit late. Special mention for the staff.  I usualy don't write reviews but this for this staff I have to make an exception. There friendlyness is so natural, you can see they love to  make you feel good. Special mention for the bartender,he's not only friendly and charming but also a professional in serving wine and port.  I've been staying  in 4 stars hotels and 5 stars hotels. For me this hotel is the ideal combination of a 5 star quality without the obligated 5 star stifness. We'll be visiting here again for sure!

Vincci is excellent, the rooms, service, location - everything is very well done. Important for me, the beds are very nice. It is hard to get nice beds in a lot of European cities, this one is just right. This was a last-minute stay - did not spend a lot of time there outside of sleeping, reasonable room rate during downtime, highly recommend for this area.

The staff go out of their way to meet your needs. We were there on vacation from Friday December 20th to Monday December 23rd. The staff is very friendly and supportive. They are well trained in customer service.

We really enjoyed the hotel.  It was very clean.  The rooms were well equipped.  We also particularly noticed the light control from bed.  The staff at the reception were very helpful and friendly.  On our next trip to Lisbon we will definitely come back to the Inspira.  Thank you for the nice weekend.

Looking from th outside, the hotel seems small, but what a surprise to discover the smart, big and clean hotel it is! Staff is very nice and the rooms are cosy. It is in the city center and easy to walk everywhere.

We stayed at the Inspira Liberdade in late November. The location is great and the hotel staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. The room (a corner suite on the first floor) was absolutely huge and incredibly good value for money given its size. The hotel was immaculately clean and offered excellent walking access to some of the most popular areas of Lisbon. And in addition to all this there were free sweets available in the lobby!!! We will absolutely stay here again when we next visit this wonderful city.

Just spent 3 pleasant nights at Inspira Liberdade. The hotel is well located and offers easy access to downtown. We were checked in by Gonzalas who was very nice, friendly and gave us lots of information on getting around and things to try. Despite my many questions he was patient and always had a smile. Although Gonzalas was 5star…the hotel fell short of this. I like unusual hotel rooms but I agree with some of the other reviews on the design flaws with the walk-in shower, very dim lighting in toilet and inadequate extraction for unwanted smells. I was also looking forward to the steam room, sauna and jacuzzi but these were a let down as there was no steam, sauna not very hot and jacuzzi lukewarm with no working jets. For 3nights it was ok….for longer stay, I’d want a little

I was quite surprised when I saw they had wall to wall carpet in the bathroom and inside the toilet room. Not surprisingly, the smell of urine in the toilet room was quite present  Apart from that, the hotel was very nice.

We really enjoyed the hotel.  It was very clean.  The rooms were well equipped.  We also particularly noticed the light control from bed.  The staff at the reception were very helpful and friendly.  On our next trip to Lisbon we will definitely come back to the Inspira.  Thank you for the nice weekend.

Looking from th outside, the hotel seems small, but what a surprise to discover the smart, big and clean hotel it is! Staff is very nice and the rooms are cosy. It is in the city center and easy to walk everywhere.

We stayed at the Inspira Liberdade in late November. The location is great and the hotel staff were extremely welcoming and helpful. The room (a corner suite on the first floor) was absolutely huge and incredibly good value for money given its size. The hotel was immaculately clean and offered excellent walking access to some of the most popular areas of Lisbon. And in addition to all this there were free sweets available in the lobby!!! We will absolutely stay here again when we next visit this wonderful city.

Just spent 3 pleasant nights at Inspira Liberdade. The hotel is well located and offers easy access to downtown. We were checked in by Gonzalas who was very nice, friendly and gave us lots of information on getting around and things to try. Despite my many questions he was patient and always had a smile. Although Gonzalas was 5star…the hotel fell short of this. I like unusual hotel rooms but I agree with some of the other reviews on the design flaws with the walk-in shower, very dim lighting in toilet and inadequate extraction for unwanted smells. I was also looking forward to the steam room, sauna and jacuzzi but these were a let down as there was no steam, sauna not very hot and jacuzzi lukewarm with no working jets. For 3nights it was ok….for longer stay, I’d want a little

I was quite surprised when I saw they had wall to wall carpet in the bathroom and inside the toilet room. Not surprisingly, the smell of urine in the toilet room was quite present  Apart from that, the hotel was very nice.

This is my 3rd trip to Lisbon and I was happy to find the Inspira Liberdade Hotel which had been recommended by my nieces. The hotel is modern, clean and super well located 2-mins off Avda. Liberdade walking. There is room service and a great lobby restaurant and bar. Clientele was young tech executives mainly and some tourists. The front desk staff were always helpful and very lovely. For those renting a car, there is a garage underneath. Would definitely stay here again.

Breakfast was very monotonous, the same every day. The breakfast staff is understaffed. The staff barely manages to clear the tables and you have to wait longer, up to 20 minutes, until the tables are cleaned and you can have breakfast. The solution with the open bathroom is not optimal. When you shower, the water splashes to the head of the double bed and you can't shut off the toilet. This led to embarrassing situations during the night.

We felt safe and enjoyed exploring the city from the hotels good location. The staff was always helpful, efficient and pleasant. The front desk kindly printed our COVID test results for us. They were also helpful with directions and recommendations for restaurants. The kitchen and bar were closed, but we did enjoy the hearty breakfast. The fresh orange juice and scones were delicious  The room we had was a bit tight but workable. The sliding glass door that serves as the main bathroom door and closet door made the room awkward. You couldn’t access the closet, safe etc. without closing the bathroom door…and when we would open the bathroom door without knowing the other person was in the closet we crashed a couple times. Not a big deal, but a definite design flaw. Bathroom was

The customer service (front desk) was fantastic. I really appreciate their attentiveness. I thought the breakfast was a tad over price to have more than one day but it was very enjoyable during my first day. The remainder of my meals where at the local restaurants. There were so many great places to eat within walking distance.  I love the décor of the hotel. And you can't beat getting daily free parking!!  There is only one thing I would ask them to change and that would be to change the lighting at the front of the hotel from boring white lights to lavender color light bulbs.  Could be as easy as replacing the glass coverings. The purple/lavender light will really make the hotel look more attractive (and romantic) at night time. It would be the only hotel like that the

Well situated luxury hotel with excellent facilities. Room was very spacieus with a touch of design. Breakfast was perfect. Friendly personel. Service of reception desk was adequate. Overall a comfortable hotel for one or more nights.

We had a great time in Lisboa, the hotel is from walking distance to some of the main attraction in the city. The streets nearby are full of nice and local eatery and international shops I would go back in a heart beat !

Inspira Liberdade provided an excellent room in a location with easy access to Lisbon. The staff was very helpful, and provided a room with a desk when the first room lacked one. The breakfast included an abundance of options, and the bartender offered excellent recommendations for a relaxing drink.

The most conscious structure we found in Lisbon regarding celiac people and environment. Only flaw was .... the restaurant was closed (this is the only reason I put "poor" on service) and we had to search for gluten free food outside (not easy at all in Lisbon. Nicely designed and comfortable . We don't usually watch TV but as it was not working we couldn't access to the hotel menu and price list for spa, and all the information which is usually printed on paper...(so "average" on rooms) On the other side, the people at the desk were the nicest and more helpful that I have encountered since a long time!

Very confortable hôtel ,very professional receptionist , Very confortable Room ,dirty breakfast too noisy .excellent stay we will be black with pleasuru on our next trip toi Lisbonne . We recommend thaïs hôtel to our friends .

Great hotel. Amazing staff, they go above and beyond. The hotel is really nice and the rooms were really clean. Location is not that close to sights but very easy access. Also, parking is free and the lot is right next to the hotel.

Our stay at Inspira Liberdade Boutique Hotel was for 1 night to celebrate our 9th wedding anniversary. We were welcomed with sparkling wine and chocolate mousse, they were delicious. We didn't drink it all as it wasn't our favourite type of sparkling wine. It was a lovely and quiet night. The breakfast was delicious, and although they don't have Eggs Royale on the menu, they made them for us, and they were wonderful. We don't give the 5 stars as there were no instructions for connecting the smartphone to the room's sound system, and the shower head had a problem which led to some of the water coming out of the pipes and not the shower head.  We could not fail to thank the impeccable hotel staff as they provided us with a special night and morning. THANK YOU VERY MUCH! How nice

I found Inspira Liberdade from booking.com and I looked to their own website if they have any offer. The offer was really great, breakfast and parking included at the same price where booking.com has the room and without paying!  So, in terms of price was really great.  We arrived and the staff at the reception was really helpful with excellent English.  The room also was really clean with excellent ametities.  TV infotrainment system needs to be upgraded, was freezing lots of times.  About breakfast, everything was inadequate. We are in covid era, but I would prefer a buffet with everything in bag/covered. The offered breeakfast was poor with little quantities (one small piece of cake for a couple for example) with only a few typical european things, nothing

Great staff, nice breakfast. Felt welcome and appreciated. Our room was good and quite, the bed was nice. The only contra for me is the airco that somehow I could not shut down in the night and delivers me a sort of headache in the morning. Otherwise I can recommend the hotel to everyone who wants to experience Lisbon from the centre. The parking included on site, is also an important plus in Lisbon.

Incredible experience at this hotel. The room was modern, bright, well-designed, comfortable and elegant. The rainfall shower with a waterfall drain (unique design I've never seen before) made it mandatory to enjoy the shower daily. Lobby is expansive, spacious and impressive, with a contemporary use of wood beams lining a gorgeous marble staircase. You'd never know what was waiting inside from the entrance on the street.   Service was excellent! Staff was accommodating, helpful, friendly, informative, patient, polite and pleasant in all instances. Felt like a welcome place to come "home" to while in Lisbon. Advice from staff and recommendations for sites were stellar and accurate. Everyone went above and beyond expectations!  Value at this hotel is substantial: great location

Hotel is nice, modern and well maintained. The only bad point would be the noise of door slapping, could be something to do here. The location is ideal close to the biggest avenue in Lisbon and car park that isn't difficult to enter/park. Breakfast is good, and well adapt with the Covid rules.  I will return for sure.

After staying a few nights, we had such a  wonderful time, we ended up  changing plans and came back for another stay. It was such a nice experience, EVERYONE at the hotel was  incredibly helpful, friendly, and made us feel almost as if we were at home! This is a unique place, managed by people who really care about what they do. I can only say this is a place not to miss.  I know I will come back again.

I enjoyed a stay at this hotel for two nights as part of a business meeting. The staff were excellent and accommodating, the room was well set up and comfortable. We are in the restaurant for lunch and dinner and it was a pleasant experience. I would stay again at this hotel if I was visiting.

It’s a modern and very friendly hotel with great amenities. The breakfast is very complete and the whole staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Also the garage is very good and important to have there. It will be ‘my’ hotel in Lisbon from now on.

My family and I have visited your hotel many times since 2018 and enjoy its beautiful design and central location. The rooms are comfortable - firm beds and powerful walk-in showers. Your food is excellent and your dinners rank, in my opinion, as the finest food in Lisbon! The real reason we return, however are your friendly and very helpful staff who create a welcoming environment while offering a superb, professional service.

Absolutely fascinated by hotel interior. Staff is lovely. Food was delicious. We enjoyed it!  City is breathtaking. Love every corner of it. Must visit: Alfama, Time Out Market, ride the tram 28, Sintra, etc.

While the hotel is centrally located and the room offer a decent amount of amenities. My experience at the Brown Central Hotel was tainted by staff's indifference attitude. I made a reservation via my amex platinum for a full/queen bed in superior double room. Upon check in, the staff claim I have requested a double room which I didn't. Once that issue was clear, they ask if my husband was staying with me at the hotel that we needed 1 bed. That really made me and my husband super uncomfortable considering Portugal is a pretty open country. After that incident, I notice little things here and there that the staff never say thank you or you welcome when you thank you for giving your key. They never asked how was my stay at check out or even a simple thank you for staying with us.

I was delighted to find the location in the middle of everything.  I booked the Brown Hotel, but was upgraded to the Brown Central Hotel.  The front desk staff are respectful and helpful. The room was big and well appointed with a large bathroom.   The only thing I did not like was the dark room, dark hallway, dark stairwell.  When I was there, the auto light did not go on in the stairwell and it was not only scary but dangerous. Hopefully this is fixed.  The black out shades did not open, there was no way to get light in the room.

We arrived very late (11 pm) and checked in without issue.  Room service was not available but our Junior Suite had Tea and Coffee making facilities and limited Mini Bar.  The room was stylish and the bed very comfortable.  The room overlooked quite a busy thoroughfare and was opposite another Hotel which was rather lively at night.  The Hotel is extremely well located, not far from the sea front and not far from the main Square.   The breakfast buffet was adequate offering a selection of hot food, pastries, cereal, yogurt and randomly green beans!  Cheese, tomato, sliced turkey were also available. Coffee excellent.  Staff friendly and helpful and Covid measures in place although no one seemed to take much notice of the “one way” system and not everyone followed the wearing a

Very helpful and friendly staff and great location . Room was lovely , clean and well equipped . Bed very comfortable. No view from room as window looked out directly onto another building but at least was quiet. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. Would definitely go again.

Our third time of staying and this place just gets better. Ideally placed in the Baixa for all the sights of Lisbon, the hotel has marvellous, modern, comfortable runs. Cleanliness is absolutely fantastic.  The beds are excellent and guaranteed to give a good night sleep. The lounge and bar area are really comfortable, pleasant places to be, and remind me of Rock's Cafe in Casablanca.  Breakfasts are of very high quality. But surpassing everything are the staff, who are polite, friendly, informed and very, very helpful.

While the hotel is centrally located and the room offer a decent amount of amenities. My experience at the Brown Central Hotel was tainted by staff's indifference attitude. I made a reservation via my amex platinum for a full/queen bed in superior double room. Upon check in, the staff claim I have requested a double room which I didn't. Once that issue was clear, they ask if my husband was staying with me at the hotel that we needed 1 bed. That really made me and my husband super uncomfortable considering Portugal is a pretty open country. After that incident, I notice little things here and there that the staff never say thank you or you welcome when you thank you for giving your key. They never asked how was my stay at check out or even a simple thank you for staying with us.

I was delighted to find the location in the middle of everything.  I booked the Brown Hotel, but was upgraded to the Brown Central Hotel.  The front desk staff are respectful and helpful. The room was big and well appointed with a large bathroom.   The only thing I did not like was the dark room, dark hallway, dark stairwell.  When I was there, the auto light did not go on in the stairwell and it was not only scary but dangerous. Hopefully this is fixed.  The black out shades did not open, there was no way to get light in the room.

We arrived very late (11 pm) and checked in without issue.  Room service was not available but our Junior Suite had Tea and Coffee making facilities and limited Mini Bar.  The room was stylish and the bed very comfortable.  The room overlooked quite a busy thoroughfare and was opposite another Hotel which was rather lively at night.  The Hotel is extremely well located, not far from the sea front and not far from the main Square.   The breakfast buffet was adequate offering a selection of hot food, pastries, cereal, yogurt and randomly green beans!  Cheese, tomato, sliced turkey were also available. Coffee excellent.  Staff friendly and helpful and Covid measures in place although no one seemed to take much notice of the “one way” system and not everyone followed the wearing a

Very helpful and friendly staff and great location . Room was lovely , clean and well equipped . Bed very comfortable. No view from room as window looked out directly onto another building but at least was quiet. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. Would definitely go again.

Our third time of staying and this place just gets better. Ideally placed in the Baixa for all the sights of Lisbon, the hotel has marvellous, modern, comfortable runs. Cleanliness is absolutely fantastic.  The beds are excellent and guaranteed to give a good night sleep. The lounge and bar area are really comfortable, pleasant places to be, and remind me of Rock's Cafe in Casablanca.  Breakfasts are of very high quality. But surpassing everything are the staff, who are polite, friendly, informed and very, very helpful.

The staff at the Brown Central Hotel was SO nice! Miguel was especially so accommodating to our needs. Originally we had a very small room, and we asked him if we could get a bigger room and he was able to make that happen. The room was at the top floor and had an AMAZING view. The room was also nicely decorated, very cozy.  Also, when I needed to print out some documents for travel, the front desk staff let me use their computers to do so. Everyone who worked there were amazing. The bar also had really good drinks and there was outdoor seating. The hotel itself was in a GREAT location. Right in the middle of downtown Lisbon and there were so many restaurants and shops around the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay here again.

In the heart of Lisbon, perfectly placed for all areas.  This is a small, stylish, well-managed, friendly hotel, with well-sized and appointed, comfortable rooms and efficient bathrooms.  Good breakfast.

I was here for two nights. The hotel was fine, small room, which is normal for the area. My room did have a small table which I was able to rearrange the coffee maker and lamp and use as a working desk. Bathroom was nice. The room decorations where eclectic and kind of cute. I could not figure out how to use the Fender music station. Wifi was ok, but SHOULD be secured. it was open Wifi. TV could not receive BBC or CNN or a few other international channels, but hey, in Lisbon, there are other things to do rather than watch TV right!. Also, the door was EXTREMELY hard to open. So I asked the front desk clerk and he gave me instructions which worked. I opted for their breakfast one morning, was nothing special for me. There were some fruits and some pastries that were ok. You had

Booked the hotel for a work group attending a conference at FIL. First trip out after the pandemic so wanted to make everyone comfortable, which was achieved extremely well by Browns Central.  Rooms well equipped, friendly staff, decent breakfast and that free cocktail the first night went down very well.  The location was great for everything, including metro and bike hire from Rossio square.

We are in the midst of a pandemic and when medical challenges arise - you would expect a hotel to understand. We made a reservation 1 day prior and tried to cancel due to the covid and they said pay 100%. Heartless and soulless.

They cancelled our booking but still haven’t refunded our money, £881 complete con and they don’t respond to phone calls or email. I appreciate times are hard but this is not on. They should have someone dealing with this.

We stayed here for a week while in Lisbon, the hotel staff were all super helpful and friendly. Checked us in with no problems and we’re always there to offer a friendly greeting!  Our room was spectacular, there was everything we needed and more! To intoning broads to coffee machines!   I would highly recommend staying here, it’s within walking distance of all major tourists attractions, great drinks in their bar and super comfy!

Hotel is centrally located within walking distance of almost all tourist attractions. Room was well equipped. Due to COVID, breakfast only served in the room at no additional charge. Worked all week in the cafetaria with a limited noise nuisance due to music but otherwise had a very comfy stay.

The location of this hotel is ideal to explore the most important attractions Lisbon has to offer on foot. Connection to public transportation is great as well. The rooms, though they are quite small, are beautifully decorated and have everything one needs. Most of all, the staff at the reception were lovely and helpful for any query one might have. Would definitely stay there again!

They have gone all in to be a real genuine design hotel, and they have successfully manged the task. Very fresh rooms, and especial the bath, with a lot of toys, plenty of details and decorations. But not so big...at all. High standard on everything though. Very good location, but on a very touristic street but a few streets away it calms down. And thank god for that. Plenty of really good places to eat and drink just in the local neighborhood. Breakfast was decent and staff quick responsive and helpful. Have tried a few Browns and this is at the top. Recomended and may return.

We had a long weekend at this hotel and it was just wonderful.  We were 5th floor in a fantastic attic room ... very clean and spacious.  It had lots of little personal touches that you do not get in many hotels.  The breakfast was good.  The hotel bar staff are fabulous and very attentive ... I recommend the spiced margarita 👍. The location is very central and most areas are walkable.  Loved it ... will stay again on our next visit to lovely Lisbon 👏👏

We chose this for the location, but it was wonderful in every way -- clean, comfortable,   pleasant, sophisticated but not pretentious; super- helpful staff gave us great recommendations for restaurants, fado, everything.  Couldn't have been more delighted with our stay.

The location of this hotel is excellent. The rooms are quite small but nicely appointed. The corridors are painted black, so bring a flashlight! The breakfast is excellent. The staff is friendly and helpful. Personally, I would go for something with more natural light as I found this hotel too dark for my tastes. It's really not a good choice for children or the very elderly. One poor women was completely befuddled by the clever light switches and found the black corridors very confusing, as did I after a couple of drinks from the famous bar.

Just returned from the browns central hotel in lisbon where me and my family stayed for 4 nights, I've stayed here on two other occasions prior to this trip but i can honestly say that I won't be staying here again nor recommending to any family or friends. Unfortunately we arrived in lisbon under difficult circumstances as the coronavirus was starting to escalate, therefore the hotel had started to put things in place to help avoid the spreading of the virus, ie hand sanitizer in the reception area and dining room and asking people to only sit 2 persons to a table and at every other table. On our arrival we had to wait for our room to be cleaned so we sat in the bar area having a drink, we all sat around a table only for my partners son being told abruptly by a member of the

Great stay at Browns Central Hotel. A couple of minutes walk from the Metro station, buses and trams a short walk away too. The reception staff who greeted us were very welcoming and friendly. We were offered a free welcome drink to have at our own convenience. Lovely clean room with everything you’d need. The breakfast room was excellent with hot buffet style food, cereals, continental meats, croissants etc. Very polite and professional breakfast/bar staff. We loved the comfortable relaxed style of the lounge/bar area. This was our first time in Portugal and Lisbon to celebrate my wife’s birthday and Browns hotel helped make it a very memorable experience. Wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.

For sure it’s central located and only a five minute walk from my office when I’m in Lisbon, but I won’t be staying there again. It’s nowhere near four star quality, starting from some of the rudest front desk folks I’ve encountered. After four nights there and checking out, the only thing the front desk woman said to me was “eight euros” which is how much I owed in hotel fees apparently.  Even though it was 70 degrees out, they still ran the heat all day which meant I had to open the window at night and listen to noisy streets. I was told to deal with it by front desk and they don’t provide fans to guests and won’t change the central heat.  Can’t say enough about the adversarial and rude folks up front, I’d otherwise say that it’s a decent place for the price and the breakfast

The name of this hotel says it all, it really is centrally located in a great location of Lisbon. Near many attractions! I found it very easy to walk to places I needed to go to. I felt safe traveling solo and staying here. The hotel itself is really cute. Great decor and cleanliness. Staff is friendly and helpful. The only two negative things but minor, was that part of the lobby is under construction and there is a smell of paint in the lobby and you had to go outside or around a different way to get to the breakfast area. Also the hallways that lead to the rooms are very dimly lit and dark. There are auto sensors for the lights to turn on and sometimes there is a slight delay and you can’t really see too well in the hallways. It can be a little bit spooky if you are a female

Brown's Central was extraordinary because the staff is truly happy to see you.  They carry through with immediate reactions to your odd questions like, "Does Iberian Airlines hang up on you when you try to change a reservation?"  Then, they help get the issue resolved.   Brown's Central is deliberately decorated and comfortable.   I do believe we will return not just to Portugal, but to one the three (3) Brown's designer hotels in Lisbon.

Very well located hotel, rooms fitted to a high standard and very clean, it was like going into a new room every day after housekeeping had been. Bar excellent, comfortable and not over expensive. Breakfast buffet again very good with a wide range of food  that was regularly refreshed. We had a snack type lunch at the hotel twice with food and service being very good on both occassions. A mention should be made of the quality of the staff who always have a smile, answer all questions you may have with humour and honesty and who do an excellent job. It is hard to think of anything about the hotel we did not like. This hotel in our opinion is perfect for a city break stay.

Super Hotel - 3 mins walk from metro. Middle of everything. Prices perfectly acceptable - Bottle of beer €2.50. Buffet Breakfast was superb. Reception & Bar Staff were excellent. Restaurant was not open in evenings - but snacks were available. Highly reccommended.

Extremely friendly and professional staff, excellent food (especially breakfast), clean and well equipped rooms. Excellent location and very well informed concierge. Check-in staff were particularly helpful and friendly.

Third visit and it just keeps getting better and better. It's the only city hotel I use where I don't even think about exploring the city. They throw 5 stars around these days but this hotel exceeds all.  The door staff outstanding such a credit to the hotel, reception welcoming knowledgeable friendly. Breakfast best in Lisbon. Pool area quaint more like a wedding venue with a pool.  The rooms, clean fresh turn down service turns them in to home at night.  Rooftop bar and SEEN only place to be in Lisbon at night food incredible as are the drinks, staff made me feel like royalty, I was there 6 nights in a row.  Sad to leave ill be back real soon. Keep up the tremendous work, solo traveller made to feel like he has family and friends.

If you are looking for a fun City break, where you are surrouned by all the hot spots...Across the road  you will find a theater, if you fancy a little shopping then you are in the mix of all the best designer shops, amazing 5 Star restaurants and then you can settle in a Beautiful and comfortable hotel.

The hotel is in a perfect location.  The hotel food in the restaurant and room service was very fresh and tasty.   The newly remodeled suites are extremely nice have all the up to date amenities.  The hotel staff is exceptional.  The front desk team is very helpful and knowledgeable and the Concierge team is exceptional and goes above and beyond to assist with any needs to make your trip memorable.  Flora the Concierge is exceptional.

This location of this hotel is amazing. During my stay I literally walked everywhere, or I would just get on the subway which is on the same block to reach where I needed to be. I will come back soon.

Extremely friendly and professional staff, excellent food (especially breakfast), clean and well equipped rooms. Excellent location and very well informed concierge. Check-in staff were particularly helpful and friendly.

Third visit and it just keeps getting better and better. It's the only city hotel I use where I don't even think about exploring the city. They throw 5 stars around these days but this hotel exceeds all.  The door staff outstanding such a credit to the hotel, reception welcoming knowledgeable friendly. Breakfast best in Lisbon. Pool area quaint more like a wedding venue with a pool.  The rooms, clean fresh turn down service turns them in to home at night.  Rooftop bar and SEEN only place to be in Lisbon at night food incredible as are the drinks, staff made me feel like royalty, I was there 6 nights in a row.  Sad to leave ill be back real soon. Keep up the tremendous work, solo traveller made to feel like he has family and friends.
