The hotel is in a perfect location.  The hotel food in the restaurant and room service was very fresh and tasty.   The newly remodeled suites are extremely nice have all the up to date amenities.  The hotel staff is exceptional.  The front desk team is very helpful and knowledgeable and the Concierge team is exceptional and goes above and beyond to assist with any needs to make your trip memorable.  Flora the Concierge is exceptional.

This location of this hotel is amazing. During my stay I literally walked everywhere, or I would just get on the subway which is on the same block to reach where I needed to be. I will come back soon.

Had an amazing experience at "Seen", the food was delicious and so was the view. Very beautiful hotel! Every staff member helped us along the way and we had no problems whatsoever to get food, drinks, roo service, etc

After two decades of business travel, COVID and the lockdowns put a complete pause on all that.  My first trip since the lockdown was to Lisbon for the LHW Annual Convention, where I stayed at the Tivoli.  What a great property (rooms, rest and bars)  and amazing staff!  Mr. Pablo González was fantastic, a true hospitality professional.    Highly recommend the Tivoli if you're in Lisbon!

The one-star is specifically for the breakfast service. The buffet was amazing. Everything else in Liberdade was not.   The rooms were relatively small for the value, and the appliances were subpar. I was using the hair dryer and it kept turning off so I called the front desk. Instead of bringing me a working dryer, they told me to hold on to the cold button so it would keep running. I would expect a 5 star hotel to provide a working blow dryer so I didn't have to dry my hair with cold air. Even worse, our safe had a low battery issue and would not let us open to get our passports. We had to call twice to have an attendant come up to our room to open the safe with a master key. This was especially stressful as we were trying to catch a train to Porto. We barely made it on to the

Although we didn't stay at the Tivoli (unfortunately), we visited their Lobby Bar several times during our visit to Lisbon since our hotel didn't have a bar.  Very comfortable and elegant location for a cocktail and lunch.  Food and drinks were excellent.  Plus the service from Samuel was exceptional and friendly.  Stop in and say hello!!!

This hotel is absolutely fantastic. The smiley door lady who greets you when you arrive, pedro from the breakfast room who cannot do enough for you and a huge special mention to the bar staff Bruno, irina, and Andre who are so warm and engaging we love speaking to them all everyday when we go to visit, thier local knowledge o the city and knowledge on the food ans beverage is just fantastic. If I missed anyone’s name on the bar I apologise but everyone on shift from the day we checked in Sunday has just been amazing!  I’m not sure why this hotel gets bad reviews, each to thier own. From my side tne hotel team are very warm and engaging and they should have a very proud General Manager.  Sarah xx

I want to start with the positive. When you arrive at the hotel you are received incredibly well. People help with the bag and you get a lot of info at the reception about everything that is in the hotel. That's about where the good service ends. Then it went downhill fast. The room has no sound insulation at all and you can hear both neighbors and people outside. So if you are easy to wake up, you will wake up. It can certainly be different from room to room.  I had plans to celebrate my birthday at the hotel. My plan was to order some sparkling wine for the room but I got info that it would be included because Its my birthday. I thought this sounded great so I did not order anything. Once my birthday was over, I got nothing. Not even a congratulatory card. I went down to the

This review is long overdue. I stayed stayed here with my mother before leaving for a Viking river cruise for my Mom's 75th in March 2019-before the world turned upside down. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed and the rooftop bar was great! I imagine it's even more spectacular with the recent renovations. We especially enjoyed having cocktails at the Lobby Bar. If Samuel, Ruben or Volodymyr are still bartending at the Lobby Bar, you will enjoy the drinks they prepare and  conversing with them. If not, you will still enjoy the laid back, yet elegant ambience. Even if you don't stay at the hotel, it's worth it to have a cocktail in the lobby or rooftop bar.

In the past ten years my wife and I have stayed in Lisbon four times, each time at a different hotel. Tivoli is without a doubt upscale but I found the Intercontinental rooms equal to Tivoli and it’s location across from the park offers pleasant views. Tivoli has an outstanding breakfast and is priced accordingly. The room was smaller than at two other hotels, with some evident minor wear and tear on the furnishings. Given the cost I know we’ll stay at another hotel we enjoy on our next visit. Each to his own.

Our 2-night stay at the Tivoli was excellent.  We ate at their restaurant the first night for a delicious meal.  The room we had was large and nicely furnished, with good lighting.  Staff was very friendly, and location was fine for what we wanted to see and do.

My wife and i completed a very nice and relaxing two night stay at the Tivoli. Wonderful and welcoming as ever. Bellmen first rate, concierge super helpful, room (upgraded to Executive Suite) was the best. Breakfast was a  great way to start, rooftop bar a beautiful place to have a drink. All in all, superlative hotel in every respect. I missed Thelma this time as well as Gonzalo but will see them soon

Really nice hotel perfected located close to the old Town.  First:, the staff are amazing and very friendly.  So helpful and professional.  The concierge Flora gets an extra star from us.  Second: the rooms a very nice, clean and the beds are very comfortable.  Third: the breakfast is really nice and contains of everything you need. And they have a Egg-chef. Fourth: restaurand Seen and a roof top bar. Really great food with a stunning view. Will stay here again

Stayed here from 22-26th of Septembre. Had an excellent stay in this hotel. Really enjoyed the breakfast and off course the pool area. Level of service is outstanding. Special thanks to conciërge Flora, she had great tips for sightseeing and restaurants.

Had an absolutely incredible stay at the Tivoli. The staff was extremely helpful and accommodating, the location is perfect, right in downtown Lisbon in the middle of shops, restaurants, and walking distance to multiple historic sites. Would highly recommend.

Absolutely love this hotel. We were greeted and welcomed warmly. Every single question we had was generously explained. Victor the manager was a genuinely kind and welcoming man. Magnificent massages with Katarina in the most beautiful and peaceful spa. Beautiful round pool outside with good drinks and snacks and service. Bartender Flavio - made the best drinks with a smile and kindness. Breakfast - included with every healthy fruit and fresh juices. And yummy decadent food tooo!  Maid service with a smile and firm cozy beds. Thank you everybody at Tivoli, the people made all the difference. Ricardo and Sofia at desk: perfect attitude!

The concierge helped reunite my friend with her phone (which had been left in a taxi in Porto). She went above and beyond and it was so appreciated! The twin room we had was a good size and very comfortable and the gym and pool were lovely. Lots of things within walking distance but the subway system is also very easy to use.

The hotel has left both positive and negative impressions.   I was warmly and efficiently greeted by the Front Office Manager and found the guest service and valet receptionists to be quite friendly and efficient. The house keeping, on the other hand, was borderline rude and dismissive and would remind us that they were working on fixed schedules should we request anything out of the textbook.  The rooms are spacious and fairly comfortable, though the signs of wear and tear were noticeable and the hotel could probably use some renovations.  The hotel has a superb bar and restaurant at the rooftop. However, the hotel fails miserably at controlling both the queues in the lift and the overall atmosphere of the hotel’s common areas with so many people visiting - and that is

The hotel was a mixed bag. The location was great, the staff friendly and the breakfast was very good. The gym was also very well kitted out.   However, I feel that perhaps it was overpriced. The rooms were okay although there wasn't much ventilation in the bathroom. It didn't give off a premium feeling despite it being a 5 star.   There is a sky bar and unfortunately you can hear it in your room. If you are a light sleeper it might be a problem. Also, we ordered some extra pillows multiple times but they never came which was disappointing.  So whilst overall this is a good hotel, I am not sure if it worthy of being considered luxury.

They have it all, exceptional service, an excellent restaurant and some of the most comfortable rooms we have stayed in. Everyone we met treated us like family from the front desk to the staff in the restaurant where the food is outstanding. The room was spacious and well appointed. We especially enjoyed the very comfortable beds and turn down service. The roof top bars is not to be missed. It has a spectacular view of the city. Will definitely return.

This is a gem of a Hotel in the heart of Lisbon. It's discrete and comfortable.  Every time we came back and sat in the lobby area, we were in awe of the space and how it relaxed & revived us as a group of four. The level of service is professional and top notch.

Warm and welcoming service.  The entire team are with esteemed professionals who took pride in what they do and will make your stay in Lisbon at once relaxing and inviting.  Their attention to detail such asa welcome fruits & snack along with refreshment both times we checked-in made us smile and grateful for the thoughtfulness.

We had the most beautyful wedding night possible in Pestana Palace Lisbon! Everything was just perfect and even better than we imagined it. All Team Members did their outmost to make this evening so special: From the organisation by Paulo, to the waiters that night that provided a First Class Service up to the bellboy who immediately knew who we were on arrival. The food was excellent and came fast and hot to all guests, an amazing work by the kitchen. Thank you all very much for making this an unforgettable night for us! Obrigado

Although a little bit out of the city centre, it is close to the biggest congress center, and in between the city center en Belem. Situated in a magnificent building. Very friendly staff. No request was too much, and staff remained professional in every situation.

This beautiful classic hotel has great details from the era it has been build. This gives a wealthy and rich atmosphere. It  is located in a quiet part of Lisbon, close to the riverside and center. I have stayed here before and will gladly come back

A whistle stop 4 days with the family was made even better by the incredibly kind and attentive staff at the Pestana Palace. We felt so welcomed, and our business felt genuinely appreciated. The cleanliness was faultless, ditto the help and guidance on trips, restaurants etc.

The Palace gives you the feeling of living like a royalty while the staff attitude is warm and friendly. They go above and beyond to make you feel you are at home with everything they can from Joel the doorman to receptionist and the knowledgable bar tenders that educate you about how to properly drink proto! lol

We had the most beautyful wedding night possible in Pestana Palace Lisbon! Everything was just perfect and even better than we imagined it. All Team Members did their outmost to make this evening so special: From the organisation by Paulo, to the waiters that night that provided a First Class Service up to the bellboy who immediately knew who we were on arrival. The food was excellent and came fast and hot to all guests, an amazing work by the kitchen. Thank you all very much for making this an unforgettable night for us! Obrigado

Although a little bit out of the city centre, it is close to the biggest congress center, and in between the city center en Belem. Situated in a magnificent building. Very friendly staff. No request was too much, and staff remained professional in every situation.

This beautiful classic hotel has great details from the era it has been build. This gives a wealthy and rich atmosphere. It  is located in a quiet part of Lisbon, close to the riverside and center. I have stayed here before and will gladly come back

A whistle stop 4 days with the family was made even better by the incredibly kind and attentive staff at the Pestana Palace. We felt so welcomed, and our business felt genuinely appreciated. The cleanliness was faultless, ditto the help and guidance on trips, restaurants etc.

The Palace gives you the feeling of living like a royalty while the staff attitude is warm and friendly. They go above and beyond to make you feel you are at home with everything they can from Joel the doorman to receptionist and the knowledgable bar tenders that educate you about how to properly drink proto! lol

room is avarage, price is very expensive but room is not luxury, they have a application that you order via app but not work well, my spa request not arrived spa personel, i just luckly find appointment because one people canceled.Otherwise if you order any order for your room service also water they charge extra 7.5 euro/per order,its too expensive, ı never seen this kind of extra in other hotel. But Spa therapist was perfect hand....

Very comfortable rooms with view on the beautiful garden of an aristocratic palace (between neo-baroque style ans liberty);  nice amenties in the rooms ; very good breakfast served in  large lounge or outside on the terraces  dominating the exotic garden (just one point : it would be better to serve a tea of another brand) ; a modern spa and  a large swimming pool complete the picture.

We were so pleased with the hotel, staff, food & beverages.  The pool area was beautiful and the hotel was gorgeous.  Cocktails & food were excellent.  The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating.  My family & I can’t wait to visit Lisbon and the Pestana Palace Lisboa again.

Following suggestion by a Portuguese friend, we went to this wonderful hotel. Excellent location between downtown and Belem area. Staff very kind and aware to meet guests' wishes. Beautiful garden and very relaxing facilities (large terrace, spa, swimming pools, fitness room). Great breakfast buffet.

I have spent 6 days last week at the hotel attending scientific  meetings in Lisbon. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area and has a beautiful garden and pool. The staff was extremely professional, everyone wearing masks. The reception personnel checked for Covid certificates and was helpful and flexible in meeting some of my small requests. They are also well informed and helpful when it comes to directions, transfers or restauranst around. The buffet breakfast was generous as was the choice of wines at the bar. Outstanding service!

Beautiful historic hotel and gardens! Great location. Friendly, Helpful and kind staff. We enjoyed our Spa treatment very much too - excellent professionals. I would not recommend dinning in the restaurant in the evening as the service was unfortunately very poor regarding the menu variety, food preparation and its presentation, waiting time and staff training/knowledge and efficiency.

Great premises. Wonderful garden and spa. Food is excellent. Breakfast as expected.  Staff is nice and responsive.  It is about 10 minutes from the center by taxi, so not exactly within walking distance. But close to the museums and the tower of Belem. I would go there again.

The building and grounds are really beautiful, but what makes this place special is the staff.  All the staff we met were really kind and helpful - in particular, Luiza and Miguel were fantastic. On our arrival, Miguel went well out of his way to welcome us, giving us a tour of the palace and grounds, and telling us stories about the many famous guests who have stayed there. After we left, we realised we forgot an expensive personal item in the safe. Luiza and the front office staff went above and beyond to make sure that it was returned safely to us.  Thank you guys so much.

The staff at this hotel are superb.  Everyone we had contact with did a five star job, without exception.  The gardens are beautiful and well maintained.  There is an indoor and outdoor pool -- the outdoor one provides  personal service for food and drink.  There were plenty of loungers and for those who do not want to sit round the pool there are  quiet garden areas, also with loungers.  The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, the bedding was changed daily and the room cleaned to a high standard.  Breakfast was very good with a buffet choice of hot food and pastries etc.  There are tables both inside and out.  The hotel is about a 15-20 minute taxi ride from the centre, depending on traffic.  The cost was about 7 euros. Hotel staff will call a taxi and they were always

Excellent stay! Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff. We highly recommend this wonderful place, particularly the Garden Pagoda, some beautiful views of Lisbon from the main palace. The menu and food quality were perfect for this early fall time of year

Pestana Palace is the historical home of 19th century style.  It was formerly the hotel of a marquee, with original furniture. My room was in the modern part of another building.  If you want to stay at the main house, you need to book the royal suite.   I asked the staff to open a room of royal suite. Maybe one day I will return to Pestana Palace and stay in one of the royal suites, I.e on my to do list.  My room was modest size and comfortable enough.  Breakfast was at the main house and can sit outdoors.  The food was good.   The staff were efficient and polite.  The hotel is at a more quiet neighborhood.  Taxi is not expensive in Lisbon.  So it is rarely easy to take a taxi to city center or train station.  The only annoying thing was 3rd party Covid test for travel.  The

Everything was great apart settling the bill at the end.  Hotel pre-authorised (blocked the amount) for 4 separate charges on my card for room rate and 3 bar bills.  After checkout it charged another lump sump amount for the total bill without cancelling the pre-authorisations, the result is that i have 4 pending charges and the equivalent amount blocked waiting for Pestana not to claim them and expire or cancel them.  I’ve contacted the hotel by telephone and emails on the 02/01/2021  to speed up the process and cancel the pre-authorisationsand 24hours later there was no progress.  They could have simply cancelled the authorisations before charging the equivalent amount again as a separate transaction or just claim the reserved amount.  No other complaint but this saga

It’s an amazing place to stay in one of the best European capitals - Lisbon. The hotel is located inside a private park with lot of green and peace. Breakfast excellent, fully stocked wide range of options. Staff super courteous , treat you by the name. Rooms spacious, but will need some refreshing near time. Very clean and staff very conscious about COVID norms. Returning guest always when there.

Everything perfect! The palace is amazing and the exterior and the gardens perfect conditions.  Wonderful breakfast and pool. The staff super attentive and nice. All the services perfects.  I want to return.

As pretty much the only country we were "allowed" to visit, we had such a great time in Portugal.   The people we met at the hotel, in the city, everywhere were just so nice, warm and welcoming.   The team at the front desk were such a pleasure to talk to.   Pretty amazing to be so positive while being obliged to wear masks.   The service was great already but when we realised we had to fly back in a hurry - amber list/green list  issue, we panicked but the front desk team went up a gear.   The whole experience was so good that if the world does get back to normal some day, Portugal will be the first country we intend to visit.  A lot of that has to do with the team on the front desk.   Apologies for focusing so much on that.  The hotel was great too!

All perfect! I don’t want to leave! Thank you very much! Breakfast incredible, pool , palace, room, employees, no problem with the car in the garage, everything perfect! I will repeat every year at least once.

We spent ten nights at Pestana Palace.  After bleak months of Covid and bad British weather we needed a quality holiday and got it. Pestana Palace is an architectural and artistic gem, good for those seeking tranquil aesthetic surroundings.  The main building, an art nouveau palace has multiple salons inviting one to sit and enjoy  antiques and ceiling paintings.  The modern wings are cleverly designed to blend in. The pool (not huge)  is elegant, oval and set in well-maintained gardens. Pool has food and drink service and is adjacent to gym, spa and indoor pool.  Our room had highly comfortable bed with down duvets and pillows, immaculate linen, large Chinese lamps and supportive armchairs, blue and silver decor. Good water pressure and large shower head.  Hotel generally was

Absolutely fantastic!!  Party of 8 adults experienced the most wonderful time.  Staying at the Palace was truely spectacular, all staff amazing, all staff went beyond the call of duty.  They provided us with the most excellent service - nothing was too much trouble.  The Chef - what can say about the food - delicious, every meal was a work of art!  The Hotel is so beautiful and the Assistant Manager Teresa, provided us with a private tour, to learn the history of the family who owned the Palace -very interesting.  The Manager, Joana was truely a credit to Pestana - spoke to us every day, was so informative and helpful!  So proud of all her staff!   Sorry we had to leave, would have stayed another 11 days!  Cannot wait to return to all the wonderful staff at the Palace!!

We stayed at the Pestana for our familiy trip in Lisbon and loved it: magnificient place, excellent location, wonderful personnel, very calm and beautiful bedroom on the garden. We had a delightful stay, thank you so much!

We spent two days and 3 nights at the Pestana Palace in August with two teenagers.  We debated when booking whether or not we should instead book in the more central area of Lisbon, but are very glad we chose the Pastana Palace, as the pool and gardens and common areas made for a very relaxing retreat after a day of touring.  The hotel arranged for a very good restaurant nearby one night, and for a dinner with Fado another in the Alfama.  Breakfast in the morning was especially good as was the hotel service.  Taxis during our visit into the center where about 7 or 8 Euro and about 15 minutes long.  The taxi to Belem was even shorter.

This is a great place if you are looking for a nice hostel. But this last edition of the Shiadu chain is clearly cutting some corners here. The room had a bizar design with a very bad desk (made for very small people) in a dead corner, terrible lighting, leaking bathroom and sounds from the neighbours next door. The collection of bric and brac furniture is silly and looks cheap. Cleaning was not OK, background music a cheap playlist and the coffee was terrible. Maybe when the owners have earned their money, they can think about hospitality again.

Brilliant place to stay in Lisbon, walking distance to many places with great transport links for trains and trams to other locations.  Staff are very friendly.  Rooms were clean and spacious. The building is charming and although in between two shoe shops, this was not an issue.  A lovely stay!

the absolute best staff I have ever encountered. from the front desk to the breakfast lady. the room was nice, clean, spacious. the price is so good for such a huge room. centrally located. but most of all, I can tell that the staffs love their job and are very motivated. they are always happy to help. When I asked them something that they didn't know, they went online and tried looking for an answer for us. Guys I worked in Hospitality for 8 years and have worked/stayed in different 5 stars hotels - but many personals from these fancy hotels still need to learn a thing or 2 from the staff at Tesouro. Highly recommended!

A very nice small hotel. Yes, entering just through a door or through a shoe shop to take a lift to the third floor for reception may seem unusual but it is worth it for the accommodation, food and welcome you receive. Everything you needed to know was explained at check in.    The room was a suite with separate small sitting room as well as bedroom and bathroom, lots of windows with double street aspect. Comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was taken in the area adjacent to the reception and was buffet, times for different guests selected by yourselves as a good covid measure. There was an array of cereals, yoghurts, cheese , hams, breads, pancakes, egg choice, juice tea and coffee, all you need for a good start to the day. Centrally located it proved excellent value.

Initially a little tricky to find , entrance is either through a closed door between 2 entrances to a shoe shop or through the shoe shop itself, but then everything was near perfect.  Reception is on the third floor in the breakfast room, staffed in a very friendly informal manner with perfect English spoken.  They were especislly helpful in showing me where to go to get my Covid test before my flight home. My room was on the top floor with a view of the castle wall above. It was bright, clean and modern. My only slight issue is that there were no cable channels on the tv , just Portugese stations. I had hoped to watch some tennis from Paris, but not a major problem . Breakfast was very good in the large reception area and social distancing was no problem Location is fine for

This is a great place if you are looking for a nice hostel. But this last edition of the Shiadu chain is clearly cutting some corners here. The room had a bizar design with a very bad desk (made for very small people) in a dead corner, terrible lighting, leaking bathroom and sounds from the neighbours next door. The collection of bric and brac furniture is silly and looks cheap. Cleaning was not OK, background music a cheap playlist and the coffee was terrible. Maybe when the owners have earned their money, they can think about hospitality again.

Brilliant place to stay in Lisbon, walking distance to many places with great transport links for trains and trams to other locations.  Staff are very friendly.  Rooms were clean and spacious. The building is charming and although in between two shoe shops, this was not an issue.  A lovely stay!

the absolute best staff I have ever encountered. from the front desk to the breakfast lady. the room was nice, clean, spacious. the price is so good for such a huge room. centrally located. but most of all, I can tell that the staffs love their job and are very motivated. they are always happy to help. When I asked them something that they didn't know, they went online and tried looking for an answer for us. Guys I worked in Hospitality for 8 years and have worked/stayed in different 5 stars hotels - but many personals from these fancy hotels still need to learn a thing or 2 from the staff at Tesouro. Highly recommended!

Yes, entering just through a door or through a shoe shop to take a lift to the third floor for reception may seem unusual but it is worth it for the accommodation, food and welcome you receive. Everything you needed to know was explained at check in.    The room was a suite with separate small sitting room as well as bedroom and bathroom, lots of windows with double street aspect. Comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was taken in the area adjacent to the reception and was buffet, times for different guests selected by yourselves as a good covid measure. There was an array of cereals, yoghurts, cheese , hams, breads, pancakes, egg choice, juice tea and coffee, all you need for a good start to the day. Centrally located it proved excellent value.

Initially a little tricky to find , entrance is either through a closed door between 2 entrances to a shoe shop or through the shoe shop itself, but then everything was near perfect.  Reception is on the third floor in the breakfast room, staffed in a very friendly informal manner with perfect English spoken.  They were especislly helpful in showing me where to go to get my Covid test before my flight home. My room was on the top floor with a view of the castle wall above. It was bright, clean and modern. My only slight issue is that there were no cable channels on the tv , just Portugese stations. I had hoped to watch some tennis from Paris, but not a major problem . Breakfast was very good in the large reception area and social distancing was no problem Location is fine for

So I booked a Superior room for 2 nights for the first weekend of July 2021. I was contacted by the hotel through Agoda messages, who was asking me to confirm my arrival time. I did tell them I would be landing at 11pm only so i wouldn't reach the hotel until 11:30pm at the earliest... There was a curfew set for 11pm from that weekend on. The taxi dropped me at the hotel, it was around 11:40pm. That's when I realized it was not a "normal" hotel, meaning the main door on the street is closed all the time and you need to ring to get in or use your room key to open the door. So I rang and it said "please wait, max 5min". So i waited, nothing happened and I rang twice more but still nothing. I called the emergency number that was displayed on the door. It's a centralized number so

We were extremely well received by Mika and all the staff, who made our stay in Lisbon unforgettable and unique. The bedroom is big, cozy, very comfortable and beautiful. Bed linen and towels are impeccable and clean. It is located in the best possible part of Lisbon (close to everything, supermarkets, metro, bus, downtown, tourist spots, in the flat part of Lisbon). We could’t make a better choice and would like to thank all the staff for everything! We definitely recommend it!

For the 4th time I stayed in one of the Shiadu hotels in Lisbon. Great stay, thanks to Diogo and his colleagues. At the moment the restaurants in Lisbon are closed due to the pandemic, but you could order dinner at the hotel, delicious and not expensive! :)

I was looking forward to this stay however, a disruption to my flights meant I arrived at 10pm instead of 11am.  I was aware of the check-in restrictions, which was not an issue when I had booked and didn't give it a second thought.  However, upon arrival I was unable to contact anyone at the property by phone or by ringing the bell.  As a result, I had to book a room at the nearby Hotel Mundo.  Regrettably, the hotel refused my refund request which is disappointing considering the circumstances were beyond my control.  My business will be diverted elsewhere in future.

Had lovely room with all you need . Very well situated and peaceful . Beds are super comfortable and high quality linen . Good breakfast and staff very pleasant . Can recommend . Unfortunately no wi fi connection in our room .

Would recommend all to stay here during your time in Lisbon. Everything is exeptional, rooms are clean and big. Staf is most wonderful and it’s location is centre centre.  Will be a no brainer returning to Lisbon which hotel to choose!  Best and keep on doing what you are doing Bart & Kathy

Very central, a few minutes away from everything, close to a big underground car parking; nice staff, big spacious and clean rooms, great breakfast. Stayed only one night but it was perfect.   Recommended.

We stayed in this hotel 3 nights and we found it great. The location is perfect to explore every area of Lisbon: it’s very central, you can walk to Baixa/Alfama/Lapa/Graca/Bairro Alto in a few minutes. Also, just out of the door you find the underground and the starting point of the famous tram 28. The staff is very kind, the breakfast good, the rooms clean and comfortable (we had an upgrade too). Highly recommended.

I am only here due to the lack of any info on Forum or advice concerning paid bookings - required -of the Shiadu Group Hotels in Portugal.    First thing - 2weeks ago - I emailed the group website to notify of cancellation of June reservations at their properties in Lisbon- Tesouro da Baixa and in Porto -Casa dos Loios. I received  emails confirming- cancellations at both but no refund of booking.  Their booking system offers only 2 choices- pay in advance with NO cancellation OR (STANDARD )pay in advance with cancellation up to 2 days prior to booking with refund.  Next - I called the office number on their website and was put off for a response to refunds for this issue in perhaps 2 weeks?   It appears that they are deciding whether to honor their cancellations in the middle

Based on the hotel brand's phenomenal reviews, we ended up booking Shiadu hotels in both Porto (Casa dos Lóios) and Lisbon (Tesouro Da Baixa) for our December trip to Portugal. I'll start by saying that we had an excellent experience in Porto. The room was clean, comfortable, and the staff provided great customer service. Both hotels were in optimal locations close to public transportation.  Unfortunately, the experience in Lisbon was far from ideal. The main issue was the hotel staff's lack of concern/sympathy for the concerns we brought up during our stay. The staff was often not present at the reception desk (sometimes laying on the couch, other times taking extended smoke breaks up front). Here are the concerns we presented to the staff during our stay:  Most Significant: We

This hotel is centrally located. The staff is very friendly and nice! The rooms are rather spacious. There is a small frig. And you have a nice view out to the street. You can identify the hotel by the light brown front door. There is a shoe store on both sides but you walk through the door up the elevator to reception. I would definitely stay here again! It’s not the four seasons or st Regis nor does it try to be, it’s a quirky hotel with modern charm. I love the Four Seasons but this feels authentic & goes with the local vibe! Cheers!

We had a wonderful stay at this upscale, classy wonderfully located hotel in the center of Lisbon. Room 401-Ultra modern, large guest room with incredible bathroom and windows overlooking the bell tower of the nearby church. Very good breakfast with fresh, cooked to order eggs. Stay here and you won’t be disappointed!

Stayed 3 nights here. After getting over the entrance being between a shoe shop and actually through it during shop opening hours, we loved this hotel.  Decor is quirky and stylish. Rooms and bathrooms a good size and well equipped. Breakfast plenty of choice and freshly cooked eggs to order. Coffee machine free to use whenever required.  Would stay again.  Close to all sights and public transport.

Loved this hotel!  Perfect location, unique decor, excellent front desk staff with perfect suggestions for things to see and restaurants to try.  Room was spotless and comfortable, large and charming.  We hope to return and also try other Shiadu properties as well!

Stayed in a superior room on the 5th floor. We had a balcony with a perfect view of the castle, room was spacious by European city standards, quiet & comfortable.  Staff is wonderful, & the breakfast very good.  Location is ideal, close to 3 main squares, easily accessible to all major sights either by walking or transit.  Terminus for the famous tram 28 is 2 minutes walk from the hotel (consider doing this trip in the evening when it is less busy). A previous post said the hotel fixed price taxi to the airport is expensive because the regular fare is 8 euro.  No idea where the 8 euro comes from, it cost us 17.50 on the meter coming in & 16 going back early morning.

What a great place to stay. Its in the middle of everything . The rooms were a nice size and clean. The showers were great. Breakfast is very tasty and the staff is very friendly.Its also a 5 min walk to Rossio train station for those of you wishing to visit Sintra on your own.Loved this place. Thanks!!!!!

The Tesoro da Baixa was the perfect place to stay to take advantage of all Lisbon has to offer. The staff are incredibly helpful, our room was clean and quiet and the breakfast each morning was very tasty with lots of choices.  We will be back! Nancy & Andrew Ontario, Canada

Our boutique hotel, Tesouro da Baixa by Shiadu, was right in the middle of the action, within walking distance of so many things, and with a tram line and metro right outside for those things further afield (the public transport system in Lisbon is so convenient and simple to use). It would be easy to miss the hotel on the first visit, as its entrance is through the middle of a shoe store! But a few flights up in the elevator take you to the reception, lounge and breakfast area to be greeted by the smiling staff, led by John.  Tesouro da Baixa by Shiadu is a funky, retro/modern/old décor combination. Each room is unique in design and furnishings, and we chose superbly with our corner room on nearly the top floor. The 4m+ high ceiling is carved, painted and ornate with a lush

Fantastic place.  Outside is deceiving because from the main road, it's literally a wood door and on either side is a shoe shop lol.  The 'main floor' is basically an elevator up to reception and the hotel on the second level.  Some reviews whine about that, but honestly, who cares?  If you want chain hotel Holiday Inn with a giant front lobby then stay at one.  The Tesouro is clean, well kept, has a quirky charm (decorated with retro household items here and there).  Staff is all very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are nice and the breakfast buffet is very good -- fresh Orange Juice daily, fresh eggs daily (made to order on request), and a good mix of meats breads, jams, cereal, fruit, prepared foods, etc.  Excellent coffee from the machine in the buffet area.  Best aspect is the

Great location, but a little hard to find next to shoe stores. Must buzz in upon arriving and go up to 3rd floor for reception. Walk through smokers who smoke/work indoors at shoe stores. Room itself was large and had nice windows. Shower was small. Breakfast was lackluster. Taxi arranged through hotel to return to airport was overpriced at 18 euro (actual trip is closer to 8 euro).

My friend and I were very excited to come to Portugal.  Believe it or not, we chose the Corinthia because the esthetics were great for pictures. However, upon arrival and possibly throughout our stay “The Soul Garden” which is what attracted us to this place remained closed- hella disappointed.  We requested a bed upgrade- When we got to the room we were greeted by 2 twin beds- we just laughed it off- see we are both tall and these beds were a joke, but we are not complainers so we made it work. Let’s talk about the major issues in room 1903, the outlet and USB port near the bed was not working (and you know most people like their devices- phone, airpods, watch - charging next to them).  Someone tried to fix it during our stay- was unable to- said he would come back and never

The room was well equipped with a working station. The bed was amazingly big and comfy! :) Bathroom with all the little details you may expect from a five star hotel. Staff was attentive and helpful. Private conversations were kept at a low tone.  Very good breakfast. Very good lounge bar ("Erva") with good music and prices. I loved it and recommend it for business purposes.

Beautiful hotel with lovely staff, food is very good, the facilities are clean and welcoming, gym, heated pool and many other places and services to assure unforgettable stay.  Highly recommended for both business or pleasure.

In a word -Awkward. Terrible guests services. It’s like a team of snowflake generation got together and funded a hotel that eliminates all Human character and grace. Not friendly staff or guidance —. They sent us to all the tourist traps  in Lisbon.  Everything is digital in there. Again nothing genuine or authentic.  Just cold mediocrity.

We own a Travel Agency/Tour Operator in Portugal and decided to stay for a family weekend as we were not familiar with the hotel and wanted to see if it was a hotel we could recommend our clients.  Overall the stay was very pleasant. Very nice room, good bar, great outside space and great breakfast.  But on the first night we had a very poor experience in the Erva restaurant, which given the quality of the waiting staff, I have to assume is managed independently of the hotel. Hence a rating of 4. Excluding that restaurant, the hotel definitely deserves  5.

My friend and I were very excited to come to Portugal.  Believe it or not, we chose the Corinthia because the esthetics were great for pictures. However, upon arrival and possibly throughout our stay “The Soul Garden” which is what attracted us to this place remained closed- hella disappointed.  We requested a bed upgrade- When we got to the room we were greeted by 2 twin beds- we just laughed it off- see we are both tall and these beds were a joke, but we are not complainers so we made it work. Someone tried to fix it during our stay- was unable to- said he would come back and never

The room was well equipped with a working station. The bed was amazingly big and comfy! :) Bathroom with all the little details you may expect from a five star hotel. Staff was attentive and helpful. Private conversations were kept at a low tone.  Very good breakfast. Very good lounge bar ("Erva") with good music and prices. I loved it and recommend it for business purposes.

Beautiful hotel with lovely staff, food is very good, the facilities are clean and welcoming, gym, heated pool and many other places and services to assure unforgettable stay.  Highly recommended for both business or pleasure.

In a word -Awkward. Terrible guests services. It’s like a team of snowflake generation got together and funded a hotel that eliminates all Human character and grace. Not friendly staff or guidance —. They sent us to all the tourist traps  in Lisbon.  Everything is digital in there. Again nothing genuine or authentic.  Just cold mediocrity.

We own a Travel Agency/Tour Operator in Portugal and decided to stay for a family weekend as we were not familiar with the hotel and wanted to see if it was a hotel we could recommend our clients.  Overall the stay was very pleasant. Very nice room, good bar, great outside space and great breakfast.  But on the first night we had a very poor experience in the Erva restaurant, which given the quality of the waiting staff, I have to assume is managed independently of the hotel. Hence a rating of 4. Excluding that restaurant, the hotel definitely deserves  5.

Very convenient hotel just 10 min from the airport with an Uber. Spacious and clean rooms with everything you need. Great bed that gives you the rest and energy that you need. Make sure to check out the spa area and have a massage if you have the time. You can go directly from your room to the spa area using the elevator.

I could not have been more satisfied with our stay at Corinthia Lisbon. It's a beautiful, immaculate hotel. The staff is very professional and helpful. The location is great, close to the airport and just a short (7 euro) cab ride to the city center.

Lovely 5 star hotel, good size rooms with all 5 star amenities. Lovely pool and spa. Great bar outside with a DJ and weekend vibe. Also a really good restaurant as bar inside to.  Staff were friendly and always available to assist. You do need to use a Uber or taxi to get about as it’s not walking distance to anything. However Uber ex is very cheap in Lisbon. Get the concierge to make your restaurant bookings in advance of arriving to Lisbon as all the good local restaurants are always booked.

Booked an executive junior suite w/skyline lounge access.but when we arrived skyline is closed but we were given a €30 voucher.cant access the sauna & steam room we have to pay additional.1st time to Booked an executive room w/out an access to sauna. We stayed in Corinthia Budapest way much better.my €100 was not refunded in spite of 2 emails sent. Was charged for something that we dont know.breakfast is not 5 star. Can't recommend sorry.

Stayed in room 1812 (like the Overture!). Room was great, lovely big 'memory foam' bed, marble bathroom, mini--bar (not that we used it!), mega TV with good selection of channels inc CNN, BBC, etc. So far so good!  Went down for breakfast and the service was next to non-existent. My wife had to call someone over to get tea, which came but without milk so she asked for milk which came in a large jug and was poured for her (and too much but what do you do with the excess?). At the same time the person never bothered to ask me if I would like a hot drink!!!! (I don't in fact drink tea or coffee  but service it was not).   There were plenty of staff in the restaurant but standing in groups of 3 around the dumb waiters and even those that were 'cruising' tables didn't seem to know

It is hard to explain fully just how awful this hotel is. Took 10 hours for the third bed to arrive for our five year old son to sleep in. We had been awake since 3am and it arrived after 2100 in spite of four  requests and first requesting it at 1045  Breakfast was a complete shambles every single morning  . Loads of staff with attitude but no leadership or orange juice or plates or glasses  or basic Supplies for a hot breakfast such as beans. No logical system for restocking buffet.  Asked for fresh milk as I don't like UHT to be told by a Manager that they don't stock it   Room service was unbelievable and the phone rang out so you have to go down in the elevator to order which defeats the purpose. Concierge arranged a taxi which costs us double the return journey .  Face

This hotel is a nightmare and every bad review is true. Breakfast is a disorganised mess, AC doesn’t work in the room because the hotel somehow feels that 21 C is an acceptable temperature for a room , housekeeping is a nightmare and even when you tell the hotel you are out and about at 9am in the morning and if housekeeping can please clean the room before 3pm they of course are cleaning the room at 5.30pm when you just come back. Forget about calling the front desk because no-one will answer the phone and when you complain no solutions and lame I am sorry sir. Nothing works at this hotel and it is a far cry from a 5 star hotel at best a 4 star based on amenities but based on how the hotel is operating and managed a three star is closer to the truth. We have decided not to stay

There is so much wrong with this hotel that I don't know where to start. First, if you are a tourist and want to explore Lisbon it is very far from the city center.  You cannot walk to the best parts of the city. The first day there we  had washcloths- never to be seen again (fortunately years of travel has taught me to bring my own). First day of included breakfast buffet it took 10 minutes to flag down a waitress for  coffee and then it came with attitude. I left the empty tissue box on the sink so the housekeeper could see it needed to be replaced. She put the empty box back on the shelf. There was never any shower gel or coffee creamer in the room.  On our last day there the housekeeper swiped  a little bag I had left on the table. Fortunately if was empty but it was a

Was here as part of an extended land stay for a UniWorld river cruise.  Hotel was lovely, services were very nice - including pool and breakfast.  Found the service friendly.  Good location nearby to some restaurants and museums.

The last time I was here it was 2015, a business trip. This time I spent 2 nights in a upgraded executive suite. The staff at the reception is very nice and efficient. And nothing has changed a lot since 2015 accept for the outside restaurant. Very trendy and with nice surprises on their menu. However the music level is not my style.   The room is excellent, clean, a lot of space and a quiet airconditioning. The bed, a super king size, of high quality. With the executive booking normally the launch area on the 24th floor is included, however due to unclear circumstances not available. Meaning normal breakfast on the zero floor, which is a challenge (like in 2015). Divided in three parts of the area, a lot is available, only not efficient staff. Not able to deal with the flexible

Everything is great at that hotel. From the hotel manager (Mr. Silva), to the barman (Mr. David) and everything in between. Covid protocols are strictly adhered to, and one really feels safe. The outside bar and restaurant are stunning, and the food is delicious. Truly recommend.

The hotel staff are very friendly and professional. The hotel was clean, new and very comfortable. We liked the Soul bar although it was quite expensive. Beautiful views from the hotel also. We had a junior suite and had a separate dressing area for clothes and luggage which came in really handy ! We ordered room service and it came super fast and was delicious!!

High quality Hotel with excellent rooms catering for all needs. But the best part is the STAFF. Always attentive to the small details, exceding in all aspects. Enjoyed the restaurants, specially the patio outiside. Will certainly return.

I had to stay here with my family at the weekend following travel difficulties and wanted a hotel close to the airport. There were 5 of us and was it was sold as one room when in fact we were split across 2 rooms combined via a door. The hotel is nice and the restaurant and bars are very well represent.  We utilised the Spa pool which was ok, however clearly not looked after to the level you would expect.  Very few towels on beds, some rules regarding swimming caps for us but then nobody else seemed to either need to wear them or were "sold" them.   The main worry here was one of the lights in the kids end of the pool had dislodged from the side of the pool and was floating around with live wires in the water. Rooms were clean if not slightly small. Our room also wasnt provided

My family and I visited Portugal August 4th until August 22nd. Our last evening we stayed at Corinthia Hotel in Lisbon. Let me tell you we had the most fun times at the Corinthia. The staff was very professional, courteous and very accommodating. Rita Silva at the front desk made sure our stay was flawless during our entire stay. Being in the hotel and hospitality industry for over 25 years I always critique places where ever I go. I couldn’t find anything at this place to criticize, every details were well thought and executed.  We will be sure to visit Corinthia Hotel at our next visit to Portugal. To entire Corinthia Hotel staff , Thank you.  Sincerely,  Mehmet Cetin

Stayed at Corinthia Lisbon for a whole week with my family. We were greeted warmly by check in staff and check in was relatively quick despite all COVID procedures.  The hotel is very conveniently located - we used the Jardim Zoologico metro station which is a 3-5 minute walk from the hotel every day to get to central Lisbon via the metro (via the Blue Line, Linha Azul) and we used the Sete Rios train station to get to Sintra and Cascais on a few occasions which is located right above the metro station. This makes transport to central Lisbon extremely easy and it avoids you having to pay ridiculous prices for taxis. The hotel itself is a very modern and clean building. The lobby is very nice followed by the rooms which have comfy beds and good decorations. The TV also had a good

David at reception was fabulous! He suggested I ate at Evra restaurant which I wasn’t going to originally because I have so much work to do and most hotels don't have great restaurants. He was very proud of it and even wrote out all the foods I need to order because those were his fave.  I order the Tempura bacalao and black pork cheek.  The spa experience was amazing. I did try to go to the pool but felt there were too many unmasked people and not enough ventilation. So, the spa took me a little early for my treatment. It was the most personalized treatment I’ve received yet. Not just what she (Andrea) asked of me but the fact that she listened and adjusted everything perfectly.  My stay was wonderful! I barely left the hotel. I ate all the food lol.  The only Con, which isn't

The bewas really perfect. The hotel is very nice and quiet, very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast buffet is very extensive and very good. The room was spacious enough. Dined twice in the Soul garden restaurant. This was very good as well!

We regularly come to Lisbon and most of the time we stay in this hotel. The last time in May 2021 we got disappointed mainly because of no access to Skybar which was announced to us in our arrival only; but we thought it might be due to Covid situation. However this time is disappointing too. We pay the amount for the family exclusive room as usual and without any reduction but the service is not at all the same as the past. Reduced number of the employees, the lady from reception who will help for the bags (that s crazy) , not the same fabulous breakfast that we used to it, not the welcome kit in the rooms with sweets and fruits , they opened the bed only for night of our arrival and the night after no service, so far not the same service level as the past years but we paid

Fantastic hotel and rooms. The front desk staff and Carolina in the Soul Garden were fantastic but the rest need a rocket up them to provide what is supposed to be 5 star service. Having to wait over 30 min for a glass of wine on several occasions isn't 5 star.  Breakfast in covid times here is a guessing game as to what you can have or have to do.. We guessed wrong every day and waiter in restaurant as good as rolled his eyes when we asked for butter with the toast after taking a easy option guess and asking for scramble egg on toast. The scramble egg arrived but no toast until asked again.   Having had to produce double vaccine certificates and sanitiser everywhere what is so difficult about allowing people to get their food or even giving a menu?  On the whole a frustrating

Amazing experience at beautiful, burlesque hotel! We stayed 4 nights( too short 😊). Decoration of whole hotel is absolutely amazing! We took pictures everywhere.  Spot clean, in room coffee machine( pods), Bluetooth speaker. Buffet breakfast very good with a lot of choice. Bar offers great cocktails. Staff are extremely attentive. They are always there, when you need them.  Location- very centre of the city. Between two metro stations. ( 200m) I would give this hotel 5*. At least we got 5* experience! Definitely coming back.

Loved our stay in the Maxime hotel. We booked the 'Dressing Room' themed bedroom and it was fabulous. The decor is homage to cabaret and the history of the building. They have done a tremendous job keeping the history alive. Amazing staff in every way and so helpful. Walking distance to everything in the city. Great breakfast and bar with great barman Vlad. Highly recommend a stay here for a couples visit to Lisbon and book the themed rooms if you can, it's worth it!

This hotel is quite unique. Theme based and cute, however, not conducive to a 2-week European travel.  No closet or cabinets for clothing.  A bar with 6 hangers was provided. The bathroom sink was decorative and not functional for a female traveler no space for toiletries.  The staff was spot-on, kind and accommodating. Breakfast buffet was one of the best I have experienced in Europe. Location is good - a short walk to one of the many city squares, and a block or 2 from a few restaurants.

I can’t complain about anything! I will definitely rebook every time I come to Lisbon! The location is great, the stuff very friendly. Although I can’t recommend this Hotel for family with small children, because of the theme of the Hotel and the Rooms!

We visited in early March, when Portugal introduced emergency measures relating to Covid – 19.  We stayed for 4 nights and on our last morning the Hotel closed. The Hotel is well situated to Central Lisbon, with easy access to shops, restaurants, and tourist areas. We loved the theme of the Hotel. The rooms are very original with some being themed. We stayed in a deluxe room on the fourth floor. It was decorated well and made us laugh, and had all we needed in the way of facilities, coffee maker, tv, en-suite with shower and efficient air conditioning. It also had a good view over Praca Alegria. The Wi-Fi was fast and managed well with live streaming. There is an outside seating area on floor one, which is used as smoking area. One can also order drinks by a remote bell system.

Amazing experience at beautiful, burlesque hotel! We stayed 4 nights( too short 😊). Decoration of whole hotel is absolutely amazing! We took pictures everywhere.  Spot clean, in room coffee machine( pods), Bluetooth speaker. Buffet breakfast very good with a lot of choice. Bar offers great cocktails. Staff are extremely attentive. They are always there, when you need them.  Location- very centre of the city. Between two metro stations. ( 200m) I would give this hotel 5*. At least we got 5* experience! Definitely coming back.

Loved our stay in the Maxime hotel. We booked the 'Dressing Room' themed bedroom and it was fabulous. The decor is homage to cabaret and the history of the building. They have done a tremendous job keeping the history alive. Amazing staff in every way and so helpful. Walking distance to everything in the city. Great breakfast and bar with great barman Vlad. Highly recommend a stay here for a couples visit to Lisbon and book the themed rooms if you can, it's worth it!

Breakfast buffet was one of the best I have experienced in Europe. Location is good - a short walk to one of the many city squares, and a block or 2 from a few restaurants.

I can’t complain about anything! I will definitely rebook every time I come to Lisbon! The location is great, the stuff very friendly. Although I can’t recommend this Hotel for family with small children, because of the theme of the Hotel and the Rooms!

We visited in early March, when Portugal introduced emergency measures relating to Covid – 19.  We stayed for 4 nights and on our last morning the Hotel closed. The Hotel is well situated to Central Lisbon, with easy access to shops, restaurants, and tourist areas. We loved the theme of the Hotel. The rooms are very original with some being themed. We stayed in a deluxe room on the fourth floor. It was decorated well and made us laugh, and had all we needed in the way of facilities, coffee maker, tv, en-suite with shower and efficient air conditioning. It also had a good view over Praca Alegria. The Wi-Fi was fast and managed well with live streaming. There is an outside seating area on floor one, which is used as smoking area. One can also order drinks by a remote bell system.

We spent a couple of days in this very beautiful hotel. The room was great, the whole maxime theme of the hotel exciting. We loved to stay there. The staff was extremely helpful, especially after the emerging problems with covid. The location of the hotel is very central and ideally suited for visiting the center of the city. The breakfast was excellent, a very big variety of food. Our room was at the third floor and it was very quiet. We will return to Lissabon once the situation with covid will be better, and for sure we will come back to this hotel!

I was very happy with my experience. The staff was very friendly and the location was good. The hotel was clean and comfortable but most of all it was fun and wacky. I loved the burlesque theme which was fun, wacky and tasteful. I was even lucky enough to catch some of the burlesque show at the hotel after I checked in on a Saturday night. The breakfast was very good and reasonable prices at the bar (I recommend the ginegr cocktail!)

We had a good and pleasant stay. The hotel and rooms looked nice and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was excellent, lots of choice and all tasty. Downsides: the tap of the sink fell off and the safe did not work.

Great base for a city break to Lisbon. Staff friendly and helpful with planning to see the sights.  Breakfast was excellent.  Rooms nice and comfortable, large bed, good shower and arrival chocolates were a tasty touch.  Would definitely recommend this place for anyone visiting.

A cosy theme hotel. Very clean. Breakfast was delicious!! Very good location - a few minutes walk from many attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they gave us lots of useful advice what to see. We would definitely recommend this hotel

Great hotel with beautiful interior! It has a burlesque atmosphere which is great for couples. We stayed at bondage room which was  big enough and with big bed. Breakfast is good. We suggest to go to Cabaret show with dinner, food is great and the show is even better!

I'm not saying this hotel was bad. It's just that it promised so much more than it provided, and let itself down in little ways that really could have been avoided. For example when we arrived (quite late in the evening) we were led that there was a private party in the bar, so we couldn't use it. Could we pop in and take a drink up to our room? No. Could we get her room service brought up? No. But we COULD listen to the private party's music in our room for the rest of the night. The next afternoon they had ticketed dinner/show events in the bar area, so once again it was of limits. We were also told that only the first Nespresso in the room would be free, although this may have been a miscommunication. Other disappointments were the room being small, and almost devoid of any

We've had a very pleasant stay at Maxime Hotel at the end of February. The reception staff were always helpful, the breakfast had plenty of cold and hot options, a lot of fruits, pastry, plenty of tea/juice and coffee's. The room was very pleasant and very well decorated in terms with the hotel theme! Bathroom was quite spotless, quite a main check that many hotels fail nowadays. Bed was very comfy and large enough for two people to stretch fully and barely reach themselves! Short to none distance to a main street which offers transport and shops all over the place.

We stayed in the Maxime Hotel for two nights and we enjoyed every moment of it. The location is perfect,the staff is kind and humble, the service is over expected.The hotel has a unique design, and the rooms are renovated and modern. The breakfast was really good with a choice for any diet. I strongly recommend this hotel while visiting Lisbon

This swanky, sexy motif hotel was a perfect stay to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday! We checked in and the staff was friendly and warm!  When we entered our room we were greeted with balloons, chocolates, champagne 🥂 and birthday cake including a candle!!! The extra touches and smiles made our stay!! The lounge was fun, the drinks were awesome and vibe was upbeat.  Unfortunately we missed the burlesque/cabaret show, next time! We highly recommend this hotel for your stay! Convenient to train station and a 20 minute walk to all the fabulous sites, restaurants, and shopping!!

Great stay for 3 nights at the hotel. Super comfortable bed and linen. Great hotel-supplies toiletries. Fun breakfast fully included.  On our first night, there was a fire alarm. While we still rate this 5 stars, a little disappointed in the lack of communication by staff. It took 40 minutes for first responders to arrive. During that time, all hotel guests were in the street for an hour at 3 in the morning and not one hotel staff to be seen. In the end, guests just walked back in, but no explanation. It would have been a nice courtesy for this break in our night could have been acknowledged by hotel.

Everything is great...…………. No suggestions or comments...…………. Recommend to all...………… Thank you very much...………. Wonderful hotel Wonderful Breakfast Great location of the hotel, near metro All within walking distance

A fantastic experience, great atmosphere, very clean but most of all wonderful staff. It's a great location with plenty of bars and restaurants. It's close enough to walk to the city centre with designer shops galore

Just got back from a great weekend in this lovely hotel. Fabulous decor, great staff and incredibly comfortable. Breakfast is delicious and varied.  Location is great too. Easy to get from the airport by metro. Just off the Main Street with all the designer shops. Near to station if your wanting to visit other destinations ie. Sintra. Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel!

Fab quirky hotel comfortable rooms with good shower and big fluffy towels . Breakfast was good and great selection. Location was perfect walk away from everything. We did have a noisy toilet but didn’t spoil it . Hotel surprised us with a bottle.

I didnt expect to be a "maxime" magazine...aka...cabaret thematic Hotel. Gladly surprise. Very good well located, close to Av Liberdade and Barrio Alto. Very kind staff front desk. Bed and room very good, ngreat deco...only a little bad, the ventilation of the room before enter in (with carpet you should clean and give an ambiance parfum before every guest. But rest perfect, breakfast also very good (missing some hot dishes, but all fine). Best at the end, location, decoration and staff, i will definetly repeat next time.

Great location, staff was excellent, super friendly and helpful, really nice rooms and a nice terrace on the first floor. All I missed in the room was a fridge,the rooms are otherwise beautiful. Recommend!

It would be great if it was slightly closer to the centre. However it is in a very elegant road with access to almost everything. Public transport is available and easy to access too. Very close to designer stores like MK and LV.

Very good place for a romance escape, with good location and a good vibe. Very good breackfast and good cleaning. Bad for parking, cause there is no free park around the hotel and there are a few outdoor places.

We enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The room was a little bit on the small side and although coffee was provided in the room, there was no tea available. Breakfast was fantastic with anything you could imagine provided for you with the staff being very attentive. My wife fell ill after we checked out (nothing to do with the hotel) and we returned back to the hotel. The staff could not have been any kinder.   They wanted to get the doctor and even offered to go to the pharmacy to buy the medicine.We felt that this was beyond any call of duty by the staff. Well done and keep up the good work! We were even given complementary water and a coffee while my wife was recovering  and we were waiting for the taxi to take us to the airport.

Consistent high quality service and facilities. Once again I stayed there and will certainly come back to my preferred hotel in Lisbon. A special thanks to José Miranda catering for the clients with great spirit, the Chef with a superb Bife a Portuguesa and Mr Daniel on the leadership frontline directly making sure everything is Just perfect.

The first sight of the hotel already hints at the coolness of the place with a large palm holding the building. And the funny, well thought out design and atmosphere continues throughout with laugh out loud messages on glass coasters in the bar and on all hotel signage.  Self check in is of course available but the reception staff was a highlight giving some great travel tips and restaurant recommendations. The room is very high tech but the gadgets are surprisingly easy to handle such as the light switches and the window shades. The toilet and shower are very integrally built into the room yet concealed enough to give privacy. The gym and the warm water pool were virtually deserted so one could feel very comfortable exercising. The public transportation links this part of

We really enjoyed everything about our stay at the hotel.  The staff were exceptional, the pool and spa area lovely, the food was good, there was a fab little street cafe next door, there were scooters outside to get into town as well as a metro station (walk was about 30 mins and we often walked too), the lighting was funky - it was just a really lovely experience.  We stayed for 10 days and usually in that time there may be something that does not come up to standard but there was not.  We had a really lovely time - thank you.

We decided to visit CleanAndSafePortugal as our first trip outside Canada since the pandemic, and we are so glad we chose Evolution hotel for our vacation in Lisboa!   To list only few of the PRO’s of staying at Evolution: - very modern hotel, great design, very clean rooms, soundproof (although in very busy area, inside the room it was very quiet), great beds/mattresses, slept like babies - all very safe, everybody with masks all the time, hand sanitizers available everywhere in the hotel - staff is very friendly, nice and helpful; we had updates posted in elevators and around the hotel (i.e. re: Daylight Saving Time ending); hotel lobby decorated very nicely for Halloween😊 - we loved having restaurant and bar 24/7, gym, swimming pool, sauna, steam room 24/7 – it almost made

Selected for its proximity to a Metro station and 24/7 fitness facilities, Evolution Hotel is an excellent deal.  Not far from Versailles Bakery, with a nice view of Duque de Saldanha Square, be aware that most visitors trend quite young to fit the hip vibe.  Form also outpaces function in the rooms with oddly situated lighting and cylindrical showers.  Overall a great value.

Consistent high quality service and facilities. Once again I stayed there and will certainly come back to my preferred hotel in Lisbon. A special thanks to José Miranda catering for the clients with great spirit, the Chef with a superb Bife a Portuguesa and Mr Daniel on the leadership frontline directly making sure everything is Just perfect.
