Not far from Versailles Bakery, with a nice view of Duque de Saldanha Square, be aware that most visitors trend quite young to fit the hip vibe.  Form also outpaces function in the rooms with oddly situated lighting and cylindrical showers.  Overall a great value.

I can't say enough good things about Evolution Lisboa.  I was intrigued by the room features which led me to book the hotel.  I am so glad I did!  The room knocked me over -- hi tech, quiet, fun toilet and shower arrangements, secure.  The service was 100% every time I encountered an employee -- check-in, dining, housekeeping, and check-out.  The food was superior -- delicious, well presented -- and the ordering system simplified the whole eating out process.  Again, a hi-tech approach won the day!  My plans called for flying from Lisbon back to the U.S.  I was concerned about access to the Metro and the location of a pharmacy for a COVID test.  When I walked out the front door - BOOM! - a pharmacy was next to the Metro entrance right outside the door.  My stay couldn't have

the EVOLUTION Hotel is a very stylish hotel with a great gym and sauna on the 9th floor overlooking Saldana place. Subway station nearby, coffeeshop Delta too! Perfect place for a few days! we will come again!!

This was a great surprise. Modern touch, great bed, a different type of bathroom, practical but not conventional what can be great for family, single and couples. Breakfast was perfect and i kind of like the restrictions where we do not move to the hotel and breakfast is served at the table. Perfect eggs! Swimming pool very relaxing with great city view Sauna and gym center.

first impression looks like weird but totally new experience with room design, well located amenities, rain shower. Excellent helpful staff. On site Parking possibilities.. Wonderful individual breakfast

This hotel is well-outside of the historic downtown area of Lisbon, in a more business district and residential neighborhood. The impact is that there are fewer, tourist-oriented restaurants, but more locally-oriented services, such as grocery stores, and small snack bars. If you are planning to tour the historic areas, leave time and budget to take the Metro (in front of the hotel) or Uber.  The staff was very-friendly and helpful - we were there at the time of the Corona Virus restrictions, and received (food) recommendations and friendly conversation. The bartender provided us wine glasses and a corkscrew for our stay, when she saw that we had bought a bottle to enjoy in our room.  The hotel is extremely modern. The lobby, with bar, is beautiful. Everything gleams. The rooms

We stayed in October for a week. We had a great time. The hotel is really modern, clean and the staff are lovely. The food is nice and the bar has a great selection of different drinks.  They let you use the facilities even after you check out. We had a late flight so we went to pool for the day and it was ideal. We felt so relaxed getting on our flight. We will definitely be back as it was one the best trips we ever went on.  The hotel is near so many restaurants if you want to try different places.

First, the hotel advertised itself as being on the ‘old town’. That’s not true, it is a 25 minute bus ride to the old town.   Second, the room was awful The shower and the toilet are in strange looking plastic tubes in the middle of the room. This means that there is absolutely no privacy! The bottom of the tube is opaque, but the top is not, and the plastic is so thin that there is no noise disguising at all – it is as if the toilet is basically sitting right next to the bed. So much for a romantic getaway. And if you want to wash your hands after using the toilet you have to walk around the corner to the sink at the other side of the room. Plus, both the shower and the toilet are tiny, so small that if you sit on the toilet your knees bump into the wall of the strange

4 night stay Our kids were so Happy to have an app for their room control  Enjoy each day the sport spot with the pool and the sauna  Perfect location to have a nice walk around  Arrive directly by the metro from the airport Everything is smooth and joyful

Very good property in Saldhana. location is connected by metro and very good staff and food.I would like to again come back if i am visiting Lisbon. I would also recommend it for business or family trip.

The room was clean. Bed comfortable and staff friendly. .but whoever thought up the idea of having see through pods in the room as toilets and showers must have been from another planet! Even being married for years I would not use these where my husband could see and hear everything. Neither would he and he went down to reception which were no better. Everyone looking at everyone else.So embarassing. The mirror was placed so the person in bed had a perfect view of the person in the pod.. on the potty..No hiding from it. Nowhere to hang towels. The automated systems were all wired up wrong so if you wanted to turn on a nightlight in the dark, The tv came on..blinds started going up and down..showers turned on..and all hell broke loose! What's wrong with an old fashioned SWITCH!

My flight got canceled due to bad weather. On their website it says to save 10% if you book directly through them. I made the mistake of doing so. Had I booked through a third party I would have been protected. Called the hotel while I was at the airport, and they asked me to email the manager. Woke up this morning saying they wouldn’t refund. I have monthly trips to lisbon and I won’t be staying at this hotel.

Good location, clean, fine breakfast, slept well (quiet and comfortable), friendly staff, excellent facilities, trendy spot and frecuented by locals on weekend evenings. I highly recommend this hotel.

Stayed one night for work. The hotel is extremely modern and funky. The room size was ok. There was a toilet and shower area with a privacy curtain. See photos. The bed was a little firm for my liking but to air conditioning was almost silent but kept the room at a pleasant temperature. There were electric blackout blinds that really worked well.   Breakfast was excellent with a really good selection of pastries including some local ones. There was the typical fruit cereals yoghurts and continental selection of cheeses and meats but a good range and high quality. Cooked food was also great. The only challenge was the coffee/tea machine. Although excellent as it was a fresh bean/grind machine which meant it was a little slow so allow time.   The staff were all extremely helpful

We were very lucky upon arrival a room was available and we were able to check in and go straight to our room.  The room was very comfortable and clean.  Even the fact that the bathrooms are in the same room that didn't really matter.  The location was great right and easy to get to transportation.  The staff was very helpful and kind.

Spent one night when visiting LIsbon with family.  The hotel is very clean has all the amenities you would expect.   The staff on reception were very very helpful and extremely pleasant.  Quirky loos in the very nice room was the only negative, i am not sure they would be to every ones liking

Upon arrival we were happy, check in was easy and the room was large and clean. I was surprised not too hear too much street traffic either, wasn’t silent but not bad at all. The issues came at bedtime... while the exterior walls were sound proof the interior were not and heard our neighbors all night at a lovely 9:30am wake up call by housekeeping hovering (clearly too early to Hoover in a hotel on a Sunday....) Additionally the AC just wouldn’t cool down the room. After a few night of restless sleep due to the heat (room wouldn’t drop below 24* and opening window wasn’t option because it opened about an inch and allowed to breeze in at all) we notified the front desk in the morning and they said they would send someone to look. We arrive back that evening and notice it still

We really enjoyed our stay. The place has a really fun and bright decor, it's quite special, and the apartment was prety quiet and comfortable, with a good breakfast, very friendly staff too, and we enjoyed the 24hr pool and massage shower. While not in the city center, it is close to the subway and main roads, as well as some cafes and a grocery store, making it a really good accomodation.  We arrived early with the intention of leaving our luggage with the security and coming back later to check in. To our susprise the staff not only expected us, they already had the room ready, we were so incredibly grateful.

Nice and modern room. Reception desk was very friendly, meeting support was excellent. The hotel personnel is very friendly and professional. For a private trip, the price was a bit too high but excellent business hotel.

The hotel offers very exceptional experience, it is so unique that you will never forget.  There is no attendant at the door or close to the door which is so different than other hotel. The design and the layout of the hotel are vibrant and energetic. I like the indoor pool on 9th floor, the bar and restaurant. The most striking characteristic is guest self- management, it offers guest with freedom and imagination! Love Evolution Hotel and recommend to anyone appreciate independent in hotel stay!

This hotel was a new concept to me! All automated with devices to open and close everything and pods for toilet and shower was a modern paradise for those who like something new. Staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was great value and the pool, spa, sauna, Turkish Haman and gym on level 9 a great way to unwind. Would recommend to those wanting a unique experience!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The hotel is very well situated. At the beginning of the high class shopping street it is only 10 walking minutes to the city centre. Clean rooms and friendly personnel. One drawback was that we had no hot water and it wasn't fixed in a day.But apart from this little problem, the hotel is recommendable.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Right on the highway, I expected more from a Holiday Inn. 1 guy is the whole staff playing desk staff and bartender. Listing said free WiFi and parking with restaurant and bar. Everything but restaurant was there. Hard to find with an address not recognized by the gps. Saw it off the highway is how we found it. Room smelled, bathroom smelled like pee and 1 towel total for 2 of us.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The check-in staff was very friendly and the entire staff so far seems here to please. I am still at the property but had quite the opposite experience of the previous reviewer.  I am a Platinum as well but did not receive any upgrade, quite the opposite, received one of the smallest rooms on the 2nd floor. It's a little disappointing but it's not the only hotel which does not do anything for Platinum members and I am fine with that, though it would make for an even better experience if they did honor status.  The rooms are nice and comfortable with everything you could need.  The only thing that is  missing like mentioned by someone else is an ioning board and ion which is usually available in other HIExpress properties but I believe a call to the reception would take care of

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: This is a beautiful hotel in the center of Lisbon with a beautiful view from the corner room balcony on the forth floor. Full recognition of my platinum IHG membership when giving me their most beautiful room with balcony. It's a 2 minutes walk to the famous Liberdade Avenue and maximum 30 minutes walk to all major landmarks in Lisbon. The breakfast is one of the best i ever had at any Holiday Inn Express hotel. Big thank you to all the staff who made my stay a beautiful one. When I return to Lisbon with my family, it will be my first choice for sure.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Average hotel. We were greeted by a unfriendly desk clerk on a Saturday morning. She was pretty rude in explaining the covid requirements and early check-in needs. I had booked 3 rooms for three nights and she offered IHG points only on one room even though I paid for all the rooms. One of the nights we walked into the lobby at midnight, and the guy at the desk didn't even raise his eyes let alone offering a greeting of some sort. The bathrooms and breakfast are decent.  Location 4/5 Lobby 2/5 Clean 3/5 Staff 2/5 Check-in 2/5 Bathroom 3/5 Bed 4/5 Minibar Iron not available in the room Breakfast 3/5 Coffee in the room 2/5 Internet 3/5

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The hotel is very well situated. At the beginning of the high class shopping street it is only 10 walking minutes to the city centre. Clean rooms and friendly personnel. One drawback was that we had no hot water and it wasn't fixed in a day.But apart from this little problem, the hotel is recommendable.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Right on the highway, I expected more from a Holiday Inn. 1 guy is the whole staff playing desk staff and bartender. Listing said free WiFi and parking with restaurant and bar. Everything but restaurant was there. Hard to find with an address not recognized by the gps. Saw it off the highway is how we found it. Room smelled, bathroom smelled like pee and 1 towel total for 2 of us.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The check-in staff was very friendly and the entire staff so far seems here to please. I am still at the property but had quite the opposite experience of the previous reviewer.  I am a Platinum as well but did not receive any upgrade, quite the opposite, received one of the smallest rooms on the 2nd floor. It's a little disappointing but it's not the only hotel which does not do anything for Platinum members and I am fine with that, though it would make for an even better experience if they did honor status.  The rooms are nice and comfortable with everything you could need.  The only thing that is  missing like mentioned by someone else is an ioning board and ion which is usually available in other HIExpress properties but I believe a call to the reception would take care of

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: This is a beautiful hotel in the center of Lisbon with a beautiful view from the corner room balcony on the forth floor. Full recognition of my platinum IHG membership when giving me their most beautiful room with balcony. It's a 2 minutes walk to the famous Liberdade Avenue and maximum 30 minutes walk to all major landmarks in Lisbon. The breakfast is one of the best i ever had at any Holiday Inn Express hotel. Big thank you to all the staff who made my stay a beautiful one. When I return to Lisbon with my family, it will be my first choice for sure.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Average hotel. We were greeted by a unfriendly desk clerk on a Saturday morning. She was pretty rude in explaining the covid requirements and early check-in needs. I had booked 3 rooms for three nights and she offered IHG points only on one room even though I paid for all the rooms. One of the nights we walked into the lobby at midnight, and the guy at the desk didn't even raise his eyes let alone offering a greeting of some sort. The bathrooms and breakfast are decent.  Location 4/5 Lobby 2/5 Clean 3/5 Staff 2/5 Check-in 2/5 Bathroom 3/5 Bed 4/5 Minibar Iron not available in the room Breakfast 3/5 Coffee in the room 2/5 Internet 3/5

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The staff, lobby, Covid precautions and breakfast were excellent. Our only issue was our room. We were upgraded (very much appreciated) and again, the staff couldn't have been better. The room has no cabinets, only one shelf and the mattress was extremely firm. I don't know if this is just indicative of European hotels, but we stayed for 3 nights and had no place to put our stuff and pretty much lived out of our suitcase. The location is excellent, and we WOULD recommend this property, just know there is really no place other than a few hangers to put any clothing if you're staying more than a night. Also, I should note that they did not have nor were able to provide a shower cap, that my wife needed, it's not something they have.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Hotel had quite a few positives and a few points that might not suit everyone. Certainly clean, good bathrooms, comfortable beds and adequate breakfast. Location is good as many others state but you need to be closer in to the centre if you don't like walking, or be prepared to use the buses a lot. Not so good points - not the most spacious room, lack of storage space for clothes and bedroom was too warm for us. Hotel wouldn't turn the air con on as they said it was winter and the majority of travellers were heating their rooms according to their computer. The fact that the temperature was between 21 degrees and 26 degrees outside didn't matter. You could open the windows a little but not enough, and the road outside is very busy so from 6.00am onwards it was noisy.  Not a bad

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The hotel is in a good location not at the center but not to far (15 min walk).  Like any other holidayinn it have all that you need for urban vacation.  The rooms are large and well equipped, it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast is free and it is very good start for the day.  Had only bit problem with the WiFi in my room but I think it's because my room was on the corner,  other places in the hotel it worked good. All together I like this hotel.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Stayed here during our Lisbon city break. Basic breakfast but enough to get you started for a day of touring the city.  Friendly front of house staff and the rooms where cleaned daily. Basic hotel but better than other Holiday Inns I have stayed in.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: We come to Portugal every February for week , to get away from the UK weather. Our usual hotel had jacked up the prices, so we looked elsewhere and discovered this hotel. It still a walkable distance from 'our favourite restaurant,'O Saboroso', and the 'Clatter Factor' ( how much noise the breakfast staff make with the crockery and cutlery) is very low compared to our usual hotel further north towards Parque station.  The reception staff are amazing, especially the Girlie who worked the Bar in the late evening. Their English is very good; they could even communicate with a party of 60 + Scousers who were on a school trip.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: There are hotels in the pedestrian-free area near Praca do Comercio. You can be closer to the nightlife in Bairro Alto. You can’t get more authentic than finding a lodging in Alfama. But we found this hotel perfect for our needs and plans. Located at the north end of Lisbon’s Champs Elysees, Avenida da Liberdade, with its black and white-patterned sidewalks, just south of the major Marques de Pombal Metro station, the Holiday Inn Express offers a complimentary breakfast including both hot and cold items, acceptably fast and free Wi-Fi and comfortable rooms (with a number of English-language channels – we could even watch Criminal Minds!). IHG Platinum Elites can elect 2 free drinks from the “bar” (which is really one end of the reception desk!) and the “business center” consists

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: We stayed at this hotel for four nights and loved it. The location is in a good neighborhood and close to Ave Liberdade thoroughfare with terrific restaurants and good transportation options. The hotel is clean, and the reception staff was very kind and attentive to our requests. The breakfast is free and large--and always had my husband's favorite custard tarts, the Portuguese Pasteis de Nata. They also have hot scrambled eggs, a range of 5 rolls/crescent rolls, etc., cereal, fruit, juices and more. I would like to thank the very kind breakfast angel, Aina [sorry, I may have the spelling wrong], who was attentive without hovering, and kept things clean and stocked with fresh food. When I had trouble with the coffee machine, she instantly lent a hand without being nosy or

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: I stayed here for a long overnight layover in Lisbon. The breakfast spread was better than I expected and better than other Holiday Inn Expresses I've stayed at. The room was a decent size for the price and had all the necessities. It isn't right in the thick of things, but given Lisbon's size, it was easy to walk around to the main attractions if you're willing to walk a bit more than 20-30 minutes.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Keeping in mind that it's a 3 star hotel it met all our expectations and more. Centrally located, reasonably priced,  attentive staff, excellent service. The room and bathroom are tiny and very clean. We never heard noise from neighbouring rooms or the corridors in our 4 night visit. Breakfast was ok. I would have liked to see more fresh vegetables than the cucumbers and tomatoes that were provided.  Free wifi worked well.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Very nice clean Hotel in good location. with very friendly staff like Philip, Ana Tika, Ana and they have a complimentary free breakfast. Highly recommended. it is surely a home away from home that we will surely come back.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: My family and I recently stayed at Holiday Express in Lisbon right before Christmas Eve and we had an amazing experience. The hotel is centrally located to shopping and all the tourist sites. The hotel is more like a boutique hotel instead a regular Holiday Inn. The breakfast was very generous and yes, the have fresh pastel de nata! And the customer service from the front desk is top level!!! I have to publicly recognize Adrian who one night warmed our dinner and served it on a plate with utensils. Also, since we checked our early, the front desk had a to go breakfast for us. Lastly, you can’t beat the price. I paid less than $80 a night.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: We booked this hotel in Lisbon because it’s very close to the Liberdade metro station (just around the corner). It’s recently been refurbished and our room was very nice. Very comfortable beds and pillows that were soft on one side and firm on the other. We had a kettle and tea & coffee in the room and also a safe. The bathroom was very modern with a really good shower. Breakfast was excellent with a really good choice - including a machine that made pancakes and also the famous Portuguese custard tarts! Yummy. The only issue we had was that there are not too many restaurants in the immediate area, although if you turn left out of the hotel & keep going until you reach the University & a student area there are a few more. There is a small restaurant next door to the hotel which

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Lisbon!  What a charm!  Of course you have to like history and go with flow attitude. There are many sites to visit and many things to do but you have to be patient with locals and tourists. There are lines everywhere.  Our hotel was a little bit out off the Centro Histórico. Right in the heart of all the designer’s shops. Simple hotel ( with breakfast included! I am not a breakfast eater but it help if you are watching your budget). Room was small but clean. Staff was very friendly.  I love the Tuk Tuk experience. It is price. Different companies and different prices. Started at 50 Euros.  In Europeans countries problem is everything was closed from Dec 24 around 6 pm to Dec26!  Even the main attractions and restaurants!

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: friendly staff and good services. The room was big and comfortable. Public parking in front of the hotel (16€/24h). Good location near Marques de Pombal square. Great option for future visits to Lisbon

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: The main advantage is location - only 25 min drive from/to Internet airport,  3 min walk to metro station and Marques de Portal square, some 15 min walking distance to other places of interest. Very friendly and helpful staff, breakfast might be a bit better in terms of choice.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Location is a plus, but smelly rooms due wear and tear carpet and ventilation, cold water for showers. Recepcionist not willing to satisfy customer. They have a smiley book and see attached comments such “ Bed to small, “we are married couple for over 30 year they gave us a single bed”! pity because the brand or chain of hotels is respectable and we should wait more for a 3 star hotel

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Small comfortable room with good quality beds you come to expect from holiday Inn hotels. Bathroom was clean and small, but good shower pressure so nothing to complain about. hotel is not necessarily located in a central location (only high end shops in walking distance) but you can easily take the metro around town. Breakfast is complementary for stay here. The only complaint i have is how slow the service staff can be here in the hotel. On the day of check out, we had asked the reception to book a taxi to the train station and she really took her time when getting that done while serving other customers checking in (who came after us). In any case we missed our train and had to be rebooked,

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: We stayed here for 3 nights. Check in was quick as we got there in the afternoon. Our room was on the first floor but could not hear any street noises. Room was a decent size with a comfortable bed, a small couch, safe, kettle, small bar fridge, a chair and desk. Breakfast was included and the options were decent. There were a lot of upmarket shops around and a Pingo Doce market about 400 metres around the corner. Bus stops were in the vicinity and there was airport transfer to drop us off 5 minutes from the hotel. We purchased a Viva Viagem card and topped it up with a 24 hour credit that we used on the buses, metro and trams. To top up the card after 24 hours, the best option is to find a local store displaying a "Payshop" icon or a metro station with a manned ticket counter

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: Great hotel, excellent staff.  Although no parking available for the hotel only paid parking during the week, difficult to find parking.  Weekends free  public parking after 7:00 p.m. till Monday but good luck finding a spot.

Hotel: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Av. Liberdade, an IHG hotel
review: This is a very normal hotel in all aspects, and it is in accordance with Express style. Although some of the brand new properties are quite nice, this one isn't.. Pretty much everything was as expected, can't really  complain, but can't say it was something special either.  I already stayed here 2.5 years ago so my expectations were not high especially because at this time  I paid 99% more and I feel that a 86€ rate per night for one person is far too much. I would have chosen another hotel for a better price, only if I could.

Overall I had a very good experience in this hotel and would happily come back, mostly for its ideal location.   (+) What I really enjoyed:  - Ideal location: close by trams, metro and station, at a short walk from all restaurants and shops - Very realiable internet - Good size bedroom with nice decoration and design, comfortable bed  - Rituals washing products in the bedroom; it smells amazing.   (-) What could be improved:  - Although staff was friendly, I found them lacking professionalism and knowledge. There was an issue with the thermostat of my room; it was 28*c and AC wouldn’t work. I had to call them 3 times to have it fixed, assuring me each time it was solved and that temperature was centrally managed by the reception. In reality it is not managed centrally as we can

We have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is great! It is value for money. Our room was very beautiful and VERY CLEAN!  We love the design, the amenities, the smell in th lobby and above all the small detail they have left for my bestfriend,'s birthday. The location is PERFECT! Close to the metro Rossio (very convenient to/from the airport), the train to go to Sintra, the line 15e to go to Belem Tower and walkable to all the main attractions. Staffs are friendly. Thanks for everything! We will definetly comeback!

Great location but would have preferred a choice of rooms instead of the roof of the adjacent bldg. No views in a beautiful city and I was on the top floor ! The room was very nice (boutique hotel) but was a little strange that every evening when the temperature rise in the room I had to call the front desk to lower the temp. They controlled the thermostat from the front desk. Overall a great location, close to Rossi Station, all the shops, Chiado, but I may try their other location the Figueira across the street next time.

The location for this hotel is incredible - so close to everything I wanted to see in Lisbon (or the public transit to take me there). One thing that was weird was that I had no ability to control the AC.  I was on the 5th floor & it got hot (maybe not hot for Portguese, but definitely hot for a Canadian).  I had to phone down to have control over the A/C to be able to turn it on.  Next day - same thing.  I think it happened 3 times.  They have a screen that monitors temperature & would agree that it was hot.  But why did this need me to say I'm hot numerous times? Other than that, it was quiet at night, very clean, and nice shower.  Internet worked well in the rooms.

We stayed here for 5 nights. The location is SUPER; convient to everything. The room was very nice, clean.  The only problem was that our heat was not working.  The room got very warm at night and when we mentioned it in the morning the response was that they would shut it off.  We ended up leaving the window open at night but then it got too cold.   Breakfast was good; not real good.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

Overall I had a very good experience in this hotel and would happily come back, mostly for its ideal location.   (+) What I really enjoyed:  - Ideal location: close by trams, metro and station, at a short walk from all restaurants and shops - Very realiable internet - Good size bedroom with nice decoration and design, comfortable bed  - Rituals washing products in the bedroom; it smells amazing.   (-) What could be improved:  - Although staff was friendly, I found them lacking professionalism and knowledge. There was an issue with the thermostat of my room; it was 28*c and AC wouldn’t work. I had to call them 3 times to have it fixed, assuring me each time it was solved and that temperature was centrally managed by the reception. In reality it is not managed centrally as we can

We have stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. The hotel is great! It is value for money. Our room was very beautiful and VERY CLEAN!  We love the design, the amenities, the smell in th lobby and above all the small detail they have left for my bestfriend,'s birthday. The location is PERFECT! Close to the metro Rossio (very convenient to/from the airport), the train to go to Sintra, the line 15e to go to Belem Tower and walkable to all the main attractions. Staffs are friendly. Thanks for everything! We will definetly comeback!

Great location but would have preferred a choice of rooms instead of the roof of the adjacent bldg. No views in a beautiful city and I was on the top floor ! The room was very nice (boutique hotel) but was a little strange that every evening when the temperature rise in the room I had to call the front desk to lower the temp. They controlled the thermostat from the front desk. Overall a great location, close to Rossi Station, all the shops, Chiado, but I may try their other location the Figueira across the street next time.

The location for this hotel is incredible - so close to everything I wanted to see in Lisbon (or the public transit to take me there). One thing that was weird was that I had no ability to control the AC.  I was on the 5th floor & it got hot (maybe not hot for Portguese, but definitely hot for a Canadian).  I had to phone down to have control over the A/C to be able to turn it on.  Next day - same thing.  I think it happened 3 times.  They have a screen that monitors temperature & would agree that it was hot.  But why did this need me to say I'm hot numerous times? Other than that, it was quiet at night, very clean, and nice shower.  Internet worked well in the rooms.

We stayed here for 5 nights. The location is SUPER; convient to everything. The room was very nice, clean.  The only problem was that our heat was not working.  The room got very warm at night and when we mentioned it in the morning the response was that they would shut it off.  We ended up leaving the window open at night but then it got too cold.   Breakfast was good; not real good.  Staff was friendly and helpful.

Good hotel with perfect location for exploring. The room we had was spacious and modern. The only negative was the staff were a little cold, making us come down and pick up an ironing board and iron versus delivering to our room. Altogether would still very much recommend.

Good hotel in very central location, room a little tight and a ropey view, but, just don’t stay in and look out the window all day your not hear to stay in the room, you can do that at home 🥴but hotel and room clean and tidy.  However a very special shout out to the guy in the image, Matheus, he was simply magical, always smiling, we could tell even behind the face mask, he helped us out of a particularly tough scenario and also managed to get us a room at the eleventh hour. Thanks Matheus, good luck in your career…!

We stayed here for five nights in mid September'21. The hotel exceeded our expectations in each category: front desk staff, room size, decor, cleanliness, amenities, proximity to restaurants, attractions, and access to public transportation.   Starting with front desk staff Mr Mendes and Mr Gomes: both answered my email queries promptly within a business day. Helped alleviate my concerns about COVID and provided detailed directions  to the hotel from Lisbon airport using metro.  Mr. Matheu Gomes went above and beyond by going on a hunt for more comfortable pillow so that I got good night's sleep. Our room was on the fourth floor, facing inside "well" which made it bit dark but upside was peace and quiet at night. Exterior rooms can be bit noisy because of street noise. Hotel

Very clean and modern, it seems like the hotel has been refurbished lately, everything looks clean and new. Bed was super comfy and the room is totally soundproof. I slept there like a stone, if you are looking for comfort you're at the right place.

I needed a place to stay in while searching for an apartment to rent and this place was the perfect place! I personally loved the tight corridors and the modern rooms in this old building. The hotel is located in a really busy area and is close to everything you might need from metros to restaurants and city viewpoints. I recommend this hotel whenever you’re in Lisbon!

I like the location which was quite convienent as it was centrally located next to all the outdoor activities and at Rossio, and the building is quite old. I liked that the price of rhte hotel was only 40/p night which was great for Oktober when still sunny.  The room however 514 had an very not nice smell of hamburgers if you opened the windows, and i also felt it was quite loud so i did not slept very good.  The reception is not very helpful, it is very much 'barbie and ken' on the reception and they do not understand your needs.  Unless this hotel is offering me anything i might not stay here again.

This is an exciting hotel that has a historic site in it's restaurant. A well that had been dug hundreds of years before civilization. This well is so important that the government asked the hotel to preserve it. Ask to see the well whenever you are in the environs

We are very pleased with our experience at this hotel. From the start the staff was very helpful with everything. They speak and understand english very well. We booked a double room and it was very spacious, more than we expected. It was  clean and everything looked very well taken care of. The bed and pillows are comfortable. The A/C  worked well, during the nights it would get very cold. We also did not have any problem with outside noise.  As for the location, the hotel is perfectly located. Everyhting is of walking distance.  There is also a parking space in front of the hotel for scooters or motors. This made it great for travelling.   Over and all we loved our stay in Lisbon.   P.s. as for the people who are wondering about the corona virus. In Lisbon, people take it very

Been there on the week of June 15th. The usual friendly and efficient staff. From reception to the room i felt very safe, but with the "human touch" we always like to have. From the moment you step in the hotel, you feel you are in a safe environment but without beeing excessive.  The Hotel is very well located, and the perfect choice in this new times.

We loved this hotel, the location is perfect.  It was our first time in Lisbon and were so happy that we chose this place when we booked.  There is so much to see in this city and the hotel is right in the center of it.  Easy access to public transport when we did not feel like walking.   The hotel itself is very nice,  and the staff were so helpful and nice.  We thought that before the virus scare forced us to abandon the rest our trip, and the staff really came through for us when we were scrambling to make new plans.    I do not see how anyone could have been more helpful and encouraging during this time.

The location was great.  It was within walking distance from pretty much everywhere we wanted to go.  The view from the room was fantastic.  It was the first hotel we stayed for our honeymoon of 1 month around Europe.  The hotel went above and beyond to make our stay memorable.  The only thing that took away 1 star from my review was the breakfast.  Our package included breakfast, so we went down for breakfast daily.  We stayed 4 nights but the menu was EXACTLY the same during the entire stay.

The hotel is located very near a plaza with a great and vibrant market. It is also very near both the trolley and bus stops and an easy walk to the train station to catch the train to Cascais (40 minute ride and a  must visit town). It is also surrounded by shops and restaurants and just a few steps to the pedestrian-only streets leading to the river, just through the old arch. It's an easy walk to Lisbon's "Champs Elysee" as well, so it's really a perfect location for people watching, exploring and dining. We were upgraded to a larger room, a mini-suite of sorts, for no extra charge  during our week's stay. Even so, the room was small as was the bathroom. That said, it was very clean, very modern and fine as we were really only there for sleeping, and sleeping was great, the

Excellent central location with bars and restaurants literally on the door step. Very handy for the old town and castle as well. Decent rooms and very helpful staff on reception. A little tired in places but excellent as a central base.

We stayed for a week. We were upgraded to a larger room, but even with that, it was pretty right quarters. Comfy bed. Street noise, but with windows closed, silence. Convenient location to the River area and all that it offers. Lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. Near trolley stops and train to Cascais. Great breakfast buffet. Very good value. Staff were wonderful. Very helpful and friendly and professional. Highly recommend for travelling a mid-range budget.

Stayed here for a night when visiting Lisbon.  Excellent value. Spotlessly clean. Right in the middle of the touristy area. Lots of restaurants close by. Checkin and out were easy. Ticks all the boxes. Recommended

Myself & mt husband stayed in this hotel. I would highly recommend it. It was reasonably priced & the room & bathroom were exceptional. It was my bday & I don't know knew but we came back to the room to a bottle of champagne & cake, such a lovely surprise. It is centrally located & spotless. I wouldnt hesitate to go back.

We booked this hotel for our three days citytrip because it's central and close to everything. We had a great experience here. The rooms are very clean and the interior is very nice. The bathroom is a bit small, but nothing to complain about. The breakfast has everything you need. There is also a very friendly staff who will help you with all your problems. We will definitely recommend this.

In November, 2019,  another teacher and I led a group of students to a conference in Lisbon and stayed in Hotel Tejo largely because of what seemed to be a perfect location.  In addition, their pre-arrival communication was superb:  they were patient as our group size changed, as we had specific requests for room location, and as we had many questions to be answered. Hotel Tejo turned out to be even better that we had hoped. Our group was on two floors and could easily communicate for group work.  The seating area outside the breakfast room was perfect for gathering (computer research and writing andfinalizing group plans).   All of the staff were friendly and helpful; I want to mention especially Silvia, Telmo, Rafael, Nina, Patricia, Tiago, and Oksana --and hope I did not

we stayed at the hotel for 3 nights during the new year week.. the check-in & check-out process was very smooth.. the standard double room was small considering we were traveling with a 5yr old kid but we were mentally prepared for it and didn't have any issue otherwise.. we managed to accomodate our 4 suitcases in the room without much issues.. the best part of the room is the setup & facilities are contemporary as well as the design with lots of useful spaces to keep your stuff.. the location is a plus with hardly a 5 minute walk to Rossio station.. later on the trip, we stayed at another hotel (higher rated & on Av. Liberdade) for 3 nights and without a doubt My Story Tejo was much superior than that one.. we would recommend this hotel for a no-frills stay in lisbon anyday !!

We had an overnight stay at My Story Hotel Tejo. We booked directly with the hotel & their communication was excellent. The location is fantastic, very central. Room was pretty new but pretty small as we expected in such a central location. Breakfast was pretty average. Overall a pleasant stay.

What can I say except we are absolute gutted that we can not return to this wonderful hotel this weekend for our wedding anniversary.  We came here for our honeymoon in December 2019 (1000 percent was the best choice from us our honeymoon was made so magical by how the hotel went above and beyond), we planned to come last December due to covid had to upsetting postpone and was due to come again from the 4th until the 13th of December and due to covid have made the heartbreaking decision to postpone again as the risk for travel is just so uncertain especially as I have health issues. From the moment we made our booking the hotel reached out to us to ask for preferences and requests for arrival. I cheekily asked for the same room as our honeymoon, nothing has been to much trouble.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 days with my daughter. The location is brilliant as in the centre and also near the airport. The room was a reasonable size and clean . However during the 3 nights we stayed no toiletries were replaced and also same was for tea/ coffee . No replacement after the first night and no milk was provided. There was a coffee machine in the room but wasn’t working . This was reported to reception. Also the jacuzzi wasn’t working. Although hotel is rated as 5 star it is more like 3 star due to the reasons mentioned. Check in was quick and staff were very professional and helpful especially the staff at the front of the hotel .Breakfast was an excellent spread and staff in the restaurant went the extra mile to look after us . Would stay here again due to the

In general the attention is great and very respectful. Nothing works, but people is attentive. Its more a 3 stars hotel.  I was mistreated by the lawyer of the hotel that accessed the Business Lounge to have a coffee with someone. Talking loud in a business area.  Comments like: "I am Portuguese and Brazilians are not welcome here in Portugal. Here things work differently." "I am in charge here, so you are not welcome".    He didnt allowed me to answer and when I said that he was being bad educated, he told me that he could demand me.   Besides of that, told me I was not in adequate clothes on a Saturday in afternoon since I had left the Gym and started to work for a few hours in the business lounge. I was wearing a T-shirt and shorts like any person who used the gym. Never felt

Definitely not a 5 star. Tired property, breakfast is way below a 5 star standard - asked for off buffet poached eggs on toast with avocado: eggs were overdone, toast soggy, avocado barely ripe.  Shower gel empty in the room, no slippers. Poor overall, won’t return

We spent two days at the Altis Grande which is in a great location close to the Metro at Avenida as well as being near to a useful choice of buses.   The staff made us feel very welcome & it was pleasing to see a sense of normality returning to hospitality & life in general. Personally I'll be happy when the mask rule for employees is dropped. It's unhealthy for the staff & I think we all prefer to see a face when we communicate.  We appreciated: comfortable bed, instant hot water with good pressure & an airy balcony (we were on 11th floor).  Breakfast was a typical buffet that you would expect at this level.   Sadly because we spent so much time out, we didn't use the various facilities the hotel has to offer but they looked good & were clean & well presented.  All in all, a

What can I say except we are absolute gutted that we can not return to this wonderful hotel this weekend for our wedding anniversary.  We came here for our honeymoon in December 2019 (1000 percent was the best choice from us our honeymoon was made so magical by how the hotel went above and beyond), we planned to come last December due to covid had to upsetting postpone and was due to come again from the 4th until the 13th of December and due to covid have made the heartbreaking decision to postpone again as the risk for travel is just so uncertain especially as I have health issues. From the moment we made our booking the hotel reached out to us to ask for preferences and requests for arrival. I cheekily asked for the same room as our honeymoon, nothing has been to much trouble.

I stayed at this hotel for 4 days with my daughter. The location is brilliant as in the centre and also near the airport. The room was a reasonable size and clean . However during the 3 nights we stayed no toiletries were replaced and also same was for tea/ coffee . No replacement after the first night and no milk was provided. There was a coffee machine in the room but wasn’t working . This was reported to reception. Also the jacuzzi wasn’t working. Although hotel is rated as 5 star it is more like 3 star due to the reasons mentioned. Check in was quick and staff were very professional and helpful especially the staff at the front of the hotel .Breakfast was an excellent spread and staff in the restaurant went the extra mile to look after us . Would stay here again due to the

I was mistreated by the lawyer of the hotel that accessed the Business Lounge to have a coffee with someone. Talking loud in a business area.  Comments like: "I am Portuguese and Brazilians are not welcome here in Portugal. Here things work differently." "I am in charge here, so you are not welcome".    He didnt allowed me to answer and when I said that he was being bad educated, he told me that he could demand me.   Besides of that, told me I was not in adequate clothes on a Saturday in afternoon since I had left the Gym and started to work for a few hours in the business lounge. I was wearing a T-shirt and shorts like any person who used the gym. Never felt

Definitely not a 5 star. Tired property, breakfast is way below a 5 star standard - asked for off buffet poached eggs on toast with avocado: eggs were overdone, toast soggy, avocado barely ripe.  Shower gel empty in the room, no slippers. Poor overall, won’t return

The staff made us feel very welcome & it was pleasing to see a sense of normality returning to hospitality & life in general. Personally I'll be happy when the mask rule for employees is dropped. It's unhealthy for the staff & I think we all prefer to see a face when we communicate.  We appreciated: comfortable bed, instant hot water with good pressure & an airy balcony (we were on 11th floor).  Breakfast was a typical buffet that you would expect at this level.   Sadly because we spent so much time out, we didn't use the various facilities the hotel has to offer but they looked good & were clean & well presented.  All in all, a

We have just stayed at the Altis Grand for 3 nights.  The staff are all very friendly but I don’t believe this should be being advertised as a 5* hotel.  We originally booked a suite as we are a family of 4. At check in we were told we had been given an upgrade and now had two of their deluxe doubles with interconnecting rooms. We stayed put as in terms of space these were better but no balcony and the rooms are we had were right outside the lifts so we could hear people arriving and leaving the floor.  In terms of not being 5 * they’re were lots of little issues. Threadbare towels, dressing gown with broken loops, room not cleaned until 5pm. Dirty pool towels not taken. No ironing board.. had to go down to reception to get this as no details of the numbers to ring to request.

Good location and really enjoyed my stay.  Lovely decor and front desk staff very friendly and helpful.  The lobby area was always very quite.  The hotel only reopened the day I arrived. Had a few drinks at night on the roof top bar.  Didn't eat in-the hotel.  Rooms were very nice and decent size with excellent shower.  The hotel was a 10 min walk from eating and shopping area and 20 min walk from the main downtown area.  Would stay again without a thought

We spend 2 nights there .. the hotel Recaption in Sad mood .. seems you are in a grave .. no action !! Spa closed.. Jacquziiii closed.. swimming pool closed, but other hotels is facilite those issues .. rooms sad too .. douche water pressure is not that and hot water need time to come .. mattress is not comfortable.. I went from hotel with Low Back Pain !!  I don’t recommend this hotel .

I booked this hotel online through a third party (booking.com). I then received a message to say the hotel wasn't even opened and that my booking was being transferred to one of their sister hotels which were way inferior in quality. I don't understand how they are allowed to actively sell rooms in a hotel that's not even open, it's bizarre!

Stayed at Altis Grand Hotel in early March 2020, before Covid-19 started to affect the world.  Staff was friendly and helpful and overall had a nice stay.  The room was nice and was fairly clean, but nothing too out of the ordinary.  The lobby of the hotel and the hallways which were very dark seemed to feel a bit outdated.  While the hotel was nice I had a good stay, I wouldn't necessarily consider it 5 star....in cities like New York or London it would be closer to a 3.5-4.    The hotel pool area/spa was a huge plus and was very nice!

From the moment we arrived our stay was excellent at this hotel, myself and my husband chose  this hotel for our honeymoon in December and what a great choice we made, from the moment we arrived the staff were welcoming, friendly and went above and beyond to provide such an excellent service. We stayed on the 7th foor the room was spacious and comfortable and the cleaning service team ensured the room was spotless. The hotel has an amazing location and it's down a side street but not to far from the central areas if lisbon by foot or taxi. The spa was great with friendly staff and the staff at the bar on the 12th floor were also very welcoming the view from the bar in the evening overlooking lisbon was lovely  and we often sat for a while enjoying the view with a drink or two.

My daughter and I stayed at the Altis Grand Hotel in March before being advised to return to Australia due to the COVID-19 virus.    i cannot praise the hotel and it's staff highly enough.    I had previously enjoyed a stay there last year and even though it involved changing hotels, I preferred to return to the Altis.    The hotel is in a great location and has excellent facilities.    Everything is spotless and extremely comfortable.    We were so lucky to be upgraded to a suite which was completely unexpected and so appreciated, especially as we had to stay on two extra nights.   The number one feature of this hotel is the staff who are all fantastic.    They are welcoming, friendly, courteous and helpful, offering excellent service at all times.     I must single out Mr.

We stayed at the Altis Grand for five nights and wish we had stayed longer. The staff are very friendly and the junior suite we stayed in was well laid out and very comfortable. The hotel is close to all the amenities and a pleasant walk to the Praca do Comercio with all the restuarants and shops. The restuarants in the hotel are very good. We had lovely meals in both the burs and the grill on the top floor. Excellent breakfast as well. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Visited Lisbon with my daughter and she made a great hotel choice. We arrived early and our room was available which was a great start. All the staff in the hotel looked after us really well. Room was a good size and had really comfortable beds with amazing pillows. We were given a complimentary offer of a free cocktail each in the 12th floor bar for both nights if our visit. We paid separately for breakfast one morning which was good with lots to choose from as well as being able to make requests for other things like omelettes but not sure it was worth the 18 euros per person cost. The shuttle bus timed perfectly for our return trip to the airport too but be aware it does not run frequently and only has space for 8 passengers so book when you check in.  Now for the reasons I

Firstly, I cannot thank the staff enough. The level of service we received was above and beyond expectation. Unfortunately, we had to make multiple changes with our reservation (at no fault of the hotel, due only to changes in our requirements), however, each change was met warmly and we were not messed around at all.  The hotel is ideally located in one of the nicer, posher, areas of the city. It is far away enough from the major roads for noise not to be an issue. There is a metro station just 5 minutes away and it is easy to flag down a taxi on the previously mentioned main road.  We only ate breakfast at the hotel, which was sublime. The large array of foods was impressive and everything we tried was delicious.  We stayed in one of the Family Suites and it was perfect for

From start to finish I have to say this hotel was beyond amazing. From the minute we arrived until the moment we left the hotel made us feel so welcome. Arrived on an early flight and we were given a room straight away. Every evening after a day of exploring we came back to the room to little treats of desserts and champagne or port. Staff also treated me to a birthday cake on the evening of my birthday with a candle included. Location is in an upmarket part of town but only a short walk to the best bars in the city. Prices in the hotel are a little more expensive than other parts but well worth it for the little perks that come with it. Although when I say expensive it’s still a lot cheaper than Dublin City prices. To stay in the hotel is more than reasonable. I have paid more

Superb City Centre 5 star hotel. The staff were brilliant. The concierge service couldn't have been better, supplying all the information that we requested (it was our first visit to the city). On the day that we left a taxi was instantly available to take us to the station. An early problem with a sub-standard meal in the bistro was soon rectified by the Guest Experience Manager Filipa Batalha who personally liaised with the restaurant manager and ensured that we received a free meal as compensation. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

I have organised my scientific conferences already many times at this hotel. Their service is impeccable. They do their utmost best to fulfill all client's requests. As a conference organizer it is very important to know that you can rely on the service at the venue and they do so with a smile. I really recommend this hotel highly for their price/quality policy/high quality food and last but not least for their excellent service!

I travelled with my husband and our 10 year old daughter. From the minute we arrived at the hotel we loved it. Check in was very fast and our bags were brought to our room. The room was lovely, the bathroom was nicely decorated, clean and we also had slippers and gowns.  BREAKFAST We had breakfast every morning which was lovely. It was a buffet breakfast with a good variety of foods, with everything from eggs, fruits, pastries, breads and much more. Most morning we were greeted by Mariana who was always smiling and would show us to our seats. Paulo who was friendly and always seemed so happy would make sure we had coffee and was kind enough to get my daughter apple juice. Now for 6 days at breakfast I would always see this one staff member making sure the food was full, the food

Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. Best experience ever in Europe! Each and every staff member was more than helpful.I would like to mention the personel in the 12th floor roof bar: Joag Mercles, Joao Santes and Marie. They were extremely friendly and service was excellent. The breakfast buffet in the morning was excellent and especially great experience with service by Paulo. Last but not forgoten was the guys at the front door,very personal and helpful. Overall a great first experience in Portugal thanks to the staff.  Carl

Rooms are very clean, buffet breakfast was good, Guest service was very good. Good location. close to shopping area. Good restaurants nearby. There is a sightseeing tour's  starting pointing at a walking distance from the hotel.

We only booked this trip last minute as we cancelled our trip to Asia due to coronavirus and I have to say - this was one of the best holidays we have EVER had.  The Altis Grand has got to be one of the best experiences in my life.  From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, we were treated like royalty and the hospitality is genuine from everyone.  Luis the General Manager interacts with Guests as do Guest Services led by Joana and they do everything they can to make your stay so memorable - nothing is too much trouble for anyone.  The hotel is fairly central and taxi from airport is approx 15 euros after the driver adds a bit but it's door to door and a good 20 minutes or more and perfect if you are new to Lisbon.    The food and drink at the Altis Grand is excellent

Had a great stay here with my family. Triple room was plenty big enough for the three of us. Service was excellent the staff could not do enough for us including a very nice gift on our last night. Great location, restaurants are within 5 minutes walk and a further 5 minutes sees you in the main square with more restaurants and good shopping. Would definitely stay here again. If i was to be picky with the room it could do with a few more sockets or usb charging points for our phones. The dressing area could do with a bit more lighting but i am still giving it 5 out of 5 Excellent!!

Impressed with the hospitality of the staff at this hotel. Guest service personnel great and came to find us next day to check all had gone as planned. Thank you Sandra. At breakfast a lot of variety and can order anything else not on display. Marianna made us feel much more than welcome and nothing was too much. Best impressions

So I was staying here for 4 nights. I booked a surprior, however when checked in the room it was nice but not up to my Paar,  I when to the front desk after an hour contemplating if I should change it or not, however this wonder receptionist said ofcourse as long as your happy we are happy, i was blown away with her response. Customer service here is everything, they attend to all your needs without hesitation. Rooms are nice, pool, hottub etc. Is great. The best part of this is that all you don't need to pay extra service to use them, most hotel in Europe you have to. Well said I am recommending this hotel to you. If you need great service why not. Thanks Altis Grand Hotel Lissabon 😉😉😉😘😘😘

We stayed there for 3 days . The lady receptionist was really helpful and helped us throughout our stay . She was very kind and told us about a few places . Breakfast was good . Lovely choice and the team was very friendly.

Good hotel with good breakfast, the front desk manager very rude since the first day. I just ask him some informatios and he just give us one map not very helpfull. The last day he charge me 12€ for city tax and 30€ parking and he tell me the i have to pay cash because the machine it is not working ok i pay cash and i left my email for the receipt because the printer not working. One week after and i dont have my receit yet. Very strange pay only cash when i pass to the breakfaat room i saw people pay things with card.

I spent eight spectacular days in Lisbon, the hotel where we were staying very good was recommended by some friends, nice and quiet room, wonderful breakfast. It was all wonderful except for the part of the checkout that a gentleman I think is the head of reception because he was the only one who had the uniform different from everyone else, does not give a good day to the people passing by, does not give a smile and is always Head down, you don't seem to like looking at customers. I asked to leave around 13h said yes but at 12h30 was already calling the room, with a boss like this oh my god ...   But for the rest it was all very good and I think I will go back.

Hotel is old. Our room was located in the basement floor and dark. Breakfast was good. The  staff is very friendly and helpful. Nice place but a bit of walk to Lisbon center. Near this hotel there are hotels much better for this price.

We planned to stay 3 nights in Lisbon before heading to Madrid, and needed a hotel with a staffed reception offering accommodations for 3 adults.This one was perfect, just a few steps from the Anjos metro stations, which allowed us to movie around Lisbon, visiting the neighborhoods we were interested in exploring while avoiding the crowds and loud noises at night. The room was clean and well- furnished, the included breakfast had Light fare like fresh fruits and cereal, as well as heavier options like eggs, sausages, breads, espresso, and juice selections. This allowed us to avoid an extra stop on the way to exploring museums, churches, and other adventures in the city. There were many neighborhood eateries catering to locals, which is the kind of places we like to sponsor.  It

We stayed there for 3 days . The lady receptionist was really helpful and helped us throughout our stay . She was very kind and told us about a few places . Breakfast was good . Lovely choice and the team was very friendly.

One week after and i dont have my receit yet. Very strange pay only cash when i pass to the breakfaat room i saw people pay things with card.
