I asked to leave around 13h said yes but at 12h30 was already calling the room, with a boss like this oh my god ...   But for the rest it was all very good and I think I will go back.

Hotel is old. Our room was located in the basement floor and dark. Breakfast was good. The  staff is very friendly and helpful. Nice place but a bit of walk to Lisbon center. Near this hotel there are hotels much better for this price.

We planned to stay 3 nights in Lisbon before heading to Madrid, and needed a hotel with a staffed reception offering accommodations for 3 adults.This one was perfect, just a few steps from the Anjos metro stations, which allowed us to movie around Lisbon, visiting the neighborhoods we were interested in exploring while avoiding the crowds and loud noises at night. The room was clean and well- furnished, the included breakfast had Light fare like fresh fruits and cereal, as well as heavier options like eggs, sausages, breads, espresso, and juice selections. This allowed us to avoid an extra stop on the way to exploring museums, churches, and other adventures in the city. There were many neighborhood eateries catering to locals, which is the kind of places we like to sponsor.  It

We stayed at this hotel only one night before a cruise. Friendly stuff. Located near restaurants and shops. Not so far from airport and cruise port. The breakfast was very, very good with lots of jummy fruits.

Rooms okay, if you’re sensitive to noise... avoid. Don’t count on their wifi. Breakfast: avoid if you can (not fresh on all days of stay): staff at breakfast were smiling and very helpful. Reception staff, depends their mood... Location good, 3 minutes from Anjos Metro.  Parking: great asset; they have a contract with an underground parking nearby. We will not return.

Nice, modern, city hotel. Spotlessly clean and elegantly designed throughout. Good sized and well proportioned room with everything you need - big screen television, but no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. You had to buy these in the bar area which was a nuisance. Good selection at breakfast, with everything you need. Staff businesslike and professionally discreet rather than 'friendly'. Well positioned just next to Anjos Metro Station a couple of stops from everywhere, or brief walk to the centre. Only drawback was our room was on the ground floor next to lift shaft, although we couldn't hear the lift there were people who would occasionally be a bit noisy while they waited for it. And unfortunately on the ground floor there is a constant rumble of the metro trains as

I had a nice stay in Lisbon for 3 days, hotel recommended by a friend and very good even, near the center clean room a bit noisy maybe for being on the 1st floor. The only thing that went wrong was the day before leaving I forgot my phone in the room and under the phone had a note of 20 euros and one of 10 euros and when I got to the room around 7:00 pm I see that there is only the my phone and the notes do not. I am sure that I left the money but also did not want to get in trouble and did not say anything at the reception because otherwise they were all very nice in the reception. I will return to Lisbon and to this hotel. Sorry for my bad English. Room:105  Arrive 14-4   Departure 17-4

Good Hotel with  Amazing Breakfast. Near the Subway, 20minuts walk to the center of Lissabon. Perfect fot a little Trip or for a buisiness meeting. The Service staff were extremely helpfull and nice. Recommended.

Nice hotel. Very clean.It is situated not far from the very center-about 15 minutes on foot.The food -breakfast-is tasty. Lots of  fruit. It is available to order different excursions, VERY GOOD  GUIDE- Zsanna and polite  and helpful driver Vladislav.Advice to choose this hotel.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Conveniently located ,stones throw from " Anjos " metro,green line. Check in was effortless, didn't have any other interaction with staff. Room was spacious enough for 2 ,with a table ,chair ,closet with safe n a mini bar. Toilet and bathroom was in good nick.T.V with English channels. Room was neat n tidy and cleant daily. Breakfast was plentiful. Tea/coffee/juice machine.Variety of cereals,bread ,cake,yogurt, spreads. Fresh fruit n canned fruit. Hot breakfast consisted of bacon/cocktail sausages, scrambled/fried eggs, changes everyday. Snacks can be ordered in the restaurant ,but limited menu. Never used the bar. Auchan supermarket next door,and a few others nearby. Patisserie opposite ,a nice Goan restaurant behind the hotel on Rua do Zaire, and a

Price is ok. Unfotunately we got suprice when we booked pre-paid room for 3 people and they asked extra 30 EUR money for this third people. At the end it was still good price, beacause we don't need to take extra room for this one person :) If you get room in first floor, then you hear Merto traffic

A good choice of hotel in Lisbon.  The price was reasonable for what it is.  Rooms and surrounds are of a good standard,  Of note are small outdoor area, free breakfast which was adequate, Metro station being outside the door plus closeness to the airport.  Only 'snacks' seem to be sold in the evening but many good restaurants in the area if you are prepared to search for them.  Would recommend.

The hotel was at even better situated than we imagined. Metro near and also the well known tram 28 (goes around Lisbon). The staff were extremely helpfull and nice. Breakfast was really good, everything needed. Rooms were tidy and cleaned everyday. Highly recommend.

The location was just a five minutes drive from City Center. Many decent Indian resturant just around the corner. Very comfortable and spacious rooms with good wash rooms. . Breakfast was just fine & they can do better. Tea coffees makers was not in the room which I believe is a must . . But otherwise no complains. Staff helpful & very co operative. .

A tale of two hotels.  Chapter 2:  Hotel Travel Park (for Chapter 1 go to my review of the HF Porto Tuela, Porto)  We stayed at the Travel Park as part of a package vacation offered by Air Canada Rouge.  This is rated as a 3 Star hotel but in comparison to the Porto Tuela it is definitely at the lower end of the 3 star rating.  To be fair if we had not stayed at the Tuela first I probably would not have been as dissatisfied as I am.    The rooms are very dated. We had a twin room but because of the size of the room the beds were pushed together.  We had a street side room and it was really noisy.  The bathroom was dated and it was impossible to take a shower without flooding the bathroom.  The beds were reasonably comfortable.  What really differentiated this 3 star from the

The hotel has all the basics needed for a short stay. The hotel is a bit of a walk from all the major sites but is doable. The room has basic furniture and bedding however it is spacious and bathroom is big too. Breakfast area is big and food is plentiful. I stayed two nights and the place was perfect for anyone in a mid-range budget.

Clean rooms, good breakfast and close location to the center. The only thing that made the stay not so confortable was the lack of electric socets near the beds for devices charging. There is only 2 available: one in the bathroom and one near the TV, which creats disconfort.

Good hotel, breakfast was very good and the lady in the breakfast room very nice. Would like to thank the young lady from the check in who was always smiling and gave us all the information's and tips to visit her beautiful city. In general everyone was helpful just exception for a man in the reception that we think was the manager (was dressing different from the rest) that was not friendly at all, never saw he smiling or standing to speak to the guests. But we'll recommend the hotel to our family's.

We stayed 3nights in hotel Travel Park, Lisbon.the room was very nice and we had a comfortable stay.the hotel us centrally located and the metro station was 5 mins walk from the hotel.so many very good eateries were found very close to the hotel.the staff were very friendly.if any problem they will attend to it immediately.if going again will definitely will stay here only.

I stayed only one night in room 405 on May 5th. I liked the hotel, quiet and clean room is the most important. The funniest thing I saw was when I was checking in by a gentleman who was very nice and helpful, but in the other chair was a lady always sitting listening to anything on the computer too loud and too many people behind me to check in. Poor man who must have checked all at that moment. She ought to have more respect for her colleague, but who I am to say this is just an outburst.   I loved the city is already the 3rd time I come to Lisbon and I will go back for the year and for this hotel. Greeting From Canada

I stayed in 5 hotels on my Spain and Portugal trip so I had a good comparison. While none of the issues ruined my stay, combined they caused me to issue an average rating.  It started when I checked in - they said I did not have a reservation for me.  After investigating, they said that hotels.com was at fault and that they had only 1 room left. The bathroom had what looked like mold in the tub(see the picture), the clothes line did not work, the a/c was hit or miss, and the safe did not work. The shower head was broken but they fixed that after we reported it.   Other reviews say this is in a good location, but I disagree. It is very close to the Anjos metro stop, but all the good sights require a long walk or taking the metro. The surrounding area is not what I would call

I really enjoyed the hotel and for sure I will go back but next time with my husband. Room good, cleanliness excellent, breakfast good and varied. Only the lady from the reception who checked me in needs to improve a lot. When I get the reception I do not see anyone but I hear background noise should be watching some movie on the computer and (was not able to get up and say good afternoon come to this side to do your check in please) Unfriendly, never gave a smile ... but this must happen everywhere. However I returned home super happy with the hotel and the city. Regards Brakensiek

I have never visited Lisbon before and came here for the Eurovision Song Contest . I still have one day of my trip left. The hotel is lovely and spotlessly clean . Wonderful spacious rooms ( only one charging point though ). The breakfast really hits the spot and the hot food really is hot always . Amazing cold buffet also. The nice thing is that the buffet changed from day to day so you don’t get bored with the same thing . The garlic mushrooms are to die for , I loved them. The staff are friendly , polite , always smiling , attentive and very smart . I have to say thank you especially to Patel and Chemi who have looked after me so well . They are truly an asset to the hotel and are making my stay even more pleasurable. Thank you guys !

The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and welcoming and the biggest asset of the hotel.  My room was nice and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  I cannot fault the cleaning – the common areas and my room were spotless.  The location is great, with easy access to Metro stations and downtown.  I’ve given four rather than five stars though as the breakfast was hit and miss, plus the hotel would benefit from a better communal lounge/bar area for guests to use.

Lovely, comfortable and clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Great location, walking distance from many interesting places and  close to subways and buses. Good breakfast with really nice staff. The rooms aren’t huge, but have very good bed and bedding. Will surely return!

Stayed for 8 nights in panoramic room (7th floor). Our room was big with great view from the balcony. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help with any questions or requests. Good location for exploring the city and 12 minutes walk to Rossio train station (we took a direct 40 minutes train to Sintra from there).

We have been to this hotel before and liked it so much we came again. It is in a great position only 15 minutes walk from the main areas of attraction. Staff were friendly and efficient and the included breakfast a bonus. Our 5th floor room was small but comfortable. If we come to Lisbon again we will come here.

Stayed here a few nights while in Lisbon. The guy who checked us in was very helpful and friendly. The parking is good except that it’s very tight (even in a Small car). We had a great view over parts of Lisbon as we were on the sixth floor. The rooms are very big and the shower had great water pressure. The air con is a bit slow but eventually it cools the room down. Good location for high end shopping but a bit of a walk to the inner city historic area.

The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and welcoming and the biggest asset of the hotel.  My room was nice and the bed and pillows were very comfortable.  I cannot fault the cleaning – the common areas and my room were spotless.  The location is great, with easy access to Metro stations and downtown.  I’ve given four rather than five stars though as the breakfast was hit and miss, plus the hotel would benefit from a better communal lounge/bar area for guests to use.

Lovely, comfortable and clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Great location, walking distance from many interesting places and  close to subways and buses. Good breakfast with really nice staff. The rooms aren’t huge, but have very good bed and bedding. Will surely return!

Stayed for 8 nights in panoramic room (7th floor). Our room was big with great view from the balcony. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help with any questions or requests. Good location for exploring the city and 12 minutes walk to Rossio train station (we took a direct 40 minutes train to Sintra from there).

We have been to this hotel before and liked it so much we came again. It is in a great position only 15 minutes walk from the main areas of attraction. Staff were friendly and efficient and the included breakfast a bonus. Our 5th floor room was small but comfortable. If we come to Lisbon again we will come here.

Stayed here a few nights while in Lisbon. The guy who checked us in was very helpful and friendly. The parking is good except that it’s very tight (even in a Small car). We had a great view over parts of Lisbon as we were on the sixth floor. The rooms are very big and the shower had great water pressure. The air con is a bit slow but eventually it cools the room down. Good location for high end shopping but a bit of a walk to the inner city historic area.

The location is perfect, it’s steps away from all attractions and in the heart of the city, yet away enough from the sketchy locations. The staff were very friendly and always willing to help The room was super clean and the size was fair in the European standards.

Our party of six stayed for 2 nights at the hotel, the hotel very clean and the staff very very pleasant and helpful, helped with taxis and advise.  The rooms are very spacious beds and bedding good quality, breakfast good and lots of choice.  Just think it is time for a little refurbishment, few building works going on around but that didnt cause us any problems.

My boyfriend and I stayed here in June 2019 for only 2 nights. It was a nice hotel, no complaints.  It had a decent gym where they gave you free apples and bottles of water. and sometimes they would have little snack samples in the lobby. The best part was the rooftop area where they gave you towels and there were little cabanas you could lay in. They did fill up fast in the morning but you could put your name on a wait list. The pool was an infinity pool which was lovely. It was a bit of a walk to the main bar area (Bairro Alto), ~ 20 min but it was nice and warm out, and we are active so we didn't mind at all.

Stayed 4 nights in this hotel leaving on 24th Feb...rooms are kept very clean..defo need to invest in double beds instead of pushing two beds  together.fridge in room was stocked with water..beer and water..not sure if they were free or not..breakfast is a bit of a shambles..definitely to small for the size of the hotel..breakfast is served from 7.30 till 10.30.. but if you weren't down sharp there was very little to choose from..on our 3rd morning we went down just after 9.. ask if we could have bread to make toast to be told there was no bread left..hotel is about 20min walk to the centre..all in all we had a lovely time in Lisbon..the weather was fantastic so that certainly made our holiday

Lovely modern clean hotel.  Very good location.  Friendly staff.  Fab breakfast.  We had 1 noisey night with works outside but this was not the hotels fault. Would recommend. Towels need to be softer & bigger!

Check in quick. Room ready. Everything as it should be. Clean and tidy. Good location: up from city centre and not too far from busier evening district. Service good. Staff polite and helpfu. Breakfast OK - certainly enough but gets busy and area is tight. Overall, very happy. Would recommend.

High quality service. Clean and up to date facility. Perfect location for walking anywhere in the city. Price was reasonable and, for just a few Euros more on our package deal, breakfast was a big buffet with really good, fresh fruit, espresso, fresh pastries and hot eggs and meats.

We enjoyed a wonderful relaxing city break here before Christmas. Hotel itself was spotless and very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. Great choice.  Staff very helpful. Great location for exploring Lisbon.  We even ended up at the beach!  Great location for the Christmas markets in Parque Eduardo VII.  Would certainly recommend this hotel.

Allied with a great location (see previous reviews) this property provides great value and an excellent service experience. We found the staff, especially the older members, to be warm, courteous and gracious. I would particularly like to single out Thomas, Paulo from the front desk and Pereira in the bar. The room was spotless, adequately furnished and spacious with an excellent variety of dishes at breakfast. Would unequivocally recommend

My sister and I spent two nights at Hotel Lisboa for bed and breakfast.  The location was perfect for shops, restaurants and sightseeing.  Breakfasts were extensive and delicious. All staff spoke English and were polite and helpful. The room was spotless and comfortable with every facility we required, including a safe.

The Lisboa hotel is very well located 200 mtrs from the metro or a 15 min downhill very pleasant walk to the city centre Local restaurants are good and very reasonably priced.  Try Chu Chu round the corner for the most extensive wine menu I’ve ever seen! Room was on 4th floor and was a good size and comfortable.  Had a couple of excellent gin and tonics in the small cosy bar.  The star of the show undoubtedly was the breakfast which was great for filling up before a days walking and climbing Would definitely return if we come back to Lisbon

Negatives  * Breakfast - small choices, poor quality - rubbery scrambled eggs, cold sausages, tough bacon. Only decent choices were the cold selection of hams, cheeses and chorizos. Pastries were ok at best. * Coffee was served via coffee machine, not fresh considering I would expect fresh coffee being in Portugal * No double glazing windows - very noisy downstairs. There is a bar outside and very noisy all night * Room we were given was on the first floor, extremely noisy at night times so request a room higher up, small room, cold room - had to set the temperature to 25 degrees in order not to be freezing to death. Caught a cold as a result. * Shower screen was too short for the shower, the floor was soaked after every shower. The bottom of the shower screen did not hold the

Spent 3 nights here while touring around the Lisbon area. While a bit removed from the old city and waterfront areas it was not an undoable walk and the area does feature good shopping opportunities and a number of good restaurants and drinking establishments. Our room was quite comfortable and well appointed. The included daily breakfast was much appreciated. Not spectacular but a good variety and well attended. We frequented the small bar off the lobby. The bar manager was super friendly and a wealth of information on where to eat, what to see and how to get around. Very much enjoyed our stay and would recommend this facility, especially to English speaking tourists.

This is a nice hotelin in an excellent location.  The staff is super always willing to help and very kind. They speak English, Spanish and Portuguese of course and are very helpfull.  Definetely will return to this hotel

An excellent Hotel, great location, friendly staff, good rooms , clean and tidy, good breakfast, and nothing is too much trouble for any of the staff, who talk good English,  but will try and help you with your Portuguese. Highly Recommended.

2 mins from the subway, and on the Avienda, spacious clean room, polite friendly staff, no complaints, good buffet breakfast, cereals, fruit, meats, and fine selection of breads. 10 restaurants within a 5 minute walk. Basic gym.

Absolutely fabulous hotel in a perfect location. Staff fantastic and very helpful in everything. Rooms and whole hotel spotlessly clean. Great spread and choice at breakfast. Location is great for walking down the main road into the city centre or up the hill to the Edward VII park past all the designer shops. Would definitely use again.

We had 3 nights at this hotel (Friday -Mon). We arrived mid-morning and the very helpful reception staff allowed us to store our cases (pre-checkin) so we could begin our site seeing unencumbered.  The room was a good size and very clean throughout our stay. The bed was a bit too hard for my comfort (not quite SE Asia hard though). Nice sheets, extra pillows and blankets. There was a some noise from outside on Saturday night until about 1am but it wasn't too annoying.  It's about a 5-8 mins walk to Alameda Metro station - turn left out of hotel, then left onto main road. This is a good hotel to stay in if you don't want to stay right in the centre.

Well located off the liberdade a short walk into centre and down to the river front Excellent varied breakfast buffet that catered well for all dietary needs Clean comfortable and spacious rooms Helpful friendly staff

Excellent location, small and friendly . Rooms are small and smart, however the room we were in was very noisy, you could here all the traffic even though the hotel is not on a main road ,the A/C was not adjustable ,beds hard ,and the towels were very thin. Breakfast was the usual continental fare, not to my taste ,the toaster was my only option but that was absolutely useless, 5 mins in and the bread was warm not toasted. One point about Lisbon, the pavements and most of the roads are cobbled, which make your feet ache after a while.

A nice hotel - very clean, and very friendly. Beds were comfortable, and there is a good breakfast buffet with a fantastic selection of pastries that completely ruined my resolve to eat healthily in the mornings!    It is not a scenic location - very close to the airport (my Uber was less than €5) but there is no airport noise, and it's a  €10 trip down to the old part of the city.

Nice hotel and the room was very good. Clean, tidy and spacious. Had all the things you’d expect, tv, fridge, safe, bath etc.  Breakfast was excellent, continental with a massive variety of everything!!! Cold meats, cheeses, sausage/bacon, scrambled egg, cakes/pastries/breads, fruits, cereals, tea/coffee and juices. Something for everyone.  Reasonable location, 2 minutes from the metro and all the main attractions are easily accessible from there.  I’d definitely stop there again.

A very nice little hotel for sightseeing. They are very strict about covid protection which makes a big plus. I had a room on the left side of the hotel which is literally next to the train tracks, and the train goes around regulary, it always woke me up. Location is close to the metro, train or some restaurants, the breakfast is great. Only big negative thing was the bar. When the young guy served me the drinks were excellent, but when the older guy was there he watered down my drink, also he didnt allow the guests to pay with card (??),  I once saw as he told very rudely to an another guest to go and take out money from an ATM.

This was such an amazing Hotel. I can't describe how beautiful it was. You would have to visit in order to see it. The reception area was inviting and cozy. It gets crowded at times. The rooms were simply amazing and large. My room had an amazing spacious bathroom and Bedroom with a living room area and large balcony. The service was great and the staff were extremely helpful. The only drawback is that the elevators were extremely slow and small. There is two dining hall where they serve breakfast every morning. Not sure if they serve dinner but I assume they do. This hotel is centrally located. The train station is literally across the street. Supermarkets, pharmacies, liquor stores, restaurants are nearby and easy to walk to. I would definitely come here to stay again if I

Hotel Roma is in a wonderful location, about a block from the Roma subway station & across the street from the train station.  It’s not in a touristy area, so there are numerous small restaurants & stores nearby.  (Nice supermarket is less than a block away.  We had a refrigerator in our room, so it was convenient to buy some fruit & drinks.)  The staff is all very helpful & friendly.  We arrived at the hotel around noon, never expecting to be given a room, but a quiet one on the 10th floor was available.   Judith at the front desk was wonderful-I explained that I was a light sleeper & she assured me she had the perfect room.  (Ask for a room at the back if noise bothers you.  You give up the potential of having a balcony but the quiet more than made up for that.) Our room was

A nice hotel - very clean, and very friendly. Beds were comfortable, and there is a good breakfast buffet with a fantastic selection of pastries that completely ruined my resolve to eat healthily in the mornings!    It is not a scenic location - very close to the airport (my Uber was less than €5) but there is no airport noise, and it's a  €10 trip down to the old part of the city.

Nice hotel and the room was very good. Clean, tidy and spacious. Had all the things you’d expect, tv, fridge, safe, bath etc.  Breakfast was excellent, continental with a massive variety of everything!!! Cold meats, cheeses, sausage/bacon, scrambled egg, cakes/pastries/breads, fruits, cereals, tea/coffee and juices. Something for everyone.  Reasonable location, 2 minutes from the metro and all the main attractions are easily accessible from there.  I’d definitely stop there again.

A very nice little hotel for sightseeing. They are very strict about covid protection which makes a big plus. I had a room on the left side of the hotel which is literally next to the train tracks, and the train goes around regulary, it always woke me up. Location is close to the metro, train or some restaurants, the breakfast is great. Only big negative thing was the bar. When the young guy served me the drinks were excellent, but when the older guy was there he watered down my drink, also he didnt allow the guests to pay with card (??),  I once saw as he told very rudely to an another guest to go and take out money from an ATM.

This was such an amazing Hotel. I can't describe how beautiful it was. You would have to visit in order to see it. The reception area was inviting and cozy. It gets crowded at times. The rooms were simply amazing and large. My room had an amazing spacious bathroom and Bedroom with a living room area and large balcony. The service was great and the staff were extremely helpful. The only drawback is that the elevators were extremely slow and small. There is two dining hall where they serve breakfast every morning. Not sure if they serve dinner but I assume they do. This hotel is centrally located. The train station is literally across the street. Supermarkets, pharmacies, liquor stores, restaurants are nearby and easy to walk to. I would definitely come here to stay again if I

Hotel Roma is in a wonderful location, about a block from the Roma subway station & across the street from the train station.  It’s not in a touristy area, so there are numerous small restaurants & stores nearby.  (Nice supermarket is less than a block away.  We had a refrigerator in our room, so it was convenient to buy some fruit & drinks.)  The staff is all very helpful & friendly.  We arrived at the hotel around noon, never expecting to be given a room, but a quiet one on the 10th floor was available.   Judith at the front desk was wonderful-I explained that I was a light sleeper & she assured me she had the perfect room.  (Ask for a room at the back if noise bothers you.  You give up the potential of having a balcony but the quiet more than made up for that.) Our room was

Hotel Roma is not bad for a couple of nights. It's convenient to public transpiration, Rossio stop and you can take it to Roma and you'll be in town where you can eat and shop. The rooms are clean and decent. They have a decent breakfast buffet as well and mini pastel de nate's in case you love them, they come in mini form here at this hotel.

Let's be clear. This hotel is a honest 3-stars hotel, very clean wherever (reception, rooms, stairwells), with a very friendly (and helpful) staff, with a subway station at just 5 minutes walk, with a great breakfast (nearest to some 4-stars hotels somehow in terms of variety and quality), just 15 minutes drive from the airport. So what, one would say? Unfortunately my stay (4 nights) was spoiled by my room position (at the center of a corridor) and the defects of construction of the hotel (renovated not too recently but still in good shape). It was simply impossible to sleep (and if you're on holiday you cannot get a rest in preparation of the following day, as you will wake up sleepless and already tired at 7am). In fact there is no proper acoustic isolation between the rooms,

This hotel is really good, the rooms are big and their breakfast is delicious. It is located very close to the airport and to a tube station and their staff is always helpful. But they do not inform you about different prices at the restaurant during Christmas time. We tried to have dinner there and discovered that they charge 30 euros per person during this time of the year. I do not know if you think this is expensive, but you must agree that they should have informed when I booked, especially for january, 1st when everywhere else is closed.

Stayed for 3 nights from 16th to 19th November.  We arrived early around 11.00, our rooms were not ready but receptionist checked us in and arranged for our luggage to be left in storage room.  We got a very good rate which included breakfast.  Room was really spacious and spotlessly clean, as was the bathroom.  There was a great selection for breakfast and it ran for four hours (6.30 to 10.30), the breakfast room was very big with plenty of tables so no problem with overcrowding as happens in some hotels.  The hotel was 100m from Roma metro station, about 15 minutes into the city centre.  This was a top class hotel (as other reviews have stated more 4 than 3 star), Lisbon is a beautiful city, and both excellent value, certainly in comparison to rip-off Dublin.

For the services offered and the value for money, at least is a 4 stars/4 stars superior! My room was awesome at the 9th floor, clean with a nice bathroom, the breakfast was simply amazing, with a lot of fresh fruits and a great variety of choice....unfortunately i have been only for 3 nights, I wish I could spend a week at Roma, the staff have been the most welcoming people I met for a long time, in particular, Susanna! I recommend them for who wanna spend some days in this beautiful city

Hotel has a OK location, with good links with metro. Rooms are basic however clean and large. Breakfast is ok too however can be improved. We stayed here for 2 nights and was ideal for a short stay. Most of staff had a good command of english and were helpful.

This appeared to be a older hotel used by many large tour groups.  It is located across from metro tracks and close to the Roma green line And buses and 10 minutes from the international airport.  There is a lot of traffic outside the hotel and very busy inside as well so attention by staff can be unpredictable.  Our room was decent in size but noisy since it faced the metro track.  The decor was dated as and best to get lower level floor due to the slowness of elevators. The hotel rate was reasonable and the breakfast was very good but crowded.

My wife & I are were VERY HAPPY that we booked at Hotel Roma as we finished our 2 week tour of Portugal.  The staff were friendly & efficient.  I urge you to pay & enjoy the BREAKFASTS offered at Hotel Roma.  A relaxed and tasty breakfast, as was provided us, was the BEST WAY TO START THE DAY!  I was impressed by the Breakfast employees & manager - and told him so!  Thank you much, Joram

Well located to restaurants shopping and the Metro. Many tour groups in hotel. Small but efficient rooms  Good beds. Very good breakfast nice variety. Good air conditioning. Noise level ok. Some stairwells not functional with poor lighting

Having stayed last month at Hotel Roma Lisbon, I found it to be an excellent choice and great value hotel located not too far from the airport and a quick walk to the Metro station that will take you into the middle of the city.   The rooms are large and kept very clean, though they are a little dated. Having said that, the bed was extremely comfortable and the bathroom was quite large too. The room also has a very large balcony.  The staff were all friendly and helpful and there is a taxi stand right at the door to the hotel. There is also a buffet dinner available most nights which I tried. Whilst the food was quite basic, it was fresh and flavoursome.  I would definitely recommend Hotel Roma Lisbon to those travelling to the city and not wanting  to stay right in the middle

We found this hotel a good place from which to explore Lisbon, as part of a coach tour.  It was comfortable and the rooms were a reasonable size, although we found bar prices rather high compared to local bars.

I spent one night in the Roma Hotel, choosing it primarily because of its proximity to the Lisbon airport. I was not disappointed. My room was large, very clean, quiet and very comfortable. And as others have noted, the included breakfast included a wide variety of cold cuts, cheeses and breads, but also 2 versions of scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon. Check-in was easy, although the receptionist was a bit curt, and she might have smiled just once. I rrived after the hotel restaurant had closed, and was told I could order room service. But I could not find a room service menu. Other than that, I'd stay again in the Roma. There is a taxi stand immediately adjacent to the hotel,  making it unnecessary to have the desk clerk summon one for you.

We were looking for a well priced hotel close to the airport and Hotel Roma came up via booking.com.   The rooms in the hotel are lovely and spacious (though slightly dated), the bathroom is a great size too. Breakfast was included in the rate and was varied and delicious. They had absolutely everything you could ever ask for for breakfast.  We would definitely return here again.

Hotel Roma is conveniently located between the city center and Lisboa airport.  Comfortable & Clean rooms, 24hour reception. good breakfast. very helpful staff at the reception. a few restaurants within a 10 min walk radius.  I would stay here once again if I do visit Lisbon in my future travels.

Great hotel in Lisbon! Clean and spacious room, amazing view fro 9th floor, friendly staff and great breakfast (I really like the bakery part, also pasteis de belém was there ♥).   Metro station is placed just a minute of walking, airport is also close (try to use metro via Alameda station).

I have been stayed with my Family for 4 nights at the Hotel Roma and it was a really good experience.  The rooms are large and clean. All the staff are good. At can be easily a 4 stars hotel. I recommand it.

Hotel rooms are basic but very clean .Excellent breakfast good Bar Area.Staff were very helpful  Big negative you are next railway lines and I mean right next to  Hotel sells hop on hop bus tickets. Taxi was 8 euro to old downtown area

I love this hotel  The front desk staff are helpful and charming. The hotel is super clean. Breakfast was delicious The rooms are spacious, try to get a room with a balcony.  Location is a bit of a distance from the downtown area. But close to the airport

On the way back to US from our Europe vacation we spent one night in Lisbon. It is close to the airport, and is perfect for a short stay. Our room came with 3 comfy beds, and a shower, all you need to rest between flights.

Tiny bed room x2 single beds soft but comfortable. Small bathroom no shelf space to put down anything 32 inch tv Good speed WIFI  View from window of residential back yards. Good choice of food at buffet breakfast.

Good value for money, but a few things that we really did not like (and may deter some of you from wanting to stay here): - the parking garage is narrow and steep. Really narrow and really steep. To the point where you are almost guaranteed damage unless you are parking your bike. - the tv in the room switches on automatically when you enter the room.. A minor nuisance you might say, with which I would fully agree, were it not for the fact that it takes a full 10 minutes of grueling effort to turn the thing off..!!?! The remote shows only incidental signs of life and the console is lacking a standby button.. It only has a joystick, which has provided us all imaginable emotions except joy. Our recommended fix involves switching to a radio channel for fado music to black out the

This hotel was just perfect for our stay in Lisbon - situated in a very nice neighborhood, close to the center and a lot of great local restaurants!  The staff was so helpful and caring, if only every hotel in the world was like this! Fully refurbished, very clean and welcoming. Totally recommended, especially for the very decent prices they offer.

Highly recommended option, just next to the center of Malaga (5 minutes walk from the center - metro station just next to the hotel), excellent staff, and clean/modern rooms. Good breakfast. Very quiet.

We have just returned from a few nights in Lisbon staying at this hotel. We have no complaints about the hotel, but find much we want to praise. The reception staff were helpful and friendly whenever we saw them and the double room we booked was very comfortable and exceptionally well cleaned every day. The room was at the back of the hotel with a balcony providing great views across the city. Breakfast was varied and plentiful and the staff were friendly. The hotel is very near to all of the tourist areas but based in an old residential area with lots of places to eat cheaply as well as some upmarket restaurants. It is a culturally diverse area with interesting shops and cafes, with a buzz of local life. It is easy to get around the city from here on trams and buses as well as

We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. The rooms are clean, well maintained. The reception staff was very helpful and cooperative as we had not received our luggage from airlines and they helped us collect it. The metro station of intendente is just 3 mins away by walking. The breakfast was good and had a good selection. And the prices are reasonable as well, highly recommended

Good value for money, but a few things that we really did not like (and may deter some of you from wanting to stay here): - the parking garage is narrow and steep. Really narrow and really steep. To the point where you are almost guaranteed damage unless you are parking your bike. - the tv in the room switches on automatically when you enter the room.. A minor nuisance you might say, with which I would fully agree, were it not for the fact that it takes a full 10 minutes of grueling effort to turn the thing off..!!?! The remote shows only incidental signs of life and the console is lacking a standby button.. It only has a joystick, which has provided us all imaginable emotions except joy. Our recommended fix involves switching to a radio channel for fado music to black out the

This hotel was just perfect for our stay in Lisbon - situated in a very nice neighborhood, close to the center and a lot of great local restaurants!  The staff was so helpful and caring, if only every hotel in the world was like this! Fully refurbished, very clean and welcoming. Totally recommended, especially for the very decent prices they offer.

Highly recommended option, just next to the center of Malaga (5 minutes walk from the center - metro station just next to the hotel), excellent staff, and clean/modern rooms. Good breakfast. Very quiet.

We have just returned from a few nights in Lisbon staying at this hotel. We have no complaints about the hotel, but find much we want to praise. The reception staff were helpful and friendly whenever we saw them and the double room we booked was very comfortable and exceptionally well cleaned every day. The room was at the back of the hotel with a balcony providing great views across the city. Breakfast was varied and plentiful and the staff were friendly. The hotel is very near to all of the tourist areas but based in an old residential area with lots of places to eat cheaply as well as some upmarket restaurants. It is a culturally diverse area with interesting shops and cafes, with a buzz of local life. It is easy to get around the city from here on trams and buses as well as

We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great stay. The rooms are clean, well maintained. The reception staff was very helpful and cooperative as we had not received our luggage from airlines and they helped us collect it. The metro station of intendente is just 3 mins away by walking. The breakfast was good and had a good selection. And the prices are reasonable as well, highly recommended

Stayed here for 3 nights.  We arrived at 3 in the afternoon and found the door locked!  It was my understanding that they had a 24 hr front desk.  We were a little taken back and were unsure what we should do when someone did show up and unlock the door.  Turned out there is only 1 staff member at that time and they needed to use the facilities so lock the door.  That's totally understandable but perhaps put a small note on the door advising that you will be right back. The room was very clean and tidy with a laminate floor and modern furnishings.  It was small but that is to be expected.  The linens and towels were very good. There was a kettle in the room but no coffee or tea bags and a fridge.  Our room was at the back on a higher floor and we had a great view.  Location is

We’ve just returned from a 3 night stay here lovely hotel very modern we had room 303 which had a balcony too. Quite small bathroom but didn’t bother us shower was lovely. Tv has a few English Channels but also fine for us. Bed comfortable.  It’s based in the anjos area when booking on booking.com it sounded more like Alfama it isn’t. Metro station literally a 2 minute walk away (interdente) really good metro lines here can get to places so easy and cheap. But easy enough to walk too first day we walked 5 miles around the castle and Alfama, baixa, Rossio Etc just bare in mind it’s quite hilly here and a big city. Anjos area is fine id read reviews about it being perhaps a rougher area but we didn’t think so really. Can hear lots of sirens but it is a city. Lots of restaurants

The hotel is located about 20 minutes walk from the historic center but very close to the metro station and bus stops. We took Uber from the Lisbon airport  to the hotel (7 euro).  Breakfast was excellent just the right amount of bread, pastries, ham, cheese, and fruits. The hotel was very modern and the staffs were very friendly.  The room and the bathroom were little small but were well designed and equipped. It seemed like a new hotel.  Lots of restaurants and stores near by the hotel including our favorite grocery store Lidl. We passed  a coin laundry shop next door to the hotel on our way to Lidl.   I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends.

We had a very comfortable stay at the Fenicius Charme hotel in Lisbon. Location so convenient, close to Metro, walk-able distance to Martim Moniz where you take the famous Tram 28. Room was very clean, everyday maid service, good breakfast, very courteous receptionists, kitchen staff and a very kind hostess. The staff recommenced some of the best affordable restaurants for us to try great Portuguese cuisine. I would go back and stay here again in my next trip to Lisbon.

I had a very enjoyable stay at the Fensius Charmed Hotel. The hotel is situated in a convenient location. If you prefer to walk, it is only 15 minutes to Rossi’s square, and 20 to 25 minutes on foot to Commercio square. There are many worthwhile attractions within easy walking distance.   The front desk staff is amazing, very professional, and knowledgeable. Filippe and Ivo Monta at the front desk were exceptionally helpful. Their advice and recommendations made my stay even more enjoyable. Breakfast at the hotel was excellent, and a great way to start the day before touring the city.

Great hotel...super breakfast and fantastic staff(Bruno one of best).good for muslim travelers..they serve halal breakfast.hotel parking available but 9€ per night.  Only problem is no fridge or slippers  is in the room.if management can provide those things  that Will be great.  Any way best option in Lisbon..waking distance to city centre and Lidil shopping is just 3 mints walking distance.

PROS: Super professional and friendly staff; great breakfast; everything seems almost brand new.  CONS: location is comfortable (near the city center) but neighborhood could seem dangerous after twilight

It was a lovely, clean modern hotel, very close to the metro and the buses, the staff were really friendly,the breakfast was really awesome. I did find the smell of the cleaning products in the rooms and public areas very invasive which gave me a headache for my 3 day stay.

Stayed here on our last night before flying out and were very impressed. Good price, friendly helpful staff and very clean and modern. Our room had a great view, soft towels, was spacious with a comfortable bed, bright and modern and a balcony to sit on. Plenty of space for our cases and tea and coffee making facilities in the room. The  breakfast was excellent, everything you could think of and all fresh and hot. Close to metro and tram 28. Highly recommended.

Very nice stay in this clean and very friendly budget hotel. I was surprised about price/quality. This is a 3* hotel but really perfect ! Hotel is located 15min by foot from the center. Very friendly people, excellent breakfast and spic and span rooms !!!!

My Experience in this Hotel was amazing. My sister and myself enjoyed it very much .  The hotel is super clean and very well located.  A big applause to the outstanding staff working in this property , especially the Front office team: Anne, Ivor, philippe and also a gentleman who did the check in for us that I forgot unfortunately his name are the kindest, most welcoming and helpful Front office Staff members we ever met. A highly recommended hotel !

This was our first visit to Lisbon and were pointed to this hotel as it had all the qualities that we wanted We stayed in Room 503 ( roof area) which was a little oddly shaped because of the roof but quite big enough and the view was fantastic looking out into far distance you could see the Cristo Rei ( which was lit up at night) We had a large bathroom and very efficient shower. It was very close to the Metro line, Tram 28 route and bus routes . Very convenient . It is a very clean hotel and the breakfast was fabulous particularly the different types of bread and fruit Our room was spotless. The people on the reception were very friendly and helpful at giving advise and the staff in the breakfast area were again very nice and when ever anything got low it was quickly and

It is a new or reformated hotel in a very good location and a cordial staff. Very clean place and quiet. Close to a lot of excellents restaurants and to a public transportation.  For sure we are going to repeat this hotel when we go back to Lisbon

This is a newish hotel with about 40 rooms in an old district, all very clean and functional although our room only had two small single beds and no other furniture. There wasn't a restaurant but there was a small bar which served non alcoholic drinks and tea and coffee. Breakfast was served in a first floor breakfast room with a good variety of cereals, fruit, cold meats, cheese, breads etc as well as scrambled egg, beans and small sausages. Its well situated near to the metro and only about 10-15 mins from the old central Alfama district. The staff were all friendly and helpful, especially the young Dutch man (Dighe Schree?) who helped with our safe, recommended the nearby Cova Funda (a restaurant for the locals with good value excellent food) as well as the hotel taxi back to

We spent 3 nights here and liked it very much. The staff was the highlight. They were friendly and they were extremely helpful. They never hesitated to help when asked. The breakfast was varied and tasty. Although ‘smallish’ the rooms were well appointed, the beds were comfortable and everything you might need was there. The only thing absent was a small refrigerator, but we did not consider that a necessity. As well, the location was great. We walked everywhere.

Good location for tourist sites, but be aware Lisbon is hilly outside the small Baixa central area. Rooms vary in size and outlook, all seem to have large Lisbon scene photos over the bed instead of the usual plain paint or wallpaper. Staff were very helpful, especially when were were leaving - our airport transfer was late arriving and the staff called to find out why even before we had to ask. Also had to leave the desk as we needed to reset the room safe - very accommodating. Good selection of (buffet) breakfast choices. WiFi worked well, plenty of TV channel choices. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby.

We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of March, and wanted a base for exploring Lisbon. We were not disappointed. The hotel is quite new, and everything is modern. The decor is clean and the staff at reception are really helpful, nothing is too much trouble! We arrived nearly 2.5hrs early due to flight times, and were going to ask to leave our luggage but our room happened to be ready so staff at reception allowed us to check in, a nice touch and much appreciated as we had been travelling since 4am.  We asked at reception for somewhere local to eat that night and staff were more than ready to help, with great suggestions. We ended up in a nearby place called Cova Funda, and the seafood was great! The breakfast, I'd read reviews that it was good, but I was even more impressed

The hotel is near to the center (+ Metro station, 28E) and not noisy for a good price, easy to acces to the Airport onyl with Metro (1 change). The staff is very frindly, we could leave our suitcases for a half day after the check out. The breakfast is included and it is very tasty and rich. We had a room with a big amazing poster (railway station) and terrasse (not balcon!) on the 4nd floor, with a great view.

Very enjoyable stay at Fenicius hotel. Located just a bit outside of noisy city centre but very close to metro and public transportation network. Rooms were newly furnished, spotless, comfortable and ours also had a balcony. Excellent breakfast with a lot of options to eat and drink. Very nice and helpfull staff. Special thanks to young mr. Schaars who helped us with our further bookings and printing out documents. Would come back if visiting Lisbon. Highly recommended!

Spotlessly clean, spacious room, with a great view!  Staff is very friendly and helpful with their tips on how to best explore their city.   Breakfast is plentiful and fresh, coffee is great.  Locations is really good, 5 min walk to the centre, with lots of bars and places to eat on the way.

Great location, great staff and great breakfast BUT… very tiny room, we couldn’t even walk past each other.  Had to keep one suitcase in the bathroom. Room full of unnecessary furniture. Shower was so small you couldn’t even turn around. Worst part was the constant temperature fluctuations of the water.

Great staff, very helpful nice lobby filled with MCM remake furniture. The room was tiny and the window opened to a nasty air shaft. The shower door could not be opened unless the sliding bathroom door was open. Too much stuff in this little room, table chairs 7 pieces of art hung crooked, and a giant mirror. The location is great but I would never stay there again. Bottom line: I WOULD NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.

I’ve stayed at Browns hotel three times during the past two years. There’s a few reasons that I always come back. The atmosphere, the friendly staff, the nice lobby, the good breakfast that is served until 11.30am every day!!! And the location in the heart of Lisbon!

Reception area is cool looking, those that worked the reception area were very nice, thanks. The room was well appointed, and exactly what we needed. Breakfast is a few steps away, and they catered for our vegan requirements (which we mentioned upon booking) with cheeses, baps and yoghurts, as well as a small handful of other things at the buffet. All in all a great hotel and i wouldn't hesitate in recommending or staying again.

We really enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. It has a very trendy design and our room had the most comfiest bed. Also had a nespresso machine and fridge. You can't beat the location, it's really close to everything you need, and not far to most central things you will want to visit. Really close to the metro which made the journey to and from the airport easy. The staff are really friendly, while booking I asked if there would be soya milk at breakfast as we are vegan. But at breakfast we were also given little extras that we didn't expect, such as vegan cheese and yogurt. I've never experienced this special service at a hotel before, thank you. Breakfast is served a few metres down the street at a sister hotel, which is no problem, and we also were given a welcome drink at

Great location, great staff and great breakfast BUT… very tiny room, we couldn’t even walk past each other.  Had to keep one suitcase in the bathroom. Room full of unnecessary furniture. Shower was so small you couldn’t even turn around. Worst part was the constant temperature fluctuations of the water.

Great staff, very helpful nice lobby filled with MCM remake furniture. The room was tiny and the window opened to a nasty air shaft. The shower door could not be opened unless the sliding bathroom door was open. Too much stuff in this little room, table chairs 7 pieces of art hung crooked, and a giant mirror. The location is great but I would never stay there again. Bottom line: I WOULD NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN.

I’ve stayed at Browns hotel three times during the past two years. There’s a few reasons that I always come back. The atmosphere, the friendly staff, the nice lobby, the good breakfast that is served until 11.30am every day!!! And the location in the heart of Lisbon!

Reception area is cool looking, those that worked the reception area were very nice, thanks. The room was well appointed, and exactly what we needed. Breakfast is a few steps away, and they catered for our vegan requirements (which we mentioned upon booking) with cheeses, baps and yoghurts, as well as a small handful of other things at the buffet. All in all a great hotel and i wouldn't hesitate in recommending or staying again.

We really enjoyed our stay at this lovely hotel. It has a very trendy design and our room had the most comfiest bed. Also had a nespresso machine and fridge. You can't beat the location, it's really close to everything you need, and not far to most central things you will want to visit. Really close to the metro which made the journey to and from the airport easy. The staff are really friendly, while booking I asked if there would be soya milk at breakfast as we are vegan. But at breakfast we were also given little extras that we didn't expect, such as vegan cheese and yogurt. I've never experienced this special service at a hotel before, thank you. Breakfast is served a few metres down the street at a sister hotel, which is no problem, and we also were given a welcome drink at

I was disappointed with this hotel, unfortunately we found it noisy and difficult to sleep. There was noise from upstairs which can’t always be helped in old buildings but the most frustrating thing was the fact the cleaners were extremely noisy every morning slamming doors and making unnecessary noises. There was also a very strong smell of drains in our room which was really unpleasant. We asked to move rooms due to noise and found the smell of drains in both rooms. We also paid for a larger room but this wasn’t fulfilled when we needed to move due to noise. The reception staff were friendly and the hotel was in a great location with nice interiors however these things aren’t as important as a good nights sleep for us!

Right between Rossio and Prada di Commercio, an excellent location to explore Lisbon. Metro station nearby. Quite street. Clean and well maintained rooms, comfortable bed. Professional and friendly staff

My friend and I came in from Lagos to see the Christmas lights of Lisbon despite a predicted heavy rainstorm.  We are very glad we made the trip and were able to get some great shots despite the wet conditions. We picked this boutique hotel for its location which is in the downtown area and close to Commerial, Rossio, and Camoes squares. The lights were beautiful! The room was small but very comfortable and Apple computer and iPad was provided. The included buffet breakfast was very varied and really good. The breakfast is in their Bistro just a very short 1 minute walk away. I could also recommend their burgers for lunch. The staff were very friendly and informative. We would definitely return. Muito Obrigado!

Wow. What a great place, loacation, staff, breafast. All around fantastic place to stay. All you need is in the general area or a short walk.  Hardest part is waiting for a return trip and stay.  Thank you to all the staff at the Browns.

Stumbled on this gem by pure luck. And know I’ll be back here again. Hopefully soon!  The hotel decor and ambiance are amazing and unique. An eclectic collection of chairs in the rooms and the lobby, and a superb location, add to the experience.   Last but not the least, the amazing Margherida at the reception. She couples efficiency behind the desk with a great taste in food and outstanding knowledge of the area restaurants. Her recommendations for each of our meals there were spot on. Along with the others there like Marco, they form a great team

Extremely well located with easy access to main tourist lines. Plenty of bars and restaurants options at the surroundings. Our room was quite small with a really narrow bathroom, but in the overall well conservated and kept. Really good breakfast served at the Brown's Bistro half block away. Special compliments to the staff, always solicit and helpfull.

Although you never want to think about it, there are times when you simply need a place to stay and recuperate. That's actually what happened to us, traveling from Barcelona to Lisbon and one of us arriving in Lisbon quite ill.   While I slowly recuperated, the hotel staff could not have been more supportive and kinder to my wife than if we were immediate family. When a doctor recommended cooked apples, the hotel staff asked the nearby Brown's Coffee Shop (which BTW offers delicious breakfasts and other meals in a classic setting) to specially cook some apples for which they did not charge and would not accept any payment. Similarly, when it became clear that we simply could not make the check-out date, Brown's hotel worked to allow us to remain in the hotel another five days,

I am so happy and pleased with my experience at this hotel. We booked it online through booking.com and it was our first time doing it that way, so it was kind of risky.   I'm a visual person so I checked out the pictures and I liked it. We also thought it will it will have a great location according to the map.   Well, as soon as we got there we were happy to see for real everything we liked online and it felt excellent because; the location was amazing,  we were in the middle of everything we wanted to go to and visit in the short amount of time that we were at Lisbon.   The service was wonderful, these people communicated with me by email three times before my arrival to make sure all my requests were done before I get there. The people in the lobby were amazing and as soon

We stayed one night on our way back home from Porto. Our room was complimentarly upgraded to a superior. It had a lovely view through large windows. The ceiling angles and the decor added to the charm. The bathroom was all granite but a bit small. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Transportation to the airport was arranged for us and although more expensive than a regular taxi, the driver spoke English and engaged in lively conversation...a nice ending to our vacation. Because we were leaving before breakfast was served, we were given "boxed breakfasts" that were quite enjoyable.  We found the interior of the hotel quite dark in places - by the elevator and in the upstairs hallway. Definitely a nice and memorable stay!

Great safe Location for getting around - Hotel staff very friendly and really helpful -The Week before arrival the hotel offered to arrange transfer from airport which was an excellent service. The Hotel is gorgeous- very boutique- the downstairs foyer area very comfortable and inviting .We stayed in a Superior Double  room and they are very nicely decorated and very clean .Lovely welcome Bottle of Red - nice touch !! Bed was a great size and mega comfortable ..u have everything you need in this room and it is well designed but note the wardrobe space is limited...2 great mirrors in the room which is a rarity I find 👍. An iPAD and mac there to use if you want. The bathroom fittings and finishes are of high quality but it is TINY - space really really tight !!! Aircon

This is a great little find. It’s conveniently located within walking distance of key places. The staff are helpful and do their best to make your stay a memorable one and are quick fix issues. Big shout out to Ines who works in the afternoon. Breakfast is at the bistro down the street and in typical European style doesn’t start until 8am. It’s basic and what you’d expect from 3 star but if you don’t eat meat be prepared for a lot of pastries. The rooms are spacious, well equipped and comfortable even if the walls are thin (bring ear plugs). I sleep in cold rooms, so put the air conditioning on and woke up two hours later in a sauna, only to be told that in October it is set to winter mode meaning that even if the temperature is set to cold it will heat the room! No signs to say

My husband and I were in Lisbon for 4 days and this hotel and its staff were excellent.  Our rooms were well taken care off each day, and the staff made several recommendations and reserved a table for us at a local Fado restaurant.  We appreciated the complementary water in the lobby and the espresso machine in the room.  The hotel is centrally located so you can walk everywhere.  It is also just steps from the metro.  Would stay here again.

Fantastic hotel. Located central to all amenities.  Staff fantastic couldn't do enough for us. Rooms and cleanliness 5 star.Bistro located beside hotel offered great breakfast and lovely meals throughout the day. Would definitely recommend.

Stayed for three nights after a cruise. Excellent location close to restaurants and shopping. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable with modern features even though the building is old.They provide a very good buffet breakfast. One thing to watch. We ordered a taxi to take us to the airport. Specifically said TAXI not a limo. Despite that they booked us a limo who charged twice the price of a regular cab. We had no choice but to take it because we needed to get to the airport. Grrrr!

Lovely time in Lisbon at Brown's Downtown. Hotel room was snug but clean, functional and nicely decorated. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Excellent location. Walking distance to many sites and close to transportation, metro stop around the corner.  Would definitely recommend.

What a wonderful hotel.! Great location wonderful young and very helpful staff tasteful interiors.. our room was small but nicely and conveniently decorated.. except the shower  which was impossible to get the pleasant temperature..boiling hot or cold..we had I-pads and Apple computers and espresso machine and small bar with coffee tea and complementary red wine in the room.. A 3 star hotel with 5 star amenities..

From the moment we arrived the staff were warm, friendly and helpful.. We had a room on the first floor which was nice but there was only one small window with a view overlooking walls and windows. Also the bathroom was very small. The decor was lovely and the towels and bedding were  changed every day. On a city break you spend a lot of time out of your room but if you want more ask for a room at the front. Breakfast is served in Browns Bistro just round the corner but the food was excellent.. The location is excellent for sightseeing as it is only one street away from Rue de Augusta. We would go back any time.

Loved this hotel. So surprising and the attention to detail in the decor was much appreciated. Stayed in a superior room on the first floor, appreciated the coffee machine in the room and the complimentary bottle of wine. My room was a good size. One recommendation would be some sheer curtains for the lower rooms. It was hard to open the curtains and appreciate the sunlight when looking straight into the offices across the street. I can’t wait to come back and stay again - would request a room on a higher floor though.

This hotel is extremely well-located, in the centre of Lisbon with easy connections to basically everywhere you might want to go, and one could also walk to the major part of it. The personnel is kind, smiley and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well-designed, with a tablet and and an amplifier should you want to play music or just browse the internet. Everything was perfect.

Small hotel but we didn’t stay in the room much. Walking distance from shopping, food, 10 min walk to Bairro alto. Breakfast is fine. Staff very friendly, area is safe, easily get an uber or taxi from adjacent street. Thanks for a nice stay.

Satyed from 01.October until 3.10.2021 in this Hotel , that offers truly a great Price . The rooms are very space even the Standart Rooms , inclusive a Safe / empty Minibar , Closet , 2 Twin Beds , AC and a TV with some Programs ( mostly Portuguese CabelNetwork Programs ) . I payed inclusive the Lisbon Tourist Tax a total of 138,- Euros WITHOUT Breakfast . The Room itself is ok as also the Bathroom inclusive a Bathtub/Shower . The Location is not one of my favorite ones . You are close to the Airpot , have some Coffeas and a Little Supermarket near by so that you can buy something but if you wanna see something from Lisbon choose a Hotel Downtown in the City s Heart , otherwise you need to take a Taxi , Bus or Underground ! The Staff at the Hotel is ok . There was one Room at

I got a good deal for this hotel so I will say average rating, but if I paid the standard full price I'd be disappointed.   Good parts: Location is ideal for Entrecampos train station which is why I booked.  Nice comfortable bed.  Big room   Bad parts: - Couldn't take a bath as the plug was not compatible with the make, after long time trying I gave up. Good thing I did as the I then discovered the bath had pubes in it, which makes me question how clean the rest of the room was.  - Bathroom door was sliding type which was completely stuck and difficult to move, couldn't close door for fear of getting locked in. Fine for travelling alone, less so if sharing.  - No kettle (but maybe this is standard in Portuguese hotels, I'm not sure)

The hotel location is perfect for airplane spotters. The planes fly really low, as it no far from the airport. if you get lucky you can get a room facing the routes of the planes. The subway station is just a few meters away from it, as wall as the bus station for 376 (I think). There is a drugstore and a grocery store right next to it.  The lobby is huge with lots of benches. The elevators were quick - there are three of them, I did not spend almost any time waiting for them.  It is quiet, amazingly quiet, there are carpets in the hallways, as well as carpet under the bed. I could not hear either the neighbours or the elevator that was a meter away from my hotel room door.  The bed was comfortable, a nice number of lights, a TV, a fridge, a safe (which I did not know how to

When we were driving to the hotel I noticed that the area looked sketchy, and then when we pulled up to the front door they had a policeman guarding the door.  They had an officer the whole three days we stayed here.  Hotel wasn't the cleanest. For example when we pulled the extra blanket out of the closet there was a used feminine pad stuck to it. Ewww.  Their breakfast buffet was pretty good. There is an ATM machine right outside the front door. View out our room wasn't the best.

Located close to the airport and by metro easy to city centre. Good bed and spacious rooms; friendly personnel. But part of the installation needs refreshment/makeover; breakfast quite limited; coffee not good and lunch really below standards.

Satyed from 01.October until 3.10.2021 in this Hotel , that offers truly a great Price . The rooms are very space even the Standart Rooms , inclusive a Safe / empty Minibar , Closet , 2 Twin Beds , AC and a TV with some Programs ( mostly Portuguese CabelNetwork Programs ) . The Staff at the Hotel is ok . There was one Room at

Good parts: Location is ideal for Entrecampos train station which is why I booked.  Nice comfortable bed.  Big room   Bad parts: - Couldn't take a bath as the plug was not compatible with the make, after long time trying I gave up. Good thing I did as the I then discovered the bath had pubes in it, which makes me question how clean the rest of the room was.  - Bathroom door was sliding type which was completely stuck and difficult to move, couldn't close door for fear of getting locked in. Fine for travelling alone, less so if sharing.  - No kettle (but maybe this is standard in Portuguese hotels, I'm not sure)
