I could not hear either the neighbours or the elevator that was a meter away from my hotel room door.  The bed was comfortable, a nice number of lights, a TV, a fridge, a safe (which I did not know how to

When we were driving to the hotel I noticed that the area looked sketchy, and then when we pulled up to the front door they had a policeman guarding the door.  They had an officer the whole three days we stayed here.  Hotel wasn't the cleanest. For example when we pulled the extra blanket out of the closet there was a used feminine pad stuck to it. Ewww.  Their breakfast buffet was pretty good. There is an ATM machine right outside the front door. View out our room wasn't the best.

Located close to the airport and by metro easy to city centre. Good bed and spacious rooms; friendly personnel. But part of the installation needs refreshment/makeover; breakfast quite limited; coffee not good and lunch really below standards.

The good-  -Super easy to get to, about 8 min from the airport  -Several markets (Lido, Continente) only 2 blocks away -Really good local cafes. The cafe on the corner- get the chicken, its awesome. Happy Noodle 1 block away is fantastic! -2 Blocks from the metro and train station. You can get to Baixa and Belem and Sintra from there. Baixa in about 15 min easy trip. -This is a good jumping off point if you either don’t have a car or don’t want to deal with tight parking. BTW, parking is 10E/day at the hotel. HVAC only goes down to about 25 or 26 degrees. -The beds were surprisingly comfy! - Front desk staff were fabulous with local. Knowledge, directions, do this, don’t do that kind of stuff. Very courteous and helpful.  Now for the bad....- -Broken- Steam room - Sauna - Hot

We booked a one night stay here as it was in close proximity to the airport and was a 4 star at a reasonable price. This hotel is disgusting!!! I’m not even sure how it has a 4 star rating when the condition of our rooms and the halls are so dilapidated. We arrived and the lobby area looked decent. We were given room 312 on the 3rd floor. Upon arrival on the floor, we were aghast. The carpet down the dark, dingy hall was filthy (despite being dark red) and the wallpaper down the hall was all ripped off with damage all over. When we got in our room it was worse. The entire room smelled of mildew and there was literally mould on the walls. The wallpaper was also torn up and the drywall was crumbling off. The minibar fridge was filthy and not working. My partner is diabetic and

The police was called, 26 people from Brazil were robbed and the hotel did not do anything!!!! The hotel has no security! The police was called and no one in the hotel had idea how all the rooms were robbed! They do not have cameras and literally anyone can get into your room leave with all your stuffs and the hotel will not do anything, You are on your own! Very sad experience. No US standards at all. Not a safe place. I do NOT recommend this hotel as there is no security!

If you want to be comfortable don’t stay at this hotel. The rooms were stifling hot. It was apparent that the air conditioning was not working only the fan. When we complained to the front desk they put us in a room that had previously been a smoking room it was still hot and it smelled like smoke. Also the sauna and the pool were  closed for two days the only two days that we were there so this hotel gets a terrible rating

I stayed in this hotel for a work conference and found that it was not worthy of its stars or price. The beds were excellent- very comfortable- and the front desk staff were polite. However, the whole hotel had an air of neglect. The carpets in our room were stained and the furniture scuffed; the health club area was seriously neglected- dirty shower, old, broken fittings and shelves, peeling paint and damp as you walked to the pool, out of order Turkish sauna and no working jacuzzi. Another small pool area was empty and used a storage for some old pool pipes. In the pool itself, the imitation plastic pool tiles felt like they were coming off  The breakfast was disappointing as well- a machine that had coffee and warm milk but the only milk that came out was sweetened. There

This hotel is situated in a great location in Lisbon. 10 mins from the airport, 15 mins from Lisbon central. It has car park facilities if you decide to rent a car.   Rooms are very spacious, comfortable beds, clean bath room and toilet. Polite staff at reception.   Would definitely stay here again.

If I hadn't prepaid for this, we would have left. The carpet and upholstery are stained and worn. Our first room on the fourth floor was next to several walls of peeling wallpaper. The view out the windows was of dead plants in plastic flowerpots. The windows and glass aren't clean. We asked for a cleaner room and were taken to the eighth floor, which at least didn't have a view of dead plants. The second room was smaller, which thankfully meant it didn't have the two stained chairs that the larger room had. The linens had stains, and there were holes in my pillowcase. We each got one pillow, which was lumpy and hard. We asked for a second pillow and got them. The bathrooms were clean, but the towels were tatty, and the shower curtain smelled of mildew. There was an electric

What a wonderful experience! At first I was a bit worried seeing a lot of negative reviews. But it was perfect. Clean, safe, good breakfast, i wished that I stayed longer. The staff were great and welcoming. The only negative thing but it isn't the hotel's fault the noises of the plane.

Hotel is on great location, not far from the airport. Room and facilities were clean and the hotel stuff was very nice. Looking forward for coming back here next time when I am in Lisbon, for sure. Thank you!

Carpet is very dirty fridge is not working I lost a lots of food nothing matches about VIP 👎or Executive I don’t think I will come again very disappointed and let down and the view from the window is terrible

Hotel is not a 4-Star Hotel but place/rooms are very clean. Rooms are big with nice and big bathroom. Furniture is basic but very nice and comfortable king-size bed. If you want to visit Lisbon this hotel is a good place for few days. Room rate is about 75 Euro incl. breakfast. Breakfast is ok but quality of coffee is poor.

Rooms are tired and basic. Even whilst waiting for refurb would it hurt to have nice bedding? Duvets instead of sheets and blankets with holes? Plump pillows instead of lumpy falling apart ones? And tea/coffee making facilities? There was an empty fridge but had to ask for a kettle. Thankfully brought my own tea but drank from small glass.  Lack of plug sockets.  New shower curtains perhaps? Or bleach mould off existing ones? The gym doesn’t open until 8am!!! Totally pointless if you have to leave that time for work.  So far totally unimpressed. Desperately looking for alternative hotel for remainder of my week.  Staff at reception polite and friendly but unfortunately powerless to remedy the issues.

Is a pretty good hotel for short stays, very close to the airport and has a metro station near, fairly big rooms decent toilets ,good breakfast.but bit away from the city center . old property requires refurbishing.

Nice rooms – fine cleaning – kitchen and restaurant excellent – service  friendly and professional –central situated for sightseeing and transport to interesting places in the area – to be recommended for shorter and longer stay.

Pros:  walking distance to grocery store and metro station             nice lobby and bar            large breakfast area             friendly staff             free wifi Cons:              not so nice area to look at               not much to see and do nearby             dirty carpet in our room              they ran out of plates for breakfast               I tried various coffees at the breakfast buffet, but all seemed to taste chocolate                fee to use the room safe

Hotel is very basic, needs major modernization or Refurb.  Staff are friendly and helpful.  Outlets like restaurant and bar expect you to pay direct and you cannot charge to your room.  Carpet in room is old and stained and TV is very very old small CRT !  I have not seen these in a hotel for at least ten years.  I slept well on the bed, which shocked me.  Hotel is in a good location.  Breakfast is very poor and I will not be eating in the hotel again.  If I had a choice I would check-out and find a modern hotel, but unfortunately I will not get any refund, so I will stay until the end of my booking and never come back.

Stayed there for three nights with family. The hotel is ok but it really needs a renovation.   Although we paid baby accommodation with only  20% discount on adult rates, the baby cot we received was at least 15 years old. There is a construction site in front of the hotel, so the view is really bad.

The hotel is nicely located, near to the Lisbon university, and the staff is friendly. The breakfast was ok and the restaurant by the lobby had a diverse menu with good food. Bed was comfortable.   On the downside, the hotel is in serious need of a major renovation. The carpet all over the hotel is stained, the shower curtains seemed dirty and the furnitures are worn off. THe airconditioner at the room also didn´t work properly. At last, there was no iron and ironing board available at the hotel.

This is a lower 4 star hotel but I found it fine and did not share some of the other concerns expressed by other reviewers. It has a nice large reception area with a gift shop, coffee shop of hot and cold food, bar and tourist brochures. The dining room is downstairs - breakfast had a wide choice. Only improvement needed is to add more than 2 coffee machines as it can have long queues at busy times. I had a twin room which was very large, It had a safe, 2 wardrobes and adequate drawers, good size desk for working, good lighting, TV. Mini bar has nothing in it - I do not use these so not sure if it can be filled. Bathroom large - over bath shower was powerful and hot. Shampoo, soap and shower gel provided. Hairdryer and shaver point. No iron which they do not have to loan - an

Stayed there a night and was enough. Although it is well located, it is not a 4 star. The room was spacious but it needs a makeover: the carpet was stained, the shower was broken, the curtains were off the rod (little things that stand out and could be easily improved). The corridor walls are cracking and the traffic light in and out of the garage does not work, which is very inconvenient. The staff is friendly and the wi-fi signal was good.

I had booked the room with the hotel directly instead of making the reservation via Booking or other websites to help the hotel save unnecessary fees (the price was the same). My flight was cancelled due to coronavirus, and I planned to stay a second night and made the reservation directly at the hotel. My next flight was cancelled as well and I had to leave the hotel at 9am and told the manager that I did an earlier checkout because we would try to leave the country by other means. We therefore left the hotel at 9am and did not make use of the second night, even though informing in advance.. The hotel refused to refund the money of the second night. A behaviour that is not understandable in the current times where all airlines, hotels and intermediates refund tourists.

The location is ok and the value of the stay is very good. Staff was very friendsly. I was both in a very small and very big room. Perhaps good to check first if you need som espace. Breakfast on roof top was great.

Without being excellent, this Hotel is in everything at least 'good enough'. The room is spacy, the balcony sufficient, only the shower room is a bit small, but working fine. On the (7th) topfloor even a nice place to enjoy your breakfast.

First the good part. Spotlessly clean and with ultra professional front desk ladies.   So what didn’t I like ? Well,  the hotel is basically full of very noisy guests. The rooms are smaller than they appear on the website and the walls very thin. I don’t think I slept much.   There is no hotel bar where one might have a nightcap (one might have concluded there was from the photos) a vending machine has replaced it.  I was also miffed to see the stated rate wasn’t the actual rate! They charge a tourist tax on top. This should be included in their quotes. I don’t favour establishments that mislead. Overall little to recommend it. I’d pay a smidge more and get something else if you care about sleeping.

Welcome was warm and friendly, Room small but clean, toilet etc also clean. If you want to visit Lisbon this is a good location Metro stations close by, 2 different lines, Breakfast sufficient and plenty. We enjoyed our stay, our car was parked in the garage with easy access.

I had booked the room with the hotel directly instead of making the reservation via Booking or other websites to help the hotel save unnecessary fees (the price was the same). My flight was cancelled due to coronavirus, and I planned to stay a second night and made the reservation directly at the hotel. My next flight was cancelled as well and I had to leave the hotel at 9am and told the manager that I did an earlier checkout because we would try to leave the country by other means. We therefore left the hotel at 9am and did not make use of the second night, even though informing in advance.. The hotel refused to refund the money of the second night. A behaviour that is not understandable in the current times where all airlines, hotels and intermediates refund tourists.

The location is ok and the value of the stay is very good. Staff was very friendsly. I was both in a very small and very big room. Perhaps good to check first if you need som espace. Breakfast on roof top was great.

Without being excellent, this Hotel is in everything at least 'good enough'. The room is spacy, the balcony sufficient, only the shower room is a bit small, but working fine. On the (7th) topfloor even a nice place to enjoy your breakfast.

First the good part. Spotlessly clean and with ultra professional front desk ladies.   So what didn’t I like ? Well,  the hotel is basically full of very noisy guests. The rooms are smaller than they appear on the website and the walls very thin. I don’t think I slept much.   There is no hotel bar where one might have a nightcap (one might have concluded there was from the photos) a vending machine has replaced it.  I was also miffed to see the stated rate wasn’t the actual rate! They charge a tourist tax on top. This should be included in their quotes. I don’t favour establishments that mislead. Overall little to recommend it. I’d pay a smidge more and get something else if you care about sleeping.

Welcome was warm and friendly, Room small but clean, toilet etc also clean. If you want to visit Lisbon this is a good location Metro stations close by, 2 different lines, Breakfast sufficient and plenty. We enjoyed our stay, our car was parked in the garage with easy access.

Booked the hotel with bed and breakfast services. The morning buffet was delicious and excellent. The hotel is located close to the city, with plenty of restaurants nearby. The Lisbon Oceanarium is located within a 10 to 15 minute drive from the hotel. We had a great time here, spending most of our days travelling and arriving in the late evenings to what felt just like home. They have great facilities, providing tired tourists with elevator service that takes you to your floor where you’ll find your room so that you don’t have to use the stairs. The breakfast area has a balcony which shows a beautiful view of the surrounding area. Also close to the hotel is the Alameda da Encarnação. Highly recommended.

This hotel is realy nice, clean with kinds personnals ! This hotel is just close to city center of Lisbon. More over, the aireport is on the same line, line red, easy for your first time in this city :)

It's very basic, clean, and helpful, but notably basic and the location that lacks the appeal of the more interesting parts of Lisbon. Do your homework before deciding if this property is right for you. It seems it's best for budget sensitive backpacking guests who don't need many comforts or services and don't mind an area with few options for dining, drinks or entertainment in the immediate area.

This is a nice, clean hotel, between the airport and the downtown Lisbon. The room was clean, but small. There is not much in the area. There are 2 local restaurants that are decent and reasonably priced. The Alameda metro station is about a kilometer away, BUT it is down a very steep hill, so after sightseeing all day it is quite a trudge back up. The best thing about this hotel is the amazing staff. Every one of them was very pleasant, extremely helpful, very caring and all spoke excellent English. They are very happy to help with arranging tours, making recommendations and giving directions. It's good value for the money, but a little out of the way.

Stayed for 5 nights at Hotel DAH which  is situated close to the metro stations Almeda and Olias that take you into the heart of Lisbon, however from Almeda it is a steep hill climb to the hotel but it is the closest. The other station is Olias which is a reasonable walk. If this is your first time to Lisbon you might want to stay a bit closer to the action. While the metro is a good price and convenient with the heat of the day I would have wanted the option to have a break at the hotel. This wasn’t the case for hotel DAH.  The hotel itself is quiet and clean and the housekeeping staff are simply amazing. The reception staff are friendly and spoke good English, but could have been more knowledgable about tours and activities. There is a small lift available.  The rooms are big

We were traveling with one of our adult children and so reserved a room for three. It was spotless with the amenities you would expect. The room was configured in such a way that the two beds were separated somewhat for a bit of privacy. The bath is modern and it has a great shower. Our room had a nice balcony. The view was not spectacular but having the breeze was enjoyable. Breakfast is typical European style -- hot eggs and meat, assorted cold cuts and cheeses, breads and croissants, fruit, cereal, etc. The staff was extremely helpful over the phone and in person. Recommended.

We stayed there for almost a week and we are pleased with everything. The room was clean and organized; the folks at the front desk were super friendly answering all our questions and giving us directions about places, etc. There is a parking lot available for a modest extra fee and the breakfast was good and well presented. There is also a lookout where you can combine coffee with a beautiful view. The metro station is really close, about 5 minutes walking.  I think it’s a safe area because we walk late at night and there were people walking along us. I would stay again if I have the opportunity.

Stayed here two nights and couldn't be more pleased. Front desk folks were extremely helpful, answering all questions and in one case going above and beyond to make a phone call on our behalf to straighten out a computer glitch with our toll pass.  Breakfast was excellent and there was ample parking underground (for extra charge).  The metro station was an easy walk away so we were able to enjoy everything in Lisbon hassle free.

Cleaning lady didn’t lock our door, we got stolen 150€, manager offered us free breakfast (2p, worth 18€) can you imagine! Lucky for us we didn’t get our id’s stolen. Staff is not to blaim, they did their research. If the manager were in our place, i wonder if he would be content by the taken measures.

We chose a triple room for our family of three as reviews commented on the rooms being small. The triple room was indeed spacious and we all slept extremely well despite it being on a main road-we are very light sleepers. The beds were very comfortable. It’s possible that a double room with an extra bed would have been enough and at that price, £78, it would have been incredibly good value for Lisbon. The room was very clean and it had a balcony where we could enjoy a beer after our child had gone up bed.  The breakfast room is quite small - there is also an outdoor part which has some ok views over Lisbon... you can see the river. The food selection was good: coffee and pastries were good but the croissants looked very dry.  Location was good although it is an uphill trek from

We stayed in this hotel for 15 nights. The hotel is near to the metro station. The front office agents (Horácio, Ana, Andreina, Susana and Cyndna) were so friendly, hospitable and attended to our needs. We left the hotel at 4:00 a.m. for our flight and Horácio helped us with the luggages and followed up on the transport service. He was very professional. Though this is not a five-star hotel, the front office agents have rendered a five-star service and we would highly recommend it to other tourists. We would definitely stay there again should we visit Lisbon in the future.

Hotel is located about 10-15 minutes by taxi from the airport.  You can get to the center of LIsbon in 10-15 minutes by nearby metro stops.  Room is simple but spacious & clean.  The front desk staff is very, very helpful (Ines, Horacio, Rosaria etc).  Breakfasts are complete and very tasty.  This hotel is a very good value.

A quiet and well run hotel on the edge of the city centre.  Easy to reach from the airport, good metro links to get around the city. Breakfast on the terrace is a pleasure in warm weather.   For those arriving from the airport however be aware it is at the top of a steep hill, so make sure you are able to carry your bags the final 500-600 metres.

My partner and I recently stayed at this hotel on a short city break to Lisbon. This is a clean and comfortable hotel with great transport links to the city. The Metro station is a 10 minute walk down the hill (wasn't a problem for us but could potentially be a struggle). The Metro was quick and very easy to use. A further 10 minutes from the hotel you can find a few restaurants and bars if you wanted to stay closer to the hotel in the evening, which were also much cheaper. Good for a place to crash after a busy day exploring.

We felt very welcome at check-in, we turned up early and were given a map and shown some good places to visit. The website we booked at gave us a twin room but we were offered a swap to a double for the next night which was very nice. The hotel is very reasonable priced and definitely worth it. It is not located close to the city but there are 2 metro stops very close to the hotel so it is easy to travel in to explore. Would recommend this place if you are just looking for a bed for the night so you can explore in the day.

Although this hotel is a bit out of the way from the city centre, it is not too far from the transit system. A few minutes walk and you are right on the subway and on your way to wherever your heart desires.  The room was a delight and offered a lovely vista especially in the breakfast area! Speaking of breakfast, the staff member was always on hand with yet another goodie to add to the already huge selection but still managed not to get underfoot when clients were enjoying the morning meal.  All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel and would return again myself if ever I visit Lisbon again.

Small hotel in good location with recently refurbished rooms. Ideal as a base, and very helpful staff. Good local restaurants within a few minutes walk, and ten minutes from the airport by taxi, or by hotel transfer.

Love the fact that 2 yrs later when I return it was the same staff. Tells you they treat their people right. Rooms are comfortable and not bad on price. Local food and grocery store as well as places for a dinner all within a 2 block walk.

Because our airline had changed the time schedule we needed to stay over 1 night on our trip from maputo to amsterdam. The hotel is appr. 15 min from the airport and provides decent rooms for reasonable prices. The lady at the reception was very friendly. After a long day we didn't want to go out and ordered room service. This was rather dissapointing.

the room was a good size and bathroom was clean and basic, but the lobby is tiny and no seats, so we had to wait our turn standing. The shower was blowing cold warm water which made it uncomfortable to shower. the hotel is some distance from the downtown and with no metro station nearby. Metro station is a 10 minute walk.

I went in 2017, Nice place located in the middle of lisboa. My first time to stay in a hostel "great experience". Rooms were clean. Friendly staff, Very helpful gives you places to visit. As i remember there is a lady who admire actor Omar ElSherif.

The pictures do not represent what you get or see when you get there.  Old and dirty, need a good wash and a few coats of paint Breakfast????? One slice of ham and a slice of cheese with a very tiny muffin.  Stayed at several hostel during my month of travelling Portugal, this is the worse place ever. Unable to close window at night cause of the smell of mold and humidity in the room

I got a private room with an attached bathroom all to myself.  I was pleasantly surprised at the comfort of the room..the bed sheets were so soft and the pillows lovely! Did not feel like I was in a Hostel. I'm 57 yrs old and appreciated that there was an elevator up to my 4th floor room(this is not a given amenity in Lisbon. The director Antonio was a delightful handsome man who has years of experience in hospitality and it shows. I had left my vrbo accommodation that was not as advertised and was so grateful to have a hot shower in my private bathroom...heaven. And the location!!!!couldn't have asked for more. Walking distance to sights, right across the Elevator and a mall with a food court for a quick bite on a rainy day. Joal was very kind and helpful with suggestions on

Just finished a 4 night stay in a 4 bed male dorm on 3rd floor. Super clean. Great shower and shave area. Friendly staff (Diego & Joel...you Rock) and the two older gentlemen who handle the night shift. Perfect location indeed in the heart of everything. Breakfast Daily was simple but ample. Yeah elevator is both blessing (as so old skol) and curse (when guests don’t close properly) but no big deal.

We chose a private room which has own bath and toilet. The room is small but clean and they provided some toiletries. Breakfast may be simple but good, staff are friendly. The aircon was perfect considering the weather. My only complaint is something that the hostel did not cause. Many guests do not close the two doors of the elevator which result to it being stuck in one floor. Since our room was in fifth floor, it was not fun to get up or go down just because guests do not see or read the hostel’s reminder posted everywhere about closing both elevator doors.   The location is perfect. No need to purchase metro card since all must-see sights are within walking distance. Lots of restaurants and cafes everywhere. The best landmark to the hostel is Elevador Justa, which we could

I went in 2017, Nice place located in the middle of lisboa. My first time to stay in a hostel "great experience". Rooms were clean. Friendly staff, Very helpful gives you places to visit. As i remember there is a lady who admire actor Omar ElSherif.

One slice of ham and a slice of cheese with a very tiny muffin.  Stayed at several hostel during my month of travelling Portugal, this is the worse place ever. Unable to close window at night cause of the smell of mold and humidity in the room

Yeah elevator is both blessing (as so old skol) and curse (when guests don’t close properly) but no big deal.

The location is perfect. No need to purchase metro card since all must-see sights are within walking distance. Lots of restaurants and cafes everywhere. The best landmark to the hostel is Elevador Justa, which we could

The staff were lovely from the start, rooms were clean and showers were hot. Breakfast provided was a bonus and they even let us keep our bags in a disused room until 7pm due to our late flight back. Also includes really interesting old elevator

I've been in this hostel 3 nights and I really enjoyed it. Everything Is all right and you have breakfast as well.  The position Is perfect, in the hearth of Lisbon and most of everything the staff Is super!!  Diego, Riccardo and Mafalda are really kind, gave me many reccomendations and advice to enjoy better my stay.

I stayed at this hostel for 4 nights in a room of 8. We wondered why every morning we were waking up ill with sore throats only to find BLACK MOULD under all our beds on our last day. There are so many nicer hostels in Lisbon that wouldn’t affect your health! Avoid this one.

Staying in Lisbom now is an absolute adventure, specially if you want a place on a budget. Tried this hostel for the first time and with was a great surprise!  Clean, downtown and on a budget (although not that cheap). Staff is nice and polite and the old building give it a somewhat nostalgic atmosphere. The old elevator is a must (don't forget to close BOTH doors in order to work!!). The only suggestion I would give is to replace the curtains on the rooms as too much light goes in... A place to stay in the future!

The Golden Tram staff was nice from the check-in until check-out. It has lots of commodities and a great price. Beds are really comfortable and it's nice and quiet. Totally would recommend for someone looking for something cheap and comfortable.

I had stayed here before about two years ago and the hostel has changed a bit. The reception is now upstairs instead of downstairs and some parts have been renovated. The check-in didn’t go that well, we were 3 guys and a girl and had booked specifically a female dorm for the girl. When checking in they told us the female dorm was full but after a while we managed to get her in the female dorm, not very professional. We got a Portuguese drink at check-in (ginjinha) which was nice. The four person room was okay, the previous time I was here the room was more modern though. The showers and toilets were clean.  Breakfast was good (a sandwich, an orange, cake and some drinks). If you want to leave your luggage after check-out you will have to pay per hour. Altogether it was a good

My fav part about this hostel is the room key which is a wrist band and the nice free breakfast. The WiFi is also really good here.   However, there is very little social life here and people very much stick to themselves.

This hostel looks nice in the pictures but really is not. The staff was downright rude and we had to ask for our deposit back even after we handed in our keys. Being polite goes a long way. It’s alright, but definitely not for a extended period of time. The bathrooms were horrid. 2 toilets on the entire floor one for men and one for women. It does have a really good location. Essentially you get what you pay for but my friends and I would probably not stay here again. It’s not bad but like I said, you get what you pay for and personally I think the staff could be nicer and it could be cleaner!!

The place is a dated, run-down guest house. While the building is a great 1920s building, with a beautiful original lift, the hostel ruined completely the ambiance filling everything with cheap boards painted in screaming colours, giving it the looks of a 1990s cheap motel.  The "rooms" - in fact, it's a large room divided with thin boards - are very small, and air renovation is very difficult. The boards not only pass all the noise being made on the joining rooms, but they even amplify it. In two nights I've got two school groups in the adjoining rooms, which made incredible noise into the night. At some point, I had to go to the reception 4.50 in the morning to ask them to do something.   There is only 1 WC per floor, often broken. The showers on my floor were also broken most

Great place to stay and explore Lisbon, rooms were clean with comfortable beds, showers were decent and breakfast was good. Great location with every part of Lisbon within easy reach. I have stayed in much worse hotels which cost much more!

I stayed only two nights, but i can tell that the Golden tram Hostel is beyond what you expect for a budget hostel.I traveled with my girlfriend and we stayed in a mixed room, the beds and corridors are really small, but are ok if you use the place only to rest at night and get a shower. What i liked the most was the excellent location, at walking distance of every main attraction on bail chide, we even did the walk towards the castello st jorge on foot. The staff is very friendly and they even offer us free storage when we did th check out. Plus, the included breakfast is great, basic but fresh and healthy. Great place for younger travelers.

This hostel really dissapointed me, for many things..  I especially choose it because the photos all show great beds with curtains, but when I arrived, they were replaced with ugly and unconfortable bunk beds without any curtains or even bedlights!  The receptionnist woman was also very unfriendly. No hello at check in, only "passport!" and "credit card!" and some basic information muttered.  During the last night, another receptionnist suddenly entered the room to add a 5th bed to the room to let 4 people in..  but I booked a room especially with 4 beds to have not more than 3 other people in it! Explaination: we would otherwise have to put you in another room to make room for this people, so we chose not to disturbe you. Sorry??   When I book a bed it should be fixed and I

The Golden Tram hostel was a good experience, we're a group of three with a private room, which was better than we thought. Breakfast is what it is, but I had no expectations at all. But overall a nice experience.

Hostel is perfectly located, in the middle of city center, close to public transport (trams, trains, metro). You can easily go for a beach, get a trip to sintra or whatever you want. Beds are comfortable, rooms and showers are clean.You can borrow a towel for 1 euro, but you have to pay additional 9 euro deposit. Also you must pay 5 euros for bracelet which allows you to open your dormitory doors. Breakfasts are kind of boring because they are always the same, but for this price you cannot expect more.Air condition works well, so does the wi-fi.

I liked it very very much! Nice dorms, nice people and nice place for the breakfast! the location is so convinient: next to the metro and right in the heart of the center. So cozy and friendly. It is the right spot to get to know this amazing city!

It was quite nice stay in Lisbon. The hostel is cheap with really great location. Breakfast which was included was every day the same but was tasty. We had room with 8 other girls. The room was clean and had a nice view to Santa Justa Lift. The bathroom was quite okay, I was missing a hairdryer. What I didn't like was the staff. Quite unfriendly, annoyed and didn't even throw a smile. I was missing some hostels activities and as I said, friendly atmosphere.

I had an excellent experience in my 4 nights here. The bathrooms and linens were clean and the staff very welcoming. It is 5 minutes away from subway/tram lines and is surrounded by restaurants and bars. I would definitely stay again!

Centrally located, near both Rossio and Baixa-Chiado station and there are many restaurants around. Clean, good breakfast included, great rooms with lockers and a charming elevator. Staff is great and helpful. My place to stay in Lisbon.

Comfortable, safe and friendly.  With its own kitchen and bar with rest area in the heart of Lisbon (opposite the famous town elevator), it would be hard to find a better place for the price.   The beds are comfortable, each with their own power socket and facilities acceptable. The rooms are key less, using electronic wrist tags.

Firstly, the receptionist told us to wait a little. That waiting lasted 2 hours after the expected check in time, then we asked if we can let the luggage anywhere and the lady was annoyed that she had to deal with us. We reserved our beds less than one day in advance, but the hostel seemed more than half empty. We stayed for a night in the top floor, where you only can take the stairs. Apart from that, the hostel was clean, the view from the window was amazing and the location was great. Since that was our last stay in the Portugal, we would have booked one of the past ones if we knew how it will be.

Put into a disabled room. Missing towels. One cup for tea and coffee. But the real problem was the incredibly bright security light at the door. Unable to sleep.   Staff kept trying to explain but still wrong.   Warning. This hotel is noisy from the airport. Flights make this a poor location fir any hotel near here.

The room was a good size, clean and there was not much disturbance. The hotel was not super well located. The breakfast wasn't great but there's a good bio-store next door and refrigerators in the room.

Good:  - Near public transportation which takes you rapidly in the city center;  - Large rooms, sparkling clean;  - Cleaning everyday (including new towels and new water bottles);  - New hotel;  - Friendly staff;  - Overall, a confortable and good choice;  - Value for money.  Bad: - No slippers / bathrobes  - Good breakfast, but with limited and repetitive choices (however, they have Pasteis de Nata!);  - Queue for the coffee;  - A/C is making noise at night even if it was set up at its lowest speed and on night mode;  - TV not working;  - Sometimes you can hear what the other tourists are talking in their rooms.

I visit last week Portuagal lisbon Masa Hotel 5 de Outubro,I like hotel and barman shoubit very nice and kindly helpful good  knowledge and make me nice Cafa latte I am proud with him ,I hope all gust happy with him service .  I will be back again this hotel.

First of all: the staff is unfriendly, unpleasant rooms, the main door of the room most of the times doesn’t close, same for the bathroom, air conditioner doesn’t work. The food was terrible even scary if we want, the water tasted like chlorine. Wouldn’t recommend it.

Put into a disabled room. Missing towels. One cup for tea and coffee. But the real problem was the incredibly bright security light at the door. Unable to sleep.   Staff kept trying to explain but still wrong.   Warning. This hotel is noisy from the airport. Flights make this a poor location fir any hotel near here.

The room was a good size, clean and there was not much disturbance. The hotel was not super well located. The breakfast wasn't great but there's a good bio-store next door and refrigerators in the room.

I visit last week Portuagal lisbon Masa Hotel 5 de Outubro,I like hotel and barman shoubit very nice and kindly helpful good  knowledge and make me nice Cafa latte I am proud with him ,I hope all gust happy with him service .  I will be back again this hotel.

First of all: the staff is unfriendly, unpleasant rooms, the main door of the room most of the times doesn’t close, same for the bathroom, air conditioner doesn’t work. The food was terrible even scary if we want, the water tasted like chlorine. Wouldn’t recommend it.

Modern hotel with lots of bars and restaurants close by, just a short way from the airport, and within walking distance to the very interesting bull ring that is worth visiting, its about 3 KM from the old town and all the sights, crew are friendly and helpful, and the bar keeper mixes a good cocktail.

We were aware this was a brand new hotel when we booked which was great but we didn’t think they would have so many issues. I honestly wish I paid the extra to stay at another hotel to save the hassle we had the last few days.   The staff were very friendly this wasn’t a problem and the room itself was great.   We arrived back at 6pm and the room hadn’t been cleaned, no toilet paper no towels no shampoo / conditioner so we had to wait downstairs in reception for the room to be cleaned to then go up and shower ready for the evening. We had to push back our dinner reservation because this delayed us. After the room was cleaned we had to ask for shower gel and a towel as this was missing.   The next day we requested for the room to be cleaned at a decent time (like any other hotel

The hotel is located a bit outside the touristic areas but one can walk from it to almost every interesting zones of Lisbon. There is also a metro station nearby. The room was big, the staff welcoming and helpful.

For the price we paid we were pleaseantly surprised at the size and comfort of the room. The bedroom and bathroom were well equiped, spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and big, we slept very well.  The breakfast was decent, plenty of choice for cooked and continental breakfast. The hotel is in a good location with a Metro station entrance about 30 seconds walk from the front door of the hotel.   The only negative is the air conditioning in the bedroom is not very good otherwise I'd give the hotel five stars. We stayed in March when the temperatures aren't too high. I wouldn't like to have stayed in the height of summer. The air con was struggling to keep the room temperature at a comfortable level in March.

I stayed here on a weekend trip with a large group and it worked well as a good base for sightseeing.  The sleep quality was ok but the acoustic separation between rooms not ideal.    Breakfast was as expected for this standard of hotel

Myself and my friend spent 3 nights at hotel masa . The room was cleaned every day location was right next to metro stop (anjos) breakfast was included (continental) . It was in a safe area and about a ten minute walk to main area . Id recommend staying here if its for a city break and somewhere to put your head down for the night. It was good value for money and id definitely stay here again .

For a 3 star hotel I was very impressed with the overall! Check in very nice and smooth by Mr Pedro on the front desk, always very helpful! Rooms are very clean, spacious ! Breakfast is good! Location of the hotel is by the metro station (Anjos) and therefore you can reach anywhere in the city or from and to the airport! All the staff i have met are very friendly! I do recommend this hotel and will return!

The hotel is located a bit outside the touristic areas but one can walk from it to almost every interesting zones of Lisbon. There is also a metro station nearby. The room was big, the staff welcoming and helpful.

For the price we paid we were pleaseantly surprised at the size and comfort of the room. The bedroom and bathroom were well equiped, spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable and big, we slept very well.  The breakfast was decent, plenty of choice for cooked and continental breakfast. The hotel is in a good location with a Metro station entrance about 30 seconds walk from the front door of the hotel.   The only negative is the air conditioning in the bedroom is not very good otherwise I'd give the hotel five stars. We stayed in March when the temperatures aren't too high. I wouldn't like to have stayed in the height of summer. The air con was struggling to keep the room temperature at a comfortable level in March.

I stayed here on a weekend trip with a large group and it worked well as a good base for sightseeing.  The sleep quality was ok but the acoustic separation between rooms not ideal.    Breakfast was as expected for this standard of hotel

Myself and my friend spent 3 nights at hotel masa . The room was cleaned every day location was right next to metro stop (anjos) breakfast was included (continental) . It was in a safe area and about a ten minute walk to main area . Id recommend staying here if its for a city break and somewhere to put your head down for the night. It was good value for money and id definitely stay here again .

For a 3 star hotel I was very impressed with the overall! Check in very nice and smooth by Mr Pedro on the front desk, always very helpful! Rooms are very clean, spacious ! Breakfast is good! Location of the hotel is by the metro station (Anjos) and therefore you can reach anywhere in the city or from and to the airport! All the staff i have met are very friendly! I do recommend this hotel and will return!

We spent one night here when visiting Lisbon. Very good location near the metro station Anjus. Comfortable room, a bit noisy air con, good breakfast. Friendly staff, car parking available under the hotel for 10,-EUR/night, check out till 12 A.M. Good value for money.

Stayed here with the family for the weekend! Had a fab time in Lisbon, would recommend this hotel. It’s a average room with en-suite and everything you need, it’s cleaned daily, nice breakfast, very helpful in reception. Good quality for a good price and central to everything.

I found my accommodation comfortable and the room was clean.  The location of the Masa Hotel is key to seeing and visiting many of the key points of interest in Lisbon.  However, their breakfast selection was extremely limited, the same everyday.

The hotel is very clean. Located near metro station (just outside - Anjos station).  At the reception the staff is very helpful.  Nearby just across the street there is a 24/7 shop.   You can easily use taxis or mobile application taxis to move around the city and it will not cost to reach any traditional restaurant with fado more than 8-10 euro per way.

The price is to high for the night and they are providing Expired food, bitter/sour milk, poorest breakfast ever,sheet food,faulty items in the room and bathroom.not recommended.asquerosa comida!rubbish

Hotel was nice but not in a very attractive area. So close to anjos metro station(  (20 metres) No restaurant or bar in hotel and no real alternative close by. We caught metro to Oriente and we ate at  the restaurants inVasco DaGama shopping centre.

We spent our last night in Lisbon in this hotel. Room was clean, breakfast was good and the price was right for what we get (we booked with a last-minute discount). There's a subway station just leaving the hotel.

During our stay in Lisbon, my love and I stayed at Masa Hotel Almirante. Hotel was in our opinion very good. Nice, clean hotel with nice and clean rooms. Breakfast was good. Nothing fancy, but it was good. People who are working in hotel were nice and polite, how they should be.  Everything was nice and ok, except the elevator. Elevator was too slow. If the owners remove this problem, nothing will stand on the way for a next star.

Just s short walk out of town but you can stop and have a couple of drinks on the way in ,hotel is very comfortable and clean lacking a good bar had to go next door but overall solid venue ,word of note don’t eat out of the vending machines didn’t work out for a couple of our guys in the group

Me and my boyfriend spent 6 nights at Masa Hotel Almirante. Rooms were clean and the air conditioner worked well. Rooms were cleaned daily. The breakfast area was quite small and the breakfast itself was a bit dissapointing. There could have been more fresh fruits and vegetables and variety overall. Coffee was bad. The working habits of the staff working in the breakfast room were unhygienic (touching cutlery from parts that shouldn't have been touched etc.).  We had an early check out at 5 am. The receptionist was informed the previous evening about our check out time. In the morning there was no one at the reception and the front door was locked so we couldn't get out. We found the receptionist sleeping in the staircase next to the reception. He didn't speak English well and

The hotel is very conveniently located just a few meters from Anjos Metron station. Helpful and friendly reception staff. As the hotel is situated on a main road, we asked for a room on the rear side of the hotel when we arrived and our wish was fulfilled. The bedroom was very clean and perfectly equipped with air-conditioning, WiFi, hair-dryer, flat-screen TV, electric kettle and fridge  (but buy our own tea-bags/coffee and cold drinks at a small store just next door to the hotel). The only thing we have to criticize is the breakfast (watered-down orange juice, under-baked bread rolls)

This year for our summer holiday we decided it was time to visit Lisbon and fell head over heels for this magical city with so much history and beauty. We got a room at Masa Hotel on Almirante Avenue and had a brilliant time. Modern room with nice kettle, bright clean bathroom, and included breakfast and wifi. Really saved a lot of money by staying here and did not have to compromise on anything actually.

Amazing hotel, perfect location to right next to a mainline metro and the staff were very friendly. Inside is beautiful don't let the street it's on put you off. Would definitely go again, really lovely for a city break.

Lovely modern hotel ,very clean well thought out rooms only issue a felt once again no thought for the breakfast very basic over cooked scramble egg my pet hate for variety needed but not the end of the world ,also for those who like a drink no bar ,the owner or manager standing around micro managing staff off putting ,negative about 2 miles from harbour which is pain as taxis are very slow with the heavy congestion  Overall nice place

Recently, we visited Lisbon and got 4 nights accommodation at the Almirante Hotel in central Lisbon for €340 each. A bargain by any standards for a central location in a major European city.  The taxi from the Airport was a short journey and cost €25 for the four of us. Our hotel was situated on Avenida Almirante Reiss and I would have to say was a disappointment on first sight not looking at all as glamorous from the outside as it had done on that most deceptive of devices – The Internet. However, on entering we were met by a much better interior and such friendly and helpful staff that our first impressions faded into oblivion.  Rooms are well sized, clean and comfortable with an enormous, extremely comfortable bed. The Breakfast area and small bar off the Lobby were

Excellent hotel located just a 2 min walk from Anjos metro station. Very clean and modern hotel with breakfast included. Not a huge range of breakfast options but bread/cheese/meats, some hot food (eggs, sausages and tortilla) with fruit and little pastries.  Rooms were great, king size bed and shower/bath.  The line green line which serves Anjos metro station heads directly into the city centre and it getting to the airport was simple - about a 20 min tube ride with only one change.   Thoroughly recommend the hotel for a slightly cheaper option!

To sum up: extremely rude receptionist, very slow work, broken showers, dose of stress. But first of all we were met like this: 'move your car out of the entrance!' We were shocked, to hear that after the long day of our journey. Especially as we have read on their website that they provide parking: 'private parking with extra payment' / or 'openair parking'. BEWARE, all this is a lie. And your journey will end in the busy road, and receptionist behaving with you like with a hobo, just because you have asked her, where to find any parking!? It was told to us that they are overbooked and it is not their problem that we do have a car!!! It made us loose time, searching for a parking and feel absolutely unwanted clients. Sincerely do not recommend, if you want to sustain calmness

When arriving we wondered where we were it seemed a bit isolated and not in an upmarket area but after a day we found the subway and purchased a 48 hour ticket and used it extensively which made getting around easy. The rooms are basic, the shower is in the bath (I don't think you would have a bath), there is a bar fridge but nothing in it but our room with a balcony was a reasonable size... we didn't use the balcony but it allowed us to open the windows....breakfast very simple, nothing special ... our first impression was that the room not that clean but this seemed to improve as we stayed longer, we had to remember this was only a 3 star hotel but represented reasonable value.

The hotel is recently refurbished and in excellent condition. It is a few steps away from the nearest metro which will get you in to town in a couple of stops. Also very easy to get to and from airport via the metro. Breakfast was ok, nothing amazing but enough to start your day off - lovely breads and a few cooked items (eggs etc) and coffee and juices. No bar or restaurant for food/ drinks at night but shops close by and the metro for everything else. Definitely recommend

Been there from 15th to 19th of May. Unkind staff, bad food (found hair in our disgusting soup), annoying elevator that made us wait forever, discrete cleaning (the glasses were dirty). Won't come back.

My friends and I stayed here for several nights. It is very well located, walking distance to the main area of this section of Lisbon, as well as to the Arch of Triumph and the waterfront.  The rooms are very comfortable with windows that open and nice-sized bathrooms. We especially liked the restaurant, which had good food, nice drinks and very friendly and helpful staff. If we go back to Lisbon, we will definitely stay here again.

The staff at this hotel is not acceptable at all, only unfriendly, that’s it.  The corridors are smelly, rooms do not have a view at all, are small. You can see the neighbors wall out of your room window. The neighborhood is dark as well and not as nice

Well-placed for all typical tourist activities, many within easy walking distance. Special mention for Claudio at the reception, who gave us extensive and spot-on advice for our trip to Sintra.   Good breakfast.

We had a lovely room. It was clean and bright. We really liked the restaurant. They had extended hours and the first night we got there late after long hours of traveling and were so grateful for a good meal and pleasant service.  We were very pleased with the location.  It was walking distance from many of the places we wanted to see.

Stayed at this hotel for five nights from the 9th to the 14th March 2020, me, my husband, my sister and her husband,  we had an amazing time discovering Lisbon and this hotel was the perfect base.  The hotel is in the centre of everything, 3 minutes to Praça do Figueira and the Rossio Metro and Train stations and 5 minutes to Praça do Comércio, a large, historic square on the banks of the River Tagus. The hotel is right in the heart of the restaurants and shops and a short walk to all the tram and bus stops. My brother in law and I were both celebrating birthdays and were treated with chocolates and wine and birthday greetings by the  front desk team and restaurant staff, everyone working at the hotel was very helpful, friendly and informative, they couldn’t have been nicer. The

My friends and I stayed here for several nights. It is very well located, walking distance to the main area of this section of Lisbon, as well as to the Arch of Triumph and the waterfront.  The rooms are very comfortable with windows that open and nice-sized bathrooms. We especially liked the restaurant, which had good food, nice drinks and very friendly and helpful staff. If we go back to Lisbon, we will definitely stay here again.

The staff at this hotel is not acceptable at all, only unfriendly, that’s it.  The corridors are smelly, rooms do not have a view at all, are small. You can see the neighbors wall out of your room window. The neighborhood is dark as well and not as nice

Well-placed for all typical tourist activities, many within easy walking distance. Special mention for Claudio at the reception, who gave us extensive and spot-on advice for our trip to Sintra.   Good breakfast.

We had a lovely room. It was clean and bright. We really liked the restaurant. They had extended hours and the first night we got there late after long hours of traveling and were so grateful for a good meal and pleasant service.  We were very pleased with the location.  It was walking distance from many of the places we wanted to see.

Stayed at this hotel for five nights from the 9th to the 14th March 2020, me, my husband, my sister and her husband,  we had an amazing time discovering Lisbon and this hotel was the perfect base.  The hotel is in the centre of everything, 3 minutes to Praça do Figueira and the Rossio Metro and Train stations and 5 minutes to Praça do Comércio, a large, historic square on the banks of the River Tagus. The hotel is right in the heart of the restaurants and shops and a short walk to all the tram and bus stops. My brother in law and I were both celebrating birthdays and were treated with chocolates and wine and birthday greetings by the  front desk team and restaurant staff, everyone working at the hotel was very helpful, friendly and informative, they couldn’t have been nicer. The

Stayed here with my mum for a long weekend in February.  Perfect location, 2 minute walk to restaurants, 5 mins to the main squares and bus tour starting points and 5 mins to the Praça do Comércio.  Rooms were modern and clean, if maybe a bit on the small side.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.  Price reasonable too for such a fantastic location!

Well, I booked just week before trip so I choosed according to  location&past rewievs. The hotel is located few minutes walking from main street, metro and public transpirt as well as sea coast. Tidy but clean room, helpful staff and great valze for money. The floor is wooden so sometimes is noisy while other guests go up and down by stairs. Breakfast was delicious, maybe a liitle bit monotonious ( identical 3-4 ingredients for a whole week), but fresh and tasty and good enough.

1°) this Hotel is well located : it's near  important  and beautiful places of Lisboa and  near metro station 2°) The  room   is not noisy  and it is  very clean 3°) The staff , in receprtion office , CLAUDIO   and NADIA  were   welcoming , attentive  and helpful !!!!!! It's a pleasure  to be welcomed  in French  by Claudio !! Nadia kindly took care of restaurants  and taxis  reservations ....  Thank you so much 4°) We had   an excellent breakfast  every morning : Ariel , Adriano and Alexia  we so kind  persons : they   are  competents , helpful and attentive  too!!! We   appreciated  being  greeted  with kindness  and  competence  by Adriano  for our  first portuguese lunch , on sunday : thanks a lot !! These  reception and restaurant  staff made us feel comfortable : we were

We just came back from Lisbon celebrating my special Birthday.Hotel is in the best possible location within walking distance to seafront and all the attractions. The windows are great no noise from the street and the bed was extremely comfortable. the hotel staff were amazing and they even got me a bottle of sparkling wine and chocolates for my birthday.I have to say thought the breakfast could be better... very repetitive over 5 days and not much choice. They could improve on that. Hotel is lovely though, very clean etc.

Brilliant stay in this fabulous cosy hotel situated in the old part of town (which probably explains the smallish rooms). Everything else about it made up for this with the best location - close to the action but a street away meant no late night street noise; the best staff from the helpful receptionists to the restaurant waiters serving what I thought was great food. Not sure why breakfast has been criticised - I couldn’t see anything wrong with it. Loved sitting in the outside section in the evening watching the world go by - with overhead heaters! Our flight was cancelled and the receptionists couldn’t have been more helpful with helping book a train. Altogether a really good option and I would certainly go back. Oh a really comfortable beds too. What’s not to like!

This hotel is perfectly located for exploring the city. Its close to Alfama, Barrio Alto, main plazas, taxis, metro, etc. However, it has a couple of downs in my opinion. Rooms are very uncomfortable (super small), you can hear absolutely everything your neighbors do, and they don’t take the thrash out. Also the included breakfast is very limited.  I would rate the overall experience with 3 stars.

The Lis is perfect if you want to be in the heart of the city. Quiet and with a very good restaurant, you will enjoy the breakfast and all meals. Great experience for us during three nights . We will come back for sure.

I choose this hotel for its location to shopping and neighborhoods I wanted to tour in addition to the "American" type bathroom meaning a real walk-in shower. It exceeded my expectations y even providing a make-up mirror which does not often happen in hotels. The soothing decor, wonderful breakfast and friendly/helpful staff made my stay so comfortable and fun. Two recommendations if you book: The main street is like an echo chamber so even the smallest conversation outside filters into your room. If you are a light sleeper, best to book in the courtyard side. Secondly, they charge 15 euros for room service which is really excessive considering my average meal is Lisbon was round 20 euros. After a long flight, it's not fun to have to go out for dinner and I don't really

Very good stay at Hotel Lis (3 nights), which I will consider for sure should I go back to Lisbon.  - The location is just great, central, walking distance to many attractions and to public transportation to/ from the airport. - Hotel’s personnel is friendly, professional and helpful. - Breakfast was very good. - The room was very clean and well equipped (i.e. safe, kettle, refrigerator, bathrobe & slippers). Bathroom was spacious and offered Uriage toiletries.  I had booked a Mini Double Room with street view and was upgraded to a Mini double room with balcony. I knew the room would be quite small. It was fine this time as I was traveling alone, but the bed took up lots of space. Should we be 2 people next time I would certainly go for a bigger room.

Friendly staff, good quality hotel with an adjacent restaurant serving quality food (and breakfast). Location is central within walking distance to the sea and to explore Alfama, Bairro Alto and Estrela areas of Lisbon. Only let down is twin rooms are very small. Recommended.

I would recommend this hotel. The location was excellent, buffet breakfast extensive, restaurant pleasant, in-room facilities very good (TV, safe, tea-making equipment, good bathroom, comfortable bed), quiet, staff friendly and helpful.

The hotel has a nice, welcoming reception area.  Front desk is extremely efficient, respectful and helpful.  We were especially pleased with Claudio who was always so welcoming and recommended a couple of good restaurants. Pros:   As above, front office Location is just perfect Clean hotel Best tasting tomatoes, offered at breakfast Toiletries of a good brand( although at times not replaced) Bathrobe and slippers Cons: Huge bed in a small room We had to ask for refilling of bacon, scrambled eggs, tomatoes etc pretty regularly Bathroom could do with a magnifying mirror and a rail in the shower to hold on to  It is not a cheap hotel considering it's three star but would willingly return there.

Enjoyed our short stay here as part of a tour. The bathroom walls are see through so if traveling on a tour with a stranger it could be a bit awkward. Great location, comfortable beds. Our door wouldn’t work at first and they addressed the issue quickly. They offer a welcome drink at the attached restaurant. They provide luggage storage too.

Ok. Who rates the stars. Without a doubt the smallest sleeping area I’ve payed for since I was a student. Luckily enough I was traveling alone because this double ? Room wasn’t big enough for two mice. Sticky carpets. No sound insulation. So if you are ok getting up at the same time as your fellow guests this is perfect

Stayed here for 3 nights in September. Friendly welcome, clean room although as per other reviews, the room has a giant bed but is small. Buffet style breakfast. The location is really central, you can walk to most places really easily. Would stay again.

Stayed here for 3 nights with my boyfriend. The location is perfect. You can go with the bike, step, by foot or Uber everwhere super quick. And iT is a Nice neighbourhood. However that is about iT what makes this a Nice hotel. The room we stayed in was very very small. Just enough space for a bed. But we did not know where to put our bags. This is not really a problem as we did not spend much time in the room. But still for the price we payed we expected more. The bathRoom was Nice. And the reception is not very helpfull. If you want to find the Nice places to eat better check TripAdvisor then ask at the front desk.   Would try a different hotel next time. Just because did not get a Nice warm welcome feeling. Location is perfect though.

Had 2 night stay, picked hotel due to location and it is well located.  Very clean and well decorated. Breakfast was buffet, really good selection inc excellent pastries and fresh orange juice and other juices. Only problem was the size of the room.  Very large bed so large that unable to open wardrobe doors properly. Unable to leave suitcase ina place where it was not hugely in the way. Tea and coffee facilities but only place to plug the kettle in seemed to be right by the bedroom door.  We were only there for 2 nights but no good at all for a longer stay.  Would suggest a smaller bed would at least give a bit more room.

Stayed 4 days and hotel is very clean and comfortable, bed was very comfy.  We had room on 4th floor with wrap around balcony. Staff are friendly and helpful and enjoyed the breakfast and tapas menu for dinner.

I have visited this hotel twice this year. Its very neat and clean. Staff is awesome and really nice and helpful. They offer coffee 24/7 in the lobby which is a nice gesture. Location and restaurant are really really great. Jessica the receptionist is such an awesome person! I would definitely be back!

Easily accessed from the metro, this hotel is perfectly located for central attractions. Compact but very clean and quiet room. Helpful staff. Breakfast room was a bit cramped but friendly staff made it work. Will definitely return. Ideal for long weekend, but probably rooms too small for a longer stay.

Im staying at this hotel and i am loving it. The room is perfect and the staff is very friendly and helpful, specially Ana and Miguel that helped me and gave me many recommendations. I hope to come back in my next visit to Lisbon.

I stayed there for 3 days for work and then my wife joined for the weekend. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. It's a new hotel, rooms are small but everything works well. Staff is very nice and friendly I should mention specifically Marcos, Ms. Maciel and Rodrigo at the reception. The reason why I didn't give 5 stars is only because we had to change 3 rooms in 4 days, even though we had said we could extend our stay next day the hotel was full and they hadn't kept our room. in the end it wasn't a big deal but in an experienced hotel management they would have shuffled around and fix this. Rooms are small , but very good sleep quality, silent clean and comfortable. Small buffet breakfast for 12 euros (same as the restaurants outside and better). and the best thing is

Hotel pulitissimo personale educato disponibile colazione ricca e camere spaziose moderne nuove bagno grande e comodissimo. Posizione centralissima comoda ai mezzi e ai negozi e facile da trovare anche senza farsi prendere direttamente dal transfer

Lovely with great location! This hotel opened  October 26, just 5 days before I checked in. They had no reviews and no website so I was a bit worried. But the staff was helpful via email and phone (I do not speak Portuguese but the staff speaks English.)  Check in was fast and easy. and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. A glass of wine and a pastry were waiting for me at the front desk upon check in. Elevator to the room. Very cool interior - modern with unique hall lighting. The room and bed were comfortable. Mini fridge in the room. No coffee maker yet (their only growing pain) but they did provide coffee upon request. No view from the window but honestly, I was only there to sleep and explore the city. The location was perfect - a couple minutes walk to the metro,
free wifi
